It's the camp life, tea time discussions that you'll remember more than the battles and movement of troops. This may not be the best WWII memoir but it certainly a fine one written by a remarkably gifted writer and I enjoyed it very much.

Conan Doyle's Gerard may well have inspired Fraser's later Flashman series. The similarities are obvious but there are profound differences between these two fictional 19th century military heroes beyond the fact that they would have found themselves on opposite sides. Flashman is an admitted rogue and coward who has gained his reputation by mere chance and misunderstanding. He knows it and the readers he addresses in his fictional memoirs are in on the secret. Gerard by contrast is oblivious that his superiors see him as rather dim and while brave in the extreme he has an acutely exaggerated opinion of himself. The difference is that with Flashman the joke is on them... with Gerard the joke is on him.Gerard's adventures during the Napoleonic campaigns are true page turners. The settings are just about anywhere that the French armies engaged from Poland to Portugal. His overblown confidence extends to his conceit about his irresistibility to women, although unlike Flashman this takes place mostly in Gerard's mind. Before this I had known Conan Doyle ,as most probably do,as the author of the Sherlock Holmes stories. This is another side of him and quite humorous, well written and worthwhile.  Anyone who enjoys the Flashman novels will love this as well.

The concept of this short and very witty book is that a group of diverse passengers stuck on the Jubilee line and faced with some choices of how best to leave is weaved into a funny pun filled dialogue around the competing social political theories of capitalism and socialism. This is part of a series by John O'Farrell.  I picked this one up while in London. It's funny and at times thought provoking. At other times it's a bit of a stretch  but it's a short and worthwhile read overall.

There are a number of qualities that make Rear Window one of the best films of all time. Set entirely in a single room facing out onto a courtyard, a photographer recuperating from injury and confined to a wheel chair spends his days observing his neighbors through their windows. His natural voyeurism becomes obsessive as he begins to draw conclusions about each of these people and give them nicknames ( Miss Lonely Heart...etc) based on what he sees through the window. Jimmy Stewart is fantastic in this role. His fashionable socialite girlfriend is played by the incredibly beautiful Grace Kelly , who is slowly drawn into his obsession that one of his neighbors is acting suspiciously and his wife is uncharacteristically missing. Suspicion and Suspense builds from there.Hitchcock had tried something similar in his earlier film Rope, also set in a single setting and involving suspense around a murder. Here he succeeds in taking that concept and directing two incredible actors to create a film that deserves it's reputation and longevity. Rear Window doesn't feel dated and still has the quality to grip the viewer and maintain it's suspenseful quality even 60 years on.

Joseph Ellis wrote a highly readable and engaging biography that brings Washington into clear focus as a leader and a man. This is not an iconography and it is also not a politically correct rewriting of history. Ellis writes in his introduction that in order to present a valid and realistic view of Washington one must judge him within the context of his times. Washington clearly made many military misjudgments and as the Revolutionary War unfolds and things look very dire from the American point of view, Ellis' description of the entrapment of Cornwallis' army in Yorktown can be seen as Britain losing the war as much as it was an American victory.Washington's handling of the post war situation and his unwillingness to follow other revolutionary military leaders examples and become a dictator is well handled by Ellis.There are surprises and thought provoking passages throughout this book that serve to demystify a man who may be the most distant and difficult to separate from the icon he has become in American culture. KIng George III hearing of Washington's refusal to grab dictatorial power is quoted here as saying " If he does not he will be the greatest man in the world." Quite a thing for the defeated King of England to say.Fine book, well written and highly recommended.

Butcher's Crossing expands on the traditional Western Novel through the examination of a world in transition. A young man seeking adventure funds and joins in a buffalo hunt high in the rockies with a mix-matched party of men who are clinging to a way of life that is rapidly disappearing. They meet in the small desolate town of Butcher's Crossing and after a year of hunting and struggling to survive they return to find the town and the world they left behind as dramatically changed as they are by their own collective experience.A novel deep in imagery and symbolism , Butcher's Crossing is totally engaging as a story of the West and yet it is much more. John Williams was a writer of incredible skill and his ability to form images so clearly in the mind of the reader is a huge factor in what makes this story so moving. As I read this I could hear the river, feel the cold of the snow and smell the campfires. I had recently read Stoner which I enjoyed very much as well and look forward to reading Augustus, his other major work. I'm very happy to have discovered the works of John Williams through the New York Review Books Classics series.

Naomi is the story of a man who becomes painfully obsessed with an adolescent girl and takes "possession" of her in order to form her into his vision of a sublimely sophisticated and western influenced partner. He is attracted to her initially because of her somewhat western features so his secondary obsession with Western culture ( this is set in 1920s Tokyo) underlines and magnifies his flawed vision of the girl.Part Lolita and part Frankenstein, the story begins with his manipulation of her but she grows into a self absorbed and selfish creature who seems to delight in his humiliation.Written in a very straightforward style and with an excellent translation in this version, Naomi is a novel that is set in a Japan going through significant social changes and the portrayal that Tanazaki provides of a Tokyo in transition and the underside of a society with a collective inferiority complex is deeply atmospheric and gritty. In turn the two main characters are fairly despicable and yet the book resonates and made me want to explore more of this man's work.

This is an incredibly well written book about Shane MacGowan. It summarizes his influences both from his Irish republican roots as well as the Punk and Traditional music that led to the formation and work of the Pogues in concise and yet detailed enough fashion that I felt like I was learning these things for the first time although I am familiar with both threads of his history. The author writes very engaging prose and there are many quotes from both Shane and others that add texture to this book making it indispensable reading for anyone who is a fan of the Pogues. Without a doubt this is the best book I've read about the band and it's influences. I couldn't put it down.

I hate cleaning out my fridge but it has to be done. I cannot explain how so many sticky spots appear on the glass shelves but my jars of condiments and bagged salads catch on this little spill or that little drop and it's just disgusting. I've always used a regular scrubber sponge to clean my fridge but they quickly turn sticky and disgusting themselves and I never can seem to get the sticky gunk to rinse out of the scrubber pad side so yet another sponge ends up in the trash. Ugh. I was so DONE with sponges when I had the opportunity to purchase these at a discount to test them out. "These are different" they said. "They are silicone and won't get gross, moldy, stinky or messy." Fine, I'll try them.I'm so very glad I did! First, they scrub REALLY well but without scratching at all. They literally grip sticky messes and jerk them right off the surface of whatever you're cleaning. You can see that my glass refrigerator shelves in the picture are *SPARKLING* clean. Thanksgiving is in a week and now I won't cringe with embarrassment when family opens my refrigerator door. The whole fridge is now gleaming! Even better, it didn't take me two hours like it usually does. Nope. I scrubbed the crud and sticky off each shelf in less than three minutes each. The silicone just wiped it off and the water rinsed it straight out of the sponge because NOTHING CAN STICK TO IT! I had no idea that I'd spent years smearing messy ketchup and strawberry jam all over the glass shelves with a regular sponge until the dish soap could finally dissolve it all and get it rinsed away. Peachy clean sponges worked sooooo much better at removing gunk the first time and not hanging on to it at all. (Silicone is totally non-stick after all.)I also LOVE that I can throw these sponges in the dishwasher to clean them and I'm certain they'll still smell good. Even after using Dawn dish soap multiple times and rinsing the sponge thoroughly, it STILL smells like clean peach! I'm kind of in love with silicone sponges now! If you are looking for a way to reduce your grocery expenditures, your family's waste and you want good, reuseable items, seriously consider getting a pack of these sponges! They're honestly amazing.

This is a wonderful food processor that makes Thanksgiving cooking EASY! Every year I made an old family cranberry relish recipe that calls for finely diced cranberries, apples and pecans. This 8 cup processor lets me make a MASSIVE quadruple batch for my entire extended family and to share with friends in just a couple hours - something that was never possible while growing up and using my mom's hand chopper.Now I have learned how to make pumpkin pie puree from scratch. You roast the pumpkin, peel the soft flesh from the skin and puree it in the food processor. My pies came out silky, fragrant and much more delicious than I have ever made them before! This is my THIRD year using my Hamilton Beach food processor at Thanksgiving and it's one kitchen appliance I simply do not want to be without when it's time to feed the family!

This creative Picnic Bowl is unlike any other food transport system I have ever used and it's positively BRILLIANT! It comes with 3 different inserts that divide the bowl into levels where you can separate foods for a picnic. Or you can remove the clear plastic inserts altogether then fill the whole bowl full of watermelon slices and snap on the lid for mess-free transport no matter who ends up holding it in the car!The bowl is a generous 9.5 inches wide and 6 inches deep with a top lid that securely clip-locks on all 4 sides. The lid has smooth, comfortable plastic handles attached to it for easy toting. The handles are designed so perfectly that when they are folded down flat, the top of the bowl is perfectly level and steady for stacking other things on top. SAVE MONEY At it's widest the bowl is 11 inches with the lid on, making it easy to tuck into the family pool bag so we can eat lunch during adult swim at the pool instead of spending a small fortune at the overpriced snack bar. Sandwiches, berries, sliced vegetables and individual bags of chips would easily fit for 2, 3 or 4 people.If you need a reliable way to transport veggie dips and sauces, the LunchBots Leak Proof Stainless Steel Food Containers Set of 2, Green I ordered from Amazon are AMAZING at containing the messiest liquids without ever spilling. The 4 ounce (1/2 cup) LunchBot container is small enough to fit in the middle compartment and the bottom divided compartment (it couldn't fit in the top lidded compartment and still allow the lid to lock properly).I'm done buying flimsy paper bags that allow food to be crushed in my pool bag or daypack or that get soggy and ruined from wet drinks or ice in the cooler. I love that I can set the entire bowl inside of our large cooler to stay chilled and fresh while the items inside are protected from the melting ice and water that has drenched so many lunches in the past.This is the fastest, easiest and CUTEST way to quickly pack-and-go food, snacks or meals to enjoy wherever your adventures - or busy schedule - takes you!

This is hands-down the best stapler I have ever used or owned. I've worked several jobs and owned numerous school staplers. Before this I would wrestle with my supposedly good quality name brand stapler that ate more staples than it ever punched through paper. I was working on making a large stack of handout packets and about lost my mind.Is it too much to ask that a stapler simply staple the paper properly every single time? We have sent a rover to Mars - how is it possible we have not perfected the common household stapler?In my frustration I jumped on Amazon, scoured the reviews and had this bad boy shipped to my house. (I love Prime 2 day shipping!) When this arrived I tested it out. It tackled the few handout pages easily, like it was stapling air. I folded a sheet of paper into fourths and rapid-fired staples as quickly as I could. It didn't jam. I stapled over existing staples. It didn't catch, snag or fail in any way. It just kept stapling like it should! FINALLY! I have found stapling bliss! (And my old stapler has gotten to know the local GoodWill).If you are a student, in college, just starting out, working in an office, have a home office or simply have hands and you're about ready to throw your malfunctioning stapler out into the street, make a small investment in your sanity and order this wonderful tool that will forever after properly attend to all of your stapling needs!

Adorable Disney playset for girls who love Minnie Mouse! The playset comes with a papery-fabric feeling drawstring bag,  set of little purple press-on nails (rated 6 years and up but would probably fit 4-6 year old), two tubes of clear lip gloss, a pink digital watch and a Minnie Mouse best friends jewelry set with bracelets, hair clips and plastic rings. It's a charming little dress up set for your Disney Princess and makes a cute packaged gift set!

We adopted a beautiful Brittany Spaniel / Yellow Lab mix but like many spaniels, he grows long tufts of fur from the bottom of his feet. This causes him to frequently slip on our tile and he tracks in enormous amounts of mud when it is raining outside because of these long tufts of paw hair. Previously I had been using my husband's hair trimming scissors to trim the dog's paws and my hubby was not at all happy when he discovered what I was using. He was much more pleased when I was able to purchase these at a discount to use instead. These are wonderfully designed with blunt, flared tips to protect dogs from accidental nicks. I have accidentally cut my pup during these trimmings and now he trembles and dislikes when I have to cut away the hair from his paws. I'm hoping the safety features prevent any more boo-boos and he begins to relax so it's not such a chore!The scissors cut his thick hair quickly and cleanly, which is really saying something when you're dealing with a squirming pup! There are both a long nose and short nose trimming scissors. The long ones worked great on my medium dog and the slightly shorter scissors would be great for trimming facial fur. The thinning scissors are awesome - I've never had a set for my dog - so I'll be able to thin out some of the fringe all over him during the hot summer months when he is shedding like crazy. In short, it's a handy set of pet tools that I'm happy I no longer have to do without!

I purchased this set of rocks to make homemade Gem Digs for my son's birthday party activity and they were a HUGE hit! I found a recipe on Pinterest that calls for sand, water and plaster of paris to make a chippable, diggable "rock" that the gems are hidden in. The children hammered, scraped and paintbrush dusted the gems free and squealed with delight at the vibrant colored rocks they found. They had a great time being outside doing such a unique hand-made activity and learning the names of the gemstones. It was such a huge hit that we made another batch of fossil digs for my son to enjoy on his own. Wonderful set of polished rocks for learning fun!

These are excellent quality, MASSIVE five inch safety pins! The tips are not needle pointed but rather blunt, like the tip of a dull lead pencil, and seem to be best suited for safety pinning heavy tarps and such together. They are incredibly handy to have while camping and at the ranch to clip things up as needed in places too narrow for a carabiner.They are constructed of a good quality, sturdy stainless steel and the pack of 10 is plenty for creating impromptu tarp shelters to protect expensive gear from the rain. Once they're in your hand, you'll find plenty of outdoor uses for them!

My 8 year-old loves metal Slinkies - LOVES THEM - to the point I have to buy them in bulk off Amazon because he ends up making "inventions" with them and ruining them. Imagine my delight when I was able to purchase this unique metal Superflux at a discount to try out!It comes in a soft velvet pouch and when you pull it out it appears to be a tangle of interlocked rings. The moment you let them go, they spring into action, arranging themselves perfectly into shape. The final display is quite large, similar in size to a volleyball, and has a beautiful symmetry that reminds one of the shape of an atom with electrons orbiting around the nucleus.With a little finesse, the rings can be returned to their original flat configuration for storage. This is sure to delight people of all ages who simply cannot help but touch it! If you have a little (or big) boy in your house who is interested in inventing and other tactile endeavors, this toy is sure to please!

These sweet little hair clips hide a secret weapon for keeping lice away from your child's head. On the underside of each one is a soft, cottony pad that will absorb and hold a drop of lice-repelling Mylee oil right next to your child's scalp.The ingredients in the Mylee oil are Rosemary oil, Phenoxyethanol and Tocopheryl Acetate to send those brat lice fleeing. If you'd like to use a different brand of essential oil or a concoction of your own make (Peppermint, Thyme and Melaleuca/Tea Tree essential oil are all believed to repel lice in addition to Rosemary), the absorbent pad dot on the back of the clip will happily accept and diffuse whatever oil is placed upon it.It seems that Amazon sends you one of a random assortment of clip colors and I was fortunate to receive a VERY charming hot pink, orange and cream set. Each clip is 2 inches long which is small enough for a school-age child but also large enough that mom could wear one if needed, too. They gave a quick, sturdy snap-close and EXCELLENT hold, even in ultra-fine baby blonde hair that nothing seems to be able to grip!Invest in these cuties before lice strikes at school. If the outbreak has already reached your children, seriously consider purchasing the Metal LEVIA Nit-Free Terminator Comb to get the nits out. (Check my review on that comb for a simple lice and nit removal kitchen recipe that really works and makes the nits slide off the hair easily.) I was fortunate to be able to purchase these lice clips at a discount to test AFTER a horrible lice outbreak hit our school but I know that using essential oils on the hair and not sharing brushes or pillows among friends does prevent them from spreading. They cannot jump across the room, thank goodness!

We live in the suburbs and own a Doberman. That alone gets us plenty of stares and sideways glances but when it is time to do off-leash training to ensure she is well-behaved and obeys long distance come-backs, it gets a little tricky. There are leash laws and neighbors we need to be considerate of. The best solution is a long training leash.At the end of our cul-de-sac is an open greenbelt with a large grassy area that is perfect for training her in the evenings. In nice weather other families are out playing catch with their children, others are strolling on the greenbelt, some are walking their dogs, so you can't hog it all to yourself. I found this leash came in very handy for training. First of all, it is literally a 30 foot long leash. It has a loop handle on one end and a metal bolt snap clip on the other end. If your community has strict leash laws this fulfills the requirement as being a leash.For our pictured training, I bought a 70 12 inch nail from my local hardware store and pushed it into the ground then looped the handle of the leash over it. My dog understands the command "You are tied up" so she didn't pull it out of the ground. If she had, the leash webbing is PLENTY strong enough to handle a big dog but light enough that the dog may not notice they are clipped up so you can reel them in if they disobey a "come" command, reinforcing that they have to comply to your commands even if they believe they are off-leash.You can also see in the pictures there are people walking, children are running around and a father is playing catch with his children nearby. None of these neighbors minded at all that I was training my dog nearby because the black leash was highly visible and it was obvious she was tethered. It made for incredibly easy training to walk her to the end of the lead, give her a sit and stay command or to put her in a long down-stay and then release her from the stay and call her back to me at a distance. Even when I was the full 30 feet away from her, people could see that she was leashed and under control so they were comfortable walking by on the sidewalk without complaint. I like that this specific training lead helps me comply with local leash laws and show the utmost respect for my neighbors while also letting me train my dog as needed.When we were done, I stored the leash by folding it in half several times and then securing it with an 18 inch Nite Ize Gear Tie I bought on Amazon. This was a great way to quickly wrap and securely store it until our next training session.I'm grateful that I was able to purchase this lead at a slight discount (not free) to test it out for our own dog training needs and that it worked so incredibly well! I also appreciate how lightweight and packable it is. This will be much easier to take on our camping trips that our big cable tie out, making it even more useful. Great product at a great price!

These cute 7.75 inch pencil cases are an adorable way to hold all the little items you need! They are made with a heavier cotton canvas-like fabric on the outside that is durable but not stiff and uncomfortable and a darling hot pink and white polka dot cotton material on the inside. The zipper pull is a faux suede leather that coordinates well with the fabric prints on each case.Yes, the label is mispelled on every case except the white/cream floral one. The brown case is the same print as the white floral, just with a dark kraft colored background. (I was curious about that since I couldn't quite tell from the example image.)I found these pouches were the perfect size to hold my mechanical pencils and my {ahem} lady things :)(I got those cool triangle pencils off Amazon! Paper Mate Mates 1.3mm Mechanical Pencils (1862168) )I needed some zippered pouches and was fortunate to be able to purchase these at a discount (not free) in order to test them. I found they are especially handy for holding tampons and when tucked in your purse or backpack, they look like a simple, cute pencil case! At under two dollars each, this is a great buy!

I purchased these to use as loops that were fastened to tent stakes to create a fast loop-and-secure system for tent guy lines. The pieces were all uniformly stamp-cut, smooth faced and none of them had any manufacturing flaws. Because they are stamped, one inside lip/edge is smoother so I faced the smoother side down so no sharp edges would cut through the paracord if the guy lines whipped during a storm. They were perfect for the use I intended and I'm pleased that they were all very uniform in shape, quality made and priced MUCH less than my local big box hardware store.

My son received a nice Land's End solid leather belt as a hand-me-down. That company has discontinued making such thick, sturdy, cowboy-like belts and I was disappointed that this one was a bit too long for his lean waist. I needed a leather punch to create three new holes but I dreaded using one. The punch my family had growing up was painfully hard to squeeze and when you finally could punch a new hole in a belt, it also pinched and bruised your skin badly. Worse, most of the leather punches I looked at had thin, flimsy looking components and appeared as if they couldn't cut through anything thicker than a piece of felt.Here I was, with this discontinued leather belt that I didn't want to ruin but that could not be worn unless it had new holes punched in it. I was fortunate to be able to purchase this leather hole punch at a slight discount in order to test it out. I removed it from the box and looked it over thoroughly before I let it anywhere near our beloved belt. The punch is large at 10 inches tall and the heft of it hinted that it is a high quality tool. I inspected the punching heads and found them to be sturdy, firm and durable. The rubber handles were cushiony and I checked twice that there was no way they could close all the way down to pinch the soft part of my palm. They simply cannot.After the tool passed inspection, I retrieved the belt and set about sizing the holes so I could select the correct size punch from the 6 different options. I found the exact size needed, rotated it into place and then measured the distance between the existing holes so I could punch equally spaced new ones. I measured the distance and marked the leather with a Sharpie where I wanted to punch it. I positioned the leather tool over the mark and squeezed about as hard as you squeeze a can opener. I thought I was positioning the tool so it would bite and hold the leather while I transferred it to both my hands to apply enough pressure to punch but after positioning it and squeezing it I heard a gentle POP and the belt was punched. That was it. I released the handle to find it had made a nice, clean round hole. I measured and punched the next hole and then the third. The task I had been dreading for over a month was completed in less than four minutes with this tool! It was SO EASY! No sweat, no blood and no tears over a ruined item - it just did what it should and made the task simple!I took pictures as I worked and in the third photo I have the first hole I punched next to the original last belt hole made by the manufacturer. They are identical and you can see how nice and crisp the fresh punch looks. I'm very, very impressed. I love the inventive double-lever action that makes this so easy to squeeze and I love that my son's belt still looks handsome.This is a wonderful tool. If you dread the old leather punches that hurt your hands or you're looking to buy your first, seriously consider this wonderfully well-built model! You won't regret it and it makes the chore of sizing belts incredibly easy!

These pudgy little animal markers are so adorable for small hands just learning to color! Their shape helps children hold them naturally with the rounded button point facing down - not out towards your fresh painted walls - to keep them working on the paper. They are scribble and "hammer banging" friendly and the tips aren't really damaged by the pounding-coloring that little boys seem to engage in.I recommend getting the huge easel drawing pads to make sure they have plenty of room to swing their arms in long, wide coloring strokes and still stay on the paper!Melissa & Doug Easel Paper PadI was fortunate to be able to purchase these at a slight discount (not free) to test them out. I find they are delightful for 15 to 24 month-olds who wail and scream when you take the big kid markers away from them and all the fun they were having scribbling all over their face and clothing. These markers have such a small tip that it is difficult to lay a lot of color down in a short amount of time, which means these guys are keeping your couch, carpet and curtains safe! Thank goodness for Crayola!

This was a great fall family movie that we enjoyed watching right before Halloween! The 8 and 9 year olds enjoyed seeing what was different in the movie compared to modern day. (Look at the cord coming out of that phone! Look at that old flashlight! Did all the doors look like that in the 80's? Their hair looks ridiculous! Can we lash plastic crates to the front of our bikes?)  It was such a fun flash-back for me to share with the kids!If you're going to get the movie, go ahead and buy a big bag of Reese's Pieces as well for the movie night because trust me, you're going to be craving them after watching Elliot throw them all over the woods, trying to lure in ET!

I live in Houston, the humid, moldy air capital of Texas. As a result from all the mold spores constantly in the air, I suffer from year-round allergy issues. I'm so grateful to have found peppermint essential oil! I diffuse peppermint oil in my home every day to kill spores in the air and to help make breathing easier. I've been diffusing for over a year and in that time I haven't had another sinus infection.As you can imagine, I use a LOT of peppermint oil diffusing it every day. A 4 oz bottle will last me several months, diffusing for 1-2 hours each day. I have tried many different brands and have found that I like a fresh, cool peppermint scent that also makes my home smell very clean when I diffuse it. (My nephew comments that my house always smells like gum! Lol!)This ArtNaturals peppermint has that sweet, clean, candy cane scent I love! It comes with a handy glass dropper, which makes refilling my diffuser without spilling sooooo much easier. I'm thrilled that this peppermint oil is being offered as such a great price! I was fortunate to be able to purchase it at a discount (not free) to compare it to the Now and DoTerra brand essential oils I have been using. I felt that it smelled sweeter than the Now brand oil and similar to the DoTerra peppermint oil that I take internally. (This one I will use just for diffusing.)Peppermint oil is also great for taming painful, throbbing headaches and when diffused regularly, I feel that frequent or repeating headaches are kept at bay. Of course diffusing it during the winter months gives your house a crisp, cheerful scent that enhances the holidays and is refreshing throughout the spring as well!

Let me tell you why you need to add Lavender Essential oil to your first aid kit immediately. It is an incredible essential oil with many skin soothing and skin healing properties. We are a family that loves to camp and be outdoors but sadly we tend to burn easily in the sun as well as suffer a few accidental burns around the campfire. I discovered how incredible lavender essential oil is after a canoe trip where I got a severely bad sunburn on my face and chest from using expired sunscreen. I was so severely burned that puss-filled blisters began rising on my chest (second-degree burn). It was incredibly painful.A family member told me to put a few drops of lavender and peppermint essential oil in a spray bottle with clean, filtered water (not chlorinated tap water) and to spray my skin whenever it was hurting. I followed her directions and it instantly cooled my skin, paused the pain as long as the essential oils were in contact with my skin and helped the burn heal much more quickly. My husband used a few sprays but not near as much as I did. His burn took about 4 days longer to heal than mine did. The lavender had helped speed up the healing process!After this experience I read that Lavender essential oil can also be used on skin burns from touching hot surfaces. Since I do all our camp cooking I'm most often the one who ends up a tad burned. Lavender essential oil applied to a minor cooking burn made it stop hurting INSTANTLY. Now I keep a tiny vial of Lavender essential oil with my first aid kit. You can buy the tiny glass essential oil dram bottles here on Amazon and keep one in every car plus one in each first aid kit:12 New, High Quality, Amber 2 ml (5/8 Dram) Glass Bottles, with Orifice Reducer and Black Cap.After we go camping in the winter I hand wash our wool clothing and I put several drops of Lavender in the rinse water to help give the wool a nice fragrance before it is hung to dry. The lavender in the wool helps repel moths that would ruin it and it helps the wool to not irritate your skin the next time you wear it. The residual lavender also repels mosquitoes!As you can see, I use a TON of lavender so I was grateful to be able to purchase this extra-large 4 ounce bottle at a discounted price to try out. It has a fresh, clean lavender scent and in testing it on a cut on my hand, has the same skin soothing and healing properties as other brands I have tried. This bottle is marked as Therapeutic Grade, sourced from Bulgaria and that it is undiluted. (Diluting with coconut oil actually helps your body absorb the essential oils better!) I feel it is a great quality oil for topical skin and laundry uses and I'm going to enjoy having this big bottle on-hand now!

I bought this card game set for my Shopkins-addicted niece who is just beginning to read as a fun way to increase her sight-word knowledge. The cards come in a super cute metal lunch box with the characters stamped and raised on the front to give it great texture and appeal!Inside the lunchbox are two cute packs, each with 30 character cards, 1 blank card to invent your own Shopkins and a directions card on how the game is played. I was pleased to see there were several fruit and vegetable character cards, which I believe helps children be open to the idea of eating their veggies! There were several characters I hadn't seen before and I'm sure my niece will LOVE matching up each of her characters with the card that tells a bit about their personality and seeing which Shopkins she still needs to collect!In short this is an adorable card game set that can help early readers in a way that engages their mind and gives them a reason to WANT to read about their favorite Shopkins characters! I was fortunate to be able to purchase this set at a slight discount (not free) to open, handle, photograph, test and try out. It's really cute!

I had no idea how beneficial copper mugs were for your health. Copper itself is anti-bacterial, anti-viral and anti-inflammatory so any liquid in the mug - including pure water - is going to benefit from simply contacting the copper. In several countries where  water treatment is less than ideal, they store water in copper pitchers and drink it from copper cups because the copper will naturally kill any harmful bacteria (it is especially good at killing E. Coli) present in the water and prevents the water from going stale.The copper also gently leeches it's best properties into your drink as it is in the cup. Copper is an important trace mineral the thyroid gland needs to function properly and drinking from a copper cup can help make up for any deficiency. Copper also reduces inflammation within the stomach, helping to aid digestion. Copper is also necessary for proper absorption of iron and for vitamin C to be used by the body.I was fortunate to receive one of these beautiful Pomegranate hammered Vogue style cups at no cost to test and review. First, the mug is drop-dead GORGEOUS. It has an old-world appeal that is simply stunning and a heft that implies it is high quality. The generous handle, the thick, rolled lip and substantial weight makes it a piece to be enjoyed. The hammered finish is simply stunning. From top to bottom, the mug is well made, well joined and well thought out. Copper is highly conductive so the ice in your mug doesn't melt nearly as fast and it feels cold and refreshing in your hands for a long time!Enjoy up to 2 drinks per day of any liquid, including water, from a copper mug and reap the health benefits of using natural, sustainable, beautiful drinkware!

My son was begging me for something that made his bike "cooler". It seems the boys in the cul-de-sac are seeking ways to make their bikes unique and enviable to each other. I was expecting to receive 1 set of lights that changed colors but was thrilled to get 3 different sets! He will LOVE the green and now we have little gifts we can share with the cousins!Coolest bike? He wins.  :)Update: These were such a hit with the boys in the cul-de-sac that we ended up sharing the other 2 packs with neighbor children after yelling fights broke out over the lights! Even the pink ones found a home on a little boy's bike! Lol! The lights turn on from centrifugal force so the batteries are not wasted while the bike is parked. However, we found that children's bikes with smaller tires just don't get going fast enough to spin the batteries into contact with the lead so the light can illuminate. They worked great on a bigger boy's bike, 10 speed bikes, etc. Just not the little bike the 4 year-old neighbor was riding. You need to be pedaling at a good speed to have them illuminate on a kid's bike. (I can see how these work so well on motorcycles, making them look like Tron cycles.)With daylight savings time making it dark by 5:30, I loved that these lights help cars to see my son while he's still biking around outside before dinner!

I read that castor oil can be used as a hair treatment AND used on your feet to heal callouses so I decided to try some. his is a premium quality that is pure cold pressed, hexane-free and triple refined. Great quality oil for beauty use!

I searched for a while, trying to find sturdy mesh bags at a reasonable price. This set of 5 bags made of thick, durable nylon mesh at less than $2.50 per bag is an awesome deal!What I really wanted was a mesh produce bag that I could fold up and tuck into my purse so I quit looking like a forgetful fool when I showed up at the farmer's market or dropped by a roadside produce stand with nothing to hold fruits and veggies. These mesh bags easily fold up to a little 2.5 by 3.5 inch rectangle and can be secured with their own drawstring. One now resides in my purse, ready for any impromptu local food stops!These are big enough that I could easily use it as a dirty clothes bag for a day trip with my son, a quick toy bag, a reusable in-car trash bag - the options are endless and why not, you have 5 bags!I have a feeling these will come in handy for berry picking next spring. We visit a local U-Pick Organic Blueberry farm in June to get blueberries to freeze and these will be great for transporting them home instead of the plastic grocery bags we have used the past couple years. The mesh is well made but breezy and breathable so my goods won't suffocate on the drive home. I could even wash the blueberries inside the bag then hang the whole thing to drip-dry, all without dumping them out! I imagine you could also use them to hang onions, which will keep well for a few months if they have airflow.These are a great value and I'm happy to have found them!

My husband believes in the buy once cry once philosophy when it comes to purchasing outdoor gear and his ultralight backpacking hobbies come with a hefty price tag. The money spent is well worth it for his outdoor enjoyment. He was drooling over the ENO hammocks when we had the opportunity to purchase this one at a discount (not anywhere close to free) to test out. I'll be honest, I figured this would end up being my son's hammock while my hubby threw down for a full priced name-brand one. I was pleasantly surprised to be wrong!The hammock arrived and my husband examined it. Humph...the color looks good. The material feels great but will it hold up? Are these tree straps cheap? How much can they hold? They're selling this for only $40? And you expect it to hold up? Fine, I'll try it.The hammock sat for a couple weeks of rainy weather and he didn't seem to be in a hurry to use it. Finally a clear Saturday came and he gave it a try while he and the guys were out at the land. His texts blew up my phone.That hammock was really easy to set up!I'm impressed, the quality is much better than what I expected at that price.I'm in 20-30 mph gusting winds and the hammock is hanging on solid.He then began sending me pictures.There is plenty of fabric left - you could easily cocoon this over you.It's very comfy. I'm going to let [our son] try it.IT FITS BOTH OF US!Thank you for buying this, it's really nice!There you have it, folks. My super picky gear snob hubby approves of this high-quality, well made, easy-to-set-up, comfortable hammock. *SIGH* I doubt I'll be cuddling with him in our double sleeping bags on camp outs any time soon. Might as well order the green one for myself!

This is the nicest leash in our house. We have a huge Doberman who whimpers to chase the hundreds of squirrels that scamper across the greenbelts where we walk. A namby-pamby little leash is simply not going to cut it for our strolls, especially when a naughty squirrel dares to bolt just beyond the reach of her nose and she breaks my heel command to lunge at it. Sometimes I skip the squirrels altogether and walk her under the stars in the late-night quiet. People appreciate such a massive dog being on a secure leash and visibly well-behaved when they are sharing the sidewalk with us.The leash is thick, durable and strong. It's made by Primal Pet Gear (their big rubber label is stitched to the leash) and features their black powder coated heavy duty metal hardware, including a metal ring at the handle where you can attach a poopy bag dispenser. Down both sides of the leash is a thick reflective strip stitched into the body of the leash. It throws off quite a bit of light, which is important when you're walking a dark colored dog at night like I do.The padded handle is hands-down the best. It's a thick red loop of cushy soft neoprene sewn onto the handle. It's neoprene so it can get wet, sweaty and slobbered on without being ruined. It feels pleasantly comfortable and keeps the thicker nylon webbing edge from scratching and irritating your skin. I've done a bit of pet-sitting and rescue group volunteering so I know there are dogs who have learned to deliberately pull at a leash until it is hurting your hand so bad that you let go, thus freeing them to romp about wildly. The padded handle should help if you're trying to break this habit in a dog you've adopted. If you've got a chronic leash-chewer, this should offer a lot more resistance while you work on training. (Forget Bitter Apple spray. Wrap the leash in aluminum foil. Dogs hate biting the stuff. Add Lavender essential oil to the leash webbing and the foil. They also hate the smell of Lavender and should quickly abandon their chewing attempts.)If you want to make a one-time purchase for a leash that will last the lifetime of your large dog, this is the one you want right here! I was fortunate to be able to purchase it at a discount but even at full price it is cheaper than regular nylon leashes at the big box pet stores.

My husband dislocated his kneecap while playing ultimate frisbee a few years ago and although he had surgery to replace his MCL, he still needs Kinesiology tape for some activities. This is a good, lightweight tape that gives support and freedom of motion at the same time. Kinesiology tapes leave a sticky residue on your skin so some baby oil or, in a pinch, a few drops of beard oil will get the uncomfortable tackiness off your skin so your clothing will quit clinging to you. Melaleuca (tea tree) or orange essential oil will also power through the worst leftover residue if other oils don't work. (You'll need to shower the all of the oils off before reapplying new tape so it gets the best stick.)I wish I would have known about this product after my C-section when I really could have used something to hold up my now empty and drooping tummy off my tender incision site!

Great beard oil for softening up your whiskers and helping them lay smooth and straight so your beard appears longer! Love the dropper bottle top for easy dispensing - makes 1 handed application quick and easy.

Total weight with stuff sack, including the plastic slider on the end to keep the sack closed, is 316 grams or 11.25 ounces according to the electronic scale we use to weigh backpacking gear. 18 inch circumference and 6 inches long when sat on to squish as much air out as possible and re-rolled tightly after being inflated for use.Great lightweight camping pillow! My husband went to Philmont this past July and wished he'd had this with him. He takes ultralight backpacking to the extreme and said that the dirty clothes he used as a pillow for 2 weeks were not comfortable at all and in the end were not a wise decision. A few ounces would have been worth the additional comfort. After trying out this most recent purchase, he said he wished he would have had this pillow. It met his requirements for light weight, although the pillow repacked in it's own brown nylon stuff sack is 18 inches in circumference and about 6 inches long, which is larger than what he prefers to carry. (Like I said, he's a tad overboard on the ultralight backpacking...)The example image colors are way off, by the way. There are NO pink or purple diamond shapes. The colors are solid aqua blue, lime green and dark green stripes together to make an apple green shade, aqua blue and gray stripes together (what looks like purple in the example image), solid red orange, red orange and yellow stripes together, solid yellow, red orange and fruit punch red stripes (appears hot pink in example image) and red orange and yellow stripes, which look tangerine orange in the example image but are darker orange in real life. At first I thought my husband had been fortunate to receive a pillow with no pink or purple diamonds in that part of the pattern but then I realized the example image was just wonky. It is a multi-colored pillow but it's not nearly that bright or little kid-ish looking. It's honestly unisex colored and fine for an adult, teen or child.The pillow has some soft fluffy fill fibers in it that add to the cushioning but they also suck down quite flat for storage. He liked that aspect, too.If my picky, "every gram counts" so he went without a pillow for 2 weeks hubby approves of this then it will probably work great for your backpacking excursions, too!

I received 100 various, bright-colored and earth-toned embroidery thread skeins, almost identical to the colors shown in the example images. (I didn't get black or brown but I didn't want them!) I was thrilled with the vibrant pinks, deep purples, aqua blues, turquoise, teal, bright orange, apple green and lemon yellow shades that will be great for a friendship bracelet craft activity. Great way to buy bulk embroidery thread at a discount!For those who are cross-stitching, there were plenty of earth tones as well like moss green, grass green, pine tree green, burnt sienna, red clay, sunset yellow, cloudy blue, airy blue, ocean water blue, turmeric yellow, red fox orange, burnt orange, lilac purple and other natural hues that are ideal for stitching animals and nature scenes. I've never seen this many colors offered at a craft store so you're sure to get a shade you don't already have!I was asked to donate supplies for a friendship bracelet making class so it was perfect timing when I was able to purchase this set at a discount to try out. There were sooooo many colors that there will easily be enough for two classes (as you can see in the two images) or for the girls to take home a couple of their own skeins to enjoy practicing with.

My husband returned from Philmont this summer talking about these buffs that he saw several people wearing to help keep the sun from burning their necks and to keep them cool. He talked about what they looked like and how they worked as he slathered burn cooling treatments on his own scorched skin. He burns sooooo easily on his face and back of the neck that I decided to buy him one for Christmas. About this time I was fortunate to be able to purchase one at a discount (not free) to test out. Let me say that I didn't just buy any old buff at the cheapest price and call it good. I looked closely at these over a couple of weeks and opted for this one because it seemed to be soft, lightweight and long. I'm so glad I chose this one!First, the material is incredibly soft. Think super soft thin t-shirt kind of material. It is a seamless tube, which means the ends are not sewn in any way. I included a picture of this so you can see what I mean. The end is a raw edge but when I drug my fingernail across it, trying to get it to fray, the material did nothing - it didn't fray or separate. If this proves to be a problem later, I'll gladly stitch the edge, but I doubt it will be a problem as I anticipate the material will naturally roll up at the edge as opposed to fraying. This means there is no itchy seam constantly rubbing your skin raw.I ordered the color NG02, which is a deep pine tree/hunter green as shown. It's quite a handsome shade and one of my hubby's favorite colors so I'm certain he's going to love it. I was worried about it being a dark color in the hot sun but it is so lightweight that color isn't a concern in the heat but it will hide dirt smudges well when he uses it to wipe sweat from his face.If you or someone you love sunburns easily when outdoors, consider buying one of these feather-light, good-looking neck gaiters for them. They will appreciate it!

Light, baffled and warm, this comforter is great except for the material used on it. I was expecting something a little softer and more luxurious. Instead the material feels similar to the cheap, not-as-smooth material a mattress protector is made out of. I was fortunate to purchase this comforter at a discount (not free) in exchange for a review so I'm informing you that it is warm and would make an excellent duvet filler but by itself it may not be as soft as you desire and the bright white may be difficult to keep clean.

Previously I had used regular bentonite clay in addition to my essential oil toothpaste and felt that was doing a good job of remineralizing my teeth but I wanted the benefits of activated charcoal for removing toxins and combating bad breath. I was very pleased that this product uses coconut activated charcoal, which is the best there is. I also like that they added several other ingredients such as turmeric, ground cloves and kaolin powder to provide a spectrum of minerals and bacteria-killing power. You can buy bentonite clay and charcoal powder to mix your own type of toothpaste powder but the addition of these other high quality ingredients gave the powder incredible value and a punchy taste.

I had been buying loose Turmeric powder from an organics section in my local grocer, unsure if it was even organic but paying a pretty penny for it by the ounce. This was a much better option and guaranteed I was getting a quality, organic product. It even shipped with a handsome wooden spoon! I'm pleased with my purchase and thrilled with the health benefits of turmeric!

This book has charming hand-drawn designs that are pleasant to look at and even more relaxing to color. I can let my mind drift as I select my favorite shades and apply gentle pencil strokes. I also like that most of the coloring spaces are a bit larger so I spend less time shuffling pencils and more time pondering whatever is rolling around in the back of my mind as I work. (I recently read that when you color, your body and brain relax, putting you in a similar state of mind as meditation.) What a healthy, beautiful way to unwind!I like the use of white space in this book and the large paisley designs that don't overwhelm the eye. Whether you want something simpler to color or are seeking a young-adult coloring book, this one is sure to please!If you're looking for nice, silky colored pencils that won't break the bank, I recently purchased the Siensync brand 48 color set (to replace my lost Prismacolor set) and found them to be incredibly rich and creamy - perfect for blending and shading the designs in this book!Colored Pencils Siensync(TM) 48 Color Art Colored Drawing Pencils for Secret Garden, Artist Sketch Set of 48 Assorted Colors (48 colors)

I add Lavender essential oil to my rinse water when I wash wool clothing because I love the smell and find it helps the wool stay fresh while stored until next winter. This big bottle came with a nice glass dropper and is exactly what I wanted for laundry and scenting wool dryer balls!

My husband received this book as a gift and I immediately fell in love with the plans for a camp reflector oven. We camp as a family several times per year and many times I had wanted a quick way to bake biscuits by the fire while our big dutch oven was in use making the main course.My husband has done a few wood building projects but he had never worked with sheet metal aluminum or done any metal working at all. This was going to be a total first for us and I won't lie, it seemed a tad daunting. The book had very reliable directions that we followed carefully. In the end, we made THREE camp ovens for ourselves and extended family members! The first one was the hardest. Not only that, but we have used it camping 4 times before I wrote this review so I can tell you that it works! Here is what we did to make the LARGE size aluminum reflector oven from the book:1. We found a local supplier for sheet aluminum. The book tells you the author used .032 (0.8128 mm) sheet aluminum in a 32x36 inch piece. We could only find .014 thickness and it came in a huge sheet - enough to make 4 ovens. Ugh. Glad we have a truck. This thicker aluminum was harder to cut so we had to use an angle grinder to do it as the huge heavy duty metal snips I had bought couldn't cut more than a few inches into the sheet. (The metal snips came in handy for the detailed little snips and cuts I had to do at the corners to follow the template.) Make sure you invest in a tool to properly cut the metal.2. The Template you use to cut the pieces has to be hand made. I'm a graphic artist with Adobe Illustrator and a Silhouette machine so I was able to recreate the template in Illustrator and then use my Silhouette to cut a cardstock template in pieces that I then taped together. Making the template was honestly the hardest part. It's a tad time consuming. If doing it by hand you'll need several sheets of posterboard, a long ruler, a short ruler, a sharp pencil, a big eraser, an abundance of patience, good spatial intelligence, math skills and an hour or two dedicated only to making the template. Once it's done, it's done forever so it is a good idea to invest the time here. If you are sloppy, the angle of the oven will be off and it won't bake as properly as it could. Tracing the sides of the oven is the most important to get right but it is also the weirdest shaped piece.3. We didn't own a riveter (pop-rivet gun) so I bought one on Amazon. All 3 of our various big box hardware stores had really low quality riveters so I scoured the reviews and selected the Stanley one linked below. I'm so glad I did - this riveter was comfortable, easy to use, powerful and worked incredibly well for this project. I strongly recommend saving yourself the time I wasted shopping around and letting Prime deliver the correct, high quality tool to your front door for the same price as the flimsy plastic riveters at the store.Stanley MR100CG Contractor Grade Riveter4. I also needed to buy rivets. Again, the book had wonderful directions telling us exactly what size to buy of a hardware piece I had never seen before. You need 1/8 inch (3mm) rivets with a 6 mm reach AND 1/4 inch rivets also with a 6 mm reach. I couldn't find the 1/8 inch STEEL rivets at the hardware store so I ordered a pack of them on Amazon along with the riveter. This set has 1/8 inch rivets with a 7mm reach that worked just fine for us. 1 pack will make 1 oven using only the steel rivets.Stanley R120 Rivet Pack Assortment5. Next you need a 1/8 inch drill bit that can drill pilot holes through the aluminum. Amazon to the rescue again. I bought these Bosch titanium bits and had them delivered with the riveter tool. You can read my review on them - they worked incredibly well and drilled through the aluminum easily.Bosch TI2135 Titanium SP Jobber Drill Bit, Carded, 1/8-Inch, 2-Pack6. The oven calls for a carrying handle. I purchased a pre-made aluminum handle at a big blue hardware store then scoured their selection of larger rivets until I found the size that would hold the handle onto the aluminum oven body but were short enough to not protrude too far into the oven box. They had them as part of their normal stock and this was easy to obtain.7. Last was the assembly. My husband was impressed that I had done all of the research, shopping, template-making and everything else needed to make the oven so he drove me to buy the aluminum, cut it and did the assembly work. The book has very detailed directions on what to do. We used aluminum angles cut to size for the legs, which was optional but made the assembly a bit faster.The oven was done! Now to test it out. We completed the oven in November of 2014 and have been camping with it a full year as of this writing. You can see the campfire scorch marks on the oven in the images, proving its use. Here is what we have found: The reflector oven is EXCELLENT at baking small, individual servings of dough, like biscuits. We have baked biscuits and canned cinnamon rolls in it with wonderful results. (Cinnamon rolls have now become a camping breakfast request from the boys!) It did not do very well baking a small, long loaf of french bread dough. The dough was just too thick to cook all the way through. Biscuits & small things cook much better. I imagine cookies would be fine, too. If you want to cook cake or brownies, I'd pour it into a longer, shallow sheet-cake pan so the fire can bake the batter all the way through. We chose to build the Large size oven (measurements for small, medium and large size ovens are given in the book) and I'm so glad we opted for this size because a Quarter Sheet baking pan fits almost perfectly on the oven shelf. Any smaller and the baking pan would hang off the edge. As you can tell from the pictures, a quarter sheet overhangs a teensy bit but we have used this set up for baking several times and it does work! However, you must purchase a very thick commercial aluminum baking sheet so the fire doesn't warp it and send all your biscuits sliding towards the middle of the pan. I got the Nordic Ware Naturals Aluminum Quarter sheet and it has worked incredibly well. In fact, I've bought a second one to make sure I have a replacement and that one is always clean and ready to use.Nordic Ware Natural Aluminum Commercial Baker's Quarter Sheet The sheet aluminum the oven is made from is going to get sooty and black. The author of the book tells you this will happen and explains why you do NOT need to clean it. The reflector oven bakes by reflecting heat - not firelight - so even if your oven has darkened from use, it will still bake. Our experience has been that the more you use it, the better it seems to bake but that is because you learn more each time it is used. We have discovered that the oven must be set in front of it's own roaring bed of orange hot coals to properly bake and brown. Placing it directly in the face of lapping flames results in blackened edges and dough that is soggy in the middle.Does this sound like a lot of work? It kind of is but it was incredibly rewarding to hand make our own camping gear. This reflector oven has lured many curious fellow-campers and brought many complements, as well as a few pleas to make some for friends! If you'd like to tackle such a project, this author has put an abundance of time into developing his own handmade camping gear that he uses as a Maine canoe guide, creating detailed directions and specialized measurements and then building his gear all over again following his own book directions just to ensure he hasn't missed any steps and to provide new items for photographing for the book. There are lots of pictures, detailed templates, supply shopping lists and more. It's like having grandpa in the workshop with you, walking you through all the tricky ins and outs. I'm very glad we received this book and tried our hand at making something new!

I bought 3 of these to use as camping plates. You can no longer find the old fashioned pie-plate shaped ones sold for camping that can work as a plate and double as a soup bowl, all in one dish. Since the old camping plates are nothing more than a 9 inch pie pan anyways, I ordered these and am very pleased! The stainless steel is thick and sturdy, not at all prone to warping and these will honestly last a lifetime. These will be banged, dropped, stepped on and left out in the rain but they feel rugged and should hold up well to all of it! Plus they are quick and easy to hand wash, which is a must while camping out.Some camps are requiring that kids bring this type of pie plate so save yourself a ton of hassle and order these! Our set is replacing some brown enameled pie pans that can chip and add a rust-flavoring to your foods. These stainless ones won't have that issue. I wish I had ordered these from the beginning (as this is our THIRD set of camping dishes and we finally have ones that will last) but I guess you learn as you go!

Little lantern puts out a lot of light! This was really handy for our Halloween trick-or-treating. It rained this year, adding slick roads to the danger of nighttime traffic. We took the children around as a group and this light lit the way for all the adults (no one had brought a flashlight) and made it easy for our son to spot his parents in the crowd, ensuring he didn't get to far ahead of the group.I set the Luci to charge in a windowsill for about 8 hours of sunlight, deflated it and stored it flat on a shelf until it was needed Halloween night, about two weeks later. It lit up and glowed for several hours that night without even flickering or dimming. Multiple people admired it, switching it on and off through it's various settings of low, high, flash and off. It even got curious inquiries and compliments from strangers out with their children as well.Not only is this a great light to have on hand for emergencies but it's going to prove useful during family camp outs (we camp as a family about 6 times per year and my husband and son rack up another 3-6 camp outs with boy scouts). I also plan on using it during night time activities at New Year's and July 4th. I love that I don't have to suddenly worry about batteries as the sun is sinking in the sky during busy, eventful holidays when it would be difficult to run to the store in all the traffic - if you can even get to the store because the roads have been shut down for the parade/fireworks show/trick or treaters. This light makes my life a teensy bit easier!

What a fun toy set! The figurines are 3 inches tall, the sail wagons are about 4.5 inches long and the barrels are around 1.75 inches tall. It's made by Fisher Price and rated for ages 3 and up. I love the bowling barrels because little boys cannot resist knocking down and destroying something stacked up!This set comes as two full-sized toys separately packaged. Each one is large enough to be given as a gift on it's own so it would easily cover two birthday parties or a gift for twins! I was fortunate to purchase this toy at a discount (not free) to test out and review. It's well made, well painted, adorably detailed and is the high quality you expect from Fisher Price. The 2-pack is a good buy. A local toy store has just a single Jake figurine for $8 so getting two gifts for ten bucks is a great deal!

Thick, plushy yoga mat is perfect for my fat butt as I attempt to do something that looks like yoga (but really just squishes gas out of me.) Thank goodness I have a yoga iPhone app and can pose...and fart...in the privacy of my own home! I was fortunate to be able to purchase this mat at a discount (not free) to try out after my old thin pink pad quit being fabulous and looked more like a trampled-flat bath mat. I love the electric apple color of this one and the carry strap is handy for holding it all together and tucking behind the door...where I can't see it so I can eat my ice cream in peace. Now I'm hoping the memory foam doesn't remember how many times I broke wind across it's soft, shock-absorbent surface while I drenched it's dimpled face in pools of sweat. All yoga is hot yoga to me. If you're already cute and skinny, I can guarantee you'll like how you look on this mat (because let's face it, you're already gorgeous and you'll look even better when hippos like me waddle into class!) As advertized, this mat was totally odor free (well, until I - ahem - used it) and didn't reek of plastic at all when I first opened it.
High quality bamboo terry with a great feel! One side is loopy and the other side is smooth. Perfect!

This hat is incredibly light weight, easy to wear and easy to pack! It is ultra-thin and almost feels almost like a pair of women's tights. Great for cool weather and can be used as a baselayer hat with a warmer wool hat over it for the coldest winter days. I does a good job of hanging on to your head when you sleep (unlike a power stretch fleece hat I bought elsewhere that pops off if I barely move in my sleeping bag). You can also wear it as heat-regulating layer under a straw hat and it will help keep the straw hat on without a chin strap. (It also keeps my hair in place, flowing out cutely from under the hat without letting it blow in my face and dragging strands across my chapsticked lips in the breeze.) The hat wads up to fit in the palm of your hand and is so light, it is easy to forget which pocket you shoved it in because you cannot feel any bulk.The most interesting aspect is how the ultra lightweight hat can keep you either warm or cool. You won't overheat and you won't freeze in slightly cooler weather. It's kind of amazing like that!

I was searching for a kid's poncho that would be durable and would not easily rip, puncture or snag. The plastic trash bag kind are a joke and some of the "fabric like" ones rip so easily they might as well be made of plastic, too. When this one arrived, I took one small raw edge and TRIED to rip it. The material barely budged and simply began separating to reveal strands of fabric as I tugged. The entire poncho is made of fabric that has been treated with a silky, plastic-like PVC coating so it sheds water. I was very happy about this discovery because that means any cuts in the poncho can be glued, taped or even sewn and then taped if necessary. I think I finally found the durable children's poncho I was searching for!

This is a surprisingly good quality shell jacket! The sizing runs large. My son wears a size 10 pant and 10/12 shirt but the 10/12 jacket fit him like a size 14. He would need the size 8 jacket in this brand for it to fit right now. I love the navy blue. He likes the lime green accents. This feels like a Columbia men's jacket we have and will repel the wind incredibly well. Sure to keep him warm!

Vitamin C serum is incredible for preventing your hands from drying out and cracking. I wash my hands too much and my knuckles end up cracking and bleeding. Vitamin C serum is the easiest cure I have found! It reversed the drying with the first application and keeps my hands soft and healthy, no matter how much hand washing I have to do. I was fortunate to be able to purchase this product at a discount and try it out before the winter set in and my hands really became painful. I'm thrilled with how soft the serum makes my skin!

Each summer I spend a week volunteering as a youth camp counselor. It's an electronics-free camp where teens get a chance to unplug and swim, do archery, zip lines and handmade crafts. Parents expect that while they are out of touch with their cell phone-less children that the counselors will be well prepared for any accident, injury or unforeseen teen incident. (And believe me, the craziest things happen!)  You simply MUST have a good, sturdy bag with you at all times full of the things you're going to need to remedy any situation, which almost always requires band-aids!This bag is surprisingly well thought-out. Inside the main body is a single pouch pocket along the back that is 7.5 inches wide. Great for stashing your guidebook (or a tablet) and keeping it separate from other items. The remainder of the main body (10 x 13 inches) is open and could easily fit a water bottle and sack lunch. Or, in my case, a large first aid kit.The front pocket features an abundance of pockets that are incredibly handy! First there is a 4x4 inch mesh zippered pocket. Behind it is a 5x4 inch open top slip-pocket for a cell phone, bottle of bug spray or sunscreen. Behind that is a large 6 x 5.5 pocket for your largest items. To the right of the mesh pocket are two pencil pockets, large enough to hold a standard Sharpie marker. (For some reason pens and markers are so hard to find when you're at camp yet you always seem to need one!)  A red key clip dangles securely in front of the pockets.There is a small mesh cell phone pocket on the side. At first I thought it was a water bottle holder but at only 2 and a half inches wide, it was too narrow for a plastic bottle. That is fine because a bottle hanging off that side of the pack would bump against your side and rub you.Stitched into the side body of the bag, near the mesh cell phone pocket, are two back and reflective silver gear loops. They are large enough to slip a carabiner through to attach additional lightweight objects.On the cross body strap is a 7x3 inch zippered pouch. it's long and deep, ideal for holding anything you need frequent access to. I plan to keep a bug bite stick, a pen, chapstick and travel size essential oils in that pocket.The back of the bag is a black padded mesh which will help keep your own back and shoulders from becoming chaffed and overheated. The pack strap can be disconnected and clipped to a second attachment point on the other side so it becomes a left-handed cross body bag if desired. The body strap can be adjusted, extending to accommodate an estimated 250 pound frame.The material: I opted for the blue bag, which is a gorgeous vibrant aqua. The material is a rip-stop kind of weave and seems to be water resistant. This is perfect because I need a bag that I can spot across the mess hall that will easily shed glitter from crafts and splatters from food fights, all in the same day's work.I'm incredibly pleased with this bag! I was fortunate to be able to buy it at a slight discount (not free) to test out. It is well sewn and feels rugged; surprisingly so for the price. I've had many bags (I typically carry an REI Flash 18) so i know good quality and I know what will hold up under real-life outdoor abuse. I hope my measurements and pictures help you make the best bag purchase for your adventures!

This is our second weather blitz football and we love them! The first one was so "loved" that it disappeared right out of our front yard and was never seen again. This replacement is just as easy to throw and catch, making young boys believe they are as cool as their dad and helping them feel confident about their throwing and catching skills. This also makes a great football for the beach because you can quickly dunk it to wash the sand off.Let me be the first to warn you that if it is left sitting out, unattended in the grass, it may be picked up for a quick game of catch by someone else and never make it back home! Perhaps I should have ordered two replacements...

This is exactly what i needed for keeping dirt out of our tent! Boots pick up so much mud, almost without you realizing it, and then it gets tracked into the tent or the cabin and someone (read: mom) gets to waste her vacation time sweeping the floor. Again. This boot scraper takes mere seconds to use and prevents a lot of muddy, yucky floors. I was shopping for one of these for our upcoming camping season when I was fortunate to be able to purchase one at a discount (not free) to test out.The thick, strong black plastic bristles are long, for poking in all the nooks and crannies of your boot soles and the surrounding sides to pick and pry mud from every angle. Of course it works for adult shoes but how about children's boots? I tested it out with my son's size 5 boots and found the bristles were plenty long enough to do a great job of getting the debris off them, too! The space between the bristles is 3.4 inches so as long as your child's shoe is wider than that, it will scrape the mud and snow off the sides. The bristles on the bottom will scrape any and every boot it touches.I'm really pleased with this simple product that makes it easier to keep a clean cabin!

This little light is ADORABLE!!! I wanted something that was similar to a Luci light but a bit more kid-sized and soft for little ones. This fit the bill! Simply set it in a window to let it charge and then turn it on for a nice glow! Children seem drawn to fun little lights like this but I really like that it doubles as an emergency light or nightlight for when tropical storms and hurricanes knock out the power here in Houston. Solar charge will hold for quite a while. I'm so glad we have solar lights on-hand now!Green squares fabric is exactly the color shown!

12 rolls of packing tape, exactly as described! This is made by a brand called CWC and is a perfect tape for assembling boxes quick and easy! (This is not thick, name brand tape but it is plenty strong and has good stickiness!) I have found that to keep the end from sticking to itself and then shredding into strips when you try to use it again is to flip the end down so sticky side is touching sticky side to create a pull-tab on the end of the roll. This makes it easier to start taping another box right away and then gives each box a pull-tab for opening later so you don't need a pocket knife. Also a great trick for sealing up Christmas gift boxes (after you have checked to see what was in the Amazon box!) so they're easier to open by the recipient: simply pull the tape tab at the end and the entire strip of tape holding the box closed comes off. No scissors or box cutters needed on Christmas morning!
Great looking water bottle! Love the flip top lid and that it is BPA free!

Fun card games that are so much more portable than board games! No dice, no pieces, just simple, easy cards that can be rubber-banded together and taken along anywhere! Both are for ages 8 and up but I think 7 year-olds may be able to comprehend the rules well enough to play. I was fortunate to receive these at a discount (not free) to try out and review!

Good quality water bottle infuser! I bought the lime green and am very pleased that it shipped with a black neoprene cover and a carabiner to hang it from! My son was interested in it because of these sporty features (it looks black and electric green when it's in the sleeve - very cool!) and now wants to try fruit in his water. Awesome!

Great tunic top! I followed other's advice and ordered two sizes up, and I'm so glad I did! The tunic fit comfortably and has room for a little shrinkage (I'll hang this one to dry. It would probably shrink too much in the dryer.) The Navy is a beautiful inky midnight blue that popped when paired with bright tees or tanks underneath and punchy colored accessories. I'm tall so the tunic hits me a little higher than it does on the model but it still covers the top of my pants.

Wow, these are nice quality colored pencils! I lost a set of Prismacolors and was really missing them. I purchased a set of Prang colored pencils and these, wanting a good quality set at a reasonable price. These are hands-down my favorite. They have a rich color and draw with a creamy smooth feel that I adore. They're not at all dry, brittle or gritty like some colored pencils.In the first picture I drew with Prang brand on the LEFT and Siensync on the RIGHT on a strip of thick white cardstock. You can see the Prang pencils did just fine but they have a bit of "patterning" to them, as if I was doing a rubbing of a wood grain. The picture shows the gritty texture of the line they left better than I can explain it - Prang just didn't color super smooth. The Siensync on the other hand color like butter and lay down a beautiful, rich hue. I was able to do fine detail work and handlettering with them or I could press harder, which I did with the red color sample, to achieve thick, vibrantly bold lines.I'm a graphic artist but I indulge in doodle work here and there. THESE are the kind of colored pencils I was hoping to find for my artistic endeavors! I'm quite pleased with them and so glad that I spent a little more on the 48 pack to get an array of colors!

Thank goodness someone invented these! I cannot stand the smell of open cans of cat food yet when my cat is sick and can only take medication with wet food, I have to have one of those itty bitty cans open for a day or two until we finish the dosing. (Ah, the strange problems of a cat lady. Luckily I only have one.) I think they made those cans especially slick so that neither plastic wrap or aluminum foil will properly grip them to give an airtight seal. And even if they did, that brat cat could still rip through them in an instant.So here I was, dry heaving at the smell of canned cat food that was temporarily permeating my kitchen, when I was fortunate enough to be able to purchase these silicone lids at a slight discount (not free) to try them out. I was thrilled - THRILLED - when I opened my package of 6 (which is way too many. You could easily split the set with a friend) and discovered an itty bitty baby silicone lid that looked like it might actually fit those microscopic stink bombs I feed my sick cat. I dashed to the pantry to retrieve one of the little pipsqueaks and squealed with delight when I realized the silicone lid fit the can! I won't have to deal with any more putrid fish gut cat food smells in my fridge! I was so excited, I even took a picture, folks!Just for fun I slapped the silicone lid on a regular can of husband food (the effects of which also stink up my master bathroom) and discovered that SAME little tiny lid fit the regular sized grocery store cans as well. As you can imagine, this little guy got a prominent spot on the cabinet shelf, where I can quickly find him next time I am retching over that danged puke-gut cat food.The other lids are great, too! I was delighted to find the largest one fit over my KitchenAid mixing bowl, so I can also keep the cat out of the cookie batter. And the husband, too, for that matter. It's taut surface gives me a great place to Sharpie warnings and death threats to anyone who dares to eat a single chocolate morsel before the cookies are baked. I'm sure I'll find several other uses for them, too. However, the large one doesn't fit over the toilet bowl so you're still going to have to use Saran Wrap for that prank.In short, I am thrilled with my purchase and look forward to covering up all kinds of things!
