I needed a towel that I could keep in my car for downpours or easily take with me on a day hike. Previously I'd been lugging a full size beach towel around with me but it has bulky and ridiculous. I'm picky about microfiber (I don't like the loopy kind) so I was skeptical. I'm happy to report this is a SUEDE microfiber towel that is super soft, it packs down small and it makes it soooooo easy to keep a towel on-hand without taking up a ton of space!

This pair of bags has the finest yet most durable nylon mesh I've ever seen. I've not seen fabric like this before but I'm very impressed by it!  I was fortunate to be able to buy these at a slight discount (not free) to try them out before all the holiday baking began. The bags are large and sturdy. They are THICK and really well stitched. The edges are serged and there is a second stitching around the edge to make sure they last forever. I love the hanging loop at the top!If you've never made mozzarella cheese from scratch, you have to place the cheese curds in a cheese cloth/fine mesh bag and let all the whey drain from the cheese. This takes a bit of time and you need to make sure your cloth/bag is STURDY and can handle the weight because it's going to be hanging there a while. These bags are easily up to the task!Are these worth the price? ABSOLUTELY. I just spent $20 buying a bolt of fine cheesecloth two months ago and I wish I'd found these sooner because they are really top-notch. I'd love it if the company also made tea bags so I could steep herbs from my garden. I'll be watching to see if they offer them because I'm loving the high quality of this set!

This is a nice, lightweight little lunch kit at an affordable price if you're looking for entry level stainless steel lunch containers. Notice I said Lightweight, because it is. This is not the thick, heavy duty stainless steel the $20 boxes are made out of. It's lighter weight, more like an altoids tin, for easy lunch toting and camping. For holding a sandwich that you're going to tuck into your bag, it is ideal and at a great price point.  Just be aware that the somewhat thin stainless can scratch and dent more easily than the heavier stuff.The silver triangle lid holder isn't terribly useful. (When the item ships, the piece is inside for you to assemble yourself so you can leave it off if you prefer.) A rubber band would hold the lid on well enough and you could band a napkin to it with your meal. This container is in NO WAY leak proof. This tin is for completely dry foods and snacks only. Any long-standing liquid may cause water spots that turn into little rust spots. (Stainless means it "stains less" than other metals, not that it is stain-proof.)Allergy Friendly: There is no plastic on or in this lunch box whatsoever. I know some people have allergies to plastic, plastic fillers, etc. This has none of that and is excellent for those with allergies or who want to avoid plastics touching their food.Our family does a LOT of camping and picnic lunches at the park on beautiful days so I'm happy that I was able to purchase this lunch box at a slight discount (not free) to test and review. I hope my honesty about the thinner, lightweight nature of the dish helps you make the best purchasing decision for your family!

My husband has a very thick, scratchy beard that constantly needs oil. He had been using a few other products when I was able to get this oil at a discount for him to try. It's a good quality blend of ORGANIC Argan and Jojoba oil that is silky in your hands but has no additional scent. I really liked that aspect because I can add therapeutic grade essential oils to it for a customized fragrance or select oils that help boost mood, energy and alertness. (The fact that he's applying this to his beard, just under his nose, is a perfect delivery system for oils that should be taken aromatically for alertness and morning energy.)Does it help your beard grow faster?Nurtured, well-moisturized skin and hair follicles will have the nutrients and environment they need to grow as fast as your genetics dictate. However the difference may only be in microns. It seems to me (and I'm no expert) that beard oil helps moisturize and weigh down the wiry hairs, helping to straighten them and that gives the appearance that your beard or mustache is longer or growing more quickly.

I'm really picky about microfiber. Some microfiber feels fine and other microfiber (especially the loopy kind) grips and catches at my skin in the weirdest way that I don't like and it doesn't even dry me off. I typically haul a full sized beach towel with me whenever I think I may need one because I can't stand how little pocket microfiber towels feel. I can't even stand thin, cheap beach towels. (Just take my word for it, I'm picky about towels!)  I know I look ridiculous hiking around with a fat, rolled up beach towel in my day pack but I just don't like microfiber!I wish the seller would state that this is a SUEDE microfiber towel that is so deliciously smooth, it's like drying off with a magic shammy. It's thin, lightweight and does NOT have tiny threads that catch on microscopic ridges in my skin the way other microfiber towels have done. In fact, there is no way for it to catch because the entire thing seriously feels like suede. FINALLY! A microfiber towel that packs small, will dry me off and that doesn't make me grit my teeth because I can't stand touching it!The entire towel in it's pouch is 6.5 inches long, 3 inches in diameter and 10 inches in circumference. The towel itself has a sewn-on bungee strap so you can easily roll it up and pack it without the hassle of a storage bag if you'd like. My husband is into ultralight backpacking and I know this would easily fit in the water bottle side-pocket of a pack or nest inside of a titanium cup if you wanted to pack it that way. (I should probably hide this towel from him.)In short, I'm surprisingly pleased with the feel and quality of this towel!I was fortunate to receive this product at a slight discount (not free) so that I could try it, use it, abuse it and determine if it is worth spending your hard-earned money on. If it doesnt work, I will tell you. If I found that the product did work for me, I will be detailed in my review about what aspects I liked the best. I hope my honesty helps you to make the best buying decision for your family!

I was quite impressed with the quality of this set of smoothie straws! First, the stainless straws arrive individually wrapped inside of their packaging. The straws themselves are smooth, shiny and don't have any welding lines or other unsightly blemishes on them. They have been polished to a mirror finish and each one has a small etched Savvy Straw logo. The ends of the straws have also been slightly rounded and smoothed so there is no way to cut your lip. I appreciate that the cleaning brush that comes with the straws has been custom designed to fit perfectly inside of these straws. It's not too big nor too small and it's sturdy - it doesn't bend or distort itself as you try to shove it down the straw.Each straw has some heft to it, implying it is no flimsy stainless steel. They are a hair over 1/4 inch wide inside the opening and while I've seen some massive plastic straws that are wider, these are no slouch and are plenty wide for easy smoothie sipping. All in all, this is a much nicer set of straws than I was anticipating!I was fortunate to receive this product at a slight discount (not free) so that I could try it, use it, abuse it and determine if it is worth spending your hard-earned money on. If it doesnt work, I will tell you. If I found that the product did work for me, I will be detailed in my review about what aspects I liked the best. I hope my honesty helps you to make the best buying decision for your family!

Excellent pogo stick for beginners! The foot pads are wide enough that you don't slip off and the padded handlebars are great in case you topple to one side and accidentally bonk yourself in the face. (Hey, it happens!)This stick is for beginners that are just learning. It takes about 2 days for a child to learn to pogo, especially if they are tall or longer-legged. Start on a very flat surface (not a slanted driveway) and encourage them to be patient as they learn how to balance on it. And once you learn, you never forget! But don't try it, dad - this pogo smashes pretty flat if an adult tries to use it because it's only rated to 80 pounds! (Might handle 90 lbs okay.)  Soon they'll be able to do several bounces in a row and, before you're completely comfortable with the idea, they'll be taking massive leaps on the thing, galloping down the cul-de-sac!Incredibly fun outdoor toy in a bright color that helps you spot it so you don't run it over if it's left out in the driveway!I was fortunate to receive this product at a slight discount (not free) so that I could try it, use it, abuse it and determine if it is worth spending your hard-earned money on. If it doesnt work, I will tell you. I hope my honesty helps you to make the best buying decision for your family!

I'm a girl. I needed a comfy, lightweight cotton shirt but the women's shirts have sleeves that are too short on me. Instead I opted for the men's Columbia shirt and I'm so glad I did!First let me warn you that the "Sunset Red" shirt is actually FRUIT PUNCH RED. It's a coral-red shade that is very feminine. I love it but my husband would never wear something so....watermelon....so I don't have to worry about him stealing it! The material is lightweight but also thick enough that it's not see-through. I anticipate getting a lot of wear out of this during hikes, outdoor activities and as a summer camp counselor.The sizes run HUGE. I ordered a size Medium, which fits like a women's XL or 1X size. Plenty of room for shrinking. I can wear it as a long sleeve jacket over a tank to keep the sun off.

I'll be honest, I didn't think this product would really work that well. You know how diet pills are. I received a discount on this (not free) to try it out and since I was feeling a tad desperate to get sugar cravings under control, I bought it. I won't lie, the first pill did nothing. Second pill kind of gave me mild heartburn feelings, which I never suffer from. I figured it must be doing something. I took the third pill the next morning, maybe ten minutes before eating breakfast. My stomach growled around 2 pm, reminding me I hadn't yet stopped my projects to eat lunch. Wow. I'm not one to miss meals but I wasn't troubled enough by hunger to pause my work. This caught my attention.Now, this product is not strong enough to stop all hunger signals completely. It's more of a support to healthy eating that may help you cut out snacks or keep you less-than-ravenous so you have time to thoughtfully prepare something nutritious instead of gobbling whatever is readily available. I appreciate it's work as a support supplement but I don't have any expectations that it will cause me to shed pounds upon pounds. It has, however, been a nice jump-start to cutting out unnecessary sugars.I was fortunate to receive this product at a slight discount (not free) so that I could try it, use it, abuse it and determine if it is worth spending your hard-earned money on. If it doesnt work, I will tell you. If I found that the product did work for me, I will be detailed in my review about how I used it and what aspects I liked the best. I hope my honesty helps you to make the best buying decision for your family!

My husband likes this beard balm a lot but I really like the smell! It has a woodsy, cedar-and-outdoors kind of smell that is faint but appealing. He's got a couple other products but I find myself favoring this one the most. Masculine and attractive scent!

I've heard good things about Vitamin C serum but I hadn't tried it yet. I use an essential oil-based facial care system that I felt was doing a good job on my face. I had no idea how this serum would improve my current regimen! It did make the skin on my face softer after only a single use. However, I feel this product deserves rave reviews for what it did for my hands.I wash my hands a LOT and I often get dry skin on my knuckles because of this. In the fall and winter it can get so bad sometimes that my skin forms thin cracks and blood seeps into the crack, giving my hands an ugly and unkempt appearance. It's embarrassing. Lotion doesn't seem to help. I tried slathering the backs of my hands with coconut oil but it didn't do much good either. Antibiotic ointment provided some relief but it was greasy and got on my clothing easily. When I bought this serum, my knuckles were beginning to show signs of cracking so I decided I would try several drops of the serum on the back of both hands to see if it helped. I awoke the next morning to normal looking skin. No whitish dry skin patches on my knuckles. It worked! I washed my hands all day and my skin didn't get worse. I did an experiment and skipped the serum that night and then washed my hands normally the second day, too. Still no dry skin. I resumed using the serum on my hands and noticed the skin had a much better, younger-looking texture than usual. My knuckles are now butter-soft. If this can spare me the pain of cracked and bleeding knuckles this winter, I will be thrilled to have found my cure!

I'll be honest, these tweezers aren't that great at plucking hairs. The tip of the tweezer is so tiny that there is not much surface area to use to grip a hair. But that's not why I bought them. I got them to use as a precision-point tool for small-to-tiny hobby tasks. I broke a component inside my digital drawing pen and used these tweezers to grip the microscopic bits and pieces I was trying to repair. For this task, it worked incredibly well!

I wanted some colored duck tape so I could mark a few specific storage boxes and make them easier to find amidst the other cardboard boxes. I didn't really care about the color so I ordered this value pack. I was pleased that I received 6 rolls of the exact color assortment shown! The first roll is a comic strip kind of design with action words which was almost immediately claimed by my 8 year-old. The next is cherries on black gingham. It's cute! The last design is a mystery. My son thinks it looks kind of like stacks of pastel ice cream scoops while I think it looks like a grandmother's floral sweater. "Daydreamy clouds" might also be a good description.It's obvious that duck brand is clearing out some old designs at bargain prices. I don't believe I have ever seen printed/colored duck tape at $1.67 per roll so this was an awesome buy!

I was very pleased with the nice quality and substantial feel of this fire poke! My husband is THAT GUY. The one who pokes, prods and arranges fires to ensure you're getting the best burn. Always fiddling with the fire, poking a stick in it like some kind of pyro-crazy eleven year old on his first boy scout campout. (For real, babe? Just sit back and relax! The fire is fine!)I decided to legitimize his fire-prodding needs by buying him one of these. It is long and quite heavy, which surprised me. I would expect to pay a lot more for such quality. The rod portion has a beautiful twist in the middle of it and the handle has a hand-wrought spiral at the end, giving it an unexpected look of elegance. I've already ordered one for my dad and father-in-law because I know my mom and mother-in-law won't mind having such a handsome yet functional piece of fire pit equipment. (It's also long enough that you could use it to nudge a snake out of the way if one dared come near your fire circle or your patio for that matter.) I believe it will be a well-received gift, especially for outdoorsy parents who have everything and are difficult to shop for!
Classic and plastic. Does the job.
Inflated kiddie swim pool, deflated kiddie swim pool.Works like a charm.
Zee lovebird loves this food. Thrives on it.

Even my husband loves this. If you live in NYC you must get one of these. This is the perfect schlepping cart for laundry and groceries and it folds down and does not weigh a ton. I can put a full week of groceries in this and move it from my car to apartment. Also perfect for traveling back and forth places - if you have to take baby and kids gear get one of these as you won't have to juggle a million bags etc. Just toss the toy bunny and other stuff in this!
Got rid of stinkbugs, mosquitos, and carpenter bees!
Good super fine set of strainers
Basic can, nice addition with shovel holder on side.Does the trick.
These run at least a size smaller than listed.These last about one summer season of use, but they are good comfortable and basic.More comfortable than havianas as they are quite cushioned.

I hate flavored toothpaste. This stuff is amazing. No flavor and the xylitol keeps your teeth fat cleaner than normal toothpastes. I found this by accident on Amazon, gave it a try and not looking back.
Very good memory foam - did not come with horrible order like many of these things.
My dog loves this pet pen! Easy to use, folds up when. It in use.The door is the only thing that takes time to screw in. My dog loves sleeping in this.
Small, small, small. Have to use two pads for my Westie.

This is good for large or heavy people. I got it to give me a boost in he drivers seat but it's super firm and I am up too high! If you are a big person this would be good for you.It's great it is black and has removeable cover.

Fits mason jars regular mouth! Blasts through Kale and frozen berries. Love it. Loud but works great! I like it better than my immersion blender and cuisinart personal blender - the mason jars are easier to clean and do not scratch like the cuisinart set.
I have had the metal ones, but this one is great as handles don't get freezing cold and are easy as heck to turn.The metal ones are a pain in the hand!
Excellent for bleach bottles or bottle with similar top.Love these. Purchased gem and cancelled because Pep Boys has them for $1.99.Enough said.

Works well for aerating laundry in dryer - last forever - not fuzz balls or residue left behind. I purchased another set on a crafty website and the ball pilled and left fuzz all over clothes - Woolzies do not do that. You can add essential oils but the balls will not scent you clothes likedryer sheets.

Too expensive - there are other options. I considered this item but decided not to purchase it due to the price. Instead I bought and Oster beehive blender on Amazon for 29 dollars and free shipping - I took the blade off of the glass blender jar attached it to a mason 8 ounce jar not even with a rubber o ring and put this on the beehive blender. Pulverized frozen fruit, kale and almond milk. Cheap effective.I do own a cuisinart personal blender but the cups are a big pain to clean. The mason jars are great on the oster!So three stars for being the only device geared towards mason jars.

I purchased a Johnny Beard bellows and was pleasantly and happily shocked to see the level of craftsmanship and quality put into the bellow. It's gorgeous and made to last. If you balk at the money, think about the fact that his might last your lifetime, it's that good.

I had another steamfast model on of their first and fell in love with it, but it output a lot of steam and my floors were left quite wet after use. I now reserve my earlier model for super grimes jobs.This model is fantastic! It makes mopping fun and fast. It outputs just enough steak to clean and dry fast. Do not let the small tank deceive you - it can clean many rooms!If you hate cleaning and hate mops even more get this! It seriously makes cleaning fun. Also you do not have to wait for steam! Once you turn the mop on the steam is immediate, previous models you had to wait for water to boil, much like a tea kettle.
Replacement kit was great except the widths of the Teflon strips were too narrow to use with my sealer. I needed up purchasing Teflon cooking sheets and cutting strips to size that worked.
I love this stuff. I use it in my Brooklyn garden and it guarantees a  thriving  garden jungle in the growing months.
Author only likes Pomona pectin. Was disappointed, as I am not a big fan of this type of pectin. Other than that delightful little book.

The product is great. In theory packaging is a great idea but its difficult to squeeze the container and aim drops into eye. It woks by a top bottom squeeze pinch method. If you do not have strength, get more traditional bottles to use for drops.

I was looking for another Salton YM9 Yogurt Maker which Salton has discontinued. This is a duplicate of the same product for three times the price! This works well but the price for a plastic incubator is very high!

I received a big blow to one eye which resulted in a massive floater that affected my vision severely. I had cloudiness, halos, and dizziness. I purchased these drops, and the clinitas drops with hylauronic acid and started using them a week after injury. Two doctors said I would have to live with the floater.I also started using bilberry as a supplement, and drinking chicken and miso broth which have levels of hylauronic acid in them. This is what the jelly in your eye is made of.Four weeks later my eye is almost perfect. I have a very slight hint of haze that is almost imperceptible.I use the drops four times a day.Also treating my elderly dog with severe cloudiness - it seems to be clearing, but will report back later if it clears her eyes substantially.I think possibly one must attack externally with drops and internally wi supplements etc. This method seemed to work for me. I am just grateful that the giant blob floater is gone, and I don't have to live with the disorienting nausea caused from it.Both of my eye doctors had never heard of these drops, but the medical establishment will not be condoning these.If they were made by a big pharm company and marketed and had to be prescribed, I am sure they would be used more to treat people. My feeling is this - if your eyes are important to you then give these a shot. It's better than vision loss and or being operated on!

The first two ingredients are water and glycerin - they are cheap. In fact very cheap, that is what you are paying for.The smell is from DMAE which is the skin firming agent in the cream. You are paying for packaging, and little else that cannot be purchased elsewhere for much, much cheaper. In fact get some dmae capsule and mix it into a jar of drugstore cream and you have made your own skin firming cream, while you are at it, if e cream does not have any glycerin you can add some.

Ladies,This product has no exotic ingredient that warrants this kind of price. You can buy skin firming creams at Vitacost with DMAE the so called firming agent in this under twenty dollars! The second ingredient in this is glycolic acid which may brighten the neck skin by sloughing and turning over skins cells. You can also use a washcloth or salux to do so.Save your money.

I got this for my husband, but now have taken over the making and eating popsicles. This is so fantastic and fun - follow the instructions - do not overfill - go under the fill line by a bit,as when the liquid freezes it will expand upward!The trick to making popsicles that taste "store bought" is to add a tiny amount of guar gum whisked in preferably with immersion blender in the liquid. Google guar gum and zoku and you will get the amount to use with liquid. Guar adds mouth feel and makes the popsicle less of an ice cube( as in rock solid) and more of a frozfruit consistency. Also do not underestimate guar gum, a tiny amount goes a long way -it's used for gelling and emulsification in foods!If you like quick treats and noi hassle, get one!Last night I made creamsicles with orange juice, heavy cream, a little sugar and guar gum! Delicious!!

These are exactly like the other one featured on Amazon for triple the price. On the lowest setting this keeps the air fresh in our bed room!Works fantastic. Turned up high this does emit a small sound but its very negligible. This little piece has a small fan it that pumps the ozone out at bottom.as far as ozone being harmful, I highly doubt the amount that this emits is harmful. We use this in conjunction with a hepa air filter.

The bowl, top and plunger system developed stress fractures and cracks in less than a year of use. the polycoarbonate material they used in manufacturing is brittle.  At the top of the bowl the fractures are such that it has made the use of the processer dangerous as I am afraid that pieces will break off and go into whatever Iam processing.  I called the company and they said that parts would replaced if under a year old. I called just over a year as I had too many other things to do...I don't know if they will replace. I even offered to send the bowl so that they could see what the problem was.  The replacement powls are about $40.00 plus shipping, so I am not happy that this might have to be a yearly thing.  I never replaced my workbowl for cuisinart-worked fine for 15 years!

This stuff is amazing-it not only tastes exactly like sugar it looks like sugar. This is the only substitute sugar my husband has not detected. We have had it in our sugar bowl for five months and he still thinks it is sugar!

I recently bought two of these presses within two months of each other. The carafe is virtually unbreakable and of good manufacture,but the press piece with the plunger and screen are made of plasticand both cracked in the same place, making the presses unusable.I sent my Amazon receipts to the company which states on its information card that it will replace the component or comparableproduct.What did I get in the mail after waiting at least 6 weeks andpaying for shipping? My broken piece back in the box, with a form letter saying that I "did not" HAVE A WARRANTY! The limited warranty is attached to the product!To top it off the letter said it enclosed a 35% off coupon to use with it's site Potsandpans.com....Guess what NO COUPON enclosed!I have had one of these presses in the past and it was great, butI am wondering if the company and manufacturing changed.Recommendation DO NOT BUY!

You must read the instructions and follow them to get the knackof making "new" knife blades out of old. It took a bit to get myextremely dull knives sharpened, but now they are fantastic!I sharpened tiny paring knives up to my chinese cleaver and waspleased with the super sharp results.Make sure you allow the blades to align with the magnetic edge,do the passes according to instructions and you won't be sorry.Sorry Amazon doesn't have a better price, I actually found cheaper by $40.00 in Manhattan, still the price is good compared to some of the models I priced out at that big box store on 6th Avenue.  My husband can't believe this sharpener delivers the goods without the addition of oil and water during sharpening.

I have tried many yogurt makers, this is the best.The Easiset thick lush delicious yogurt1. 1 qt. whole milk+1/2 cup alba calcium fortified dry milk( you can use any powdered milk... this is for extra body and calium)2. Heat in microwave until 175 degrees approx 7 min on  High.(check your microwave of course for shorter or longer time))3. Cool between 110-115 degrees4. Scoop some of the warm milk into a clean glassadd, some active yogurt(dannon plain is okay) or add 1 package of Yogourmet Yogurt starter(best starter Ever, at health food store), stir throughly but not viciously!5. Add the starter mix to large container of cooled milk, stir.6. Pour milk into Yogurtcantainer that comes w/ set.7. 4 hours and fantastic Yogurt. Make sure you let it chill, gets thicker...and you won't believe your eyes and taste buds at the thick yummy yogurt!No additives, sweeteners, strange thickeners. I make every two days, can't keep it in the house, everyone waits for new batch. My husband has colitis and this is saving him!The price beats all on this appliance!
This fits and feels great. Durable fabric is soft but keeps it's shape. My daughter wore this one to school today. Said she kept it on cause it was so cold out. Got down to 82 today.

This set comes with everything you'd need for a jumping competition including a horse and rider. Very well thought out. Well done, as usual with lots of detail and realism. Everything is well made, stands straight, fits tightly together. We are never disappointed with Schleich (we have over 100 Schliech) and once again they have proven themselves worth the extra cost.

Nice sized paperback. Each book starts with an short overview, and has a discussion of key themes and a few key facts. Each chapter has a heading in red and every few pages has a text box discussing a concept or idea in the text and ending in one or more questions for the reader. At the end of each book is a set of questions and suggestions for taking it further. There are several colored maps and an index to the maps and two indexes to well known and not so well known bible passages.This is very well done and I appreciate that the text boxes are done by a variety of scholars so that no one perspective dominates.

Good size with pretty blue hard cover embellished with fish. Each book starts with an explanation of the book and it's general message as well as the people and places in the book. On almost every page there is a text box with commentary that explains or enhances the readings. The use of color and the text boxes breaks up the pages nicely and keeps it interesting.I take a liberal approach to the bible and found nothing I object to in the authors additions. for example one of the boxes in Deuterotomy started with "Why does God say to kill those who worship other gods? What does this mean today?" The author answers by explaining some history and then saying that today we look at people of other faiths respectfully and believe God wants us to live together in peace. "God's heart is happy when God sees us figuring out how to live together."

This comprehensive study guide has everything I can think of that would help a student score higher on the World History AP test. The first 50 pages deal with general info on how to think about the info to do well on the test, layout and function of the test. Then they give a diagnostic test so the student can make good decisions about where to focus the most energy. Two hundred pages are devoted to review. The info is divided into 5 chapters with high points at the front and review questions at the back of each chapter. There are 4 practice tests at the back of the book along with a sturdy 1 page tearout study sheet and a DVD that reviews the most important concepts.

I love the design. This acrylic jar hold a nice sized salad and the cap has a little jar attached to hold dressing. I don't put dressing in there, I put "wet" veggies like tomatoes and olives.  The cover fits tight with no leaks but seems to go on a little hard.
Soft but durable sweater fits great and looks great on my daughter. She loves it so much she wore it all day today despite temps in the 90s!

I got my daughter an expensive basketball hoop but we've not used it much. This ball has inspired more play from both of us. She loves she size and weight so we are using it not only to play with the hoop but for other ball play. She is  not a strong dribbler but I believe she has improved in the past few days just from playing with this ball more.

I am impressed with the variety and creativeness of these recipes. Mostly classic eastern fare but always with a twist. There are a few things that seem not classic at all like candied grapefruit peels and some downright weirdos like garlic marshmallows but they all look fun. I really like the layout of a full page pic on one side and a recipe on the other. There are eight suggested menus, two for each season. The recipes are grouped for each menu rather than separated by main dish, veg, dessert etc. his makes for fun browsing and easy meal planning.

I am thrilled with this play set. We have been oogling it since it's been on the Scheich website but knew that because of the cost it was not an option for us. Not that it is not worth the cost, just too much for us to swing. When it showed up on my free vine queue I swooped it up. When my daughter opened the box she was practically in tears. We put it together and it is divine! The details are beautiful and the design is so creative.I needed to help her put the big pieces together since the took super human strength to connect them. Once I clicked them in it was clear that the tight fit was intentional. This two story house is rock solid and will NOT be wiggling and coming apart. A small decorative piece of railing on the second story was missing. Very unusual. We have over a hundred Schleich figures and many playsets (yeah, I know) and have never encountered a missing piece or accessory so I actually looked around the room many times before I conceded it was missing. I emailed the company and they responded within hours to say sorry and they will mail us a new replacement piece.

This oversized watch is slim and beautiful. It was easy to set, keeps time well and has an attractive leather wristband. The wristband is a little weird and was hard to figure out how to close the clasp but once we figured it out it was fine. It comes wrapped in plastic inside a gift box that is lined with faux suede the is poorly sewn. Not the greatest if you are giving this as a gift but surely the beauty of the watch itself should make up for this deficiency.

This game is a little like Cards Against Humanity but not quite as outrageous. About half the cards are adult only humor that is mostly sexual with a few racist jokes and bad language. I pulled out those to play with my 10 year old and her friends. We were howling with laughter at some of the phrases. Even the cards left had some references that weren't offensive but were nonetheless incomprehensible to the kids. We still had a ton of fun. I would like a kid friendly version.
This is the best instant coffee I've ever had. It doesn't even taste like instant.

This was easy to put together and works like a dream. My mom has been mowing her .25 acre yard with a weed wacker all these years and loved it. She recently developed a back problem so I now have taken over her lawn work. After one go with the weed wacker I ordered this. Even she is impressed. It pushes pretty easy and cuts her grass cleanly. Yay!

Good basic Christian relationship book. Nothing new but an easy read with good info and lots of real life examples. This book is under 200 pages but I would like to see it with a bigger print even if that means adding on pages.

I did not care for this book at all. The author sees the cause of fighting to be self righteousness, entitlement, selfishness and anger. His solutions are to give in, let it go, look at things differently. He never addresses the emotional pain underneath the causes and never offers meaningful help for the many (most) folks who fight without feeling entitled or selfish.Additionally, the goal of never fighting is unreasonable. This guy is a psychologist. He should know better.

My 10 year old daughter tore into these as soon as we got them. The pieces fit together well and some of them are rigged to light up when connected to the base. I didn't realize that the base not only lights up the blocks but can be sound activated to light up to sound. The directions are pictorial, like legos does but they only provided one project in hard copy. The other 23 can be found online. An annoyance if you want to follow the directions. Some of the light up blocks seem a little fussy in that we had to turn them "just so" in order to sustain illumination. Other than those two minor details this toy rocks!

My 10 year old daughter opened this, set it up and started using it without any assistance from me. That in itself wins it 5 stars. Ours started off going slower than expected but we were using older batteries. Once I got some new ones it started to work as well and go really fast. It stands on it's own, balances well and turns on a dime! It comes with a removable rider that has a HD logo on his back. Really fun!I advise the frustration free packaging if  you can get it. Getting it out of the box was the hardest part of the whole set up.

Most books like this just focus on ways to style and braid hair but this on has a broader scope with great info on hair care, making and using accessories and little tips for making your day to day hair look better. Only about a third of the book is dedicated to special hair do's. This makes the book more usable and useful to us and encourages my daughter (indirectly) to take responsibility for her own hair by giving her the real info and tools to do so.

I used this with my new carpet cleaner on a strip of carpet that my dog keeps peeing on. It had some old stains as well as a fresh one. The directions say just 1 1/2 to 3 oz per gallon of water. I used 3oz and very hot water. I am impressed. It took up all but the oldest darkest stain (lightened it though). It has a pleasant scent that is not overpowering. I prefer this to the solution that came with my machine not only because it worked on the stains better but because it did not leave such a strong perfume and seemed to come up "cleaner" with no slippery feel. This could be because the solution is less concentrated but as long as it works as well as it does, I am happy to use less. It saves me money and puts less chemicals in my home and the environment.

This is drinkable, especially if it's really cold. Not "green" tasting at all and a little tart. The ingredients say spinach is the top ingredient after water. The bottle also says there are 11 3/4 spinach leaves per 46 oz bottle. No wonder it doesn't taste green! That works out to two spinach leaf per every 8 ounces of juice. Seems like a waste of calories to me if you are really trying to get some greens. The bottle also contains juice of 8 1/4 carrots, 2 apples and 1/8 cup of a combo of other veggie juice. 60 calories, 14 grams of carbs for 8oz juice.

Fun building toy with big, easy to assemble pieces, good directions and capacity for kids to create their own designs. My 10 year old daughter had fun with this without reading any directions or following any plan. She just opened the box and started making stuff. She does not do this with her legos. The directions give a variety of options easy to hard. Perfect for all levels of experience.

Perhaps I am spoiled by the "barely touch it and it staples" stapler at work but it seems this one needs a bit of force to make the staple prongs close and lay flat.  My 10 year old consistently cannot get the prongs to close on her staples unless the stapler is braced on the table. Even several times watching her and giving feedback does not help. It does staple 52 sheets nicely if you press down fast and hard. I tried 60 and the prongs just aren't long enough. This takes special staples and the seem to be thinner than the standard kind of staples.I ordered the black and red model and received  the black and white model twice. Not sure if this is the fault of the company or a glitch in Amazon's Vine order fulfillment department. The black and white one is beautiful and seems very well made.

Great book I devoured in one gulp. I don't usually do that but it was a good, easy read with clear, worthy concepts illustrated with lots of examples from movies, books and real life situations. I didn't feel talked down to and although it has a protestant Christian element,  I didn't feel like the author was preachy at all.

I've been using this for several days in a row and liking the 4 settings and 2 speeds. I'm not sure how the ceramic ring helps but I have not had a problem with my hair getting heat damaged so it must work. The diffuser works fine but I think it's easier to just use my hands. The speed/power toggle is right where my fingers rest so I have turned it off a couple times on accident. I think this is likely more of a thing I just need to get used to rather than a design flaw.
Thick consistency but leaves hair just lightly conditioned. Felt sticky going on but was easy to rinse out. The scent is mild and barely noticeable.
Fun building toy with big, easy to assemble pieces, good directions and capacity for kids to create their own designs. My 10 year old daughter had fun with this as did a 13 year old neighbor boy.

This little machine heats up water in about 30 seconds and produces a cuppa java in about 60 seconds. It is easy to fill, use and keep clean. You just insert the pod, adjust the bar to how many ounces you want and press a button. I use a standard coffee cup but if you used one of those tiny expresso cups there seems a potential of possibly the coffee dripping outside the edges of the cup but mostly the liquid comes out straight. I don't love all the flavors and wish I could find a fill it yourself pod for my own coffee but the machine itself is awesome.

These have great sound for the price and are very comfortable. They still allow some outside sound to come in so I can still have a conversation while listening to what ever I have on. I wear hearing aids and it is hard to find head phones that work for me but these are ideal.  They are comfy, breathable and super clear.

This doll is more attractive than our other earlier edition equestrian doll Twilight. She comes with a fabric skirt and plastic shirt and shoes. The plastic shirt stays on better and looks nicer than most fabric doll clothes. My daughter is particularly impressed with the fact that this equestria doll has feet. The earlier ones just have stumps that fit into ridiculously high heeled shoes.

I love all kale chips and really enjoyed these alot. They are fresh tasting and a little sweet with a ranch flavor. There weren't as many bigger chips as I would expect for the price. Half the bag was broken crumbs.

Got this to deter the neighbors cat from coming in our yard. I realized as I sprinkled that I would need far more than a 1lb can to deter him since 300 sq feet really isn't that much space. The product smells pleasant to me so I invited my dog to take a sniff. She kept coming back to sniff the open can as often as I invited her. I am not convinced that this stuff is aversive to any animal since my dog seems to like it so much. I will up my rating if I see any positive evidence of it repelling anyone.

Cool design, actual fabric (not plastic) and great price make this a winner. We have a big Halloween party each year and this is an elegant addition to our decorations. Seems sturdy enough to use but I would hand wash to make sure it doesn't snag in the washer.

I cooked this for 11 minutes and measured everything meticulously. I liked the texture but my daughter thought it was "chewy". She thought the flavor was "meh" but not bad. I thought it was cheesy enough but it tasted like "powdered cheese" instead of just cheese and more "powdery" than regular kraft powdered mac n cheese. I prefer the texture and taste of this noodle but can't get past that powdery thing going on. Too bad, I was really hoping to like this more.

Three little girls ages 9-11 played with this today. It was lots of fun and the horse walked well without tipping on most surfaces including a low pile carpet. The doll stays on pretty well except for when it is on an unstable surface. The doll does not always make it up onto the horse without getting stuck. There is definitely a learning curve here since somehow the youngest girl figured out how to do it most of the time while the other two had about a 50% success rate. One girl says it's an OK feature but not worth extra money. It seems pretty durable.

I love this product mostly because my daughter (who is not a fan of housework) loves it and and sweeps up the floors without assistance. It took reading the directions to figure out how to put the cloth in but once I had it together it works great. It's handy for getting way underneath furniture and nice not to have to carry the dust pan. It fulls up quick if you have a floor like mine but does the trick for small jobs.

We love the regular Apples to Apples but this is even for fun! We played it with some neighbor kids and laughed the whole time. I played it alone (without keeping score with my daughter later that night and laughed again. I know it will be fun when I being it to our big family gathering and play it with just the adults who will surely come up with some risque answers.

We have already had a ton of fun with this camera. It is fairly low resolution but can take 800 pics and 2 1/2 hours of video and comes with all kinds of mounts plus a waterproof case! It's been keeping my daughter busy and away from my phone. She says the 3 games it comes with are boring but fun enough to occupy her in a pinch.

Towels are pretty and absorbent. They need a quick iron after washing if you are going to use them as a 'display" towel rather than just keep it in th drawer but the effort is worth it. So pretty and elegant.

Applied this to my one big age spot on my face then covered with my regular foundation. This was the perfect color match for me and neither the coverup or the spot was noticable after I applied the rest of my makeup.

This is an "off brand" bag...nothing wrong with that...they are made with the same spec's as the Hoover brand. These are a nice thick material affording a better capture of the dirt/dust, especially good for us allergy sufferers. I would suggest these to anyone needing a Q bag!

Oh I wanted to love this...but I was so disappointed, honestly for 390 calories and 19 gm. of fat...I was prepared for greatness! Boy was I sadly disappointed. Too much non descriptive cheese sauce and too little macaroni...the macaroni was way over cooked.  The product was easy to heat, can eat right out of the pouch...but bring your wallet...at nearly 4.00 each, it's a bit over the top in pricing for what it is.

Another cookbook without photos...I don't understand a cookbook of any kind not having photos....we eat with our eyes first.  Plus I believe this is really geared to cooks in Europe, as there are a lot of items used that are relatively unknown in America...like 'rocket'.  Measurements are a blend of handfuls, which can vary greatly...and gm's, ml, oz, and jars...those can vary greatly in size too. This also needed another set of eyes on it for spell checking and incorrect words...my favorite was "white whine vinegar".  I hope the author will do an update and include photos.

I purchased this for our daughter and she loves it. She said it's well constructed and runs quietly. She has a glass top desk and said it stays put on it.  She has no complaints, I think I will get one for my laptop too...it's amazing the heat that blows out the left side of it!  So, with my girl really happy with it AND knowing the quality and good pricing of Belkin products, I would suggest this CoolSpot laptop cooling pad to anyone.***I purchased myself one for a laptop I use as a desktop...it gets real hot and thought this would help...it DOES! I plugged it into the laptop and turned it on, the fan started as soon as the laptop was powered and was not only moving air but doing it QUIETLY...a bonus in my mind! I really am pleased with this and feel it was an excellent price too. I would recommend this to everyone.***UPDATED Sept.2nd***. I still like it but do not love it, as it has become much noisier. I use this on a large TV tray, and not on any other surface, including not on my lap...so I feel its still a fair review. I am not sure WHY its become noisier, but it has and its distracting enough that if I was sitting and watching a video it would attract my attention, and not in a favorable way. I have deducted one star for this as its not that old and I feel it should still be as quiet as it was when purchased, just over 3 weeks ago!...so from a 5 star to a 4 star.

I don't know where to start...this is the neatest little vacuum!  I have NEVER had a vac this lightweight. I have had as many vac's as diets I have been on...lol...plenty! First let me say that the company REALLY put a lot of thought into the packaging of this vac...yes, the packaging. I'm a woman of a certain age and its not easy for me to open some boxes and or get things OUT of their box...THIS was a breeze! I sliced the big box that Amazon put it in, there was the Hoover box and some wadded paper. Pulled out the Hoover box, slit the taped top and could see there was folded corrugated cardboard at either side, I thought oh great, it will be anchored to that...it wasn't. I reached in, got a hold of the vac and pulled straight up...it came up with the cardboard pieces falling aside. The cardboard pieces are just cut and placed together like a little jigsaw puzzle, VERY easy to take apart, no glue or tape, and went right into my recycle bin...I appreciated THAT...the rest was easy too...box dealt with!The VAC...oh man, it's SO EASY to use...came with only one (and installed) filter....the handle snapped into place, one screw being needed and provided in a little orange bag. The CORD....LOVE that SOMEONE FINALLY SEES we needed longer cords on vacs!  I have a no name vacthat rhymes with 'Spears' that has a 18 ft. cord, drives me nuts...had another no name vac that rhymes with 'Bison' and it was about a 20 ft cordor so...its gone, but the 'Spears' brand is still here, now in the second position...for when I need to reach up with a tool on a hose for cleaning things up high. That is my ONLY complaint about this Hoover, I KNOW its a commercial, they don't use all the on-board tools in stores, motels, etc. but most women will still want to keep their old vac or get a little vac to use strictly when you need to clean those up over your head spots, like in the kitchen to clean the soffet areas or what I use the attachments for is to vac my many baskets that are all around the house...so tools DO have a use at home for most of us still, but for just plain old vacuuming this little light weight BEAST has my heart...it was so easy to maneuver and the suction was GREAT and the noise level was less than my big older vac.  I would definitely recommend this vac to anyone.

My husband has used ViewSonic before, and felt I would be very happy with their larger monitor. I had an old Samsung, that was great when it was new, but its now retired, pixels went bad and that is not good. I hooked this up alone, I unpacked it alone too...found it to be easy right out of the box. AND light weight, I REALLY thought that this being a 24" screen, that I would need help carrying it, thankfully I was wrong. I plugged it into the comp and into the electricity and was staring at a blank screen. I started to feel all around the frame, front, back and outside diameter...but did not find a power button. I called the company and spoke with a nice gentleman (Blain) who looked up this model and found where the buttons were. They are RIGHT in front...I had to get a flashlight to see them, guess I had not brushed exactly over them, but as soon as I DID it responded and turned on the monitor. I think its nice they are low profile, BUT, they should maybe put a little '3-d dot' or two on the power button...anyway that is where they are located, RIGHT SIDE near the little slash of white right where the bottom and side edges come together. When the monitor is ON that white slash will be blue. Once you find and touch the button you will see it hardly takes ANYTHING to turn it on...or off.  ALSO, Blain had said that if I was running windows 7 or higher, I probably would not need to use the CD that came with it, I was ready to run it, but I did not need to. He said there is lots of good info on the CD so I DO plan on taking time to look at it one day soon. Anyway, it set itself to full screen, the color is good, I really have no complaints about it at all...if that changes I will be back to change the review...but as of now, this looks to be a quality large screen monitor that I believe anyone would enjoy owning.  I DO hope that they come up with that '3-d dot' on the power button or a better "sketch" on their quick start guide, as of now that guide shows a finger pointing at a 'start button' and that is it...even if they were to give you a little blurb saying the control buttons are flush, positioned at the far bottom right front corner...something to help us out...especially those of us of a certain age ;-)  I would recommend this monitor to anyone looking for an updated replacement monitor.

There are several recipes that sound good in here...but...another e-cookbook sorely lacking photos. There is a thumbnail photo on the first page of each different section...like beef or fish, etc BUT those little photos aren't marked, you have no idea if they are of a casserole in the book or not. I just plain do not get why cookbook authors do not put a photo of EACH recipe in their book. I am hoping they will do an updated version and INCLUDE PHOTOS of all recipes.

Meals in jars has several nice sounding recipes I will undoubtedly try a few...this seems to be a very popular way to prepare, store, cook. My main complaint is NO PHOTOS!  The front cover is great, bright, colorful and appealing...so, why NO pictures inside?? This is a cookbook and it would be nice to see what we are aiming to create. I truly hope Mr Gordon does an update and adds a photo to each recipe...then it would be a five star!

I have a new George Foreman in the house...I own a little one that is almost an antique now...still works great but...the NEW one, oh...bigger cooking surface and cooks everything I want!  I the number one thing I love the most is it's plugged into an outdoor outlet, on the covered porch, right outback by the sliding glass door...can you say convenience?? ;-) not heating up the kitchen makes me very happy, I think this is a real winner! A fun and useable gift ESPECIALLY for apartment dwellers, MANY apartments will NOT allow BBQ'ING due to fire hazards...this takes care of that problem. Plus it's a beautiful shade of red.

Twigs, bark, poppyseed with a bit of lemon flavor...yep, not lying. I had high hopes for these...my sister-in-law bought me a box, she had previously bought me a box of Belvita cranberry orange biscuits (FYI, those are great) so I have had a similar item before...honestly, these are beyond bad,  I've never had anything this dry and bland from Nature Valley before. They do offer other flavors, but I think I'll pass...I'm full up on twigs and bark biscuits.
Bought this for my sister-in-law to replace an old all metal one. She LOVED this! Was happy the silicon will not chip or dent or mark up bowls.FYI, the red is as nice in person as it is in the photo.

This sounded interesting...I thumbed through it today and found several recipes that piqued my interest...but...why no photos?? Just the front of the book has one...and it's a lovely photo...I just wish the author would of taken a photo of every finished plate...it would spur me on to actually WANT to make all her recipes and brag about her book!

They say...."Perfectly Compatible with Kindle, iPad mini/1/2/3/4/Air, Galaxy and most 7"-10.1" tablets" BUT....it opens to about 8.25". Unless I am TOTALLY missing a switch, button or SOMETHING...there is NO WAY this EVER is going to fit a 10.1 tablet.  I have a Kindle Fire HDX which is under 9.25"...and this stand is NOWHERE near fitting it. I'M SO DISAPPOINTED...I was so looking forward to this product...it's a great idea gone wrong.  Plus they have only photo directions on the box...you do figure it out that it's some kind of spring loaded contraption...but, pull as I may it is never...ever...going to fit.  IF someone else who has reviewed this, will let me know just HOW they got this to fit a 9+ inch tablet, I will be back to change this review. Until then if I could give this a minus star vote I would!

I live out in the middle of nowhere and we have a lot of birds...I feed/water the birds and they love it here. Of course we get bird strikes and it breaks my heart to hear/see this happen. I have decals I bought at a no-name-box store during Easter, have them on a very large plate glass window, theywork great, a lot less strikes...hardly any actually.  I think these Artscape ones are pretty, and I am going to use them on the sliding glass door, to HOPEFULLY deflect birds and to keep people from walking into the doors. Their claim "The window decals break up the seamless reflection of the habitat to prevent birds from striking" is probably true, I'd say like any decal, of any print/decor. If nothing else they are more "adult" looking in their  style than a decorated hard boiled egg.

I'm not sure where the author is based, but there are some odd (to me) mixtures in her book. Some of the directions are not clear...but might make perfect sense to someone else, hard saying. I guess the thing I miss most about many of these E-books, including this one, are the lack of photo's. They'll put one photo on the front of the book and nothing IN the book...when you have recipes that are new and different from your normal foods, it's nice to see what you're aiming for...we "eat with our eyes" first.
Ok...if you don't have a cookbook available.  Seriously such a disappointment...if you're a new cook, it might be worth 3 stars.
Needs spell checking and MANY more recipes. This is not a free app, you'd expect more.

I bought two of this app developers apps thinking I'd actually learn something helpful, I was wrong. Both of the apps arecommon sense things not only that your doctor has told you...but you've seen it on the news, health reports and healthmagazine's. I wish I could get my money back for these 2 over priced apps, but can't...so I hope to help other's save their $$.
Might work for someone who wants a very basic app to help them out.This is mostly very common sense and widely available on the web and from your family doctor.

I like both of these, I put the motion activated one in my laundry room, our point of entrance/exit from our garage and cars. Nice to unlock the door and walk in without feeling around for the wall switch!  It's plugged in just above the counter tops, so it gives you decent lighting in the room, not just the floor. The free standing/wall mount one is nice too I have that one in a large walk in closet off in a poorly lit corner. What we really like is that these are LED lights, the free standing one should be pretty easy on batteries. I put the "Amazon Basics" rechargeable batteries in it and hope they will last in there like they have in other battery using products, I'm sure they'll do well. I would suggest these to anyone who wants a little light someplace for safety OR just to see a bit better in a closet or a pantry or hall. Oh, the plug in one will cover the whole plate when you plug it in, just something to be aware of.

It was a nice surprise that I received a 3-pack of these cushions -- I was expecting just one. It came with a red, blue, and yellow tomato cushion, and they're really cute.The cushions are pretty small -- the tomatoes are about 1.5" in diameter, but I'm petite and have tiny wrists, so it works well for me.  The velcro was adjustable on my wrist with room to spare (I really have skinny wrists). The pin cushion is reinforced by a hard plastic at the bottom of the tomato, so there is no danger of poking myself if I get too excited with pins and needles. It's cheap -- I mean it's a basic pincushion I didn't need it to be ber-fancy, but it doesn't seem like it'll fall apart right away.It would hold a couple dozen pins and needles, which should work fine for what I do (I normally do cross-stitching and basic sewing). Plus, they gave me three of these, so I can easily use one to hold stuff for cross-stitching, and another for sewing (and I have one extra!), so overall, I am quite happy with this product.

I guess I beg to differ with most of the other reviewers. It isn't bad, but it's not my favorite. It's got a standard girth, and the material is soft and flexible. It came in a really fancy box, and quite odorless, too.What I didn't care much for is that the "grasshopper" stimulator was too powerful. Maybe I'm just not one of those women who like it this powerful -- I went numb down there which didn't do much with my pleasurable goal. Also, the thing is quite noisy -- way too noisy for my liking. So I guess it's OK, some people may be OK with it, it's just not my favorite.

This will be too large for petite women. I was hoping for a more "standard" girth -- I'm more length than girth, I guess. When I opened it, I was, "OH WOW THAT'S HUGE!". The material is fairly similar to the real thing, and it's got a sweet strawberry-like scent which doesn't bother me.For me, it's probably good for novelty item. Only a few fortunate women will be able to take in this guy. I tried, and I am not one of them.

It's OK, I wish it was more ribbed than nubbed. I guess nubbed is not my thing -- or the nubs are just too protruded for me. And the on/off dial eventually didn't work well after a couple attempts at using it.

This is my first vibrator to own ever, so I did a lot of research, and so far this item has gotten a lot of reviews and mostly positive ones, so I decided to get this. I did not regret it.Since it's my first time using one, it took me some time to get used to the general sense of having this machine on my lady parts, but after a couple nights toying around with it while hubby is out, this little thing managed to provide me multiple orgasms, which is not usual for me. I started off with the lower setting, then progressed higher as I familiarized with my body more. Well needless to say, I hardly felt lonely on those nights hubby isn't available LOL.The only thing that makes it 4 out of 5 stars was because it drains the battery very quick. I got in half a dozen uses until the medium setting decreased its power significantly then died after several minutes (that session became really disappointing so I had to finish in a different way). Once I tossed in new batteries, and it was back to mind-blowing. :)

I like this, I'm petite and a size 1, and it contours my body well. I'd say order a size up if you aren't comfortable with very fitted clothes. The skirt is rather short, though even for my 5' height, it ends at mid-thigh. But it's sexy to wear with hoses, and if you're a bit more modest you can wear it with a pair of leggings and boots. The fabric is not thin or cheap-feeling, it's actually got a nice thickness to it, a perfect staple for winter.

Simple to operate, quiet, and easy to refill. The tank is quite huge, and it works well in a small bedroom. The low setting is very low, I hardly see any vapor coming out, so I usually set it to medium. It's very quiet, except for the occasional gurgle. You can turn off the night light - I really have no use for it since I really only need the humidifier part, but it's a nice soft blue. Probably too bright for people who normally sleep with the lights off but it's not too harsh. I am not sure about the "120-hour claim" since I don't really need to top off the tank as I only use the humidifier when I sleep, but half a tank does last me throughout a couple 6-hour nights. I can't say much about the ease/frequency of cleaning as I've only used it for a couple weeks. The reservoir is easy to grip -- there is also a handle at the underside so you can carry it upside-down right after refilling it.The only thing I am complaining about is very minor -- the item has a small cleaning brush that is attached to the underside of the reservoir -- well, supposedly. The brush keeps falling off so I just put it along the edge of the lower half of the unit rather than attach it to the reservoir. I don't know if that happens to others and maybe I just got a weird unit, but it's not a big deal to me. Also, when you refill, a few drops are to be expected to splash about so be careful. I'm used to refilling the inverted tank of our cat fountain so I'm used to it.

It wasn't what I expected for a $25 liquid leggings -- I've had significantly better quality leggings at $4 more. The fabric is thin, and the material is very plastic-looking and not faux-leather like. It was quite wrinkly -- my other pairs of liquid leggings have a thicker, firmer fabric. It felt like the black garbage bags if it were made of fabric. Sure, the wrinkles stretch out when you wear it, but the shininess just looked a little bit more costume-y than I expected. I'll probably wear it for Halloween costumes or maybe cosplay, but to me it looks a bit cheap to wear for a regular night out.

Out of the 10 seeds I got, only one sprouted. I tried scoring some of them, I tried just soaking some as-is, but the success rate was pretty slim. I soaked the seeds overnight and then planted them as directed, after a few days all but one rotted out (they broke apart and became mushy white stuff on the inside).Hopefully this one survivor actually is worth it. They say it takes quite a long time before you find out if the seeds are of good quality as the flowering period could take several years. Right now the lucky one is a 3-cm little thing and I am crossing my fingers. I've read that this plant can become uncontrollable if not taken care of properly and can destroy property -- so I'm attempting to make it a bonsai plant (potted) and learn.A lot of gardening sites say you'd be better off with a seedling than a seed, and making sure that the seedling came from a reliably flowering tree. I just gave these seeds a shot, they didn't survive me. Plus, they grow faster, obviously, since you don't have to work as much trying to germinate them.The vendor did give me a packet of 7 free giant Russian sunflower seeds together with the wisteria seeds, though. They all sprouted (after soaking), however, my husband mowed over the seedlings *sigh* (maybe I have a gardening curse). One still has leaves while the others are all reduced to tiny stalks. I hope that one also survives -- otherwise, I'll chalk it up to experience.

I had qualms with this, seeing as there are a few reviews about cats being able to tear their way out of this. But I got it anyway, and did a trial run inside the house. Our cat seemed very curious as to why she was in this tent and head-butted her way around it, but she finally got used to the screen. I played with her a bit inside the tent (I am 5' tall, I fit in sitting down with room to spare), then on the next warm sunny day we took the tent out to our deck.Our cat seemed pretty weirded out initially, since we usually take her out on a harness and leash, so she meowed quite a bit and did the head-butt all around the tent. But I tossed her favorite cardboard box and toys in with her, and gave her some space (definitely still keeping one eye on her). Eventually she sprawled on her belly, watching the birds and bunnies on the backyard. I guess she isn't crazy enough to tear it to pieces (she puts her paws up the tent walls to stretch, but hasn't torn it apart so I guess she's being gentle).Cat likes it, we like it especially when we feel too lazy to "walk" her around the yard, so it was actually a great buy. Also, setting up is a cinch, just make sure you tie a knot at the top strings so it doesn't collapse.

I just installed it in our 2007 Sonata SE, to replace the "universal" floor mat that we've got that kept on sliding around like crazy because it was much too small for the front floors of the car. According to the specs, this will fit our model of Sonata, and while I'd like to get the tan one to match the carpet, however, since the gray was on sale, I figured it would work.The product seems to be well-made, of rubberized plastic, and installation was a snap. It was flexible yet rigid enough to slip onto the floor, and it seems to be a nice, snug fit -- it was made perfectly for the car! It had enough coverage behind the pedals, there were no worries of snagging at the same time provides more protection. I did not notice any strong odor from the product -- it was mid-winter, but we'll see how it does in the summer.For its price, I think it's worth it. I only got the front liners, though -- we don't usually have passengers at the back of the car, so we'll keep the old liners in there for now. I think this cover will last for many years.

These shoes are quite comfortable and look nice. I am normally a size 5M but since they seem narrow at the toes I got two pairs of size 6 -- one nude and one black. I received two pairs of black, so I had to ask the vendor for an exchange, which they have done efficiently and painlessly.I believe these shoes are true to size. With that, the size 6 is an OK size for me, as long as I wear thick winter socks underneath. So I decided to have the vendor ship me a size 5.5 for the nude. The 5.5 actually worked for the regular pair of cotton socks. They do taper a bit at the toes, so this is not good for wide feet, but it worked for my 5M feet with some room to spare.The only parts that need breaking in are the shoelaces and the suede part of the shoe. I say shoelaces because they have this plasticky coating on it that makes it sort of stick out stiffly when you tie them. But I'd say a little exposure to weather elements it'll soften up and look better. The suede part of the shoe does not feel like suede -- more like felt. The shoe is going to be pretty stiff the first time you lace it up, however doing a few squats to get some crease into them softens the fit around your ankles.I only wish they'd design the flap at the top of the shoe (I don't know what you call those, but the flap where the shoelaces criss-cross each other) such that it's UNDER instead of over the side flaps of the shoe. That way you can lace up the shoe tightly or loosely depending on what you're wearing. Also, while I like the sole because it has those little nubs for better traction (why do most sleek boots have little or no traction?), the nubs are coated with some sort of felt, which is just weird, because it's counter-intuitive. It's not too slippery or anything, it's just that you have nice, grippy rubber soles but there's a thin layer of furry stuff coating it. I'm pretty sure it'll rub off with usage, so it's no biggie.Overall, they are still surprisingly comfy for me. It does not have any arch support, but the insole is padded enough for my feet. It's not the best boots I've ever had, however, it's a fair quality for its price.

Got the p12040 model from a home store (they're cheaper there, BTW) to replace the two ionization alarms across the hallway that kept going off when it took longer than usual to pull the pizza out of the oven. Seriously, the ionization alarms are at least 30 feet away from the oven and it still picks up "invisible combustible particles". There was no smoke whatsoever.Anyway, it was easy to install this photoelectric alarm. We did not have to change the wiring harness with the existing Kidde alarms that it replaced, just the mounting plates. Easy to test, and while it's not typical of alarms we're used to, the red light blinks every 30-40 seconds to indicate it's on standby. Also, I think you have to press the Test button upon installation or else it will chirp incessantly (I don't know yet if you have to do it every time you replace the batteries. It comes with a dust cover, so you can cover these if you are doing something dusty in the room.I don't want to jinx it, but so far it hasn't caused any false alarms due to burnt out parts. Maybe it's the older models (pe120) that had faulty parts? It hasn't been years yet, but I'm curious as to those people who had the p12040 model for a year or so if they had any similar problems?In case that happens (I really am hoping not), I'll post an update. Smoke alarm gremlins -- please leave me alone.

Smoke detectors are recommended to be in hallways outside bedrooms. Sigh.Our hallway outside our bedroom is very "conveniently" (hint: NOT) right next to the kitchen, and very close to the gas oven, and we had a ionization/CO alarm that gave us a scare when we first used the oven and called the fire department to confirm if there is any CO leak that we didn't know of when we bought the house. That's when we learned all about "nuisance alarms". The alarm from the apartment where we used to live rarely went off while we cook so - yeah, this annoyance was new to us. Given we have about 10 of these hardwired together when one went off and I hate loud noises, I knew the smoke alarm will be my least favorite of all household electronics.We got this to replace the one next to the kitchen -- it was easy to install and test (with earplugs), and so far it did not throw any tantrums during frozen pizza nights like we used to have. I did not have to replace the existing Kidde wiring harness -- just the mounting plate. It integrated well with the variety of Kidde alarms we currently have (we plan to replace the nuisance ones at some point in the future).I also installed this in our basement to replace the ionization type that we have right beside the laundry/furnace room (that also went off when we are using our flat iron). No nuisance so far, although we make sure we don't put steam directly beneath it. Of course, I also got a separate CO alarm for the basement, though, for added protection.4-stars because while I'd rather chuck each one of these out into the dumpster, I have to have these for my own safety. I don't love it. I like it enough because it saves me from having frequent heart attacks.I wish they'd be able to manufacture more alarms that's ear-friendly, not ear-splitting, while being able to alert you with the situation. Or sound out a voice warning a few minutes before it starts beeping like crazy. It's just ironic how you're supposed to "remain calm" when these things go off, but I usually feel like joining my kitty under the couch when it starts shrieking.

Got this to discipline our kitty after a few attempts of ordering squirt guns/sprayers and failing (our kitty had all the luck). The NERF super-soaker ironically was DOA, and we wanted the trigger-action, not pump action. I tried getting a small spray bottle, but it failed too. So I said -- screw it, I'm going to get a cheap squirt gun, and decided on this, since it's a 12-pack at less than a dollar each. If any one failed we can just toss the defective one and use a new one (hoping the working ones outnumber the duds).The day it was delivered I opened up half a dozen of these and filled them up. Out of those, one ended up leaky at the tip and another had a gaping hole on the barrel. The rest though, held up pretty well. I haven't seen any leaks with the plug so far, but I am extra careful not to lay it plug side down. I kept the others as spare, but so far, it's got a fairly good working percentage. As of this date, a total of 3 died (including the previous 2 I mentioned), the rest filled with water are still sitting around various locations of the house, waiting for kitty mischief.UPDATE: Three more died as of today, most of them due to leaks. The plastic itself is quite brittle, so I'm pretty sure that if you drop it on a hard floor it will just shatter. None of them leaked at the water input plug; most of them leaked around the colored tip of the gun, the trigger area, or the seam where the two plastic pieces are glued together. We are now down to 50% of this pack's original count. The ones that remained so far are still good after quite a bit of squirting (our kitty suddenly lapsed into a bout of craziness the past week or so). Thus the war on naughty kitty continues.

I have to admit the smoke detector is probably the least favorite of all the home appliances. I have quite a phobia for loud noises, and I grew up from a different country where smoke detectors aren't really a normal fixture in the house. But then, we don't really have gas heating appliances there so there's least risk of CO poisoning. Here, I have to live with it -- for our safety.We replaced the detector that was in the hallway nearest our bedroom (and consequently the kitchen) with a heat detector, because the former ionization detector kept on sounding every time we turn on the gas oven (we learned that gas ovens normally give a burst of CO during startup). So now that detector didn't cause issues. The one by the living room/kitchen area was also causing nuisance alarms, so we replaced the one with a photoelectric alarm. So far so good -- we have been cooking pot roasts and pizza without nasty surprises.Then we got a kitty and placed her on the storage/utility room, so we had to leave the door open for her to come and go to her room as she pleases. Cue frozen pizza dinner. We opened the oven door a few seconds longer than usual to get the pizza out, and the alarms went off. Of course we initially thought the ones nearer the kitchen were causing it, but after trying to hush those to no avail, we figured out the one that triggered was from kitty's room. Which was about 30 feet away from the oven, right at the other side of the house. And it is the i4618 model.The kitchen isn't even by a closed hallway -- it opens up to the living area. My husband was cooking bacon for chili the other night and of course, he opens the oven, and that same alarm starts shrieking. He hushed it and closed the door -- we never heard a peep from it afterwards. Seriously -- how far does this thing have to be from the kitchen before it stops causing us hearing loss for no reason?I understand that photoelectric alarms are better around kitchen areas -- but this room is the farthest away from the kitchen, and it's got a very sensitive trigger. I'm not entirely thrilled with smoke alarms in general, but I realize ionization types are the least of my favorite. They give me and our kitty heart attacks.We have those two rooms at that end of the house, one of them is constantly closed (we plan to use it as a guest room in the future), and they both use the same i4618 detectors (as well as 4 more on other rooms of the house that we keep doors constantly closed). I'm sure if we get to leave these doors open we'll get an unpleasant surprise. We are replacing these on a one-off basis -- I'm paranoid enough to want to replace all of them with nuisance-free models, but hubby would probably prefer to replace them as they start causing us trouble. Technically they ARE working, but I'd really would like to avoid getting so used to these nuisance alarms before I ignore them when they actually alert me of a dangerous situation.

I got this spray for our very naughty newly-adopted kitten, who we'd like to discipline as early as we can. The ones in the hardware store are just too huge (we don't really need THAT much water to squirt kitty -- and it's too heavy to carry around), and we were using that up until I decided to look for a smaller spray bottle from Amazon.This spray bottle is small, perfect for discreetly spraying the cat whenever she gets too rowdy, without the water being obviously associated with you. The design is cute (I got a dark green nozzle) and it's got a good grip. However, I've tried doing a quick spritzing test, but no matter how much I adjust the nozzle, or tried different rates of squeezing the trigger, it was just too flaky. Sometimes it would give a decent squirt, sometimes it won't. Plus, water constantly dripped from the nozzle. So unfortunately I can't rely on it to squirt when I actually want it to -- it would spoil my hidden glee of seeing kitty's puzzled face after it's been 'chastised'.I was unlucky enough to get a defective product.
