I'll see if I can return it -- meanwhile, I'll look for water pistols instead. For this round of Man VS Kitty, Kitty = 1; Man = 0.

Finally found a nice, perfectly-fitted thermal top to layer with! I ordered a Small for my size 0-1 frame, and it wasn't too snug, but it wasn't too loose either. It was better than the HKNB thermal top that I purchased several weeks ago (I have a separate review for that). The fabric of the Cuddl Duds top feels a bit thicker and less stretchy than the HKNB one, and I like the V-neck so its neckline won't be too visible when I decide to layer it with a V-neck sweater.The elbows of this top has little elbow patches, which adds a bit to the style of the top. The sleeves are long enough to accommodate a thumb slot, which is an added plus, because I layer more tops when it gets cold and I always have the problem of sleeves rolling up while slipping on another layer of clothing. There's a small stitched brand logo on the end of the left sleeve, falling right on the top of your hand, but it's not a name (more like a circle with two open parentheses -- "o))"), and it's lighter colored so it's not too obvious. I initially thought the fabric was going to be too stretchy, warpy and thin (the HKNB thermal was), but it actually is thick enough and not too pajama-looking to wear by itself.I don't know yet if there's going to be shrinkage when I throw it in the washer/dryer, but I think with proper care it should last long.

I initially ordered the polished steel variety, but it was delayed due to Sandy. The seller, though, suggested the brushed/matte look, and I didn't know they offered this design. Since the brushed design coincidentally goes perfectly with our bathroom's look, I agreed to get it instead of the polished.The towel rack is pretty sturdy, and came in a compact package -- some assembly required. Pretty easy to assemble, though -- I finished it in less than 20 minutes (I think it can be done in less, except my kitty kept on distracting me). The base is very solid, no worries about tipping the towel over, fastened to the vertical metal base with two large screws. The four smaller screws are for the horizontal bars, and they fit sturdily.Overall, it's a very well-made product. The only reason I give it less one star is because the rack is actually somewhat shorter and narrower than I expected. If you fold a plush bath towel (the larger fluffy ones) in half lengthwise, you cannot hang it right on the side prongs of the rack (leaving the vertical bar visible) -- it's too narrow. I ended up having to place the towel over the entire horizontal bar, leaving just enough room for a hand towel. It's really a small towel rack to be used for 2 people. I think this towel rack is made just for one person.I ended up with our bath towels hung one on each of the upper and lower bars, with the hand towels squeezed in beside it, so now the gorgeous rack is now all covered up. If they had made it say four inches wider and taller it would have been perfect for 2 people.

Purchased ours at PetSmart -- there seems to be a consistent problem with the way the circuit is connected -- the beam lights up when you screw the cap on in a very particular way. Too tight or too loose, it won't work. Even if you got it to work, after a few presses of the button the laser stops working again.We thought we had a defective product, so we decided to give it a chance, we returned the first and got a second. We thought "it couldn't possibly have the same issue the second time around" and opened it up without waiting to get home -- SAME ISSUE. When we returned to the pet store, we avoided this brand and decided to go for the brand hanging next to it. We were contemplating to get a larger, heavy duty-looking one, but we decided what the heck -- let's try out the same "bullet" style from a different brand. Needless to say, after getting home and installing the batteries, it worked. It's sort of funny because the KONG pack brags about being "tested in the USA!", but the one that didn't say anything was the one that actually worked right out of the box. Not that I think all items labeled "[insert verb here] in the USA" is of high quality, because not all items "made in CHINA" equates to cheap quality, either. The whole caption just made us chuckle, as obviously we've had horrid luck with KONG.Not that our kitten enjoyed the laser toy, though -- she indignantly ignored it and preferred to be silly with plastic springs. Still -- pretty disappointed with the product.

I grew up on the Serious Sam games and remember having to ask my dad's permission to play the original. They were always a blast to play, but I never played the HD remasters before now. They are all included on the disc, as well as Serious Sam 3 (and DLC,) as well as DDXL.There isn't much to say about the games that hasn't already been said: For an old-school, hilarious, and challenging first person shooter, look no further. The gameplay is repetitive, sure, and there isn't always a variety of enemies, but bang for buck, it's hard to find a more fun game. The level design is incredibly linear and beginning to show its age, but the secrets and hidden items prove to be rewarding.Co-op is fun if you can find servers. Consider how much of a bargain this collection is: If purchased individually on the Xbox marketplace, this collection would cost you upwards of $40, but for $10, it's hard to find a better deal on such fun games.Altogether, while the game lacks proper narrative and character development, it's okay to set them aside and just have a blast (literally) as wave after wave of enemy come to strike Sam down. His deadpan humor and unintelligent one-liners lighten the mood, and this game offers plenty of variety for the first person enthusiast, big or small.9/10

I am a bit of a late bloomer to this game, having never seen the films, nor playing either Riddick title until now. Lately, i've purchased a few games second-hand to expand my digital palette a bit with some that i've never played. I'd heard about the Riddick games in the past and seen screenshots, but never any actual gameplay. You can pick this up now for under $10, and if you get the opportunity, I strongly recommend it. Coming hot off the heels of a title like Alien Isolation or Dishonored, this game is a fairly smooth transition. I can see where Isolation gets some of its inspiration from.For starters, the game is visually stunning (even the remastered version of Butcher Bay, dating back to the early 2000s) featuring rich environments with plenty of variety, great shadows (a wonderful dynamic, as well) and very nice visual effects. For a title that's around six years old, it certainly packs a punch. You can tell the developers certainly took their time to do this right.The gameplay is very varied, and the transitions from gameplay styles (stealth to action) is fairly seamless. The gunplay seemed to fit just right, and the multi-faceted ways to get out of situations was really cool. Hand to hand combat with improvised weapons seemed silly at times, but when you hook a punch, or perform a disarm successfully, it proves for a rewarding experience. Savepoints and health machines got a bit annoying. Sometimes, the guards seemed like overpowered robots, and other times they seemed like they lacked brains, proving for a dull experience. Thankfully, the Dark Athena campaign features an upgrade on the already great gameplay and graphics. There's a bit of something for everybody in the game to enjoy for hours. The branching sidequests and open-ended gameplay was pretty awesome, certainly unique for a game of its time.Vin Diesel's gravelly voice is a nice addition to the game. His humor and cynicism blends with his wisdom in a way that gels with the player perfectly, providing a bit of relief from the sometimes repetitive sneaking around.This game isn't without its share of glitches, either graphical or physical, but nothing game-breaking. All in all with a bit of patience, this game is easy to enjoy, and proves for a challenge (but Riddick tends to like those.) If you consider yourself a fan of first person action games, this is one you don't want to miss. Truly a hidden gem!

If you're looking at this listing, my guess is that you're aware of who Paul was. He was a legendary actor and driver, as well as humanitarian. He was taken from us too soon, and this sticker is a great way to commemorate him and celebrate his life.I grew up on the F&F films, and after walking out of the theater from watching Fast 7 (wiping away a lonely tear I might add,) I immediately decided that my truck needed to have a Paul Walker sticker. My sticker arrived pretty quick and was super easy to apply. These are a great deal for the price.The graphic is probably about the size of a Polaroid, and looks professional-- as if you had it made at a sign shop or something. It fits great next to my "I am The Stig" sticker and I've gotten a few compliments from people.

These strings are great, especially considering the cost.I purchased a pack at the recommendation of my uncle, who services the owner of DR Strings' personal vehicles in New Jersey. I am glad that I did!They're about the same price as D'Addarios strings of the same gauge and they last just as long, but they sound only slightly different once broken in, and that sound would be enough to merit purchasing more strings in the future. These are a bit mellower, but have more mids than your average pack of D'Addarios, in my opinion.I've used a few packs on my guitars at present, trying them all in various tunings and such, and they are consistent in their strength and tone.I'd definitely buy these again, they are cheap, high quality hand-made strings for electric guitar, and they offer great value.I'd really love a multi-pack, though, like D'Addarios does.

This stuff is incredible. I purchased mine in conjunction with Music Nomad's "The One" guitar cleaner. They have some genuinely great products!The F-ONE oil applies easy and works wonders. Just a couple dabs onto a cloth and rub that into the fretboard. For those of us with clammy hands who play maple fingerboards, you'll find our fretboards get gunked up pretty bad. I know mine do. Rubbing the grime off takes time and hard work without the proper cleaners-- neither of which I had.So I invested in getting a bottle of this and I'm glad I did-- my fretboards are all conditioned, cleaned, and look and smell wonderful. It's worth mentioning that this cleaner contains no lemon extracts making it safe for any and all fretboard woods. This is a great product, and I strongly recommend it to any and all guitarists!

This product works great! Wow, I was truly floored by how well it performed.I applied it to all my guitars. It comes in a convenient spray bottle applicator and while the bottle recommends spraying small dabs onto a microfiber cleaning cloth, I can verify that directly applying The One to your guitar body will produce the same results.For starters, let me just say that Music Nomad has a great business model with their products-- proceeds from their purchases support independent musicians, their bottles are made of PET plastic so it is environmentally conscious, and the formula itself is biodegradable. Nice to know for those of us who try to minimize the footprint they leave behind.Applying the spray is a pleasant experience, which is a plus. For me, I have recently gotten back into the full enjoyment of cleaning and taking care of my guitars, so when cleaning becomes a chore and less of a force of habit or act of respect or love for your instrument, you lose touch. The spritz smells like candy and beads up much like Rain-X would on a car windshield, and you just rub it in the finish and anywhere you want to clean the guitar (though I would avoid the fretboard/strings and instead use their F-ONE Oil and 0000 steel wool for optimal results) and let the cleaner do it's magic.It works great, applies easy, and produces great results. A few guitars I had genuinely not cleaned more than with a rag for a few years now look showroom new apart from hardware, and knowing this polish protects your instrument while cleaning it is great peace of mind.They have a great lineup of products and while this is a bit more than your average bottle of Dunlop 65, you can rest assured knowing full well this product will stand up to the test and live up to the extra dollar amount over your average name brand. I strongly recommend this, as well as Music Nomad's other products, to the guitarist in your life.

It's odd that at writing I didn't seem to see any reviews for this book-- which is weird, considering it's been out for a few months now. I think that may be in part due to the underground nature of BFI's library. To be fair, I didn't even know these books existed until my film professor at college brought in his copy of the BFI Terminator book to help us get a grip on narrative development.To any readers who are unaware (much like I was until recently,) the British Film Institute publishes neat little paperbacks that analyze popular films of the past few decades under their Modern Classics series, and Alien finally got its turn! In a nutshell, they analyze the film from many different angles-- to its thematic elements, to physical things such as how it was made. These books are well-written and I hope some of the other, older ones I ordered (Blade Runner and The Thing) stack up as well.It has some nice pictures and concept art from a multitude of Ridley Scott films, not just Alien, which was a nice touch-- this book considers all aspects of a film production and how it holds up in a modern age with fresh eyes and ears. Ridley is a sci-fi master, from his eponymous Alien, to the cult classic Blade Runner, and to his much-debated epic, Prometheus, his work will be talked about for the decades to come, even as Alien nears its 40th anniversary.While it certainly doesn't bring forth much new trivia or tidbits of pictures, it does allow the reader to get a better creative grasp on Ridley Scott's sci-fi masterpiece and offers some great inspiration for the budding writer or director. The avid fan of xenomorphs and Space Jockeys will almost certainly have unearthed most of the information and pictures contained in this book, but for the price, the Alien addition to the BFI library of publications is a great resource, whether to fans of sci-fi cinema, film majors, or just fans of Alien in general.The cover painting by Marta Lech is a masterpiece as well-- it's not been since Giger's original "Big Chap" that the world has seen such a ghostly, perfect organism. Her rendering of the Alien serves as a great keystone to complement the aesthetic and design of both the original creature itself, as well as that of the film.All in all, this is a well-written, gem of a book totally (in my opinion) worth it's sticker price, and makes for a nice addition to the collection of an Alien fan, or a sci-fi fan in general.

Great, high quality knobs with an abalone dome. These look great on my Jackson SDX and complement the white/black color scheme on the guitar nicely.The knobs only took a few minutes to install and came with all included tools. They fit snug and turn smoothly.The only thing I really could complain about is the price-- essentially, $10 per knob seems cheap but adorning a Strat-style guitar with 2-3 knobs can get costly, almost $50 with shipping. While I will say these are professional-grade knobs and certainly worth the money, I just wish it wasn't so expensive to order them. All in all these are worthy of the 5 stars I gave them!Definitely recommend to any guitarists looking to spruce up their look.

I purchased this because I am directing a short film this semester, and our main character's (a gritty cop a la Dirty Harry) part called for a large revolver.Being in college and not of legal age to purchase an actual handgun in my state, much less afford a handcannon of a magnum, this Crosman Vigilante made for a nice compromise. It's sturdy, well made, and durable. To the untrained eye, this looks exactly like a real gun, which is what we were going for during filming. It looks so real that I would not suggest brandishing this in public, and only using it in private or on private property only for the sake of public safety (but anybody who has fired any firearm should at least know that, BB gun or not.)The revolver has a great weight to it, it looks and feels real. It's pretty beefy, at that, as I accidentally dropped this (unloaded) against a desk during a shoot and it had only left marks on the desk, not the gun itself. The trigger and hammer pull are both very comfortable and the tactical rail was a nice addition, as our crew attached lights to the rail. The safety works as it should and the user need not worry about it.While I have yet to physically shoot this gun loaded, I have noticed several other reviewers mentioned concerns about its accuracy-- That I physically cannot speak for as neither I nor any of the cast and crew have shot this, we just used it as a prop.

This is a neat little art booklet. You can get these fairly cheap now online. Adam Adamowicz's full portfolio of Fallout 3 concept art can be found on Flickr, but this is a nice little hardcover and great companion-piece for fans.

Update:  Finally was able to use this mower to do my front yard.  The #1 good thing about this mower is it is SO MUCH EASIER to push than it's predecessor, the one that looks exactly like it, but is not self-propelled.  It was FAR, FAR easier to cut the front yard with this new mower.  I'd say it got done almost twice as fast too.  Now for some of the problems I ran into.  First, I wondered why it was bogging down.  It was because Mulch was "on" by default.  Once I turned that off, then it ran like a champ, not even slowing down when mowing up hill in 6" grass, with the self-propulsion turned on.  Next issue, it was set to cut at 2" and that was too low for me, so I reset that to 3", which is easy as pie.  The next problem was the rubber stop guard on the back.  I assume it's there to protect a rock from being thrown at your ankles and breaking your leg.  Well, when you pull the mower back, the guard folds under the mower... this makes the mower hard to pull back, and when you are ready to go forward, there is resistance as the stop guard now has to come back to the original position.  Effectively, it's like it's trying to raise the mower off the ground, a little.  As long as you can keep going forward, this is not a problem.  And, of course, when you engage the self-propulsion, it overcomes the rubber pretty easily.  I finally figured out how to see the battery charge.  On this mower, there is a button by the fake lights that when you push it, it will tell you which of the three cells still have power.  After doing the entire front yard, it was on the last cell, so it was nearly empty.  There is absolutely no way this mower could do both my front and back yards on one full charge.  I don't know the exact measurements of my yard, but it's about 75' from the house to the curb, and about 120' wide.  However only about 1/2 of this area is grass.  I have a very large driveway that is up to 3 car widths wide at one point, and then there is a stand of trees on one side, so no grass over there, a side walk, more plant areas, etc..  If I had to estimate my grass area, I'd say it is about 60' x 90' equivalent.  That gives you a rough idea of what the batteries can handle, using the self-propulsion most of the time, no mulching.  (note: when mulch was turned on, the mower darn near stopped in 6"+ grass)Original review:It was easy to "put together", as all that was required was a socket wrench to put the two bolts through the bottom of the handle, screw them in, and then set the adjustment height on the upper handle.  All easy as pie.  Now, I already have the predecessor of this model, the one that looks exactly like it, but is NOT self-propelled.  Amazingly, the battery charger is 100% identical with the older model, right down to the same model and part numbers on it.  That works out well because effectively, I now have a spare charger.  :-)  I charged it up... at least it appears I charged it up, because the lights on the battery do NOT show it is charging.  I let it sit on charge for 24 hours, and there was no change.  I'm assuming it was shipped with a fully charged battery.  I put in the orange circuit completer and made sure everything works.  The mower turns on, spins the blade, so good there.  I then tested the forward self propulsion, and yup, that works too.  Tried it at higher speed, and I could tell immediately that I won't likely be using that speed as it's faster than I can go.  (sucks being old)  I have NOT cut the yard yet because it doesn't need it.  After  I do the first cut, I'll likely add to this review.The reason I got this is because the hill in my front yard is just too difficult for me to push the mower up hill very easily.  I can get it done, but run out of energy pretty fast.... that is "I" run out of energy, not the mower.  So this should be interesting to see if the self-propulsion does the trick.  The nice thing about having two almost identical mowers is that I only need for this one to do the front yard, and then I can pull the FOB out and put it into the older mower to do the back yard, which is flat.  Effectively, I have double the capacity, and will never have to worry about battery life.My only "complaint" is that the mower wasn't scheduled to be delivered until Aug 5th, but the sucker came VERY early on July 23rd.  Super, expect I wasn't looking for it and UPS delivered to my garage door, and did not take the time to walk 15' to the front door and knock/ring the doorbell.  Usually, they are VERY good about doing that.  Only an alert neighbor came over and knocked on my door, as they were concerned that somebody might come by and steal it, as it had been sitting outside for several hours.

I've used nothing but electric mowers for the last 7 years.  Because I'm not inclined to sharpen my own blades, I'd rather have spares available should the old blade get damaged or become worn on the edge.  After I've replaced a couple of blades, I can take those old blades to Ace Hardware and have them "professionally sharpened" by somebody who knows what they are doing.My first electric mower still works, but I gave it away to a family member as I wanted a bigger mower.  I bought a used Black and Decker mower but it did not have powered wheels.  I liked the newer mower because it was wider than my old electric, but it was also a LOT harder to push because it weighs more.  Being old, I wanted a new Black and Decker that has powered wheels.  Ergo, I got spare washers and blades for it too.

Some people complain that these "washers" are plastic, and should be made of metal so they don't fail when your blade hits an immovable object.I feel the opposite.  Because if these were steel, and the blade got stopped dead, the likely result is immediate engine damage.  By being made of plastic, you have an inexpensive "washer" that fails, instead of a blown engine.

Update:  I had purchased TWO hoses (but Amazon only lets you write one review, even the the products are different sizes.  My other hose was 25' and I finally went to use it yesterday, only to find out that the washer in it too, was defective.  I had to replace it, just like the 10' hose, with a Gilmour Rubber Hose Washer.  Now it also works perfectly.  Just wanted people to know that it appears the washers that are installed on these hoses apparently have issues.Original review:I probably should have made it a 4 star rating, because I immediately had to pull out their hose washer as it was defective.  It LOOKED okay, but it leaked horribly.  Fortunately, I also purchased the 10 pack of Gilmour Rubber Hose Washers.  I put in the new Gilmore rubber washer and bingo, it now doesn't leak even a drop.The reason I give the hose a 5 star review is simply because it doesn't stink, doesn't have lead in it, and therefore is FAR superior to MOST of the hoses sadly being sold in this country.  There is absolutely NO EXCUSE for lead to be allowed in hoses.  (it's added to stabilize the cheap plastic)  Lead will poison the soil the water is sprayed on.  This should be against the law nationwide.  Yet another failure of bad government regulations, or the lack of them!Interestingly, I noticed that water pressure appears to be higher using only a 10' hose.  I can reach the far side of my lawn from the top of the yard now.  With my old 25' hose, I was about 5' short of the bottom.  (and yes, the old hose was the same size hose, diameter wise, but I suppose the real reason it could not squirt as far was all the kinks.  :-)

I'm especially glad I bought these washers as I also purchased two new CAMCO Drinking Water Hoses at the same time, and when I went to use the CAMCO hose, it leaked very badly where it was attached to the faucet.  I removed the washer that came inside the CAMCO hose, and put in one of these Gilmour Rubber Hose Washers, and the problem TOTALLY disappeared.  I also used one of the Gilmour washers with my spray nozzle as it's one of those old brass types, that is probably 20 years old, and it's washer was leaking quite a bit.  Put in the Gilmour there, and it also totally stopped leaking.

The only problem I had was the batteries were wrapped in protective plastic, which was kind of hard to get off.  Once that was done, I plugged in the charger, inserted the two batteries, the red lights came on, and when I checked back an hour later, they were turned off. Now the batteries are ready for usage.

The ONLY reason I bought this product was because of the unique slightly curved handle.  Because of this shape, you can have a hook on the side of your sink cabinet, over the wastebasket, and after you clean your toilet, you face the "belly" of the curve towards the cabinet, which forces the brush to hang about 2" from the wall, in "open air" and dripping contaminated water into your plastic bagged refuse waste basket.  In this way, there is no need for a (you know it will get disgusting) brush container sitting on the floor.  When you empty your trash, you automatically throw out the contamination with the plastic bag.  No muss, no fuss.  And no icky container thing sitting on the floor taking space and looking cluttered, as well as distasteful.It used to be that this shape was common, but more expensive to make.  Now, it's nearly impossible to get this shape.  So that explains the higher price, in my opinion.

Update:  A couple of days ago, I was breaking down cardboard boxes for the recycling bin, and lo, I found the attachment screws in the very bottom of the box, buried under plastic sheeting.  So, my review below was incorrect.  They were there and they now are installed and that is SO much better as these make the seat tight as can be.  The generic attachment screws had the seat sliding all over the place.  It was already a 5 star product before, and now it's an even better 5 star product!While I love this seat, as the construction is top-notch, I was surprised that there were no attachment screws for the two hinges to attach to the toilette.  Considering that almost every brand of seat has their own design when it comes to the hinge design and cover over the hinge design, I expected they be automatically included.  I had a couple of sets of screws, but we had to use our dremel tool to grind them down to fit the unique hinge insides.  As a result, installation took about 20-30 minutes to get it right.  Some of these screw sets lock from the bottom, and some from the top (but never both ways, as far as I know).  I had to use a set that came from a 20 year old toilette seat that was scrapped a few years ago.  Being pack rats, we always save the hardware.  You never know when you'll need it, like this time!

When I heard the news that the folks that determined what is the correct dosage for daily intake of Vitamin D3 was TOTALLY incorrect, due to the Statisticians that made an error in the study and nobody caught it, I immediately had to order a larger dose than I have been taking.  It also explains why my daily intake of 2,000 units was only keeping by blood level of Vitamin D just barely over the lowest needed levels for good health.  This, in combination with my age and size, told me that I probably should be taking 10,000 units per day.  However, to err on the side of caution, I elected to go with 5,000.  The next time I see my doctor, I will have a blood test again for this to see what the effect is, then decide if I should increase it again.It's very interesting how much Vitamin D3 has changed my life.  All of my life, I usually got 3-6 colds per year, as well as the flu every few years (I do not get flu shots).  I've now been taking Vitamin D3 for roughly six years, and have NOT GOTTEN even ONE cold or the flu in all that time.  Wow.If you live north of say, the northern border of Georgia, you are probably Vitamin D deficient.  Rarely do people in the northern half of the USA get enough sunlight even in the summertime, to have the recommended blood levels of Vitamin D.  When you do get it from the Sun, it is only stored in the body for a few short months (perhaps 3 or so?) before you run low.  Isn't it interesting that people in the northern states usually don't get colds in the summertime (always are exceptions of course), but get them very frequently about 3 months after summer is over?  And when does the Flu Season run rampant?  Why, yes... starts in November and runs through the Winter.  Coincidence?  I don't think so.  (granted, this my opinion and I am not a doctor or a scientist, but I am a human with a thinking brain)

Skyrim, in my opinion, is the best game ever made.  It is easy to play, yet hard to conquer and it is HUGE.  You can easily play it for hundreds of hours, which makes it a great deal, especially at this price.  Now originally, I bought the standard edition when it first came out.  I always wanted the three add-on's for this game, but didn't want to pay the additional price.  So imagine my ecstasy when I realized that I could re-buy the Legendary Edition for a mere $20, and get all three add-on's WITH it (as verses paying $50 for those three add-on's purchased individually).  That was a bargain, and I could not resist.Installation was simple as can be.  This is a Steam Powered supported game.  If you have the original standard edition installed, you do not even have to put in the CD/DVD that comes with this box.  All you have to do is go to Steam and enter in the registration code inside the cover and bingo, it automatically upgrades the entire game with all the add-on's.  How simple is THAT????

In my opinion, the finished product looks way too flimsy, even from a distance.  This was given as a gift, based upon one review that said it looked "okay" from a distance.  To my eye, it didn't look "okay" even from 30' away.  I would not buy this product again.  But the receiver of the gift did say it was sort of fun putting it together... it took 4 of them over an hour to do it, so it was much like doing a picture puzzle, and was a nice way to spend some time together.  It's basically cardboard with stick on plasticized painted/printed surfaces.  The final result leaned every which way.

In my opinion, the finished product looks way too flimsy, even from a distance.  This was given as a gift, based upon one review that said it looked "okay" from a distance.  To my eye, it didn't look "okay" even from 30' away.  I would not buy this product again.  But the receiver of the gift did say it was sort of fun putting it together... it took 4 of them over an hour to do it, so it was much like doing a picture puzzle, and was a nice way to spend some time together.  It's basically cardboard with stick on plasticized painted/printed surfaces.  The final result leaned every which way.
Or I should say, my  wife likes it.  She mixes this with her coffee every morning and she says it makes her coffee tastes great.  She also adds a little skim milk too.

The cartridge is an official HP cartridge, so what else is there to say?  My positions in Information Technology taught me that when it comes to cartridges, trust the original product from HP.  Sure, it costs more, but what is the cost of a service job to clean out a laser printer where the cartridge has leaked all over the inside of the printer?  Having seen both scenarios, I vote for the HP original product.

I was a tad worried, based on reviews of other "replacement products" for Sears refrigerator filters that this might not be as good as the Sears "official" filter product.  Fortunately, it worked absolutely perfectly, and I have no complaints at all.  I cannot tell one iota any difference between this and the original version.  It loaded easily, I used the same amount of water in the opening process to cleanse the first pass through of the filter, and the resulting water afterwards tastes just fine.  There are no leaks, no issues at all.I would buy this again.

Okay, I tried two different ink pens for writing on the tabs.  Neither worked at all, even though they both worked just fine on regular paper.  One ink pen was regular ink like has been used in ball point pens (Paper Mate, etc.) for years.  The other ink was gel, and I expected that would not work, and it was lousier than the regular ink.  But neither wrote legibly.  I had to resort to a magic marker pen to get the job done.  I doubt that will erase very easily, but who knows.The quality of the plastic paper is actually quite good.  It's as thin as regular paper and is attractive too.  Because it is plastic, it is not likely to rip out of the clips in the holes with repetitive usage.

The color is as bright as it looks.  I wanted this color to make it easy to spot when laying in a mess of folders, and I am in a hurry.I like the durability of the folders.  They will still be "walking the earth" long past their intended usage.  That said, I got these because when I've used the paper folders, they work but can be damaged way too easily.  This folder will out live the fasteners within, most likely.  It, of course, depends upon how often I unbend them and adjust the contents.The main thing I don't like about plastic folders is that they don't stack well.  They are so slippery, they are best stored standing on edge.  If you put even a couple that have fairly full contents, they likely will slide apart all by themselves, perhaps even urged by the pull of the moon as it circles the earth.  (humor attempt intended, but perhaps closer to reality)Because of this slipperiness, the pockets are less usable.  For example, I put 54 pages into the center posts (which is about maximum, by the way), and when I slid 4 pages into the front pocket, laid it on the table, the pages in the pocket started sliding out all by themselves.  I then moved them to the back pocket, which worked better because the weight of the documents in the center, held them in place.  Somebody should try to figure out a way to make plastic folders that are not so slippery.  One solution is to put a rubber band around the entire folder, one up and down, and another left and right.  This would keep material from sliding out.

This is exactly what I wanted.  Having read some of the other reviews, I generally agree with some of the more important points.  Yes, on about 10 sheets is all you want to punch at once.  In fact, I think the sweet spot is about 7 for ease of one hand punching.  I won't address the adjust ability of the hole areas, as I had no intention of adjusting them now, and probably, never.  It's nice to know they can be adjusted however.  I punched about 250 sheets today, and had no problems at all.  Some mentioned that the cover that captures the punch chips could come undone unexpectedly.  It appears to be solid to me.  Some complained that the holes were too close to the edge.  They seemed fine to me.  Considering that the results had to fit into a folder with tabular posts (you know, the kind that the metal slide through the hole of the paper, then eventually into a reinforcement piece of the folder, then bent down to hold everything in place), had the holes been more to the right, it's possible the reading material would have been covered by the center of the folder when opening it.  So for my use, they are perfectly placed.One thing I noticed that probably most people who use things like this probably already knows.  When you slide in the paper for punching, there is about 1/16th or so of "play" in the paper.  That is, you can slide the paper slight up to the top or slightly down to the bottom.  I found that sliding to the bottom appears to be the best thing to do, as this matched up perfectly with prepunched dividers.

It seems like I'm always having a hard time finding a stapler when I need it, even though I know generally where it should be.  I think that's because of my other two staplers, one is beige and the other battleship gray.  That makes them harder to spot with clutter around them.  This one, being so bright, it shows up like a spotlight in a subdued room.  These days, using LED lighting throughout the house, often there is slightly less light than with the old incandescent bulbs.  Now I'm not complaining about the difference in the lighting, only pointing out that it sometimes makes stuff harder to see, as the LED light tends to be more directional.  And, of course, it doesn't help in that my eyes aren't as good as they used to be.Besides, it's pretty.  :-)  Oh, and it does staple just fine... as good or better than the ones I used at the office.

I bought this along with some of the competing Highland brand.  I tried both, and they each have their own special values.  The Highland is thinner regarding thickness.  This means you can see what is underneath it a little more clearly.  Also, it's more tape on the same size reel (I suppose because it is thinner).  I bought this so as to compare the tapes directly, side by side.  Both are good.  The Scotch is thicker, so that's why there is 296" less per roll.But the clincher for making this purchase was the free tape dispenser with the tape.  They both stick well and the extra thickness I believe makes the Scotch a little easier to handle as the tape doesn't tend to curl and get caught up within itself quite as much.  I would buy either product again.

I bought this along with some of the competing Scotch brand.  I tried both, and they each have their own special values.  The Highland is thinner regarding thickness.  This means you can see what is underneath it more clearly.  Also, it's more tape on the same size reel (I suppose because it is thinner).  You get 296" more.  It sticks well, and their is little tint to the tape, so when it's on say a white envelope, the words beneath the tape are clear and sharp.My only regret about this brand is that it's not stocked on Amazon... at least, in bulk.  I wanted to buy a box of 6 or more, which is why I also bought the Scotch tape, because it comes in a box of 6.  But that said, I had not tried the Scotch brand for many years, so I wanted to check them out side by side.  Both are good tapes.
They worked flawlessly, and I had no problems with jamming or anything like that.  The size is convenient, and they do the job for me.

after taking a shower to soften the beard.  I also have used them to "dry shave" around my lip, as I have a mustache that sometimes irritates the corners of my mouth.  (usually after skipping a day of shaving)All first shaves have been really good, as I have not cut myself yet.  I can get about 3-4 weeks out of one blade, so that's excellent.  On occasion, if I'm not careful, I have managed to nick myself if I forget to pull the skin taunt in certain areas on the chin.  Nothing serious, and about the same when I used the old 3 to 5 blade in one ridiculously expensive razors I used to use.I will save enough money from NOT using those old multiple bladed expensive razors that I easily have paid for the safety razor these blades go into, in just the first year of usage.  I definitely would recommend people consider this option.

First, the good stuff... (1) It works; (2) the light it makes when it goes off is bright enough to light a darkened stairwell; (3) the swivel of the light "ball" within the base is nice (but stiff - hard to move it); the design of how the part you would screw to the wall is pretty cool and innovative; (4) when it senses motion and turns on, and the motion totally stops, the light stays on for about 10-14 seconds, which is really nice to save battery power.The stuff that could be better... (1) the sensor is awfully sensitive... it will turn on the light if it detects movement when the area lighting is subdued, but easily navigable; (2) it truly needs an on-off switch - because of light sensor being too sensitive; (3) with the batteries in it, it is pretty heavy; (4) I would be afraid to try to swivel the ball if this light were mounted on the wall because it takes so much pressure, it just might rip the mounting plate from the wall... especially if it's screwed into plaster.What I wanted this for was to light my inside stairwell when the house is dark.  Because the sensor is too sensitive to low light, that is, it "thinks" it's dark out, if I mount it where I wanted, the batteries would need to be replaced all too soon, I think.  This is why I wish it had a simple slide switch where I could turn it on after dark.I do have a back up plan in case this doesn't "do the trick".  My door into the garage, which is windowless and therefore dark even in the daytime, I can mount this inside the garage, by the door, so that when somebody comes through the door, it will come on automatically.  Because there are cement steps to navigate, this would be an improvement for walking safety.

that was working generally fine, but on some software, the cursor was jumpy, hard to position accurately, and the software ran very slow.  I installed this new GeForce GT 610, and it worked marvelously.  It was a breeze to install both physically and software wise.  It even automatically went to the nVidia web site to get the latest drivers.  Everything installed just fine, and then I ran the software that was having the problem.  Now, there is no problem.  The cursor doesn't jump all over the place, the images process quickly and it's like the entire system is now faster.  Strangely, it feels like it even boots a little faster.  If I had to guess, this nVidia card is at least 2 to 3 times faster than the nVidia product that was installed on the motherboard.  (which was a GeForce 6100)Now I get an appreciation why laptops are the turtles of the computing world as most of those have their video on the motherboard too.  The memory on the GT 610 is 4 times more than that on the motherboard (plus the motherboard was using system memory on a sharing basis, which is why the system even boots up faster, I think).  The processor on the GT 610 is at least 3x faster than the 6100 per benchmarks I looked at.  Now some of that is lost because my motherboard is PCI Express 1.0 and the GT 610 is PCI Express 2.0... however the video card is totally compatible with 1.0, but some performance is lost due to that.Regardless, this video card was a perfect solution for my problem.  AND, it has a fan on it that is NOT noisy, like some of the comparable products - see reviews on Amazon for that.  I cannot hear this fan at ALL!!  For me, that was worth paying about $10 more for this brand and model.

The music is appropriate, the acting is absolutely excellent, and the intrigue is in depth, and true to Roman Society, as I understood it to be from the History classes I took oh so long ago,The treachery and debauchery are mind boggling.  I can see why the Barbarians eventually sacked Rome and finished off the decadent empire as it came to be under the Emperors.  It's also interesting how they started with the concept of a Republic, copied to some extent from the Ancient Greeks that preceded them, having a Senate, but not understanding the Athenian Greek concept of the public right of the people to determine direction of government.  Rather, they adopted the semblance of that aspect by having a Senate, which in fact, the people's will had nothing to do with electing Senators, as that was all controlled by the Aristocracy.  Those with money were the only ones that could become Senators.  (sound familiar?)But that was as far as they went with Athenian ideals... a.k.a. lip service.  The real government was more like Sparta's form.  Brutal, with fear keeping people in line.  The Roman excelled at that!Anyway, I diverge... the series is good, and I highly recommend watching it.  It's absolutely great watching it via the Amazon Fire TV box, no commercials, easy to use, and FREE with Amazon Prime!  Excellent!!!!

First, the smell everybody talks about.  It is very smelly when you open it.  As suggested, I took off the cover, and then let it set in a large open room to "air out".  The instructions say "a couple of days".  I let it set a week, flipping it a couple of times over that period.  It still smelled some, but was much improved over day 1 and 2.I then put the cover back on, and set it up on my bed.  I found it to be comfortable, and the right height for me.  Some people said in their reviews they had problems with their arms getting uncomfortable because they would slide off the sides as it's somewhat narrow.  I did not have that problem, even though I am a hefty person.  Some also said that they had problems sliding down it in the middle of the night, thus making their back hurt in the morning.  I did not have this problem.  I think, for me, I know the reason why.  My mattress is a Temper-Pedic.  Because it's so firm, I simply do not slide at all.  I used to use a Select Comfort, but I bet that would be an issue as with air mattresses in general, if you apply too much weight in one area, you hit bottom.  So I would bet I would slide on one of those.Now as for quality of sleep.  For me, I find I can sleep about 4 hours on it and then I have to set it aside and finish up my sleep flat, as I am a side sleeper.  While I could sleep on my left side, anyway, on this wedge, I suspect I might pay for it later, as I think that could stress areas in the spine that should not be stressed.  It seemed comfortable to lay that way, on my left side, for perhaps 10 minutes, but I would prefer not to take a chance on that.The good side is that while I am sleeping with the wedge, I no longer snore, and I don't have to wake up to go to the can, which is interesting.  (snoring is usually co-existent with sleep apnea, which I have... the body will trigger a false bathroom call signal if you are not getting enough oxygen... when I'm laying flat, I get woke up with this trigger signal every 2 hours... with the wedge, I have yet to wake up with that signal occurring for as much as 5 hours.  And, when I do wake up, I don't actually have to go at all.  I just have the desire to lay flat, so I can side sleep, ergo, 1/2 the night with the wedge, 1/2the night without it.)About the only downside I have experienced is that because the wedge is made pretty much like my mattress, it does get warm if you stay in the same spot for a long time, as in 4-5 hours.  This is part of the reason I set it aside for the rest of the night, as my back says to me, "I'm hot.  Give me air."  At the same time, the upside is I have ZERO back pain from using the wedge.  I always have some back pain from sleeping flat.  (but NO WHERE near as much back pain as I had with inner spring mattresses or water beds!  A side note... the Select Comfort also gave me no back pain, but strangely, I got knee pain... remember, I said I am a side sleeper... that combined with my size, caused my body to sink into the Select Comfort mattress just far enough that my knee that is towards the mattress gets hyper-extended sidewise, and that HURTS!  This was the ONLY reason I switched to the current mattress.)

in our household.  It really does help to get to sleep.  In general, there are few side effects in the morning... the main one, feeling refreshed after a good night's rest.For me personally, if I get up in the middle of the night to visit the "john", and I took some of this melatonin, I do feel a little groggy, but so far, I am still able to function with the task in hand, and then can go back to sleep very easily afterwards.

Some have complained about dice cups in general, for both "wrong size" and "noise levels".For me, this cup is actually a tad smaller than I would have hoped, but in reality, that doesn't matter.  As for noise, I think it's pretty darn quiet.  The felt lining and the leather (like?) exterior, have a nice mellow sound, and touch too.I can hardly wait for our next D&D session to try this cup out.  (the included die go into my large bag of unneeded die that will probably never be used)

it's "close enough" for my tastes.  I'm pretty sure this stuff is considered "bad for you" by most doctors, simply because of the high sodium content, if for no other reason.  That said, most doctors also abhor real bacon too, for both sodium and nitrates.I mostly use a teaspoon of this on my salads for more flavor, being as a great many salad vegetables are flavor limited.  I eat more salads than I used to, simply because these Bac-Os makes it taste good.  So, some bad stuff with the good stuff.  (Oh, for any comment oriented folks, I don't like salad dressings, in case you were going to suggest those... I ONLY use vinegar, which certainly adds flavor too, but it gets boring year after year)(I've tried competitive fake bacon chips/bits and found the other brands don't taste as good to me)

As I recall, it was "suggested" because I had watched "Vikings"... so I was expecting more of a story.  But, this is a documentary, and I have found it interesting, especially when it points out that the bloodlines of the Celts in "Britannia" do not match those of Celts in Middle Europe... which I didn't even know there were Celts in that region too.

The hard part you will have to face when it comes to the violence is that the Vikings usually showed zero mercy, and it can be really sad to see them slaughter totally defenseless people's.  But, that's reflecting the reality of history, so I accept it.  (but it is wrenching, regardless)I watched the entire first year on Amazon and was very pleased to be able to watch it in order, (as compared to cable where if you don't just happen to catch them replaying the series starting from the beginning, you lose some continuity)  My only complaint is that the quality of the broadcast for Season 1 was not Hi-def.  Rather, it looked like something made for "standard TV".  However, I could overlook that just because the series is so darned good.  Now if I had to make a direct rating to Gladiator, Gladiator was better, but both are 5 star in my book.The character development is wonderful, and it's gratifying to see the star of the show slowly migrate his thinking closer to the idea that war isn't always the whole solution.  I can hardly wait to see Season 2.  (which has already started, but I didn't know it was on, and therefore because I see the value in watching it in order, I will have to wait either for it to be re-broadcast on cable or available on Amazon Prime.  (next year, I suppose)If you love seeing history played out in reasonable reality, you should love this show.

See my long-winded review on Ghiradelli and you'll see more information on my obsessions with dark chocolate.I have tried other brands that are available, and for example, I like the Black and Green, but it is more expensive, and frankly, why pay more for something that is about the same quality as Lindt.  There are even more expensive brands, but why bother.  None of them taste significantly better, and some actually taste not quite as good.  There is one German brands that are pretty good and very inexpensive, available at Aldy Grocery stores, if you should happen to have one of those available in your area.  It is called Moser Roth.  (there is an umlaut over the letter "o"... it looks like two small dots, in case you don't know what that is)  I do not know how to make an umlaut on the computer easily, so I describe it instead.  Anyway, the Moser Roth is pretty good, it's 85% dark chocolate and melts faster than the Lindt, but not as fast as the Ghiradelli.  The flavor is similar, but recognizably different.  The downside of the Moser Roth is that it often has bits of congealed harder chocolate in it (at least, I hope it's chocolate).  As a result, I usually get the Lindt and Ghiradelli instead.  But all three are fine.

And, I've read many of the reviews of these and was rather entertained by the vividly succinct feelings about dark chocolate.  It seems that it's nearly a religious experience for some.  Wow.  I had no idea.Anyway, I have usually always bought these at one of the many grocers I frequent (and I include Target and Walmart in that generalized statement, even though that's only partially correct to think of those as "grocers").  But I noticed the price has been pretty high at some of these places, especially the "real" grocery stores.  So I thought, "what the heck... get it from Amazon!".  And, I'm happy that I did, simply because with these 12 bar packs I won't have to scrounge the stores for "the slightly cheaper pricing".So, my general comments.  First of all, I usually prefer the 90% Lindt bars because though they are somewhat bitter, they take longer to melt in your mouth, so it makes the experience more heavenly.  Now some people don't like that much bitterness and I saw a number of folks be unhappy about that.  My experience is if you are really trying hard to avoid ALL SUGARS, or as much as possible, by not drinking soda, juice, cool-aid and/or eating sweet candy bars, etc. that your tongue gets REALLY sensitive to LACK of sugar, and then, then you are ready for the experience of Lindt 90%.  (my dietary efforts are to approach living with the "Caveman" or Paleo, diet, as much as possible.  Yes, ANY dark chocolate is NOT on the "approved list" for Paleo.  It however is my one and only exception, and makes BEING on Paleo MUCH more tolerable.  (a man has GOT to have at least ONE vice, right?)Anyway, back to Ghiradelli dark chocolate in particular.  (wow... I am long winded)  Anyway, it is creamier than Lindt 85% and, of course, 90%.  It also melts faster, but because it does so, the flavor is outstanding!  I really do love it.  (but I alternate with the Lindt, "just because" of loyalty to the fact that their chocolate melts more slowly and they also have the 90% too.)

And that goes back probably 20 years or more.  It is our favorite taco seasoning.  Alas it is getting harder and harder to find it in the grocery stores.  I suppose it's all the competition, and limited shelf space.  Out of the 4 grocers that we usually visit on a regular basis, only one has OCCASIONALLY had it.  And, we had not been able to find it for 3 or 4 weeks now!  Desperate, a light flashed in front of my beady eyes, and it they glowed with the letters, A-m-a-z-o-n.  Whoopee!  (and it's not the Goldberg version)... Amazon had it and now I got a large supply of it!  And it's pretty fresh as the expiration date is in mid-2017!!!

and, that worked super, BUT the cable was left hanging in the air as it was just a couple of feet short.  Ergo, I felt I needed to order a longer cable for this connection.  Naturally, it's a Belkin and therefore works perfectly, as expected.  I will keep the 6' because I have another computer that I occasionally use for backup and convenience... as it happens that one I was using wireless, but a cable connection on the wall is just the right distance to use it hardwired.  Naturally because it is now hard wired, it is noticeably faster, especially when getting those huge downloads on the monthly patches from Microsoft!!
it works perfectly, and there absolutely is nothing else that matters.  Perfection is always a 5 star rating.  Enough said.

Because I already knew the device needed to be updated, I ran a hard wire to it so that would go quickly, and it did.  A few minutes later, and it was working super!  It is pretty simple to find a TV series to watch that is available on Prime, and movies that are available on Prime.  I watched both for a few hours and never had a single glitch.My only actual complaints are two.  One is that the pictures it shows of the various selections of entertainment are in rather poor quality.  That is, they are blurry and I often had to get up and walk closer to the movie cover being illustrated on my 59" HDTV so that I could read it.  It appears these are recorded in the lowest quality pictures of MOST, but not ALL, covers, so it appears to be more a fault with the provider of the movie cover not using a high quality bitmap.  Two, the first TV series I watched was Season 1 of Vikings.  I finished it, and that is an awesome series by the way, but, the picture was rather washed out.  Considering that the content is available in Hi-def, it's a shame that Amazon could not include the Hi-def version with Prime, instead of the "made for tube TV version".I should point out that I also got to play with a Roku-2 last week (a friend brought it over), and I have to say that the Fire is most definitely faster and easier to use than the Roku-2.  I hear that there is content available on the Ruku-2 that is not available on the Fire, but I don't care about that, because I'm only really interested in Prime movies and TV content.The only thing that prevented me from making this a 5 star rating is that a fair amount of the Prime content is not Hi-def.  I know I could pay for the Hi-def version, but my cable bill is already too high and my "better half" prefers to watch TV on cable.  So to save the money, I will take what I get, regardless of the definition.
And now I have one.  I tested it, tied to multiple connectors back to the source and it works perfectly, with no delays, etc.
I noticed that I did not have any of that on my iPod.  Now I do!  Vladimir Ashkenazy plays very, very well.  It's as good as any I have ever heard.
It's Okay.
It's Okay.
It's Okay.
It's Okay.
It's okay.

This is yet another one of those biopic reads thats really hard to put down. In fact, while reading yet another of Jack Rosewoods books, I just had to keep turning the pages. Not necessarily because it's all that enjoyable in any way, shape or form, to delve a little too deeply into the malefic minds of such murderous men, but because I sincerely believe that most people are fascinated in one way or another by serial killers. Perhaps its the human morbid fascination with death. Im not exactly sure. However, maybe it just astounds the average person as to how depraved another can be.The author (and co-author this time) does an excellent job in documenting this particularly disturbing case. Its well written and researched and it shows in the details provided. Of course it contains a copious list of frightening and decidedly disturbing details about the personal background and the bevy of crimes of the killer, but the macabre material is handled quite tastefully in most cases, and even the faint of heart will still probably be enthralled while reading the book.I would highly recommend this read to all fans of the crime genre. I received a copy from the author for my unbiased review.

This is yet another one of those biopic reads thats really hard to put down. In fact, while reading yet another of Jack Rosewoods books, I just had to keep turning the pages. Not necessarily because it's all that enjoyable in any way, shape or form, to delve a little too deeply into the malefic minds of such murderous men, but because I sincerely believe that most people are fascinated in one way or another by serial killers. Perhaps its the human morbid fascination with death. Im not exactly sure. However, maybe it just astounds the average person as to how depraved another can be.The author does an excellent job in documenting this particularly disturbing case. Its well written and researched and it shows in the details provided. Of course it contains a copious list of frightening and decidedly disturbing details about the personal background and the bevy of crimes of the killer, but the macabre material is handled quite tastefully in most cases, and even the faint of heart will still probably be enthralled while reading the book.I would highly recommend this read to all fans of the crime genre. I received a copy from the author for my unbiased review.

I just finished reading The Magic of Christmas-The Magic of Love, to my grand kids and we thoroughly enjoyed it. The author is very honest and real in her poems, and the illustrations are fantastic. She has a fluid, steady flow to her words, where one line carries seamlessly into the next. There is an abundance of rich imagery in her words that lifts off the pages. Just lovely. I would definitely recommend this book to all poetry lovers, young or old. Well done! It's a 5 Stars from me.

Robert Berdella was born in Cuyahoga Falls, Ohio in 1949. His father worked as a die setter for the Ford Motor Company and his mother was a stay at home mom. He did well at school, although teachers found him difficult to teach. He was also bullied by the other students. He was severely nearsighted and had to wear thick glasses from the age of 5. When he was 7 years old his brother, Daniel, was born. Bardella's life took a dive for the worse at the age of 16; first, his father died of a heart attack aged 39. Shortly afterwards his mother remarried, much to Robert's resentment and anger. Around the same time he claimed that he was sexually assaulted by a coworker.What I found most chilling was the fact that he saw a 1965 adaptation of the John Fowles book The Collector, which is about a man who abducts a young woman and holds her captive in his basement; he later stated that it had made a lasting impression on him. Of all the serial killers I've read about, Berdella has to be one of the sickest individuals I have ever come across. It's bad enough that some people murder, but to torture their victims for weeks beforehand takes things to a whole different level. The author does an excellent job in documenting this particularly disturbing case.A highly recommended read to all fans of the crime genre. I received a copy from the author for my unbiased review.

I really enjoyed reading this book. Its well researched and written. Also the pictures are awesome! This would be a nice read not just for the young, but also the young at heart. There was a time when only boys would dream about becoming an Air Force pilot but things have changed now to an extent that even this would be a great read for young girls also. Im glad Im living in an age where stereo types of the male pilot have been put aside and we now have women fighter pilots who protect us.I think this is a great book that will inspire and fire up the imaginations of young minds in particular. It will also, no doubt, instill a degree of respect for all those who serve our countries and protect us in the sky above us.I graciously received a copy of this book from the author for my unbiased opinion.

This is a very well written account of Cary Anthony Stayner, an American serial killer convicted of the grisly premeditated murders of four women between February and July of 1999. The murders occurred in Mariposa County, California, near Yosemite National Park. Stayner's early family life was marked by the abduction of his younger brother, Steven, a kidnapping victim of convicted child molester, Kenneth Parnell.This work is well researched and well written. I would highly recommend this to all fans of the true-life crime genre.

I was very impressed with the speed reading and comprehension techniques in this book. I have tried several books and courses on this topic in the past. This concept of combining words into thought groups is not only unique but possibly the best Ive come across. Transferring the thought groups into images is the way to go for increased comprehension. Well written. Well done!The author graciously provided me a copy of the book for my unbiased review.

Streams of Consciousness is a wonderful collection of poetry. This is a book to dip in and out of as the whim takes you. A must have on any poetry lovers bookshelf. Whether you want to stretch your mind, provoke your thoughts, or merely delight in the composition of some exquisite works of words, I'm sure you will enjoy this!It was difficult to find a particular favorite. But a few that I really enjoyed were, Pieces Of Paper, It Is Hard to Be, That Moment So Silent, and many more. I also enjoyed the fact that the poems are so varied with different contributors from different life paths and perspectives.The authors graciously provided me a copy of the book for my unbiased review.

This was a very interesting and fun packed read. It was well researched and well written. The author obviously took the time to get her facts right! I would absolutely recommend this book. It wouldnt surprise me if this became a bestseller. Well done Shir. Ill certainly be looking forward to reading more from you in the future.The author graciously provided me a copy of the book for my unbiased review.

My first time out with this author and glad he introduced himself to me. I graciously received a copy of this book from the author for an unbiased review. Its not much different from similar books Ive read, but I like his style of writing and his down to earth approach.I must admit, I did actually get a few things out of this work that I wasnt expecting. Nice work and I would certainly recommend a read!

This story had every element a good story should have. An exciting plot, attention to detail, but best of all fleshed out, well-written and well-rounded character development. Theres an abundance of well illustrated scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the story, and that's something I really look for in a good book.This captivating and commendable work had me immersed from the beginning. The story flows from scene to scene with ease, and the author shows exceptional skill when it comes to storytelling.  There are twists and turns in this page turner that will take the reader on a thrilling journey!Its one of those stories that come along once in awhile that makes you want to read it non-stop until you get to the end. Im giving nothing further away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery and enjoyment for the reader!A highly recommended read from me.Ill certainly be looking forward to reading more from JC Gatlin in the future!

This collection of paranormal essays and short fiction was a fast paced and very interesting read. The authors insightful, intelligent and sometimes witty commentary does not require intense concentration or endless analysis to get the gist of what he is trying to say. You won't have to grapple with unfamiliar or awkward language. This is not to imply that you won't find yourself thinking about what he has to say. It's just that his approach is so matter-of- fact, easy going and accessible.This is a well crafted collection of stories and I absolutely enjoyed reading them from start to finish. Its a captivating and gripping read that had me immersed and engaged from the beginning. There are few and far between authors, in my opinion, who actually have the ability and talent to achieve this. Each story flows from scene to scene with ease, and the author shows exceptional skill when it comes to storytelling. Theres a plethora of well written scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the stories, and that's something I really look for in a good book.This is my first time being introduced to this author, and needless to say, Ill be looking forward to reading more from Mark Antony Rossi in the future. I would highly recommend this book to all fans of the paranormal genre. Although, I could also see fans of UFOs, unexplained mystery enthusiasts and even New Agers having a nibble on this one! I was graciously given this book as a gift for my unbiased opinion.

Im giving nothing further away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery and enjoyment for the reader! A highly recommended read.

I absolutely love this children's author. The effort made to complete these books obviously takes a long time. I've purchased books many times before for my grand kids and we've often stood there looking at each other as to what was going on?Not so with this author! My grand kids love this work...and to be honest, so do I!I would highly recommend this delightful children's book.A 5 Star from me every time! A wonderful read...well done!

I loved everything about this book and so did my grand kids. And, if it's good enough for them, it's good enough for me! It's very obvious that this author loves doing what she does.This is yet another great learning book for young kids about the fascinating world of Sharks. It's a well researched read that is sure to capture the attention of young children and encourage them to learn all they can about these magnificent creatures.I'm always surprised by this author because I end up learning just as much as my grand kids! Well done!
This is a resource every parent should impart to their children. Very important read and highly recommended.
Forget the 4-9 year olds...this book is magic for everyone! I love it!

Wow! What can I say? This novel blew me away! This is the kind of book that I like to call a "buy once, read twice". This absorbing and attention-grabbing work had me immersed from the beginning. The story flows from scene to scene effortlessly, and the author shows exceptional ability when it comes to storytelling. I might be a little biased with this review because I have read this author's previous work, namely, Devil's Move and Executive. If you're not familiar with this author, you don't know what you're missing out on!This story had every element a good story should have. An exciting plot, attention to detail, but best of all fleshed out, well-written and well-rounded character development. There's an abundance of well illustrated scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the story, and that's something I really look for in a good book.As much as this genre can be predictable, I found this tale of intrigue to be refreshingly imaginative. There are twists and turns in this page turner that will take the reader on a fascinating journey. Also, the writing style is uncomplicated which makes for an enjoyable read.It's one of those rare stories that come along that makes you want to read it non-stop until you get to the end. I'm giving nothing further away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery!I'll certainly be looking forward to reading more from Leslie Wolfe in the future!A highly recommended read!

From an emotional point of view, this book will have you upside down. I don't mean that in a negative way because this is a fascinating study on the reality of life and the different levels of spirituality that each of us attain throughout our lifetime. It was a very interesting and intriguing read. The author is obviously very well educated and intelligent. My motto has always been, `each to his own.' However, I do feel that there is enlightenment in this work.  In a world where even scientific fact becomes blurred in a system driven by money and false achievement, it would make one wonder if there is something more than the material? Just a thought.I'll certainly be looking forward to reading more from Yitzhak Segman in the future!A highly recommended read!

If you're unfamiliar with this author, you don't know what your missing out on! He absolutely delivers for my grand kids every time. This is a wonderful series that I would highly recommend.The author writes in a wonderful style that guarantees the attention of young minds. The pictures are also delightfully illustrated. It would also be great to see this as an animated cartoon series on TV. I've no doubt that kids would love it.
Loved it!
A decent plot and well developed characters made this a fun read. The book was exciting, especially the ending. Can't wait for the sequel.

The author has the ability to lure the reader into this dark and murky world - kicking and screaming if need be! Although, I would imagine that fans of this genre won't be able to wait to sink their teeth into this one!This story had every element a good story should have. An exciting plot, attention to detail, but best of all fleshed out, well-written and well-rounded character development. There's an abundance of well illustrated scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the story, and that's something I really look for in a good book.This captivating and commendable work had me immersed from the beginning. The story flows from scene to scene with ease, and the author shows exceptional skill when it comes to storytelling.  There are twists and turns in this page turner that will take the reader on a thrilling journey. Also, the writing style is clear-cut which makes for an enjoyable read.It's one of those rare stories that come along that makes you want to read it non-stop until you get to the end. I'm giving nothing away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery! Needless to say, I'm looking forward to seeing what's coming next!A highly recommended read!

This is an incredible book that can be read on its own or you can use an app to bring it to life! It's one of the most inventive books I've ever read...or seen! This will be a best-seller without a doubt. I would absolutely recommend this children's book.The free app is available on Google apps and the App store.

In my life I have known many people with addictions and I've dealt with a few of my own. I found this book to be a very good resource for those who are dealing with any type of addiction.Overall, this was a good introductory book on addiction. Highly recommend if you want to identify if you have an addiction or if someone you know has one and you want to understand them better and help them out.Taite Adams gives an honest account with insider information on not only the opiate addition epidemic but also how it happens and what it does to the addict.Well worth a read for anybody struggling with addiction.

This is an excellent example of how an EBook should actually be written. Moreover, it will be an invaluable addition to any author's digital tool box.It's a well written guide that's packed to the rafter's with information that will lead the reader into areas that will keep them even better informed. Make no mistake about it; keeping your finger on the pulse of what's happening in the world of digital publishing is vital if you want to succeed in this business. Things seem to move at light speed in cyberspace so it's important that author's keep up-to-date. This excellent work shows you how to do just that.As I said, this is a well written guide. It's clear, concise and gets straight to the point. And, this makes for an easy and enjoyable read.I would highly recommend this insightful and informative guide.

I absolutely enjoyed reading this book to my grandkids and it brought a few smiles to our faces. It seems to me that this book has been created with a lot of love and joy and it is very obvious to me that the author really enjoys creating such wonderful stories.I loved the effort the author put into writing this. The stories and the illustrations are wonderfully done. I would absolutely recommend it to parents as a book for their young children probably aged from about 4 years up to 8 years. Kids develop at different rates so this would be a rough guide depending on where your kids or grandkids are at. This is a nice one all the same. My grandkids liked it, and so did I!

This is another superbly written and well researched book by this favorite author of my grand kids (and mine!). It's always a joy to purchase her books knowing that it will educate young minds in a very friendly and informative way.As an added bonus, I always end up learning new things myself! Well done again on another very educational and fun read. Keep up the good work!

This is a well crafted story and I absolutely enjoyed reading it from start to finish. It's a captivating and gripping read that had me engrossed from the beginning. The story flows from scene to scene with ease, and the author shows exceptional ability when it comes to storytelling. There's a profusion of well illustrated scenes that really make you feel like you are right there in the story, and that's something I really look for in a good book.The story had every element a good story should have. An interesting plot, attention to detail, but best of all fleshed out, well-written and well-rounded character development. This interesting and compelling work, as I said, had my attention from the start and there are emotional twists and turns in this page turner that will take the reader on an intriguing and rousing journey! Also, the writing style is uncomplicated which makes for an enjoyable read.It's one of those stories that come along once in awhile that makes you want to read it non-stop until you get to the end. I'm giving nothing further away here. And this, I hope, will only add to the mystery and enjoyment for the reader! I'd highly recommend this read to all fans of the Romance genre.I'll certainly be looking forward to reading more from this author in the future!

This was an excellent read and really informative. I really hope this author writes more books about her life as her story could really help so many others in the same situation. This was a very honest and down to earth read.  I couldn't recommend this book highly enough.

Here are the stats: 220 calories for a 1 cup serving--about six in the carton (a cute old-timey milk carton). Total fat 3g, Sat fat .5g, Sodium 45 mg, Total carbs 42g, Dietary fiber 3 g, Sugars 15g, protein 5 g, Ca 4%, Fe 8%.The ingredients list brown sugar as the second ingredient, so the high sugar is to be expected. There are also rolled oats, whole wheat flakes, crisp rice (=Rice Krispies)--presumably white rice, raisins, "modified milk ingredients," oat bran, soybean oil, almonds, apple juice concentrate (=fructose), honey, soy lecithin, natural flavors.This tastes great, because sugar. It fills a bowl more than many granolas because Rice Krispies. You have to make the call on how "healthy" this is. I found it did not hold me all morning, unless I added more protein and fat --whole milk, say, or more nuts, or an egg on the side.

I used the chart on the website, and it doesn't cover all sizes---there are steps. I tried the one for 36D (I am between 36D and 38C), and this fits, but is a trifle snugger---I bought more anf sized up and was happy. It's a great product--very expensive looking, comfortable--no bunching, not hot, and covers my full-coverage bra. It's perfect for those super-flattering faux wrap tops and deep vee necks.

These are 5000 i.u. gelcaps. They are small and easy to swallow. My concern is that the dose is really high, and unless someone has a doctor's okay, could be dangerous if taken daily.
