When the results of the autopsy reveal not pond water but soapy water in the Tommy's lungs, Carmen changes her story, but is it the truth at last?You do not have to have read any of the other books in the very popular Inspector Sejer series to enjoy this book thoroughly.  If you are a fan of suspense, of mystery, of crime and the darkness that lurks within, you will want to read this book - and you will enjoy every minute of it.  I highly recommend this book - would give it more stars if I could.

I bought this as a gift and haven't given it yet but the Kissy Kissy Footie in Pink Newborn is adorable.  I love the cotton fabric used by Kissy Kissy.  It feels soft, washes and wears very well.  I have given it as gifts in many sizes and patterns to many babies.  I just bought the blue pattern for my newborn grandson and although he weighed 8 lbs 12 oz - the newborn fit him perfectly and he wore it home from the hospital.  This is a lovely pattern of hearts.I recommend this highly; you can't go wrong with Kissy Kissy.

"On a Ring and A Prayer" is the first Jessie Stanton novel in a planned series of three by Christian fiction author Sandra D. Bricker.  The heroine Jessie Stanton was a young girl from a middle class family in Louisiana who had dreams of a more exciting life in California.  She moves West and is working at a perfume counter when successful and wealthy Jack Stanton sees her and is immediately captivated. After a whirlwind romance and marriage on the beach, Jessie finds herself living the dream of wealth and privilege, wearing designer clothes, driving a BMW, and living in a 4000 square foot mansion.  She has everything she ever wanted, or so it seemed...until one day while lunching with her best friend, Piper, she sees her car towed away...and then her credit card is declined.  She goes home to find her house empty of Jack's belongings and it has been sold without her knowledge.  All she has left is her clothing and her 4 carat Neil Lang wedding ring.  Her husband's cell phone is disconnected and he is gone without a word.As her world comes crashing down around her, Piper helps her find a private investigator to help her locate Jack and find out what happened.  The investigator, Danny Callahan, is a kind Christian man,  who lives his faith.  He helps find Jessie a place to live and supports her when she starts a business renting out her designer fashions.This is light, easy to read Christian fiction; no sex, no swearing.  The characters tend to be pretty simple and the story is predictable.  By turns naive and frustrating, the reader does come to care for Jessie Stanton and will probably want to read the second book to find out what happens to her next.The basic premise of this book is very reminiscent of a much better novel by Nora Roberts "Daring to Dream" also the first in a trilogy about three women starting over to remake their lives after disastrous circumstances.

Wellness has the reputation for quality ingredients without fillers like wheat, corn and soy and without artificial ingredients.  These Wellness WellBites Soft Natural Dog Treats live up to that reputation and are an 8 oz bag for $7.55 on Amazon (a savings of $3.44 off the retail price).  Considering the quality ingredients, the first two of which are lamb and salmon - no meal or byproducts, I think this is a good price.  The treats are approximately an inch square in size, but they are scored so they can be broken into smaller pieces easily.  My 12 lb. pup did quite well with half a treat and liked them instantly.  For training a dog his size, I would break them into smaller pieces.I think this is a premium quality treat at a reasonable price and my dog loved them - so we'd both recommend them!

I have to admit that I had never considered bookmarks for a three ring binder/notebook.  The package of Avery Tabbed Snap-In Bookmarks includes 5 very brightly colored plastic bookmarks for three ring binders; one each of 5 different colors and patterns.  They are cut just below the holes to allow you to slip them in and out of a binder without opening it and they do so easily.  The question is why would you need that? it's no big deal to  open a three ring binder.  I also question why you even need bookmarks in a binder...I have been using them in my recipe binder instead of those sticky tabs.  You can write on the top of them on the enclosed labels; you are also given a link to the Avery website where you can print the labels.While not a necessity, they are fun.  I personally did not have a problem with them falling out of the binder, even when I held it upside down.

"The Great Zoo of China" was the first Matthew Reilly book that I have ever read.  While my first thought was "uh oh, 'Jurassic Park' take off"...this book is truly so much more than that, and the author himself makes a tongue-in-cheek reference to that by one of his characters.  I started this book at the beginning of my long flight from the Midwest to California...I finished it waiting for my shuttle bus to arrive.  It is literally nonstop action - of the over the stop/incredible type to be sure, but if you want thrills and excitement, in a fast read that you won't want to put down - this is your book.Set in present day China, the story opens with Bill Lynch, a leading herpetologist,  being hunted ruthlessly by other men and then by something much, much worse...at this point I was sucked in and never stopped reading until the book was finished  several hours later.  Dr. C. J. Cameron is  Lynch's protege, a herpetologist herself and a leading authority on the largest reptiles in the world, the salt water crocodile.  When she and her photojournalist brother Hamish are asked by National Geographic Magazine to visit and document the Great Zoo of China before it is open to the public, they find themselves in an elite group including the US Ambassador to China and his aide, a head columnist from the New York Times and a leading internet voice.  It is obvious that the Chinese have spared no expense to announce their zoo to the world.  As the tour begins, I hear Jeff Goldblum's character from Jurassic Park in my head discussing all the ways that nature cannot be controlled...and that is exactly the premise of this book.  SPOILER ALERT:  It is not really the Great Zoo of China but The Great Dragon Zoo of China.  The Chinese have actually found dragon eggs, raised several species of dragons and even "trained" them...but of course the reader knows this is destined to go very wrong and it does.  The intrepid Dr. Cameron goes from one fantastic adventure to another, but the author keeps the story moving at the speed of a runaway train.  I did think that this has blockbuster movie written all over it...if they could figure out how to film it.  The story is so big, that it is at times more fantasy novel than thriller, but the reader won't care.The section in the book titled "Sixth Evolution, The Time of the Dragon" begins with this quote by Tolkein "It does not do to leave a live dragon out of your calculations, if you live near him".  Wise words indeed...Fantastic, over-the-top fun and a great summer read.  Note:  I read this on my kindle, which was handy for flying, but made it very difficult to see the several maps of the zoo that were included in the book.

I've tried several different LED bulbs and have already switched most of the house over. LED's offer low wattage and energy use and last years longer.This bulb is amazing for two reasons. First of all, it looks identical to a conventional bulb. If I hadn't known that it was an LED bulb ahead of time, I wouldn't have noticed the difference. The bulb has a warm, soft yellow 2700K color temperature and really lights up the room.Something else that is really cool about these bulbs is that they are filament bulbs, resembeling bulbs from the early 20th century.These bulbs aren't overly bright, they are only 40W equivalent but they are perfect for a bedside lamp or a bathroom strip light. I have been using this bulb at my nightstand but I intend to switch them over to my bathroom strip light.These bulbs are dimmable if you have a dimmable fixture. The bulbs instantly turn on when I flip the switch and they stay cool to the touch. The filament style really is cool to look at and they give a warm vintage feel to them. For some reason I get black bars on the pictures when I take them but the pages pictures are very accurate.Overall, these bulbs are great! This KeyLine charger is a 5-stage charger and maintainer for car, motorcycle, and marine batteries. It chargers at a low, 0.75A speed and is very easy on older batteries. It features built-in overcharging protection and surge protection to protect the battery during long charges.I have charged my boat battery on a slow, 1A charger for several years and have noticed that it holds a much better charge than a higher ampage even though it takes longer. After reading into the difference between this charger and my trickle charger, I feel much safer using this one not to mention it does seem to charge a little faster.This charger is also a quarter of the size of my trickle charger. It is easy to store and it has alligator and terminal cables included. The charger has a long cable and can be plugged 110-240V wall outlet.Overall, great inexpensive and high performance charger. First off, I'm not good at jump rope, and am a total newbie.  the last time I used a jump rope was when I was about 10 - over 40 years ago! I am hoping to use this as another cardio alternative at the end of my weight lifting workout.This is a decent rope, and does the job once you figure out the correct length.  I did some googling, since nothing about sizing came with this rope and discovered that for sizing, all rope lengths are measured from handle tip to handle tip, NOT just the length of the cord. To determine the exact length for an individual, stand on the center of the cord. The handle tips should reach your armpits, or just below the shoulders.  To adjust this jump rope you'll need a small philips head screw driver and wire cutters.The problem I had with the adjustment is that I'm just 5'2" so had to shorten it quite a bit.  this left a long length of cord hanging off one handle as you can only adjust one side. I now need wire cutters to cut it down to size because the rope is not just vinyl, it is steel wires that have a vinyl coating. It hurts when it slaps against unprotected feet (wear shoes!) and shins. I won't be trimming it completely the first time as I may need to adjust the length again as I use it more and get used to it.I suppose if I was more experienced at jumping I'd probably give this 4 stars, but I'm still trying to get the hang of it and not sure right now if it is me or the rope.  I may come back and change the rating as I get more experience with it.

I haven't really lost any significant weight with this, but I have noticed it help with reduced appetite. I am not good at remembering to take pills so having to take this 30-60 minutes before a meal is kind of a pain for me, but when I do remember it has noticeably helped in reducing those feelings of wanting to eat something (when I really don't need to).  I have been taking them on and off (because I don't always remember to take them until its too late) for about a week now. Haven't noticed any significant weight loss, but then I only need to drop about 5 pounds.  I've been watching my food intake and exercising as well so I'm hoping that this will help me with the in-between meal snacking urges. I think it would probably be more effective if I could remember to take them before the meals. Since I don't eat my meals at regular times each day, it's a little difficult for me.Because I am exercising regularly and paying more attention to what I eat, any weight loss may not necessarily be attributed to this, but I figure it can't hurt if it helps reduce the urge to overeat and snack.  honestly, if you're looking for a magic pill for weight loss, this isn't it because there is none.  The only true way to lose weight and keep it off is to change your eating and exercise habits.

I have acne.  I'm 50 years old and still have to fight pimples on my face!  I get a small breakouts every few weeks.  This has been my constant battle since puberty!  Needless to say, I've tried a wide variety of products.  So far nothing has been the perfect answer to perfectly beautiful skin.  However, I do notice that my breakouts are much less when I use products with benzoyl peroxide rather than the salicylic acid, which most seem to have these days.  This product, Neutrogena Rapid Clear, contains benzoyl peroxide.  I've been using it about a week now and I really like how it cleans.  It also doesn't have the little "gritties" that other products seem to love putting in there, making it a "scrub."  Seriously, when you already have large pores from acne and oily skin, those little gritties aren't really good for you - the can cause small tearing of the pores which makes them larger.  I never did understand why companies put those gritties in there when dermatologists and studies recommend that people with oily skin and large pores do not use them.what I like about this product is that not only does it control my acne better than others I've tried, but it is smooth (no gritties!) and it has a light, fresh scent - kind of like baby powder, but not strong smelling at all.  it is easy to rinse off and, again, no left over little gritties to deal with.  I have not had any issue with dryness, but then my skin is used to acne medication.  If you're not used to it, and you get a lot of drying, I'd suggest using it just once a day for at least a week then up it to twice a day.  Also, get a good oil-free lotion to follow it with.Bottom line - I like this much better than the others I've tried (Biore, Aveeno, Olay).  Everyone's skin is different so you may see different results, but for me benzoyl peroxide works much better on my acne than salicylic acid. Most product these days don't use the benzoyl peroxide, so I'm glad to to see Neutrogena including it here.  If I continue to see improvements in my skin I may come back and give this a 5 star, but until I find the absolutely perfect skin care product for my skin, it's going to be 4 stars.

I really like this case.  when I first put on my iPhone I was hesitant due to the added size, but then it's not like it's the size of those new iPhone 6 monsters!First thing I did after I got the phone into the case was to test out all the buttons - they work just fine - better than other cases I've had, in fact.Next was a test to see how the earbuds sound.  I'm not very discerning when it comes to earbuds as I'm rough on them, although I do need a decent sound. I am a runner and usually have earbuds strapped from a waist belt up my shirt to my ears.  they get sweaty and dirty.  When you're out running you need to hear some of what's going on around you in order to be alert for any dangers - so I dont' need complete noise cancelling features.  Anyhow, the sound on these is great.  It's not tinny like some others - it's perfect for me.  The controls on the ear bud are a little to get used to in the new spot, up near my ear rather than down a ways like the iPhone standard earbuds. But I found that they were simple enough to control so I can skip songs, repeat songs, and answer calls if needed.The case itself is soft and easy to hold. It seems to provide good protection for the phone as well, which is good as I'm known to drop mine now and again (so far only one time i"ve had to have the glass face replaced, thank goodness!)The one thing that is missing -- well, when I get in my car, I don't have a bluetooth radio so I plug in the auxiallary into my iPhone to listen to audiobooks or music.  I can't do that easily with this case - I need to remove the phone from the case in order to plug in.  If they just had an option to plug in externally to the audio jack, this would perfect!  So needless to say I've had to take my phone in and out of the case for my work commute trips and so far I've had no issues with the earbud cables tangling or getting messed up.  It's pretty simple task to remove from the case and replace it later.So other than the lack of an external audio jack adapter/extender, this is a great case.  I've already had a friend with an Android see this and be envious of the fact that I dont have a tangled mess of earbud cable with my phone.  She wants one of these - and she has a bluetooth radio in her car.  Maybe I should just upgrade my car radio.

This little stylus works great with my iPhone, helping to reduce the "fat finger" issues of typos that I always get.  (I hate auto-correct, so I turn that off and try to fix my typos myself - much better than relying on auto-correct with its often horrifying replacement words!)  This little stylus is sleek and easy to hold.  When the cap is off, it screws nicely onto the other end so you don't lose it.  The built-in clip is perfect for clpping to a case - which would be great for iPad (or other tablet) users who have a case.  The probably with using a stylus on your smartphone is that you need it to be handy and while I've hooked this guy onto tthe pocket of my purse, that is still one step too many for me when I'm out and about.  So, not having a tablet to use this with, I use it on my iphone when I'm at home and sitting around playing Words with Friends or checking my Facebook updates.  I do think this will be a great gift for my 83-year old father who loves his iPad and uses stylus with that until they wear out (yes, he wears them out!)  The tip on this is different than the little rubber-ball type tip I've used in the past, and it appears to be much more durable than those.  So, I'll have to see if dear old dad can wear this one out as fast as he does the rubber tip ones!

loved the color but sadly this was way too small for me.  I'm a 32DD, and this fit like a 30D- too tight around the band and cups much too small.  Sadly I had to return it, though the return process was smooth, it did cost me $5 in shpping to return it so I'm a little hesitant to order in a larger size.  It really is a beautiful bra and I have other DKNY bras in 32DD that fit perfect, so not sure why this particular style runs so small.
Am I the only one on the planet who is just seeing this wonderful show for the first time?!  I am hooked. It's human, funny, and the characters are perfect.  I can't get enough of it!

I'm not sure what I was thinking when I got this flavor, the cinnamon chai taste is really not my favorite, but that aside, this is really not bad tasting. my first time mixing this up and i added bananas and strawberries  - i do not recommend that!  They just do not go well with the cinnamon flavor. Since then I've simply blended it with plain, unsweetened almond milk and it's been good.  I drink a glass of it after exercise - usually weight lifting, but sometimes after a run. this could easily be a meal-replacement with its nutrional composition but I got it for the 20grams of protein in each serving.  I love that this is vegan and is pea-protein rather than soy.  Pea protein is great because it is hypoallergenic - easy to digest with no lactose or gluten.  Of course all the green foods in this protein powder (6 servings!) lead to your protein shake also coming out green looking.  Not to worry, though, it's still very much palatable, despite the color.I have no tried this in a shaker bottle, I only use my blender, so I can't say how it mixes up in a blender bottle, but it blends nicely in the blender.  It also does not have a chalky or textured taste that I find from many powders.  I think Vega is a good brand, well researched, and uses whole, plant-based foods, which is one of the big reasons why for my next tub of protein mix, I'll be getting the French Vanilla flavor so i can throw in those bananas and strawberries -- that will add calories, of course, but this is only 160-170 calories a serving, so if using this for a meal replacement, adding in a banana and a few strawberries will make this more of a meal.

This works pretty well.  It's not the be-all, end-all acne killer for me, nothing really seems to be, but I do like how my face feels afterward and the breakouts so far seem to be minimal.  I've got adult acne, always have, where even at the young age of 50 I still get a break out now and again.  My skin is also always reddish looking so I was intrigued by the "mattify" step with its "hint" of green in it.It's pretty clear that this is marketed for teenage and young adult women, with its cutesy names -- curly brackets and exclamation points all included: {Acne Hater Scrub!}, {Spot Zinger!}, and {Swirled Mattifier!}so the cutesy names are fun and, well, cute, but they are just that if the product isn't up to snuff... so, here are my thoughts on the set (I do suggest getting the set as they are formulated to work together).Step 1: Cleanse - it has a fresh scent and little "gritties" in it to make you feel like you're scrubbing off the crap.  I do always wonder why acne treatment products put gritties in their cleansers when these are not supposed to be good for those of us with larger pores (generally typical for those who have oily skin and break out often). The gritties supposedly can cause the pores to get larger by "tearing" them open a bit.  personally I like the feeling that I'm getting a good scrubbing, so it's not that big of a deal, unless these little guys are causing my pores to get larger - although I see no evidence of it.  I'll let you decide on your own.  Oh, the other thing about the gritties - I find it's best to scrub in the shower so I can get a good rinse off under the showerhead.  If I'm washing my face at night over the sink with a wet washcloth, it's often a pain to get all the gritties off my face.Step 2: Treat - this little bottle of treatment seems to work well.  I dab little spots of it on the trouble spots of my face then blend it in.  No stinging for me.Step 3: Mattify - this is the one with the subtle green in it to help cover up the redness.  first off, remember that a little of this goes a long way!  one full pump will probably be more than enough, so I suggest taking it easy the first time you use this.  It goes on pretty smooth.  Blend it in so it's on with a fairly thin layer then give it a few seconds to absorb into your skin.  I do notice a subtle improvement in the redness, although it's not a cover up so the redness won't go away completely.  This has a scent to it that I'm not too keen on - but it seems to dissipate after awhile.  This also does well under makeup.  I use a bare minerals powder foundation and it goes on nicely over this mattifier.I've been using the Olay Fresh Effects treatment for about 2 weeks now and I did still have a minor breakout, although the blemish did not seem to get out of control so it appears that this system has helped to kept it in check.  I've not had any drying of my skin, but then it's pretty used to salicylic acid, so if you're skin isn't, I'd suggest you break into this easy but maybe only using it once a day in the beginning.  It does seem to work best, though, with regular use morning and night.

When I first got this I thought it was interesting that the a/c power adapter weighed more than the hub itself.  But that's really no big deal since this hub sits on my desk all day doing its thing.  The cool thing about this is that there are 7 ports PLUS the 2 'always on' fast charging ports for iphones, ipads, etc.I use this port with my MacBook Pro which, using bootcamp, has both OSX (yosemite) and Windows 7 on it.  The port works fine with both and it worked right away after plugging it in.  I have external hard drives plugged into it, a keyboard (for when the MacBook Pro is "docked" on the desk), a printer, and a wacom tablet.  All work great with this.The one thing you have to remember is the 2 charging ports are solely charging ports.  You can't plug in a USB flash drive, external harddrive, or other peripheral device and access it through one of these 2 bonus ports.  Which means you also cannot sync your iPhone, iPad, Android, etc when plugged into one of the 2 charging ports.  This is perfectly fine by me because it gets annoying plugging in my iPhone to charge and the computer always wanting to access it, sync it, or whatever.  Plus the fact that these charging ports are always on means I can shut down my computer but leave the devices I need charged plugged in and they continue to charge.  No need to move them to a wall outlet charger.I also have a 7-port Anker USB3 hub, which works great but it does not have the additional charging ports.  Between that one and this TP-Link I have plenty of ports to plug in external harddrives (I use many of those for backups and portable data storage).

I've been an OSX user for years so I know a lot of what's in this manual already, still with all the changes and new features that have been thrown in over years, I found that I didn't know as much as I thought I did!  I've been happy to just log in and work in Photoshop and Illustrator without a whole lot of thought to the OS.  However, this book is a great little gem that offers insight on all the handy little features of OSX that make my life easier.  While writing up some documentation on how to update a webpage, I found myself making tons of screenshots.  I didn't realize all the extra little things you can do while capturing the screen with shift-command-4.  Saved me a lot of time dragging around windows but instead of dragging, tapping the space bar.  My mouse turns into a little camera icon, then I only have to click on the dialog box I want to capture and voila!  easy graphic to add into my documentation.This is a great reference book, and one I will no doubt refer to now and again.

These are great.  I was worried that every time I opened the cabinet under the kitchen sink, where I keep the garbage bin, that it would smell perfumey and just too much scent.  I've been pleasantly surprised, as that has not happened.  I can barely smell the fabreze/gain, but I can also barely smell the old coffee grounds from this morning and the onion peels from last night's dinner.  It's subtle and it works.My husband claims that these are the best garbage bags and, in fact, he's thinking of creating his own clothing line with them so he can wear one every day and not bother with deodorant anymore.  I figure, why not, we live in the Pacific NW, it would be rainproof attire.Ah, but in all seriousness, the other thing I like about these is that Glad did not skimp on the other things that make their bags so great - the drawstring and the 'force-flex.'  It doesn't say "force-flex" on the box, but these are made with Glad's signature "force-flex" material, keeping them strong and tear free.

We love these glasses!  These are perfect wine glasses!  I received some beautiful Tiffany crystal wine glasses as a wedding gift, they held as much as these but unfortunately were very delicate and I ended up breaking two of the four!  So we decided it was time to get something durable for our (almost) every day use when we have a glass of wine with dinner.  Stemless was my first choice, as both broken Tiffany glasses happened because they were tall - one I accidentally hit on the sink faucet when I was washing it, the other I had filled with water to soak it a bit before washing and when I picked it up to empty the water, I grabbed a little too low on the stem and it toppled over in my hand, against the sink.  Thus, the two remaining Tiffany glasses will be brought out for special occasions only.These stemless Luigi Bromioli glasses are durable, fit great in the dishwasher, and they hold a lot of wine!  Not only are these durable, but they don't feel cheap and are very well made.  We have a "recipe" we enjoy now and then with our wine -- throw a handful of frozen fruit in the glass, then cover it with white wine (Pinot Gris or Prosecco - love the bubbly, are our favs).  After dinner, when we finish up the wine in the glass, we have fruit left over - making for a nice after dinner treat that's much better for us than ice cream or cake.  The size of these glasses make that a perfect treat.

I started the Zyflamend with a half dose (one pill a day) after reading about the potential for for stomach issues.  I have had acid reflux pretty much my whole life, although I control it by avoiding foods that cause me problems, so I was a little worried about this.  I decided I'd try the recommended 1 a day for the first few weeks and see how it goes. I did feel a very subtle "warming" sensation in my stomach the first few days when I took the pill the in the morning. After about 2 weeks I had maybe two minor acid-reflux issues related to the Zyflamend, but decided to go ahead and up to the dosage to the full dose of 2 a day.  that was about a week ago and so far I've had no issues whatsoever with heartburn or acid reflux from the Zyflamend.  So that's a good thing!  (we're all different, so your mileage may vary - suggest trying it in the low dose as recommended, but if you have issues the few days, perhaps try a lower dose version).Now, about what it's taken for --- I have been having some issues with a pain in my knee/leg that has hindered my running a bit so I googled Zyflamend to read more about it and see if the "imflamation response" could possibly help out. It sounded like this could help with that and the other minor aches I get now and again when I push the workout a little more than I should. Okay. I'll be honest here, I'm going to be 50 in less than a week - I still love to run, bicycle, and lift weights - I get aches and pains often, but I find it takes a little longer to recover from them as I get older.  Maybe it's coincidence, but I have started to notice less of the aches since I've started the Zyflamend.  And the knee/calf pain that's been plaguing me on and off for over a year now is less noticeable.  I suppose it could be time healing it, but I'd like to think the Zyflamend is helping.  As long as this keeps up, I'll keep taking it.I also want to mention that in my google research I discovered that Zyflamend is also good for the prostate, so I started my husband taking this as well.  Although, I notice that New Chapter has a separate version specifically formulated to help with prostate health.As a female (almost 50.. as I mentioned above) i definitely need to worry about bone strength.  Being a vegetarian, I still eat some dairy and take a daily multivitamin (from New Chapter as well), but I need more calcium so taking the Bone Strength supplement from New Chapter is a no-brainer for me.  Besides, my doctor told me to start adding calcium supplements to my routine back when I was 40.  I really like New Chapter's products and the Bone Strength product has calcium, magnesium and D3 - not only good for bones but joints as well. I'm sure that's also a good thing for that pesky knee/calf issue I mentioned earlier, too.I'm pleased with these products, I've always felt that New Chapter makes quality products, using organic whole foods, not synthetics.  I only have one body, I'm going to treat it well!

Love the feel of this, but it is too perfume-smelling for me.  I thought it would have a lighter scent, but I can't get past the fragrance in it.  I was pretty bummed out because I really like how great it lathers and how my skin feels afterward, but I really don't care for the perfume smell.  My husband also commented on it being too perfume smelling.  He used it once and that was enough for him!

perfect size for my Western Digital My Passport Ultra drive!  sturdy and well made.  You can't beat the price, either!  I carry the drive around in this and it fits fine in my laptop bag to protect the drive.  The pocket stores the cable nicely along with some extra thumbdrives I carry around as well.

If anyone ever tells you that using an epilator doesn't hurt, they are lying.  These things basically tweeze your hair en masse causing all the pain one might expect if you took a pair of tweezers and started ripping out the hairs in your armpits, your bikini line, and on your legs.This was actually my first real experience with an epilator.  I'm writing this review having only been brave enough to try this once so far.  And, of course, when I decided to try it, it was all-in.  I used the standard head, dry, and decided to try it first on my bikini area.  I figured I'd do one side, then shave the other side and compare.  It was not a pleasant experience, painful as it ripped the hairs out.  Although i was not screaming in pain, and I tried to make it through by doing the entire area.  I switched the modes from hard to soft and even tried the various heads, but it all felt about the same.  The hair didn't come off as completely as I had expected, either.  There was still some left after I had covered the entire area with the thing. There were small red blotches from the ripping out of the hairs and my skin was tender to the touch.  Figured I should have tried this wet first, but I was too lazy.That was at least a week ago and I still have not gotten up the nerve to go near the device again.  however, pain aside, I have noticed that the hair removed by the epilator along my right-side bikini line has not grown back as quickly as the hair on the other side that I shaved on the same day as the epilating.  So for that, it is great.  Basically for me it comes down to whether or not I want suffer through the pain and discomfort of using the epilator in order to not have to worry about shaving/epilating as often, or just keep shaving.  Right now I'm going with the shaving.  I'm too much of a wimp.perhaps I'll get brave and try it again in the shower, where it is supposed to be a little less painful.  If that ever happens, I'll report back.

Perhaps I'm being too harsh on this product giving it only 3 stars, as it's the only one I have tried in the Benzac line.  As a hydrator it works well. As an acne control or acne clearing product it is "meh."  (you know, average - 3 stars).  I have had acne my whole life - never bad enough to go to a dermatologist but there's always a breakout coming at some point.  And now at age 50, you'd think this would be gone, but nope.  I still get a zit or two on my face every now and then.  I was hoping this product with salicylic acid and the addition of sandalwood would help.  I've been using this hydrator for over 2 weeks now.  As a test, I have been applying it to only the left side of my face.  The scent of this does seem "citrus" to me, it's an odd scent that I can't describe - not really bad, but not pleasant, either.  Still, it's faint and goes away rather quickly after applied.As for the effectiveness of the product itself, while the acne is no less or no more on the left side of my face where I am using the Benzac Blemish Clearing Hydrator, I can see a visible difference in the smoothness of lines on my face.  Interesting, since I'm using this in combination with Dermalogica products - so my full face is getting hydrated from that as well.After hydrating with this the left side of my face does feel smoother and cleaner.  not sure why, the Dermalogica products aren't bad, but I'm glad I only have a trial size of those - and I won't be purchasing the full size of those.  I realize that companies create their products to work together, so using and reviewing just this one (step 3) product out of their 3-step system may be unfair.  With how the hydrator alone has been nice to my skin, though not given me any sort of "wow" for the acne control, I may see about getting a trial pack of the Benzac in order to get a full review.I just wish I could finally find a skin care line that works with my skin. It's been a continual search my whole life and nothing yet has blown me away as the perfect solution for my acne-prone skin.  I'll update this review if I find that using the full Benzac line is beneficial.

Thes boots are cute, well made, and fit nicely.  They are also comfortable and affordable.  I couldn't believe the price and thought they may be pretty cheaply made, but they are nice quality.  I got the beige in a 7.5 - I usually wear a 7.5 or 8, and I almost went with the 8 based on reviews, but decided to try the 7.5 instead.  it fits perfectly.  My feet are not wide, but they certainly aren't narrow either.  I tend to be close to a wide than a narrow so I was a bit concerned about that, especially since these have a pointed toe.  Usually a pointed toe means it's going to be narrow, order the 8. But I had no problem with that.  I the first time I wore them, I wore them to work.  I sat in meetings most of the day but i did have to walk around and up and downstairs a few times.  No problems whatsoever.  they were plenty comfortable and looked really cute with my skinny-leg jeans.  (They aren't really skinny jeans, but fitted in the legs, kind of like jeggings, but not.  - can you tell I don't know the fashion terms for these things?  lol!)

The first one that Amazon sent me was black, not titanium as I had ordered.  I wanted a slightly different color than the black one I already have so I could differentiate the two.  The box it came in said it was a WD My Passport Ultra but printed on the drive was only "WD My Passport"  and it was also printed in the other direction, readable from "portrait" (or vertical) orientation rather than "landscape" (or horizontal) orientation.  I thought that was  little odd, but decided that it would help me to differentiate the two after all.  So, I hooked it up to my windows 7 install and windows attmpted to load drivers for it but after a minute or so it failed.No problem, I thought, I'll just plug it in to my Mac and format/partitition it there as I had done with my other My Passport Ultra drive.  Nope.  That didn't work either.  Mac OS X Yosemite  couldn't do it either and I couldn't even erase it to start fresh.  It simply didn't work.  I googled the error, thinking I could fix it with some command line process and found instructions on running FSCK to resolve it.  I decided not to bother with that additional pain, because what if it still didn't work?  Having ordered it from Amazon, I figured the best thing to do was to return it and ask for a new one.So I returned the first one, explained that it was "dead out of the box."  And Amazon promptly sent me a replacement. (Another reason I LOVE shopping from Amazon - aside from Prime - is that it is always fairly painless to return things).The replacement arrived 2 days after I submitted my return claim and one day after I actually put the dead drive in the mail to send it back.  The replacement was exactly what I had ordered - it came in the correct color - Titanium - and it has the printing on the drive just as shown in the picture (horizontal orientation).  I plugged it in to my Mac and had absolutely no problem partitioning and formatting the drive to my specifications.  it works perfectly so far and will be used as the backup for my other My Passport Ultra.I am only taking off one star because of the first dead drive that I got, but really if the rating is for the drive that I have now, it's definitely a 5star.

Ok people love her now because she wrote Gone Girl and it shocked everyone and made a movie and everything. WOW! As I said before, I've read better. SHE'S written better. So here we are with a short story. I hope she really did write it as a favour for a friend because for the the third time, I've read better. Do worry Ms. Flynn, your 15 minute story will make you money and keep you in the public eye until you finish your next book. But you didn't need this story, it wasn't even your style. And you know you phoned it in. I liked you when you wrote what you knew. But I think Gone Girl has gone to your head. Your next book better be fabulous, because if it's not you will lose your hard core readers. I let it go when Gone Girl made me lose a little respect. I'm letting this story go as well. But you're only getting one more dance from me, I have better dark places with sharp objects to cut me when I read.

I received a complimentary copy of this book in exchange for an honest review.  That being said, the review club that sent me this book asks for four things - a disclaimer (done), that the reader read the entire book (done), that any spoilers be clearly marked (no spoilers here), and that the reader provides constructive criticism in a helpful manner. Herein lies the problem. Is it constructive to tell the author ( and other potential readers) that I wouldn't read this book again if my life depended on it? Is it helpful to review this book and recommend that no one should ever be subjected to such an amazing array of stupidity? Is the author going to hunt me down and shoot me if I say this book of short stories is so awful, I don't want to admit I read it?  Look book reviews are boring at best. Most people only read a few, and several people wrote good things about this book. If your the author, be happy with that. If your a potential reader, my silly, little, uninspired recommendation is run away, run away. This book reminded me of why I have to read so many books, because it's so difficult to find a good one.

I was given this book free in return for an honest review. And you are definitely getting an honest review. First of all this story is 18 pages, that's a newspaper article, not a book. The story was not so bad, except it felt like one chapter of an unfinished book. How am I supposed to care about characters who weren't fleshed out. And the plotline has no point of reference. Usually if a book is bad, I just skip reviewing it. I hate to denigrate anyone skilled enough to write something, but I had to review this one. My apologies to the author and please forgive my ignorance but this story was predictable, a repeat of previous books, and stereotypical. Oh look, my review is longer than the book.

Lately, I have been re-reading  some of my old favorites. I think it's because I have around 1,000 or more na books to choose from and I don't know where to start. Either way it matters very little since I am re-reading a fabulous book by a terrific author.  And so, Ms. Gregory, we're still having fun, and your still the one.

Another re-read. I had forgotten how much I hated it the first time around.  It's so sad because I do so LIKE Koontz's books. Always have, always will. But lately he is writing from twilight land and his books are becoming BIZARRE!!! Maybe he needs to retire before he ruins the career it took him 40 years to build. He's not King and he never will be, but he had his place in the horror/suspense fiction genre.  I would hate for him to lose it and turn into a hack.

A great first novel with a few psychological errors (sorry it's my field) . I liked it as a first novel and I ordered the next one. So I guess we will see if she is going to be a favourite author or not. Definitely one for the read pile, if you haven't already.  Check back with me later and I will give you a final opinion. Nevertheless she's good, in fact very good.

This book begins with a bang and proceeds with a novel idea. But it was to short and ended to perfectly. I think if this author fleshed out her ideas and characters more, she will be unstoppable.  Good Luck!

While I support the author's right to make and print his ethical decisions, I do not agree that one person has the right to establish themselves as "the ethicist" or refer to themselves in such a manner. He is a writer, an author, no more, no less. He is in no way "my" ethicist and he certainly does not represent all of America, even if he does write for the Times. At least Dear Abby & Ann Landers were not quite as egomaniacal, and pedantic. They also weren't nearly as long winded.
Remember my star classification. One star for anyone gifted enough to write an actual book. One star if it's free.  That's It! That's how bad this book was.

The sequel to this book is out now. So I thought I better take a quick ride through this book before I read the second one.  As I get older I need to refresh my memory more often.  I remember now after a quick re-read that this was a good book. But considering the author, I didn't have to read it to know it would be good. But I do know this, it wasn't great. And that does surprise me. But by this time, King writes for himself and his fans, not for money or recognition. Let's just hope as him and I get older, he remains the best and I won't have to re-read much anymore.
He's the master and always will be. Even rereading his stories over and over again, he's still the one. We're still having fun and he's still the one.

To much money for information I already knew. A more clinical approach with some resources listed to enable the reader to seek help is crucial for this type of book. It is slightly irresponsible to point out such serious flaws or problems in relationships without any mention of where to go for help if needed.

Took a little walk on the dark side of Sweden. It was a sad and depressive visit and I won't be returning. Hidden inside this place were some secrets and some lies. None of them were enough to lighten up this story. It was a book worth reading, but not worth remembering.

For the price I paid six stories was all I got. And it's an ebook. Not nice guys even if you are all famous well-paid writers. I am a poor not-paid reader. Give me a break. Just because you write great stories doesn't mean they are worth their weight in other book money. Try to keep that in mind please.

How do you review a " short story " that is only 19 pages long? All I can say is, I am apparently lacking in intelligence or I am not "deep" enough because I didn't get it. And even if I did I still wouldn't like it.

I received an advanced copy from the author in exchange for an honest review. Keeping that in mind, I am a tough critic. I have to be because of the sheer number of books I read. So take this review for what it is, a solid review based on a very critical reader. I don't write books, and I wouldn't aim to try. It's hard work, and it takes an imagination I have to obtain by reading. And that doesn't even begin to touch the necessary literary skills necessary to write a book, which I don't have. That being said, it frustrates me when I come across a book that could be good but misses the mark by just a squeak, I get aggravated. This book is to short for a novel and to long for a short story. It's full of superfluous information and has a few very large plot holes. The thing is it could of been a great book. I could see what the author was reaching for, and I cringed every time he missed it.  Especially since he missed the mark by a whisper, not by leaps and bounds.  I liked the ideas, but I had to reach way to far to make the story line fit. And there were to many leaks in the plotline that I don't understand how the author missed. I saw them and I am a literary idiot. The book deserves 2.5 stars. I rounded up to 3 stars. Be thankful author and keep it in mind dear reader. Like I said, it's not that I didn't like it but... my brain is itching to fix it.

It's a great book. It was great when I read it as a teenager. It was great when I re-read it last night. What do you think I could say that someone much more intelligent hasn't already said. And yes put me in the " book was better than the movie" group. Somehow I don't think that surprises anyone.

I liked this story. It was sweet. Maybe a little to sweet, maybe a little to perfect. There were a lot of secrets in this book, and I don't know why. Everything that happened was a logical progression of events. While I understand why secrets and lies seemed so important to the plotline, they weren't important to me as the reader. And that i'm afraid is a problem dear author.

It was as good as the last time I read it. And I'm sure you don't need a review on a book you have already read many times. One of the few books where the film was better than the book and we all know how often that happens.

I am in the process of re-reading some books as I am reading new books. This is one of them. It was fine when I read it the 1st time. It's still fine. Harris has done so much better I am glad to get this one out of the way. So it's on to Red Dragon and I'll finish Wreckage while I am at it. See ya soon.

Actually it was a horror OF a novel. I must not be bright enough to follow books about spirits and demons and death.(although I have read Koontz, Crouch, King, and many, MANY others) maybe I should adapt what my AMAZING grandmother taught me and if I can't say something nice, not to say anything at all. But she would have hated this book too.
No I am so sorry but just no.A disturbing psychological thriller?Absolutely no.- based on the humble and possibly inaccurate musings of a lowly reader with a  doctorate in Psychology

I'm not sure when this was written but it could be tomorrow's newscast. It's impossible to decide whether I was reading a story or watching CNN I've read better, but I've also read a lot worse.  At least it's current affairs.

I am so dissatisfied with this purchase. This is the favorite go to toy for kids of all ages and has been for many years. I had them, my children had them, and now I am buying them for my grandchildren. Over the years, I have spent thousands of dollars at Amazon. This year alone, I have spent in excess of $5,000, and Amazon has been pretty good to me. But when I got this item, I could have cried. They were packed incorrectly and ended up on the bottom of the box, most of them smashed beyond use. It would cost more than it's worth to return them, so I guess I will just have to buy them again. Amazon, I just wish you used the same care and consideration with package 200 as you did with package 1.Debbie Wood

I f more people believed in God and accepted the miracles he is willing to give them, we would pray more and worry less.  "The shortest distance between the problem and the solution, is the distance between your knees and the floor."( unknown)
Love this app. Chooses good books, not just garbage. I am only writing this because a little note popped up in the app and made me feel guilty. But it's still a good app.

Although it was only .99, it was also only ten pages long. It mostly talked about fung shui and how to change your color schemes which I couldn't possibly afford. Also the focal point of my house is the refrigerator. And that's not likely to change until I have no more teenagers in my house. Skip this one, you'll never miss it and it will save you some clutter on your kindle.

Janet Evanovich has been writing best-selling books for so many years I forget when I started reading them. The antics of Stephanie and her crew have made me laugh so hard I had tears running down my legs. The sexual tension between the characters has always had me coming back for more, and, more. Ms. Evanovich was a master of the craft and we all profited from it.  She's done now. The legend of Stephanie Plum is over. I don't know how it happened. I don't know when it all started to go wrong. But alas, the ride is over. Maybe it started when the author started to write other series with other authors. Maybe she just had no more left for Stephanie to do. But since about book 11, I think we all started getting tired of it. How many more times is someone going to say "babe"? Are we expected to read a book where someone usually dies, the dog eats something and pukes, grandma does something kooky, and the heroine waffles back and forth between two men. We all give thanks for the years of enjoyment but we are officially done. For the last ten books (translate ten years and about $300.00, not to mention the shelf space we have lost) you can take off the dust jackets, mix them around and put them in any order you want. It makes no difference, THE'RE ALL THE SAME BOOK!!!! I gave it ten good years and except for the fact that the books are getting thinner, they haven't changed a bit. I actually SKIMMED through this book. Can you believe it? SKIMMED!!! I'm sorry Janet, I have loved your books since I was a teenager, but I can't read one more repetitious word. I WILL miss you. But I really need the shelf space.
It was way, WAY to short, even for a short story. Even for only $1.00, we deserved more. But as always it was a good story.

There were a few to many subplots going on. And instead of using the secret lover triangle that's always a red herring,the author played it straight. Just a kidnapping but way to many possible suspects and way,WAY, to much child sexual abuse that had little to add to the main plotline.  If it were cheap, I might buy another one of this author's books. But it would have to be very cheap or free. I really wish they had half stars on here, I would give it a 3 and a half.

I really needed something to make my skin feel soft and lotion wasn't doing the job. I decided to try out this cellulite cream and it has been a great decision. My rough parts of skin has now become soft and and it looks great. Perfect product.

I love this style of this desk lamp. It's very slick and has a great feel to it. Needless to say, it does all that it needs to do. The touch sensitive control makes it futuristic. It's a great lamp for my needs

Very surprised with this book. Loved the twists and turns this author has put into the book. The setting is thousands of years in the future in a place called 'New Merka.' This story flows great and if it's romance you want, there's something in the book related to that as well. What I'm trying to say is, there's something for everyone and believe me, this book will be hard to put down.

I have to say this is very fast acting. This definitely protects my body by keeping the cells healthy. The pills are easy on the stomach and o not have any side effects associated with them. Also, at $11, this item is a steal.

BRI Nutrition always produces the best supplements. This one is no exception. It works great and like their other products, no side effects. I was always against supplements because of the side effects but this one gives me no reason to dislike it at all. Good work!

I got this because of my acne problem. I have tried many different solutions in the past but none seem to have worked out for me. This was going to be the last thing I buy and I love the fact that it's working out for me. I could see clear results within a week and I will be buying more when I run out.

This is a very next gen slimming tool. I did not expect this to work, but after many great experiences with the company YoungYou, I wanted to give this a try as well. The body patches do work. There's little irritation and I've seen some loss already.

Absolutely LOVE this case. I tend to use my phone a lot and the battery life on the phone is great, but not enough for what I do. I bought this and it has been a great investment for me. The extra battery life will last you a while and it protects the phone very well.
I am loving this cable. It's the perfect length and does exactly what I need it to do. There is no need for driver installation which is an added plus. Does everything and I have no complaints here.
I love this set because it helps me organize all the material that I need. Adhesive is certainly there and won't come undone after a couple uses. Pretty good price for the product. I would recommend.
This is such a fancy desk lamp. I love it. It provides sufficient lighting for anything that I may need to do. The touch sensitive control panel makes it very easy to use. 5 stars for me.

Weight loss pills that work have been hard to find. This, however, worked perfectly. The best part about this pill is that I haven't had any side effects to this. It works well and I don't feel the negative effects.

I've been feeling extremely bloated as of late and I simply can't take it anymore. The decided to try this out because of the good reviews and I have to say, I am very pleased with the product. It does exactly what it promises to do.

This item is very revolutionary. It prevents theft but also keeps the information safe. It can easily be stored inside a wallet and be used at any time. I'm constantly afraid of theft and this will help me out a ton.

A perfect item. The material seems very sturdy and I know this because I accidentally dropped it already. I'm happy to say this water bottle took the impact and there is no damage done. Very happy with this.

These pills will last two months. The price is not at all unreasonable for the amount of time this lasts. The results are clear and you will notice them within only a couple weeks. Would totally recommend to all trying to lose some weight.

I am pretty picky when it comes to moisturizers. This one feels and smells great when you put it on. Feels like a hug on your face. I used to get pretty dry on my cheeks - little rough patches. Since I have used this - I am not nearly as dry as I used to be!

I drive a 1999 car and the lights are getting really dim. Even when I put on the high beam, the light is not enough to light up the roads. These were at a great price so I decided to try it out. I'm happy to say that I'm very satisfied with this product. It instantly lights up the road and it makes it so much easier to drive.

This product is well worth the money. The 60 capsules will last an entire month and it works really well. I cannot feel any side effects but I do feel a lot of energy. It's a great weight loss pill and you will see results fairly quickly.I'm really happy I found this product.
This thing works great! I just put my toothbrush in and press down till I hear a click. Buying one for the kid's room.

I gotta say I love this so much. You literally just plug it in and it starts shining. The colors are great and it changes so it offers lots of variety. It's so easy to use and seems to be very durable as well. Very happy about this!
I love this scene and I'm so glad I found this figurine. It's an accurate depiction and it's beautifully done. Stands perfectly and is the perfect size.

Loving this as well. I've bought tons of stuff from BestPysanky and this one was included in the package. I've played all their items around my house and it adds a great taste to my house. I love this little sculpture and will buy more of their stuff.
I love the seller BestPysanky. All of their products are top notch and of great quality. This one is no exception. The artwork is done beautifully and it's the perfect size for display.
This figure looks great on display. The artwork is beautiful and a great representation. The shipping is also extremely fast.

This is a great car model. I am a huge collector of these model cars and I am not disappointed with this one. It looks just like the real thing and is in great condition. I love it and now have a new car for my collection. Great shipping speed as well. It came in perfect condition.

I can't say enough good things about this product. I am in my early 20s and my skin type is dry. Throughout my teens I suffered from acne, which has left me with some serious dullness in the texture. My skin needed a lift, and this was it! It takes some time. It it's the only one I've used that I actually noticed a difference with. I use it I. The morning under my moisturizer and at night before bed!
Much cheaper than we could get elsewhere and it works great!

Total Car Diagnostics did an amazing job with their software. I'm a 20 year professional mechanic. And used every tuner under the sun for every imaginable car model, both from America, Asian, German. TOAD is by far in the top 3. We're using it as our default tool now in our service center. It's tuning software isn't a miracle. You should first have science and experience with tuning car maps before even using their tuning software. Then again, there's no simple way to tune cars. TOAD certainly makes it close to easier.

I actually really like this little device. I wanted to see how much I walked when I'm working so I got this pedometer. I tested out how accurate it was going to be before actually using it and the steps were right on. The charge time for this is also really fast. It lasts for about 4-5 days for me and it only needs about half an hour to fully charge itself. The instructions were easy to follow and if you have a smartphone, definitely get the app. It will help you out with recording the information and everything. It looks really slick when I wear it and people always ask me what I'm wearing. It's a really cool device. Overall I would recommend this to every one that's looking for a device similar to this. I believe that the price is fair for such a device. Thanks so much Vidonn!

If you understand the concept of Political Realism then nothing in this book is really going to come as much of a surprise to you, but the fact is that most people (and most authors) don't know what I'm talking about and thus will probably find the book a lot more novel than I did. Basically if you've been watching too much of that nonsense known as Star Trek: TNG then you'll probably be just totally shocked by everything (and you'll probably miss the fact that the utopian Culture society can't reasonably be expected to work at all without the Minds running it) but if you've been studying real-world history and global security issues then you won't be.In essence, the book is about the naive product of a hyper-utopian society who encounters a traditional Imperialist society that employs what is essentially a limited meritocracy based on the use of a complex military board game as a sort of Imperial Exam system somewhat similar to that of the Song Dynasty in China. Like most readers likely will, the main character goes through pretty much the whole story without understanding much of what's really going on.The book is pretty well written and the story is much more orderly compared to the previous train wreck Culture novel Consider Phlebas which is only slightly helpful for understanding this book (and then, mostly just due to the world building background information). Though the book is quite a bit different from Ender's Game, in some ways it's like a much more grown up version of that book.I didn't really like Ender's Game that much, but I did like Player of Games even though I wasn't all that surprised by anything in the plot. The fact that I still found The Player of Games interesting even though it was almost exactly what I expected it to be indicates to me that the author did a good job.

The best way I can describe this book with a single phrase is "a sci-fi war adventure story with strong undertones of futility and inconsistent luck." The main thing that I got out of this particular book is world building for later Culture novels. Otherwise it is, in terms of the story (not the world/universe setting) sort of like watching a much more chaotic version of the TV series Firefly where everything goes very wrong almost the entire time and characters are saved or killed by good or bad luck as much or more than their own intentional decisions.To avoid biasing myself I'm trying to write this review before reading any reviews by anyone else, so I don't really have any other ideas here besides my own, but after reading this I'm kind of left wondering "and the point of this story is supposed to be...?" My only real guesses are: "war is messy" and "supertechnology doesn't grant easy success or address differences in values" along with some random ideas about how the overall values of a society don't necessarily separate people or keep them together, especially in extreme situations.Maybe I'm just too old or something, but I don't feel like I really got anything new out of reading this. It's not a bad book though, and I'm quite sure other people would get more out of it than I did. (I wish I could think of something more insightful to say.)

While I basically like this book, I found that the "world building" (amount of detail provided) is a bit weak even considering that it's written in first-person voice from the point of view of someone who's largely kept in the dark by a totalitarian government. To me the setting basically seems too surrealistic for the level of believability that the author seems to be aiming for simply due to the lack of detail about the world itself. Obviously the whole premise of the book is far-fetched but in order to have characters who behave according to believable realistic human psychology you need enough detail about the environment to get the feeling that their behavior makes sense. I feel like there are too many unanswered questions and unspecified details to give me confidence that the author is making realistic statements about human behavior and society.For example, I'm constantly thinking to myself: "There's absolutely no way they'd need to have a lottery to force someone to participate. They would always have volunteers, and if there was a lottery it would be to decide which volunteer actually got the option to become the 'tribute'. There are simply too many adolescents who are suicidal, or want some sort of fame and don't really grasp that they're over 95% likely to die, or maybe just want to die or would be willing to just to be famous for a while."Maybe I'm just hyperanalytical, or I just spend a lot more time than most people do studying how people behave in real world extreme situations, but while I think the author does understand certain aspects of human psychology very well as it applies to warfare, I still can't help but be bothered by too many behavioral assumptions that just don't seem to match up with real-world study and experiences.

This book gives me a headache simply because it seems like the information is spread all over the place rather than grouped in some sort of sensible manner. I was assigned this book for a "crash course" covering four different types of welding plus oxy-gas cutting, and even for the superficial treatment of any given welding technology it seems like the book is lacking in information at least on certain types like oxy-gas. It's not just me, the instructor actually had to provide a packet of supplementary handouts so students could answer half of the questions on the quizzes that aren't covered by the book.I was hoping that this book would serve as a good reference for different welding technologies for those like me who may need to do some welding but aren't planning to become professional level welders. Unfortunately it looks to be very bad for that purpose.I suspect that this book was designed for a very specific degree program curriculum or something, and if the instructor for your class isn't following the author's plan then you encounter the frustrations with finding information that I have. I've probably spent more time searching for things in the index of this book than actually reading the book, and half the time what I was looking for isn't just in an unexpected place, it just isn't in the book.

I use a KNK Zing electronic cutting machine (often called an "electronic die cutter" or "cutting plotter"), and like most such machines, whatever you're cutting has to be stuck down to a cutting mat. These mats normally come coated with a tacky removable adhesive on them that's equivalent to spray mount, if not exactly the same thing.While you can use the mat for a while with the same adhesive, eventually paper fibers and stuff end up stuck to the mat which eventually reduce it's tackiness to the point where it no longer works.As a result, you have to add some sort of repositionable spray mount type adhesive to restore the mat to a sufficient degree of tackiness. This product works well for this purpose assuming you use it properly and don't apply too much or apply it unevenly, etc.This is the first one I've used with the mat, so I really don't know for sure if cheaper alternatives like Krylon 10-1/2-Ounce Easy Tack Repositionable Adhesive Spray (almost half the cost) are just as good. I think that KNK (manufacturer of my machine) sells the Krylon, so it's probably fine for cutting mat needs and significantly less expensive.After reapplying adhesive to the mat 3 or more times you end up with too thick of a layer of adhesive and paper pulp on the mat and need to clean it off. This is true of any adhesive used with such a mat, but fortunately the 3M stuff cleans off rather easily using stuff like Goo Gone Pro-Power Spray Gel followed by dishwashing detergent to get rid of the adhesive/goo-gone mix. I have no idea if it's any easier to dissolve and remove compared to cheaper stuff like the Krylon, but I can say that it does dissolve rather easily with safer solvents like Goo Gone.I've never gotten any residue on paper/etc that I've stuck down to the mat for cutting purposes, and you usually need to press the paper down very securely with any sort of cutting machine mat with any sort of adhesive. Even with lots of pressure to adhere stuff, no residue problems. Sometimes if I make the mat too sticky the stuff will rip thin bits of paper off of the bottom of things, but even when it's really thick and sticky it barely does this and it really just means I've put too much adhesive on the mat for the material I'm using.The stickiness is very controllable within a rather wide range. Two or so light quick coats from 8" or so away gives you something lighter than a post-it, and heavy coats are very tacky without causing problems or residue. (Just let it dry longer with heavy coats, at least a minute or two. Stick stuff on it immediately while its wet and you'll get some of it coming off.)I sometimes have to tape thick materials down to the sticky parts of the mat with regular masking tape, and this works out just fine. The tape sticks well enough and comes off very easily. Even with adhesive on both the tape and the mat, there are no problems like bits of tape ripping off.Another thing I have to do sometimes is scrape lots of little paper "chads" (caused by cutting small holes for intricate designs, for example) off of the mat, and this works perfectly. The little chads come off rather easily, and very little of the adhesive comes off on the rather sharp plastic paint scraper than I use. What little does get on the paint scraper is so slight that I don't need to reapply adhesive at all and I don't even need to clean the paint scraper.So far I've had no problems and no complaints about this stuff. When I have had a problem it's always been caused by me applying more than needed, or getting a super-thick spot in one place because I held it 3" away for a second.While the instructions on the can say that, once you're ready to put the can away, you need to hold it upside down and spray it so that the propellant can blow all of the adhesive out of the spray tube/nozzle, I didn't do this last time and the can sat for 2 weeks without any clogging. The directions also tell you to clean the nozzle with turpentine, but that's been totally unnecessary so far. (Maybe eventually some gunk will build up and need to be removed.) So the can seems very resistant to clogging.I'd give this stuff 5 stars except that all of these spray adhesives are really nasty stuff. Arguably I shouldn't fault this particular product since I have no reason to believe it's any more toxic etc than any other product of its type, but spray adhesives are so nasty that I wouldn't give any of them a perfect 5 stars.ALWAYS SPRAY THIS STUFF OUTSIDE OR IN A vacuum HOOD or BOOTH! Like I say, this stuff is NASTY. Not only is there absolutely no way to avoid overspray creating a toxic cloud of aerosol, but the toxic cloud can also blow around and get on anything nearby. Because of this it's absolutely critical that you only use it outdoors or with some sort of fume hood that sucks the toxic cloud through a filter. When used outdoors I'd advise standing at least maybe 6' from anything and also pay attention to which way any wind might blow the cloud. Slight wind can easily blow the toxic mess back onto you, other people, or other objects.Summary: Perfect stuff for what I'm doing. It just can't seem to do anything wrong. The only real con is that it's almost twice as expensive as stuff like the previously mentioned Krylon, and I don't know if it's that much better than cheaper products.

These things are much better than the putties in most cases.The main problem is that they end up being significantly more expensive per thing mounted on the wall particularly if you're using one for each corner of rectangular posters, etc.Note: You can wash them off under running water! This is very useful if something does happen to fall off the wall or the squares somehow get on the floor and pick up dust. Also, if you happen to stick them to a dusty wall and they fall off due to the dust, being able to just wash them allows you to clean the wall and put them back up securely.While Scotch seems to recommend against using these squares on flat wall paint, I haven't noticed any spots left behind. If anything they just don't stick as securely to flat paint but for me the stickiness seems to be good enough. So far I haven't had but one thing fall off of flat wall paint, and the only thing that did fall off seems to have been caused by dust on the wall coating the adhesive. But as previously stated, I just washed them off, cleaned the wall, and put them back up with no trouble. With glossy paint they might not even fall off of dusty walls. With flat paint use a lot of pressure to get them stuck down securely.Summary: good stuff, I'm just subtracting one star for the increased cost over putty. If you need to mount lots of stuff then the putty may be more cost effective, but otherwise I'd rather use these things.

Compared to Saunders UHU Tac Removable Adhesive Putty Tabs and another brand that I've tried, this stuff is much worse about leaving residue on walls, at least with flat wall paint, than other brands.The main problems are that it's too soft (causing it to leave bits of putty behind more easily when pulled off the wall), and it's blue (why?) so the residue that it does leave will be much more obvious on most colors of paint. While you can get most of the residue off by the usual technique of rolling a ball of putty over the residue until it comes off, this takes longer and is generally more trouble with the Blu-Tack compared to other brands like the UHU. That, combined with the blue color, makes this significantly worse than others.I have no idea why they made this stuff blue. There seems to be no valid reason for this.Like the two other reusable tacky putty products that I've used, this stuff WILL leave something that looks like an oil spot on flat wall paint. This doesn't seem to be a problem with glossy paint though. (Glossy is usually easier to clean in general.)I would certainly not recommend this blue stuff. The best comparable products I've found are the UHU Tac and 3M Scotch  1-Inch Indoor Mounting Squares. The removable silicone mounting squares are actually much better than the putties, but they end up being significantly more expensive per thing mounted on the wall particularly if you're using one for each corner of rectangular posters, etc. While Scotch seems to recommend against using these squares on flat wall paint, I haven't noticed any spots left behind. If anything they just don't stick as securely to flat paint but for me the stickiness seems to be good enough.Summary: don't buy this substandard blue junk. Get the UHU instead!

I've bought this along with Blu-Tack Re-usable Adhesive and some other brand that I can't remember the name of (I stripped the label but I think it's Scotch.) So I've had three brands to compare.Things to know:1) At least with the cheap flat wall paint in my apartment, both this stuff and Blu-Tack will leave an oil spot. I suspect this is true of all flat wall paint, but this is not a problem with glossy paint. I suspect all brands of this tacky poster putty type stuff will leave a oil-like spot on the wall.2) The UHU brand is much better about not leaving bits of residue on the wall when it's removed compared to the Blu-Tack and other stuff I have. Residue isn't really that much of a problem even with flat paint because you can roll a ball of the putty around over the residue to pull it off, but this UHU stuff leaves less residue initially on removal, and removal of any residue is much easier and more complete than the Blu-Tack especially.3) This UHU stuff is also cheaper than other per amount of putty you get.I did these residue tests for both 24 hours and 2 weeks. The results were about the same in both cases. (You'll get the oil spot on flat paint even after 24 hours.)If I need more of this stuff I'll be buying this brand, but with 3 oz of it I doubt I'm going to run out for a long time!If you want something superior to putty tack like this, you can get 3M Scotch Mounting Squares, Clear, .68-Inch by .68-Inch, 35-Pack which are very sticky and don't leave any visible residue at all. The problem with them is that you don't get many of them per pack, so they're significantly more expensive. If you don't have more than 6 posters to hang then these will work, but I have so much stuff to put up that I'd be spending at least 10x as much money for all the silicone mounting squares that I'd need compared to some sort of putty.Summary: if you get removable tacky putty stuff like this, the UHU is the best one to get at least based on my comparisons with two others.

I'm using a KNK Zing cutting machine. Like most of these consumer-level cutting machines, it's really only designed to cut chipboard up to 0.03" thick and some makes of them won't even do that. In any case, if you have a electronic "die cutter" that costs less than $400 that "cuts chipboard", I can almost guarantee that what they mean is that it will cut 0.03" thick chipboard and not anything thicker. Usually the rollers and mat won't support that thickness regardless of the blade or cutting force.When I got around to using this stuff I noticed that it was thicker than it should be, and I actually measured its thickness with a micrometer. (I'm an engineer so I actually have one.) Exactly 0.05" thick, +/- 0.001" or so depending on humidity, etc. Somewhere I see that it's supposed to be 0.057" thick but for whatever reason mine isn't. (I know my micrometer isn't off by THAT much.)I measured some matte board that I have and this chipboard is as thick as the matte board. Luckily it's a good bit softer and less dense than matte board though.I don't know why I ordered this stuff thinking it was 0.03" thick. I thought surely I must have been sent the wrong item. Maybe I saw "medium weight" in another listing where it was defined as 0.03" in thickness, but now that I look at this listing again it doesn't give the thickness anywhere! Perhaps I'm wrong, but I don't think "medium weight" is any sort of industry standard term that specifically implies 0.05"-0.057", so the term is almost meaningless unless the manufacturer clearly defines it which they did NOT do in this listing. BAD!I'm still giving this four stars because I think it's good quality chipboard that would be perfectly good where 0.05" chipboard is needed. Arguably I should give it 3 due to the bad product listing, but I think that would mislead people about the fundamental product quality. So I'm being a bit "generous" here.Anyway, if you're using a consumer-level "electronic die cutter" (cutting plotter) you certainly want 0.03" chipboard like Light Chipboard Sheets 12" x 12", 25/pkg. (I know nothing about that specific brand or product, I'm just linking to an example.)
