This is the go to polish that I use on all my black leather shoes.  It is easy to apply, polishes quickly and I believe keeps a shine longer than the standard Kiwi black.  I use it on both dress shoes and leather boots.  I employ the time honored spit shine method of starting with clean shoes, applying a little polish, working it in iwht a touch of spit or water and continuing until the desired shine is reached.  Since I'm blind, I just assume a half hour is going to give me the shine that I would be happy with and everybody tells me that my shoes look great.

The only reason I give this four stars is because they can be hard to put on.  The pull cord is so tight that at first I thought I would have to send them back.  After working with it a few minutes, they expanded enough to slip on.  Now, they are fine and I can walk my laps in the pool without destroying my feet.  Bought my kid a pair and he loves his too without any complaints.

Installed easily in a few seconds.  Print quality is first rate, as good as the original HP and 1/4 the price.  If it prints anywhere near the 2500 pages it claims, I will certainly be a repeat customer.

These were purchased for a child who had some bedwetting issues.  They fit fine on his 100lb 4'6" frame and absorbed most of the urine.  Most.  Wish they were a little more absorbent and  I would have given five stars.

The waist is about two inches smaller than others I have claimning to be the same size.  The pants are made from a very cheap cloth  like the previous reviewer stated.  In addition, mine came with a slice at the top of the pants.  Seller charged me shipping to return them.  Big waste of money.

I really love this stuff for dishes and greasy hands.  A very little goes a long way so don't waste it.  I keep some in the bathroom for extra dirty hands.  A little squirt on a sponge and I can clean an entire sink full of rinsed dirty dishes. The pump is high quality too and I have reused them for other soaps.
These bags are very strong, hold a lot of compacted trash without breaking and are reasonably priced.  I will buy them again.

This picked up a lot of ground in dirt but didn't remove some pet urine stains on my area rug.  It also took an entire can  to properly clean an 8x10 rug so it's expensive to use in my opinion. However, it did a good job of removing entryway dirt and grime from the carpet there.  Overall, kind of  ambivalent.

This is a very well made and warm jacket.  I'm kind of large around the middle so it was a little tight but the average or slim guy will have no problem.  It's so bright when light hits it that people can see me from Venus. Comfortable and windproof, I've worn it in windy single digit weather with another hoodie and stayed relatively warm.  It makes a great fall jacket and with layers, a passable cold weather one.  Very pleased.

Installed in a few seconds, printer calibrated and the test page was perfect.  If it prints out 2500 copies as it claims, I will be a forever customer.  Great price for what appears to be great quality even compared to the original HP and at 1/4 the price.

First of all, this is one quiet machine.  You can easily have a normal conversation while using the bike.  It is comfortable and easy to use, the seat puts you up high enough to sit properly while being low enough to be able to actually get off the thing when you're done.  The computer is low and out of normal vision so that someone can easily watch TV while using this bike.  The magnetic resistance makes for 8 levels of workout, easy to really tough.  The operation is as smooth as it is quiet.  Assembly was pretty easy, many of the parts have the bolts already attached or rubber-banded to where they belong, very intuitive.  Once assembled, it is solid and stable and I weigh nearly 300 pounds.Overall, this is a great deal for the price of a cheap semi-recumbent bike.
These are good quality aftermarket cables for my iPhone 5C.  SeemCharges the phone quickly and the cables appear to be made with quality construction.
Solid, stong cable that's priced very well considering the high quality.  The quick connectors are a nice touch too.

Brought in a few extra channels and made two channels much more clear.  Worth the money in my opinion but may not be necessary in a clear view environment.  I live in the middle of a hill and need all the help I can get.
Sticks on both sides, holds my area rugs down but corners of rugs don't always stay down.
Easy to see cheap and disposable.  Nothing fancy, they do exactly what they are supposed to do, provide a simple target for the shooter.
This is a great indoor target for aspiring airsoft shootists.  The bb's stick to the target then drop slowly into the tray.  Wish it were bigger so more missed bb's would be caught.
Didn't notice any difference whatsoever in my appetite or energy levels despite taking five a day.
These fit my son's Crosman pistol perfectly, as expected.  seem to last through many magazines full of airsoft rounds.  Good price and quick delivery.
These did not fare well on a textrured wall, two  out of five strips fell off within a few days.  I would use these only for smooth surfaces.

I am fortunate to have a housekeeper to clean my house and she loves this mop and mophead.  The first one lasted about six months before it got pretty ragged and couldn't come clean any more.  The dogs love chasing the mop as it must resemble some flat squirrel or something.  Picks up lint and dust as dry mop and works perfectly well as wet mop too.  This is an attachment for the Twist and Shout Mop handle.

This is a really high quality drill bit set for my handyman toolkit.  The plastic case is sturdy and closes firmly, the drill index holds the bits without them falling out all over the place.  The bits themselves seem very strong and straight.  I've had other indeces that weren't even completely straight so this is a real issue for me.  Very happy.
The overall construction is high quality but the female connector could be tighter, just doesn't have the "snap" I usually like.  Still, it sounds fine and is a sturdy cable.

For some reason, this color is very hard to find locally.  It's just what I needed for my Cordavan colored dress shoes and I have always liked Kiwi brand since my time in the Marines.  Applies smoothly, polishes easily and people tell me the shine looks great.

These fit and fire easily into the two Crosman weapons my son has.  He says they are bright green and easy to find on the basement carpeting so he can reuse them.  The bottles have the nozzle to make it easier to reload the magazines.  They are little round balls of plastic so not much else to say.

Although this is really an assault rifle and not a sniper rifle, it is nevertheless a great addition to any Airsoft armory.  The construction is solid for a plastic weapon, the parts function properly and relatively smoothly for such a non-precision product.  The aim is  superb at least to 50 feet.  My son says this is now his favorite Airsoft weapon even though it's a single shot.  We added a vertical forend grip and a cheap laser and now he's stalking the bad guys in the basement like a junior Close Quarters Battle Marine.

This was purchased for an airsoft rifle.  It fits easily onto the Picaninny rail, has simple adjustments and comes with the wrench to make the elevation and windage adjustment. Two position switch mounted securely with the Velcro patch.  Great deal for an Airsoft gun.
Both the P38 and the P51 are sturdy, quality can openers, the P38 being the smaller version that I always wore with my dog tags.  Just as advertised.

The tool is high quality and worked perfectly at removing the old spring from an old watchband.  There are two ends, one for removing links and the other for removing the springs.  Also came with some extra springs and another attachment that I'm not sure how to use.  Very good product.

The watchband is sturdy and good looking for the low price.  I wouldn't match it up with a Rolex or any expensive watch but it goes nicely with a less expensive watch.  I do not have large wrists for a guy and this just fits snugly on my wrist so if you have large wrists, this will not fit you.  Also, the retaining pins were too small for my 20mm watch, rather odd since it's a 20mm watchband so make sure you save the old pins from your previous band or you'll need to buy a pin assortment and find a match.  Overall, it's worth $15 and I'm happy with it.

My German Shepherd and mini-Doxie both love these treats and they haven't become noticeably sick from eating them.  I gave it three stars because they're so overpriced in my opinion.  My Shepherd barfs up Greenies and I am always looking for something she will tolerate without busting my budget.  She seems to do best on the super cheap biscuits but I would prefer something healthier and that's why I bought these.  Because the dogs love them, I'll probably buy them again eventually.
Blows lots of compressed air, comes with straw.  Seems like a good price for the number of cans.  It's air, it blows, it works well.
Very classy and yet inexpensive watchband.  Comes with retaining pins already installed. Fits smaller watches.

Inexpensive but practical.  Installed easily with included hardware, just use the wire nuts to connect to the existing wiring in the ceiling fan, screw it on and screw in the light bulb.  Make sure to turn off the electrical before you work on it!
This is the Boy Scout manual that all Boy Scouts need.  This one has the spiral binding so that it will lat flat.  It's just what my son needed and came in brand new condition.

The block maker doesn't work in Wisconsin for any type of snow we've had this year from heavy, wet to light and fluffy.  The lighter snow goes right through the top hole and the wet stuff won't come out in a block.  My son was very displeased.  The snowball maker is OK but it's just as easy to make a snowball by hand.

These are the most comfortable pants I've bought in a long while.  They hang nicely, the expandable waistband makes dressing easy and the material is soft and light.  These are not for cold weather as wind goes right through them but that is not a concern for me.  I think the waistband will expand about two inches.  There is a single button closure and a zipeer fly.  The inseam has plenty of room and although I usually wear a 29" inseam, these ended up being about 2" inches too long in the cuff so I had them hemmed.  I'd much rather have them long than short!In every way from price to comfot and quality, these are great trousers.
Bought for son who lost the first set, and needed it again.  He uses it a lot, and likes this.

These glide easily and they don't rust so I expect they will last a long long time. They make taking down the liner regularly to wash much easier.  We do have both a liner and a shower curtain one on each side.  I just leave the curtain on, and wash the liner once a week.

Very comfortable for a thin thong, will look fine with capri pants and more comfortable than expected. To add, the only issue I have now is they aren't good for driving, they tend to slip off the pedal easily.  I LOVE them for comfort and style, but I won't use them to drive in.
Nice and Fresh capsules, I know because I bite through them to make sure they are fresh, and these are just fine.
Best bbq grill brush I have used.
LOVE this.  Have ordered three times now, really makes me feel more alert and able to concentrate at work.
Can't find Tone in my local stores anymore, and I grew to like it a lot.  Will keep ordering, thanks.

Very pleased with this purchase, and I think everyone should have one, and I recommend it. This has high quality soft pliable plastic, it squeezes easily and the stream has a good amount of water and pressure for washing. You will feel much cleaner than using tp alone. I plan on adding a hint of witch hazel to the warm water mixture.  Get one, this is a great item to have for anyone!

When I upgraded my Samsung Smart TV with the built in software upgrade option it rendered the internet and widgets useless that I used to be able to access amazon prime movies with.  I went in search of something that would remedy that, because their tech support at Samsung told me it was not their issue it was Yahoo Widgets I needed.  (That isn't true - you can't even buy widgets from Yahoo-most likely Samsung can't afford programmers to fix that software upgrade that ruins your internet).  Anyway, this little Amazon Fire Stick remedied everything. It returned all my options like getting access to my Amazon Prime movies and Hulu Plus TV and now I am happy again.  There isn't a lot of difference between the Fire TV Stick and the Fire TV - you only need one or the other and I didn't realize that, so I bought both thinking they would work together.  Actually, I am keeping both because I can use Amazon Fire on the big tv (its remote has voice command and is a bit more convenient).  But the Fire TV Stick has most of the same features without voice command so I am using it on the smaller Samsung. I find both Fire TV and TV Stick have extremely high definition and nice selection of games, prime music, prime movies, Hulu TV and everything I really wanted.  Love both.  Thanks!

I bought the 22 inch to use as a PC monitor and tv with the amazon fire stick.  I had to learn my way around to make everything look good.  With the Amazon fire stick, the picture is amazing, very clear and wonderful.  With the PC it is NOT until you tweek it as follows:  I found no difference between using a HDMI/DVI cable and an HDMI cable (as a TV).  But the picture with EITHER cable as a PC Monitor was very fuzzy until I did this: Go to Menu/Source List and change the SOURCE name and link it to the option PC.  When you do that (I found that tip from another reviewer below-thank you!) the resolution is so much better for PC Monitor use.  Also I did Menu Mode Magic Angle/Standing Mode and it improved again.  I agree that you should NEVER EVER do an update from Samsung under the Samsung upgrade option because it will RUIN the tv rendering it useless for internet use.  I did that recently on my large 40 inch Samsung and that is why I had to buy Amazon Fire for both because the Samsung software upgrade is faulty probably so you will spend more and force you to buy another TV - there is no support from Samsung to fix once you upgrade it either.  They just tell you to contact yahoo to download widgets and Yahoo doesn't have widgets to buy.  So heed this warning NEVER update software through that link. Otherwise, the price of $167 was very good considering can be used for tv and monitor.  And Amazon Fire stick OR Amazon Fire are great with this TV if you did the software upgrade and want to access your amazon prime video's again.
Use these for everything - its what we grab over everything else in the linen closet for washing, drying, cleaning, wiping.  I'm sure for baking breads and rising dough too when we have a chance.

Maybe a floor stand would be better, but I wanted it for reading kindle in bed and I'm not sure it is all that great for reading laying down or reclining.  I guess its ok, depends on what you are clamping it to.  If you want to read in a recliner, need something nearby to clamp it to.  I had the problem where it will not stay in the position that you put it in, the neck isn't firm enough to stay put, it droops with weight of kindle (but it does fit the kindle hd 7 inch) if you stretch the sides as you put it in.  I really am not using it because it tends to be in the way mostly.

Have had mine since Feb 2013 and I didn't experience as many issues as others have with this printer, in fact I actually like it.  It DID take a LOT of work to get the WIFI to work, and after I got it going, I did end up just using a cable to connect it to my laptop, but it prints nicely, and scans well IF you can find the scan program in photoshop or word for example, because the Epson icon doesn't have the 'scan' option that I could find, you have to either use a program in your software or try to use the printer screen which I find semi difficult.  What prints out is nice and I do like mine for photos or color printing, even though the ink is semi pricey.  I replace it about twice a year, and do very light printing though.  The WIFI part is sort of a joke though.  I give it four stars because it does have a very difficult set up process and if your system updates you sometimes have to reinstall it again, so recommend to keep the passwords on file, it requires a lot of them.  I think I will opt for a color laser printer to replace this when it goes out.  For now, I do really like it with the cable hook up and NOT as a wifi printer.

Ours had a five year life span from August 2010 to Feb 2015 which I guess isn't too bad for a printer.  However, this was very lightly used, and had to reinstall software a lot.  Ink was pretty expensive to replace.  Just ok, not that great.  Going for laser this time.

Comfortable shoes.  I ordered my usual size but went with wide and although the heel is slightly loose, I can just buy heel inserts if needed.  I like these being a bit big so I can wear thick socks with them when its cold or wet and rainy.  They are good winter shoes for cold rainy days and feet will stay comfortable.  First pair was Navy and today ordering again in Brown. These work for me.

Nice black and white laser printer that is reliable and has easy set up. Since its not a network printer it only needs a USB cable which you probably already have from a previous printer, and to buy extra toner for later, it even comes with toner for immediate use that will probably last a month. Perfect for a student that needs reliability. Toner is not expensive to replace. I'm ordering a second one today because we constantly have issues with the network printers in our house that are multifunction and don't print when you need them the most. We needed mapquest directions asap this morning on an Canon MP 560 printer that stopped working. If you love simplicity and reliability and need a compact printer to save space, this one is a GOOD ONE. I am keeping one Epson xp-600 Wifi printer for photo printing but replacing two others with this version, which will solve many printing problems and be very cost effective.  Excellent.
Good fit, comfortable cotton undies.  This is the style and brand that I have been buying for several  years and is my favorite.

I've come to really like this as a facial cleanser.  It has a barely detectable scent, which is good for me.  What I can smell is a slight apricot - it could use more even.  I use it every day and like it.
Bought this in silver and it is a good bike cover.
Too narrow, returned.

FABULOUS conditioner.  We use it all the time and I will reorder this for as long as I can find it.  I have hypothyroid hair that breaks easily and this helps me so much.  It is not greasy, leaves your hair soft and supple and manageble.  Hardly any conditioner works for me, and this one is really nice for me. Good for everyone in our family of all hair types.

Dark Brown Metal and I like it for the option of not having to buy a tree some day.  Would probably be able to put a few real fir boughs in it and put those little LED light string on it with a few small ornaments.
Yes, I have wood floors and this is really helpful to get the water squeezed out so its not too wet.  Good purchase.  So hard to find a good mop, and this is a good one.
Super Entertaining
Perfect for my bathroom
CUTE and I love it.
Very nice quality sharpener and it works well, like it.
Pretty good for eyebrow shaping and cleaning up.
I bought Barely There and its very good for me.  Will order more.

So incredibly good.  This makes my fifth time I'm buying this brush, they make perfect gifts and myself and close and extended family all love this brush too.  Feels like a good massage on your scalp and is a quality beautiful brush.  One got lost when we were painting a room so I am ordering again.  Super good brush even for hair that is thick and brittle and tangled, brushed carefully this is a wonder brush.
I chose Mauve and it is just perfect, looks really good on my skin color.  First time trying Nyx and I agree it is a good brand.
This is a clear lip balm and with a nice raspberry flavor.  Very nice, I would buy it again.

Color is misleading if you are decorating and have light pastels - this rug is much darker than the picture shown. It is ok if you have darker strong deep colors - but if you are going for a pastel look with light greys and whites it is too bold.  I did return since the colors didn't work for us. Otherwise, the workmanship was nice.

Received chair and assembled fairly easily.  It is not as comfortable as I'd imagined, slighly stiff to sit on.  I ordered the cream version and it did have one small tear on the upper back side but I ignored it.  What I do not like is the fabric is definitely NOT real leather and has a chemical smell to it that doesn''t go away easily.  Also the base has gold and black plastic, a little bit tacky really and I suggest trying to assemble the arms to the back and seat loosely then tighten it down, its very hard to get it lined up and the back doesn't fit very well, ie, one of the screws wouldn't go in no matter how hard I tried, and I had to try to loosen the other screws.  The workmanship is so so, I like the look of the white but I wouldn't order another and I do worry that the chemicals might not be healthy to sit on.  I may end up donating it - wasn't the quality I expected.  Edited for update: It is now March 16th and I have grown to like it more.  I put seat pads on it to make it more comfortable and the smell is slowing fading.  Will keep it since with time the smell dissipates, just open windows for a while.

These fit very well on me, extremely comfortable - and the ankles are wide, but that works for me.  Definitely would order again. Edited to add:  I bought the both colors and I'm returning a third time to get another sand color to have as a newer pair for dressier occasions since I've worn these daily, this is my go to pair of sandals, just love them.  The sand is my favorite but I like the brown for jeans.

My feet love these, had them on all day and more than pleased with them.  I bought a whole bunch of shoes and returned anything that wasn't comfortable on me, and kept only the most comfortable, and this was among the keepers.

I like Seiko, easy to read at night, and easy to set and simple design.  Best of all, its QUIET!  No ticking at all, which is exactly what I like. If you don't want the alarm on some mornings, you will have to remember to turn the alarm back on weekdays though.

My son needed a pair of good work boots, and these are GOOD!  We returned a different brand that was not the right fit, and really happy to find these.  They fit his feet well and are very comfortable in addition to being waterproof with steel toe and he likes these. Keen makes high quality boots.
Very nice lotion.  Sweet honey scent, and you don't need a lot, it goes a long way.
Had the first one for several years, getting another to replace the first, use it a lot,  a good shower cap.

Description from Amazon.com, two books in one volume.THE CHRISTMAS COTTAGELacey Quinn does not believe in happily-ever-after or the legend of the Christmas Cottage. But her best friend does, and she's the one getting married. It's Lacey's job to make sure everything at the cottage is perfect for the newlyweds. Instead, she finds herself snowed in with the best man, and she begins to wonder if fairy tales really can come true.**This one was not bad.  Lacey and Ean were meant for each other and it was fun seeing them come together. Ava was a Bridezilla of the first degree and extremely annoying.  I dont mean just a bit annoying, there was no way to like her.  That Lacey put up with her is credit to a long term friendship. For me this was a book to pass the time, kinda fun and romantic but just okay.Deets Rating: 3.5EVER AFTERAva Callahan wants desperately to believe in love everlasting. But when Brian McCabe walks back into her life and upsets her carefully organized world, her commitment to perfection makes it hard to accept the love that's right in front of her. Will it take a night in the Christmas Cottage for Ava and Brian to find their happy ending?**Brian is Masons best friend.  Mason and Ava were about to be married but they broke up in The Christmas Cottage book.  Now Brian is back wooing Ava 8 months after the break up and Mason is about to marry someone else.  I still find Ava to be beyond annoying.  I dont really care if she and Brian get together because who is this Brian anyway and what does he see in this poor excuse of a woman, Ava? Too harsh? Maybe.  This book was torture for me to finish since Ava is not my idea of a sympathetic protagonist. Deets Rating: 1I received this book free for review from the publisher.My blog: http://ladeetdareads.wordpress.com

I do like my romance with some suspense and mystery and this book delivers on all three.  Jasper is the hunky Earl that is also intelligent, fearless and kind.  The combination that all romance readers love.  Hermione is a bit of a tom-boy for her time and likes to drive her phaeton with her beautiful matched grey horses.  That is until her father loses the horses in a card game.  There is something amiss when the winner of the horses is found.well, I will let you find out for yourselves.Manda Collins has given us a well-constructed mystery with some delicious sensuality and perfectly nuanced characters.  I turned pages anxiously to find out who was behind the mystery.  I was rewarded by a I-never-saw-that-coming surprise which was most satisfying and made sense. Hermione and Jasper had a friends to lovers romance, even though Jasper used his personal skill to ensure that he won her hand.This is the second book in The Lords of Anarchy series, but it is a standalone novel with side characters from book #1, A Good Rake is Hard to Find, playing important roles in this story.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

If you have read the previous books in this series then, like me, you have been anxiously waiting for Bears story.  He has been the big oaf in the other books where the family relies on his brawn but they dont give him much credit in the reasonable thinking department.  However this is how Bear wants it with the family but he shows his intelligent nature to Catriona and his ability to solve family problems where no one expects it of him.  You certainly dont need to have read the previous books to enjoy this one.  Ms. Enoch peppers this book with all of the MaArrcLawry family and their children (bairns) and does a good job of bringing the reader up to speed.I loved this addition to the series.  I stayed up until 4am to finish reading it I was so entranced with the story.  The writing is top-notch from an accomplished storyteller.  The protagonists are so well suited for each other and so sublimely sensual with those heated encounters. The bad guy isnt quite as bad as I usually like him to be, but he holds his own and is integral to the story. The side characters carry through their personalities into this book which makes it a delight for series readers.If you want a cant-put-down novel then this is your book.  Read the series it is a winner.Scandalous Highlanders Series1. The Devil Wears Kilts (Ranulf MacLawry & Charlotte Hanover)2. Rogue With A Brogue (Arran MacLawry & Mary Campbell)3. Mad, Bad and Dangerous In Plaid ( Rowena MacLawry & Lachlan Mac Tier)4. Some Like It Scot (Munro Bear MacLawry & Catriona MacDonald)I received this book free for review from the publisher.Also on my blog: http://ladeetdareads.wordpress.com

This is my first foray into this genre of the Amish Romance for that reason it is hard for me to say if these stories are typical of the genre.  As in all genres there are good writers and those who dont speak to the reader.  In this book I found both.  All the stories were very predictable and each practically beat the reader over the head with the moral of the story.Im not saying I will never read this genre again but I am saying I will definitely do a bit more research before I give it another try. I found I liked the writing of Ruth Reid and Kelly Irvin and will look into their books.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

Gwyn Creadys Time Travel romances are full of action, adventure, sex and laugh out loud moments and this one does not disappoint.  Serafina asks her fortune teller friend Undine for help in claiming her stolen fortune.  The help she gets is Gerard Innes from NYC in the twenty-first century. Gerard wakes up in Scotland in the 18th century and is hard pressed to figure out what is going on.  Serafina whisks him away from danger almost immediately and the chase is on.  It is she and Gerard running from the bad guys and then she and Gerard running to claim her fortune.  The question seems to be if they will be successful before Gerard is taken back to his own time or even if they will survive in Serafinas time. Peppered throughout the adventure is Gerard being the typical advertising executive even helping the tavern owner to increase his business.  As Serafina and Gerard rely on each other their romance flourishes.  Will Gerard choose to stay in Scotland with Serafina? Will it be possible? Will Serafina want to go with Gerard to The 21st century?This is a light, fun time travel romance.  It is very sexy and very funny.  The side characters were introduced in Creadys first book in this series, Just In Time For a Highlander. They are integral to this story but this is a standalone novel.I received this book free for review from the publisher.Also on my blog: http://ladeetdareads.wordpress.com

FIRST SEASON (originally published in 1983)Widowed Lady Anabel Wyndham was married right out of the schoolroom and has never before experienced the delights of a London Season. She's dazzled by the attention of the fascinating Sir Charles Norbury, a man whose touch seems to melt her very soul, but a notorious rake. She's drawn to handsome friend-of-the-family Christopher Hanford and the comfort and serenity he offers. But how does one choose between two such charming suitors? Anabel is finding that love is so much more dangerous the second time around.**That blurb neglects to mention Anabels three precocious children, William, Nicholas and Susan.  They are really the stars of this book and help to focus the story.  I truly enjoyed this book because so many of the current romance novels dont feature children in pivotal roles, it was a welcome change.  The bad guy doesnt seem all that bad until toward the end, the good guy is rather wimpy at times and Anabel is indecisive most of the time.  That leaves the children to do their best, in childish ways, to rectify the situations. Kudos to Anabels mother for being the only mother in Romance Novel history to hold her tongue and let her daughter decide her own fate. That Georgina, Anabels cousin, had to lose weight to be accepted was rather sad but I suppose true of all eras.BRIDE TO BE (originally published in 1999)Emily Crane is the toast of the ton-and she couldn't find it more tedious. Until she encounters the darkly sensual stranger whose life she once saved and the London Season becomes infinitely more exciting. Recently returned from the wilds of South America, Lord Richard Sheldon has only contempt for tiresome London chits, but he finds himself stunningly intrigued by the dauntless Emily Crane. When the two become embroiled in a budding scandal and are forced into an engagement, they discover a passion more dangerous than any killer...**This is very much a Mystery/Historical Romance.  It appears that life threatening near misses may be actual murder attempts on Richards life.  At least that is the notion that Emily decides and Richard poo-poos. Soon Richard comes around to Emilys ideas and since they have been compromised into a betrothal they will work together to figure out the mystery and then go their separate ways.I enjoyed this romance novel.  Again the premise was quite original yet believable.  There is a feisty heroine, a paranormal medium, quirky artist parents, a stuffed shirt Duchess and sons, not to leave out a handsome hero and his weepy mother.  My only negative is there was too much time spent running away toward the end of the book. Deets Rating: 4, Sexy Rating:5.Deets General Impression:  Both of these books are very entertaining and original, more so than many contemporary offerings.  It would do all of us die-hard Historical Romance fans to delve into the back-lists of authors and Im sure we will find hidden gems like these two.

This is very much a romantic suspense novel with touches of the paranormal just like most of Kearsleys books.  The setting is Wales and the characters are for the most part English.  Not only do we get a mystery but also some insightful looks at Welsh history. Once again Kearsley touches on all of my favorite tropes; romance, mystery, suspense and learning something new.  The author has combined a real life setting with fictional characters and plot.  Once you start reading you are immersed in the setting, time and place.  It is not apparent that there is evil lurking but there is something that is just a bit off.  As an involved reader you will try to help Lyn figure it out but it is often elusive and difficult to know who to trust. This is truly a wonderful book from a supremely accomplished author.I recommend this book to all who like a good mystery and a happy ending with doses of history thrown in for good measure.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

First let me say that this was very tasty.  The Reese's Snack Mix had Peanut Butter cup minis, Reese's Pieces, Roasted Salted Peanuts and Mini Pretzels (280 calories).  The Hershey's Snack Mix had Mini Milk Chocolate Bars, Milk chocolate pretzels, Roasted Almonds and mini pretzels (270 calories).  What I didn't like was how each package arrived with the contents melted into one massive blob, where I'm quite sure it was all supposed to be separate pieces. My recommendation would be to order this in cool months for optimum satisfaction. At my house we all still ate the solidified contents of each package and really no one complained.
This works great on mosquito bites.  stops the itch in record time.
It works without making me itch.  All I ask for in a deodorant.

This is a very sexy book with sparks flying from the get-go.  In the beginning Connor and Faith have a teasing bantering relationship that, because of some scary circumstances that throw them together, becomes hotter and hotter until they cannot deny the attraction any longer.  All this before the snowbound encounter. These two both have troubled pasts but Faith is more recent in her heartbreak and is being very cautious with her heart.  Connor knows what he wants and it is Faith forever.There is really nothing new in this story but the characterization is done so well it is as if these are people we know and we are rooting for their HEA.  Connor is An Alpha male that Faith tries her best to adjust to his demanding nature.  Faith is so anxious about falling for Connor that she often puts up stumbling blocks. This is the fourth book in the series and characters appear from previous books, but this is a standalone novel.  I had not read the previous books and had no trouble following this one.The setting is the Thanksgiving/Christmas holidays and it plays a part in the attitudes of both the H and h.  This is a very comfortable holiday book with a bit of angst and lots of sex.  If that is your bag you cant go wrong.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

That description from Amazon is so well done that I wont repeat it here.  This is a very emotional book.  The chaotic past of Ria is slowly unfolded for the reader throughout the book.  I felt it impossible to put this book down.  After every bit of information from the past I wanted to know more.  Ria was such a tortured soul and Vikram was so full of hurt, I needed to know how these two became so damaged.  Even though I knew this was a romance with an inevitable HEA I worried that Ria would not survive.  Sonali Dev gives us wonderful word pictures of Indian culture and celebrations.  We are treated to the delightful family life of Rias Aunt, Uncle and cousin, but we also see that not all families are the same.  I cannot praise this book enough.  It is beautiful and very moving as well as romantic.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

We start off with Jo Beverlys Prologue telling us that a Christmas house party is being planned by the Dowager Countess of Holbourne (known as Lady Holly) and her companion Clio Finch. We are privy to those who will be invited; Sarah Langsdale, Edward Stretton (Lady Hollys son), Roxanne Heyward, Mary Gower and her father, Lord Gabriel Quinfroy, Allie Fenton, Clary Douglas.  We also know of some trouble in Lady Hollys own family with Kim Stratton, Caro and her husband Camden. Ms. Beverly sets the scene.(I received this book free for review from the publisher)1. My True Love Hath My Heart by Joanna BourneNick Lafford is a younger son of a younger son.  Enough in the ton to be invited to house parties.  But that is not why he is here.  He is here to see Claire who has infiltrated the party as an upstairs maid, she is really an accomplished jeweler.  She seems to be a thief looking for jewels.  She broke off an affair with Nick several months earlier and he does not know what she is up to but he will find out and perhaps help her or win her back or both.There is romance, mystery and suspense in this short story by Ms. Bourne who is a master of those genres.  There is an evil villain and a sweet innocent in need of protection. The addition of this side story was a bit of distraction since I really wanted more of Nick and Claire in this short story.  I wished this story had been a full length book as so often happens to me when I read an accomplished authors short story. Rating: 4.5-stars, Sexy rating: 4, Christmasy Feeling: 52. A Scottish Carol by Susan KingHenry Seton and Clarinda Hay have a history but they were torn apart by the Napoleonic War and now in a blinding Christmas Eve blizzard are stranded together at Henrys estate.  Will they renew their once thwarted love affair?I liked this short story of two souls who are destined to be together and who complement each other.  Rating: 4-stars, Sexy Rating: 3, Christmasy Feeling: 53. Christmas Larks by Patricia RiceIvo Whitney-Harris was wounded in the war. After 5 years, on his way home he is attacked by highwayman and suffers a serious head wound. Sarah Jane Langsdale, at 17 years old, watched her childhood friend, Ivo, become betrothed to another, breaking her heart. When she discovers him, ill and suffering, in a house destined to be an orphanage she attempts to nurse him back to health.Another story of a reunion during the holiday season.  I liked the plot but thought it was slim on holiday feeling. A cold abandoned house does not give off a warm Christmas vibe.  Rating: 4, Sexy Rating: 3, Christmasy Feeling: 14. In The Bleak Midwinter by Mary Jo PutneyKim Stratton has been sequestering himself in the tower attached to the family home since he arrived home from the war all scared and broken.  He has refused to see anyone except his loyal batman Jamie who has helped him recover.  Before the war he had an understanding and was in love with neighbor Roxie.  But now he has refused to see or speak with her for the past 6 months.  Roxie is running out of patience and will see what she can do to end this nightmare.War leaves its mark not only on the soldier but also on those left behind.  This story is a tribute to those who serve and those who pick up the pieces.  It is a lovely story but with little holiday feeling.  It could have been any time of the year. Rating: 4.5, Sexy Rating: 5 not explicit, Christmasy feeling: 25. Old Flames Dance by Cara ElliotIn this story we are treated to two romances.  Brothers Kim and Edward and Lily and Roxie.  Now Roxie loves Kim but Kim has been wounded in the war and has not allowed any family or his betrothed, Roxie, to see him.  Edward asks Roxie if the two of them could announce their betrothal and have a marriage of convenience if Kim still refuses to see her.  Meanwhile Lily, who once loved Edward and since has married twice and been widowed twice, comes to the Christmas ball.  Yes you guessed it.  She loves Edward and wants to marry him.  How will this work out?  Rating:4 ,Sexy rating: 3, Christmasy Feeling: 16. A Season for Marriage by Nicola CornickCaroline Camden is married to Piers Camden for 6 months and they have been struggling.  She loves him but he is afraid to love her because he saw his parents totally neglect everyone and everything because of their obsessive love for each other.  Will the Christmas Ball bring them together?Rating: 4, sexy rating: 4, Christmasy feeling: 17. Miss Finch and the Angel by Jo BeverleyLord Gabriel comes at the summons from his Godmother, Lady Holly.  She wants him to dance with all the Last Chance single ladies at the ball so that other gentleman will want to do likewise. (Yeah, right, Lady Holly.  Were not falling for that ploy.)  Gabriel falls for it but he seems intriqued by Clio Finch, so much so that there is a chance he will forget his mission from Lady Holly.Gabriel is my favorite character in the entire book; Clio not so much. Clios character and background was not developed as well as Gabriels. However, this was a sweet story and proved that the Last chance Ball was working its magic. Rating: 4, Sexy rating: 2, Christmasy Feeling: 28. Mistletoe Kisses by Anne GracieIn this story a spinster is forced to leave her home to become a teacher but she is looking forward to one last Christmas alone in her childhood home.  A raging snowstorm has caused an accident on the road and a gentleman and his sister are stranded at the only home until the storm passes. Will love bloom for John and Allie? This story has the most Christmasy feeling. Rating: 4.5, Sexy rating: 3, Christmasy feeling: 5+Deets summary:  I enjoyed each of these sweet stories.  Only three had the feeling of the Christmas season but each story was full of romance and warmth.  Lady Holly was a fairy godmother and matchmaker extrodinere and I found her no nonsense demeanor to be delightful.  Each of the stories are related to the theme of the Christmas Ball as the last chance for spinsters to land a husband.  The stories are short and will be a delightful addition to your holiday reading.

This was very well done for a novella.  Deft characterization and interesting plot points.  There were characters introduced who will have their stories told in the upcoming series.  If this prequel is any indication then the series should be quite original.  This novella was very unique in the story.  Im sure Historical Romance fans will like to settle in for this cozy, enjoyable read.

I got this for my TV and Surround sound system.  I like that It is off the floor and plugs right into the wall outlet. It also plugs in so that one of the holes in the wall outlet is free to plug in something else. So in other words it has turned my two hole wall outlet into a 4 hole outlet, three of which are surge protected.  I also got a 6-hole surge protector for my computer and accessories which I like just as much.  I can't speak to its surge protection because I've been fortunate enough not to need it, but if I do at some future date, I will update this review.

I really like this surge protector because it gets those cords off the floor and right into the wall outlet.  Turning my two hole outlet into six is also a plus.  I really can't speak to its effectiveness as a surge protector since I've been lucky and not needed protection since I got this. I have my computer, phone, lamp, printer-scanner and even my electric pencil sharpener plugged into that outlet. I also ordered a 3 hole surge protector like this one for my TV and home surround sound system. It arrived packaged in that plastic bubble wrap but it just took a pair of sharp scissors to open. No problem.

Louis has had enough of being a vampire and wants noted London physician, Dr. Howland, to "cure" him.  But the cure is always very temporary and requires blood and medications frequently.  Arabella is fascinated with Louis before she knows that he is a vampire and falls for him.  She is in love and swears to stand by him once she finds out. There are dangers surrounding their alliance and nothing is simple or easy.This is a compelling romance between a vampire and a human.  It is in the vein of Dracula or perhaps an Anne Rice novel.  It is dark, violent and not all that much romantic unless you like your romance bloody and quite dangerous.  Personally this is not in my wheel-house.  However this book is well written and is sure to appeal to those who do like Gothic Vampire stories.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This arrived well packaged so all we have had to do is take off the Styrofoam, tape and plastic sheeting.  Then it's time to fill the ink wells.  This comes with 4 bottles of ink, blue, red, yellow & black, that completely fill each ink reservoir. (There is a see-through plastic window for each reservoir.)  According to the specs I shouldn't have to add ink for 2 years. YAY!  This is the reason I got this printer after I had read a very favorable review in the Wall Street Journal.  I was really tired of buying ink all the time.  After filling we had to wait about 20 minutes for ink charging. Then it is just put in the CD and upload the software to the computer.  I printed off the test page and all was good.This was a very easy installation!  It took me about 30 minutes all together with the wait time on the ink charging.  I have uploaded photos showing my husband filling ink wells.  The instructions suggest using plastic gloves and as you can see he has ink on his thumbs because he was too impatient. So my advice is to use the plastic gloves.  We will be moving in a few months and there are very complete directions in how to move this printer with full ink wells.I have printed several different items using card stock and computer paper and all printed well.  I've also scanned items and that went well.  Absolutely no complaints. Easiest install I've ever attempted.(I had photos to upload but can't find a place to do it. sorry.)

There is much wrong with that book description at the top of this Amazon page since Mili did not get permission to leave India from her grandmother and Sam is trying to secure an annulment for his brother, not a divorce. I really get annoyed with these misleading descriptions.  An annulment was necessary because Sam's brother had already married and impregnated someone else.  Mili didn't inform her grandmother of her plans because granny was of the interfering type and would have tried to thwart her plans.This is an emotional story.  I laughed, a lot, and I cried.  It is delightful in the way it brings to life the Indian culture.  I learned so much from this novel about Indian family relationships, food and fashion.  But the slow to develop romance was just perfect.  We saw the movie director playboy slowly falling head over heels for Mili.  And we saw Mili defiantly refusing to succumb to his charm. The troubled past of each character added to the emotion I was feeling as the reader.This book has had a tremendous amount of hype in the romance reading world and I just had to see what all the fuss was about.  I'm so glad I read this book.  Even with some of the confusing Hindi words here and there I enjoyed them all. If like me you enjoy a book that opens up new ideas and introduces new cultures then definitely pick up this book.I'm looking forward to reading and reviewing Sonali Dev's soon to be released The Bollywood Bride.
I have read the entire book and loved it. I reviewed the book on the Amazon page for the book.  I couldn't just stop after a few chapters.

If you have read books by Grace Burrowes then you will recognize the Haddenfield family from Burrowes' Lonely Lords series.  Nita is one of Nicholas', Earl of Ballefonte, sisters. His other sisters are Della, Susanna and Kirstin all of whom will have their own story in this new True Gentlemen series.Tremaine St. Michael arrives at Nicholas' estate in order to negotiate business for a herd of Nick's precious merino sheep.  Nicholas is bent on matchmaking one of his sisters with St. Michael.  There is some back and forth negotiations with St. Michael not going along with the matchmaking until he gets caught up in the lives of the Haddenfields and totally falls for Nita.  Nita falls for Tremaine but there are obstacles and a side story that involves the entire family.This is a most complex and riveting novel.  I have to say that Grace Burrowes is at the top of her game with this delightfully, insightful and compelling novel.  She has us holding our breath through hair raising scenes and moments of terrifying events.  The romance is so very believable in its slow development with realistic dialog and breathless love scenes.  We are given in depth looks at each sister so that we look forward to their romantic stories.I highly recommend this book to all romance fans.  This one is truly at the top of my best-of-2015 list.(It is not necessary to have read the Lonely Lords Series to enjoy this book, but if you haven't read that series, I think this book will compel you to read Nicholas' story when you finish..)Nicholas: Lord of Secrets (The Lonely Lords)I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This candy is very soft.  This is perfect for my husbands dental appliance since the caramel doesn't affect his chewing.  the taste is delicious. We both like the flavor of the caramel and vanilla swirl. Each piece is individually wrapped and convenient for toting in your purse or pocket.  What's not to like? Yummy!
This was just an "okay" movie.  Rather predictable but still interesting enough to keep me watching.

If you are looking for lots of Christmasy warm-fuzzies you will have to wade through almost 400 pages of melodramatic angst.  Now Im all in favor of some troubled protagonists but this is a bit over the top for me.  If you like a hero who, granted, is a hunky, retired Delta Force soldier with an inability to talk and PTSD.  As well as our heroine who is anxiety ridden because of being on the run with her son from her ex.  Then this is your cup of tea.  Did I mention the hunky soldiers sister who has run off and left her daughter in the care of these two less than mentally sound people?  Just too much drama for me when you throw in the psycho ex-husband. I gave it a 3-star rating because Ms. Wilde writes some believable dialog. This book has a 4.5 rating on Amazon so Lori Wilde fans seem to like ita lot.

This is a grand start to a new series.  The synopsis gives you the pertinent details so I will not elaborate.  Jeremy Keane is a character we have met in a previous book by Sabrina Jeffries and it is good to see him get his own love story.  Yevette Barlow's brother the Earl was jilted in the last book of Jeffries' The Duke's Men Series.  He has no hard feelings and thus attends the wedding of his former fianc where he meets Jeremy and hires him to paint his sister's portrait.  The book slows down a bit in the beginning but not for long.  This is a romance with some surprises and secrets that long to be uncovered.  The Close proximity of the H/h while the paintings are being painted leads to lust and love. An easy, comfortable read even if it is a bit long at 400 pages.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This is a beautiful desk lamp.  It comes with a 13w CFL bulb that is equal to 60 watts.  This is enough for me on my desk but if you want this as more of a task lamp it cannot use a higher wattage bulb. The base is very steady and heavy so there is no chance of tipping over no matter what height you place the shade. this is truly a stunning lamp.

Well...not so much passion, but certainly a slow building affection that becomes more and more romantic.  Eventually binding Camille and Jonathan, this closeness will see Jonathan as Camille's protector.I enjoyed this novel.  It is part suspense, part mystery and part romance and Ms. Ladd gives us all three with some surprises thrown in also.  This is sold by Harper Collins Christian so there is no sex which is welcome to some readers.  The extent of physical interaction is a kiss. There are nice characters, there are not so nice characters and then there are really down and dirty characters.  This makes for some interesting interactions in the book.This is a charming, story with some angst and I recommend it to those who want their romance on the sweet side.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This is the first book in Julie Anne Walker's The Deep Six series.  It is the story of six former SEALs who band together to form a salvage company to find lost treasure at the bottom of the Caribbean. Their civilian goal is set aside when they agree to help CIA agent Olivia Mortier, an agent they met when in the employ of the Navy.This is action packed and when Ms. Walker writes action she can pull you into the story as you quickly turn pages to find out what will happen next.  It is also sex packed with the lust that does more than simmer between Leo and Olivia.  They are often thwarted in their lovemaking attempts which is sometimes very humorous. Olivia is made very human by her very human reaction to violence.  Side character, and civilian, Maddy has an initial horror of her circumstances but seems to adapt rather too easily to the situations.  The remainder of the salvage crew all have distinct personalities and I look forward to each of their stories.It always amazes me in these highly violent Romantic Suspense books how the H/h can find time to get-it-on while all kinds of crazy is going on around them or just before their hook-up.This is a taut thriller and I can surely recommend it to all Romantic Suspense fans.I received this book free for review from the publisher.  This review also appears on my blog http://ladeetdareads.wordpress.com

Sloane is getting over being dumped by her fianc by becoming a workaholic.  Her friends want her to snap out of it so they are delighted with the idea that she is going to vacation in Scotland to find her "Jamie Frasier".  Of course Sloane has no intentions of finding anyone but with her friends arriving in Scotland in a few days she needs someone to pretend to be her found boyfriend.  Galen is the hunky Scot behind the bar at the Black Thistle and Sloane propositions him to be her "boyfriend" by offering a hefty sum that he needs to upgrade his bar.  The pretend part works well for a while until feelings start to surface.There is lots to like about this novel.  There is a hunky Scot and a determined American.  The writing is full of the humorous banter that always puts a smile on my face.  The bickering between the H & h is just fun especially with the Scottish burr that the author can almost make you hear.The story progresses well and we think early on that there will be a happily-ever-after but then our H/h start to over think the relationship and others try to come between them.I liked this book! I did think the ending was a bit abrupt especially with all the angst that just went before. I recommend this book to all fans of romance but especially if you like the Highlanders.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This is my first time reading an Alexandra Hawkins book.  Although the premise was good, two friends wagering on who could seduce a beautiful debutante, the debutante was so overwhelmingly nave and seemed out of character for the era.  I kept wondering where were her parents, who seemed to love her, when she was traipsing around unchaperoned. The Duke and the Marquess were rakes in the truest sense.  Both were hedonistic rogues one with a conscience and one who was a sociopath.  Fair warning, there are two scenes of rape.This is a dark novel that could have used a bit more fleshing out.  At times I felt like I was reading scenes that were well written but didn't seem to connect with the whole.This is not a light and fluffy read, but if you like your romance dark and dirty then you may like this book in spite of its flaws.

I confess!!! I got this book because it was Free on Amazon.  Yes, I like free.  But this one was so delightful that I am truly happy I "bought" another free book. This novella starts out like a totally ditsy farce like an Oscar Wilde play, then it settles down only a little and we get some romance.  Like many novellas, I wanted more of both Benedict and Amelia but I will forgive everything because this was so well written and it left me grinning for hours after I finished.  I will definitely be looking at the remainder of books in this series.  Erica Ridley is a diamond of the first water.

Yes, this is a sizzling novel; safe to say it is a bit raunchy but feels like reality of the times.  It doesnt gloss over the morals and attitudes of society by focusing on the simpering debs at the ball.  This is about those who are trying to just hang on in society and perhaps even feeling some panic at their perceived downfall. Or some who have learned how to play the game for their own advantage.I enjoyed this darker regency romance.  The characters were brought to life and felt very real.  The good guy had his faults and the villain was truly evil.  Iris was very lucky when she pursued being a mistress that she encountered Martin who was an honorable man since the ton was full of the dishonorable type. I really like this not-so-varnished view of the era.I can easily recommend this book to HR fans.

I dove into the first chapter thinking I would just read a few pages.  Well.....I had to keep reading because it was so funny and I had visions of a Rom Com movie dancing in my head.  This is well written by an author who is better known for her mystery series.The bride, Megan, is terrified of her mother, Nicole, who is rather autocratic and definitely overbearing but written a bit over the top.  That is why Megan has been unable to confront her mother with the news of the broken engagement.  Josh is a really decent guy (as well as hunky and handsome) who sees a way to solve both his business problem and at the same time help out Megan.  He didn't plan on falling for her. Side characters play an important part in the shenanigans in this story and set up future books.  Megan's two childhood girl pals are her bridesmaids and confidants.  Megan's grandmother is sharp as a tack but plays at senility, and if she's a bit over the top, well, she is lovable.  The scenes of humor are a bit contrived but that never stopped me from laughing out loud.If you want a light, laughable, romantic and sexy read then this is your go-to book.  And who doesn't need one of these funny books once in awhile.

I love time-travel romances.  At least I love the idea of them.  So often I've been disappointed but every now and then I come across a hidden gem and this is one of those.  This story is superbly plotted and so rich with time-slip explanations that the reader starts to think it could actually happen.  Our Fifteenth century Highland Laird is, of course, the epitome of virile masculinity and handsome.  Our Victorian miss is sweet, tender and much put-upon by her female relatives. There is a villain that we hope gets his comeuppance and a group of kindly old scientists who aid in the understanding of time-slips.  This has been just a delightful book by a very accomplished author.

An Eloisa James book is usually a slam-dunk for being a page turner.  This one is no exception.  We are introduced to our hero, Vander, and our heroine, Mia, when they are teenagers and in an embarrassing situation.  The story then picks up years later when Mia, who has sworn to never even talk to Vander again, is in his study proposing marriage. Of course Mia can't tell Vander the "real" reason for the proposal and so Vander, justifiably, is angry at her effrontery.In many books, I find I yawn and shake my head at the use of this trope of misunderstanding or blatant holding back of information between characters.  In this book it all makes sense that Mia can't really divulge the reasons for her proposal and why Vander accepts also is totally understandable.  So what we have here is powerful writing by a talented author.  That these two find common ground is also skillfully accomplished.This is a sexy, well written, totally engrossing Historical Romance. I recommend it for all romance aficionados.

I cannot tell a lie! I really liked the first book in this series. I found it near impossible to finish this one.  Not a bit of it felt like the regency era except maybe the carriage rides. The heroine was supposed to be a proper young lady but continually delved into compromising situations. She was to instruct the hero in properly comporting himself when she continued to be improper. Although I can look away when there are some discrepancies in the manners of the time period, there were so many that they ruined the story for me.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

Okay, does that title grab you?  Hm-m-m, do you think maybe this is a sexy book? Does the fact that Romantic Times Magazine dubbed it "Book of The Year" at this year's convention mean anything? Well, what can I say, yes, the title grabbed me, I figured it was sexy and if Romantic Times thought it that good maybe I should just see what the fuss was all about.Sexy does not begin to describe all the sex in this book. Some sensuous, some rough, some play-acting all written VERY well.  Ansel is truly a gorgeous hunk and who could resist his French accent. Mia is confused about her future for most of the book but has fallen for Ansel although she tries to deny the attachment. What happened in Vegas started something that traveled all the way to Paris.Yes, I read this cover to cover, all 416 pages in two days.  I had trouble putting it down when I really needed to sleep so I picked it up again first thing the next morning. These characters were believable and their lusting for each other was also believable.  I kept waiting for this initial infatuation to wear off.  I could not see how these two were to get a happily-ever-after.  That is why I kept turning pages.  I was totally hooked on their attraction and their scorching chemistry. Throw in an ex-lover and the suspense ratchets up.I recommend this book to those who don't mind lots of sex in their well written stories.

Throughout this series there has been a welcome side element introduced that goes beyond the expected romance.  In SLOW HAND I learned about ranching in the west, in ROUGH RIDER I learned all about the workings of the rodeo circuit. In this offering Ms. Vane gives us some valuable lessons both pro and con of wildlife management, wolves in particular.  I am really enjoying my romance novel with a side of fascinating lessons.This the third book in the Hot Cowboy Nights series is a standalone novel.  I did think it was more in the "military romance" genre because we didn't get to the ranch until about 2/3 of the way through the book.  Reid was a noble hero, he was a good guy who in my opinion fell for the wrong woman.  Haley was annoying from the beginning with her incessant fanaticism and her total inability to see anyone's point of view that might differ from her narrow focus. I kept wondering throughout what Reid saw in her.Not liking the heroine does put a bit of a damper on my opinion but I have to say that Victoria Vane does write a good book.  There is action, sexy encounters and a very slow build romance, coming to terms with love. Add in the lessons about the pros and cons of wolf management and this is a really good read.I received this book free for review from the publisher.

This the third book in The Wallflower Series is Evie's story, one of the four young women who were wallflowers during their husband-hunting seasons in London.  She is the shy one, with a self-conscious stutter who tries to fade into the background at most society functions.  She is also abused by her extended family and kept from visiting her dying father, a prominent gambling hall owner. Sebastian, Lord St. Vincent, is an unrepentant rake who is in dire need of money.  Evie is also desperate to get away from her abusive family and comes to him with a proposition he can't refuse.  "Marry me." And he does.For many readers this book in the series is their favorite.  I tend to like all of the books with over the top fan-girl squees.  Yes, I did just say that.  This book like the others has a supremely sensuous romance, beautifully crafted love scenes and characters that the reader falls in love with.  This entire series is splendidly entertaining and I do suggest that the reader start at the beginning with Secrets of a Summer Night (The Wallflowers, Book 1) (or the unofficial prequel Again The Magic). However, this is a standalone novel but so much will be added to the readers enjoyment if the entire series is read in order.

Oh yes! This is romance at its finest. Lord Westcliff goes from insufferable prig to swoon worthy hero.  That Ms. Kleypas can bring about that transformation is the mark of a superb writer.In the first book of this series Secrets of a Summer Night (The Wallflowers, Book 1) we become fans of the four wallflowers and hope for their happily ever after.  Annabelle found hers with Simon Hunt. Now Lillian Bowman is searching for hers at a house party at Lord Westcliff's estate. That she manages to attract two interested men is somewhat surprising since she has been out in society for four seasons without any takers.  There is an evil villain and a not very nice aristocrat, Sebastian St. James, who try to throw a monkey wrench into the romance of Marcus and Lillian. It will be interesting to see if Ms. Kleypas can redeem Sebastian in the next book of the series The Devil in Winter (The Wallflowers, Book 3).This is another can't-put-down page turner from Lisa Kleypas. I highly recommend this series and a prequel Again The Magic.

Do we need another recording of Arensky's overplayed Piano Trio in D minor? Probably not, but I welcome a complete recording of the two trios, which is rarer. The question is whether the Leonore Trio offers anything better than the Beaux Arts Trio or Borodin Trio; each performance is distinctive and dissimilar. I would say no. The Beaux Arts Trio delivers a superior interpretation and they would be my first choice for a complete set of Arensky's piano trios. The Borodin Trio recording on Chandos is also decent, although much slower in performance.The Leonore Trio gives a crisp and urgent performance of the Piano Trio in D minor (1894). Yet there's something lacking in the first movement, notable for its striking themes combining Brahmsian thickness of texture with the lyricism of Tchaikovsky. There's a deficiency in force and elegance so beautifully conveyed by the Beaux Arts Trio. However, Leonore is particularly sensitive in the sorrowful and moving slow movement, while letting loose with lively rhythmic zest in the finale. There are many other great performances available, but Hyperion's excellent sound engineering is hard to beat.While Arensky's Piano Trio in D minor is a staple of the trio repertory, his lesser-known second Piano Trio in F minor (1905) is on the periphery. Despite its minor key, this is an upbeat and luminous trio, heavily influenced by Chopin and Tchaikovsky. All the forward momentum and strong active piano writing of the first movement, however, suggests Schumann. It's quite shocking that this movement is in F minor because the music is so bright and warm. Even in the second movement, a sort of Chopinesque song without words, Arensky eschews melancholy in favor of sweet tenderness. The finale also looks to Chopin, particularly in the rhythm and contours of his waltzes. Some lovely lyricism and rhythmically interesting variations are heard, mostly restrained, but some extroverted and passionate.Conus's arrangement of Rachmaninov's Vocalise is a nice bonus, even if it's been recorded before and in a much more passionate performance by the Eroica Trio. The melting beauty of this work is well suited to the trio medium. The intense central section with low bass material sounds very expressive on the piano and Rachmaninov's passionate strains are so affecting when played by the violin and cello alone.Bottom line: There's no shortage of recordings of Arensky's D minor trio. While the Leonore Trio's performance is sincere and impassioned, I think the Philips recording with the Beaux Arts Trio is the go-to choice.

Son of the more famous composer Harald Saeverud, Ketil Hvoslef (b. 1939) is largely a composer of instrumental music incorporating rock and jazz elements. His Piano Trio (2010) is merely OK and not enough to gauge his talents as a composer. This single-movement 21-minute trio mixes tonal and atonal writing, includes minimalist gestures, and dissonant monophonic lines played in unison on all instruments. The textures are at once spare and then intensely active, while the mood of the work is accordingly introspective and suddenly dramatic. The content is unremarkable and even in the extensive solos for each instrument I found the material unrewarding.Little known outside of his home country, Fartein Valen (1887-1952) garnered attention from Glenn Gould, who recognized Valen's talent at polyphonic writing. Valen is at his best when he aims to express darker moods, particularly in his piano music. I don't think his Piano Trio is as interesting. It represents his pursuit of radicalism and breaking away from late Romantic foundations. In essence, the trio is Valen's crossing of the atonal Rubicon. The opening "Moderato" is full-blown Schoenberg in its aesthetic, although Valen's usage of tone rows is not dodecaphonic in the Second Viennese sense. The "Scherzo" is a wildly hectic and atonal rhythmic exercise, uneven in its quality. By contrast, the "Largo" creates a soundscape of desolation and introspection. In the "Finale," Valen brushes shoulders with Webern, indulging in swirls of dissonant activity, wide spans of registers, and frenetic counterpoint that borders on the chaotic. This is prickly and melodyless music, difficult to appreciate without seeing on the page. After such an atonal marathon exhibited in this finale, Valen brings the music to a close with a startling triumphal major chord. Whatever Valen's reason for this, the major chord sounds as jarring as a tone cluster occurring at the end of a diatonic piece.Klaus Egge (1906-1979) continued the tradition of Valen's dissonant counterpoint, although he generally adhered to tonality and less to serialism. His Piano Trio is not as effective as his piano sonatas and less forward-looking than Valen's trio. While the inspiration for the trio is the Soviet-Finnish Winter War of 1940, there's not enough dramatic weight and harrowing emotion to suggest this conflict. The opening "Allegro con impeto" is tonal with profuse dissonance, optimistic in outlook, and chock full of post-Romantic gestures. At the emotional core of this trio is the lovely "Adagio," a movement of sweet reflection and tenderness, featuring an intense climax of expressive power worth hearing several times. Equally gripping is the finale, which shows off strong thematic material and riveting momentum. Here Egge is inventive and inspired with his rhythm and forward drive.Bottom line: Valen's expressionist trio is the most effective item on this recording and yet I can't say I care for it all that much. I prefer his piano music. Egge's trio is also uneven and shines mainly in the gorgeous slow movement. The trio of Hvoslef is hit-and-miss, an experimental and unimposing work of minimalism and atonality.

This thoughtful program features the piano works of four Norwegian composers, each studying with the other and thus representing a continuous thread of modernism in Norway: Valen taught Egge who taught Mortensen who taught Wallin.Little known outside of his home country, Fartein Valen (1887-1952) is better known now after garnering attention from Glenn Gould, who recognized Valen's talent at polyphonic writing. Valen is at his best when he aims to express darker moods, exemplified in the Four Pieces, each atonal and steeped in the expressionism of Schoenberg and Berg. "Nachtstuck" has a feverish and dark anxiety about it, reminiscent of early Schoenberg. It is difficult to detect any waltzing in the "Valse Noble," which is more Berg than stylized dance. Desolation and fragility are conveyed in the Bergian "Lied Ohne Worte." In the "Gigue," Valen strives for atonal counterpoint in the manner of Webern; sudden volatile eruptions add to the drama. Valen's best solo piano piece here is the "Intermezzo," an explosive and somber piece, taking turns at harsh and aggressive expression followed by respites of bleak meditation.Klaus Egge (1906-1979) continued the tradition of Valen's dissonant counterpoint, although he generally adhered to tonality and less to serialism. The Piano Sonata No. 2 "Patetica" is one of his most significant works: jagged, expressive, astringently modern, and influenced by Bartok. The opening "Grave stentato" is a heady mixture of crunchy dissonant chords, harsh dissonance, and forceful rhythm. The slow "Canto Etereo" is by contrast spacious, bleak, and wraithlike, comparable to Feldman. The "Finale" is a decent essay of drama and energy in similar dissonant garb as the first movement.Finn Mortensen (1922-1983) studied counterpoint with Egge and was influenced by the Darmstadt school. However, his early work is largely under the shadow of Hindemith. His Piano Sonata has vestiges of his early preoccupations with neoclassicism, but it is emotionally distant from Hindemith's world. The "Quasia una fantasia" movement is completely atonal, angular, and liberal with tone clusters. Whiffs of Messiaen occasionally emerge. Even more arresting is the "Fuga," a lethargically slow fugue of dark ethereal beauty, amassing speed and volume halfway through and giving vent to expressive and volcanic outbursts.Rolf Wallin (b. 1957) studied composition with Mortensen, but took a more avant-garde path of fractal and computer-generated music, which makes his textures similar to Xenakis and Ligeti. Seven Imperatives (2001) is a fascinating cycle of miniatures, each conveying a specific kind of action or motion. The colors generated in "Push" are based on computer calculations, but the result to my ears is American ultramodernism: intense mechanical rhythms and savage tone clusters redolent of Ornstein, Antheil, and Cowell. "Sink" is a gentle and fragile evocation with icy delicate figures. "Spin" is one of fast scintillating ostinatos while "Stab" attains its character through a brutal and severe tone cluster statement. "Lean" is the longest of the cycle at 8 minutes and explores a static soundscape of mystery and deserted solitude, reminiscent of Feldman's "Palais de Mari."Bottom line: An interesting survey of lesser-known modern piano music from Norway, thoughtfully linked together through the teacher-pupil relationships between the four composers. Valen's pieces will satisfy lovers of expressionism while Egge and Mortensen produce strong essays of serious modernism; Wallin's colorful and experimental cycle is deserving of revival.

All but forgotten outside of Norwegian music history, Fartein Valen (1887-1952) did receive some recent attention from Glenn Gould, who recognized Valen's talent at polyphonic writing. Valen is at his best when he aims to express darker moods. I also think he excels in solo piano pieces, but these chamber works are less effective.The String Quartet op. 0 is a student work, late Romantic with small traces of Valen's future radicalism, namely in the chromaticism and slow contrapuntal writing. The opening movement is tender and reflective with adequate part-writing, although its flat unchanging dynamics got a little boring. There's nothing outstanding about the "Scherzo," which is textbook Mendelssohn in its carefree spirit and lightness.With the Violin Sonata, Valen embraces the expressionism of Schoenberg. Tonality is stretched considerably and the atmosphere is much darker and chromatic. Violent stabs of dissonance and crunching chords create a sense of tension and inner turmoil. Valen also pursues his quest for expressive polyphony, at times sounding like mature Reger. This new path of "dissonant counterpoint" culminates in the "Fugue" movement, one of rich post-Romantic gestures and an outpouring of intensity.The Piano Trio goes even further towards modernity and represents Valen's crossing of the atonal Rubicon. The opening "Moderato" is full-blown Schoenberg in its aesthetic, although Valen's usage of tone rows is not dodecaphonic in the traditional Second Viennese sense. The "Scherzo" is a wildly hectic and atonal rhythmic exercise, uneven in its quality. By contrast, the "Largo" creates a soundscape of desolation and introspection. In the "Finale," Valen brushes shoulders with Webern, indulging in swirls of dissonant activity, wide spans of registers, and frenetic counterpoint that borders on the chaotic. This is prickly music, difficult to appreciate without seeing on the page. After such an atonal marathon exhibited in this finale, Valen brings the music to a close with a startling triumphal major chord. Whatever Valen's reason for this, the major chord sounds as jarring as a tone cluster occurring at the end of a diatonic piece.Bottom line: Valen is distinctive for being a founding Norwegian modernist composer, but I think he does better in his piano music. I cannot quite recommend this recording except to fans of the Second Viennese School. Even then, I would suggest first exploring other lesser known Second Viennese disciples, like Hans Apostel, Egon Wellesz, and Josep Soler. The Violin Sonata is the most interesting of works, while the Trio seems more experimental.

Paul Kletzki (1900-1973) was more renowned as a conductor than a composer and much of his output was destroyed during the Second World War. What I've heard of his music leaves me with mixed feelings. Some of it works and some of it merely shows promise. Although born in Poland, Kletzki later took Swiss citizenship. His style is no more advanced than early Schoenberg anchored in the late Romanticism of Strauss and Mahler. Kletzki's harmonic language is chromatic and tinged with early modernist dissonance, akin to Szymanowski. Unfortunately, Kletzki lacks the font of creativity, lush colors, and expressive grit of Szymanowski. These two chambers works are hit and miss.The Violin Sonata in D major (1924) is a passable specimen of early modernism with late Romantic lyricism and extended tonality in the manner of early Schoenberg. The first movement sets the stage with a mood of impassioned energy, although much of the content is forgettable. It is the remarkable second movement marked "Andante lugubre" that steals the show. Here Kletzki is not afraid to express gloom and darkness through murky chords and dissonant colors. This is no doubt the emotional heart of the sonata and fraught with elegiac strains.
