I wanted to love these because i really love the design, but surprisingly the 10 was too small, so i sent it back for an 11, which actually fit just right, but i became really annoyed with how the shoe didnt form to my foot well. every time i stepped my heel would come out of the shoe, on both sizes. so unfortunately i had to send them back.  with as much as i paid for them i didnt want to stick it out with something thas was uncomfortable and just didnt work for me.  they are really good looking though

these are super cute.  tiny, but cute.  i bought them just for collection purposes so they serve it well. they dont stand up very well though so will need to be hung by their little chains or mounted somehow.

I actually picked these up at best buy because at the time they were a little cheaper than on amazon.  Well actually i wanted the white ones but could only find them on the PDP website, and they have a horrible return policy that if i didn't like the headphones, i still couldn't return them.  That didnt sit too well with me being that I've never even tried or used them before so I didnt know what to expect.  If they were weak I wasn't going to shell out almost 200 for them, which is what i ended up paying back when they were worth that much.I ended up really liking them, but instead of returning them to get the white ones, i just kept the black pair.  Setup was pretty easy and straightforward.  it came WITH the stand :D which i really like, and i fell in love with the fact i could change the color.  that was a major selling point for me, i'm somebody who really loves to customize things as much as i can and appreciated the ability to set whatever color i wanted.Another feature i really like is that they're wireless, and i dont have to worry about being tangled in the cords because i lay in my bed a lot and use my laptop. and it's also nice to be listening to music or a video and walk away and still hear whats going on.The 3 different sound options are awesome too.  there's like a gaming sound mode and a threatre one and a heavy bass, so you can choose which one suits your current application, and it works on windows 8.My only beef with them is the ear cups.  they are soft and padded, and fairly large, but they still hurt my ears.  I have my ears pierced 4 on each side, and it puts pressure on them as its rounded. but again not much of an issue for those without a ton of earrings.the retractable mic is great too.I became addicted to gaming headsets and moved on up to the Astro A40's  those are much more comfortable on my ears as they're the larger rectangular shape, which i prefer, however I've got to say i'm honestly disappointed by the mixamp. it supposedly has multiple sound modes like the pdp, however i really do not notice any difference whatsoever when changing between them. my astros don't really have much bass at all. and not a lot of features and settings to play with.  i love that they rotate sideways to lay flat. but they didnt come with a stand....I was going to sell my PDP's since i got my astros and thought it was a good upgrade, but now i think im keeping them because they just have so many great aspects to them that they're worth hanging onto.  They can actually hold their own against my astros, which are not wireless (i chose that on purpose as opposed to the a50's) so now ill keep them because they are pretty much a lovely looking jack of all trades.

when i saw this dress, i fell in love with it, and i linked it to my friend who showed it to her daughter, and she loved it too (the dress was for her) it was one of the few cute ones i found that carried her side and so happy that it worked out because there were only two sizes left, and no time to switch.  Dress fit as expected. she's 7 and wears 10 in clothes but 8 in dresses and it was perfect.  i found some adorable jewelry on amazon that matched this as well, gold with that teal color rhinestones, and it was so pretty together.  I paired this with small gold huggy hoops, a gold leaf hair band, a gold locket and a bracelet with the matching rhinestones. all bought from amazon prime. heres the pic of the combo i put together for her, minus a little black shrug in case she got cold.

Only played through the first stage, and a couple adventure mode stages, and OMG already in love.  I got all giggly and cheese smiling while the familiar and classic music played, the beautifully animated characters and especially the cutsscenes.  So far im loving the story line too, link, gorgeous as always.This is just what i needed to tide me over a while until zelda wii u comes out next fall i believe for 2015. I bought my copy here on amazon for the twilight princess costume pack, which is one of my top favorite of the series, and caved as soon as i started this game and bout the hero of hyrule DLC combo back that includes the dark link costume, and all the new DLC content that will come out over the next several months.  I also downloaded the free Ganon costumes from club nintendo for registering the game.  So much stuff already and i've only been at it for an hour.I've been a zelda fangirl for almost 30 years now since the series first began, and played it as a child on the original NES, and Im very happy to see that the guys who made this game did not screw it up.  That's always a big concern with letting other people touch the franchise, im talking to you Philips..... the CDi debacle)  I dont know how i will accomplish anything now with so much hoard squashing to be had!  I hope you all have as much fun playing this game as i am!

I am addicted to this coconut juice.  I first had these from the local grocery stores, one of them carries the larger cans, the other the small, so i grabbed a bunch of both, the small ones run about 89 cents and the larger 1.54.  I came here to see if I could find them by the case a little cheaper.  I have a mini fridge in my room full of this stuff (its my guilty pleasure)One time they were out at the store so I bought one of each of about 3 or 4 different brands of coconut juice that are "comparable" to this and they were all mediocre. None of them came close to tasting as refreshingly delicious of Foco's juice.  I've never had an issue with a metallic taste so I have no idea what anyone else is referring to so it must bot be a very common thing.  I've never had a bad can of this stuff.  There's the occasional dented can, but still tastes great!  I actually just got done drinking one and it's what prompted me to check here.It's sweet, but not horribly overpowering, i LOVE the diced coconut pieces, and as another reviewer noted, they are crisp and have some bite to them.  Other brands I've tried they were soggy mushy pieces that was not really a satisfying feeling coming out of the can.  I actually prefer to drink this one straight out of the can.  I'm more of a straw and glass kinda girl, and i love lots of ice, but these are the exception to the rule for me.  and even with some sugar in it, they are not that bad, they're 80% juice with water and SUGAR, not HFCS or any other weird kind of "-lose" at the end.  just coconut juice, water, sugar, and diced young coconut, so you know what you're drinking, and sugar, is not bad.  Everything in moderation.  even overdosing on water can kill you if you ingest too much at once so a i don't concern myself with the sugar in it.Once I get low on the ones i just bought i may snag a case on here if its a better deal than my local spots.

i loved the look of this scale, but when i got mine, the LCD screen was not positioned right in the unit.  it was crooked so i couldnt tell if it was a 1 or a 7, or 4 or a 9..  and then it just wasn't always consistent.  So i had to send it back.  I liked it, and i wanted it to love it and keep it.  But it was just too inconsistent and flawed.points for being very nice to look at and modern, and i loved the green backlight, i wish that was an actual color and not the secondary screen color.  i found that i didnt really care about knowing what i weighed the last time, if it said how MUCH i actually lost compared to just this weight and last weight. but said like, - 7.6 lbs.  That would have been more useful.

these shoes are SUPER cute and they fit as I expected, unfortunately for me one of my feet is just a tad smaller so one shoe feels a little larger, but they have a nice strap that helps keep them on me, which was definitely a reason i bought them.  I havent worn heels in years and im  a little nervous about earing them again and these are great.They're really comfortable  and I can wear them for several hours and they stay on and dont hurt my feet.  I'd cant wait to buy more

Pretty good stuff.  I also came across this product from a youtube girl, and from her results, and then seeing everyone elses positive reviews i decided to try it out, and as far as whitening goes it's a visible difference after the first time, which if i recall from the instructions was 2 times for 30 minutes .My only thing with this is the taste is just awful. it has a barely there hint of mint with the rest tasting like eating some kind of medicinal cream.  I tried using the top and bottom trays at the same time, BIG mistake.  gag central. almost threw up so many times i just had to take one out so it doesnt really even matter to me if the top mold fits the bottom one perfectly , because I will not be using them together.  I can only do one at a time, and i also use a paper towel folded up that covers the back of the mold while in my mouth to help with the excess salivation and the horrible taste.the gripes though are very small to me because it definitely wouldn't stop me from using this.  its a teeth whitening system not candy so im totally fine with it.  I just had to put that out there because it was quite the process and had to adjust it to suit me. i havent been too consistent with using it, but ive started back up with it the past couple days and im happy with the results as expected.

was very disappointed with this movie.  it was AWFUL compared to the original.  its very pointless, full of extremely cheesy one liners, like every other sentence. they start just breaking tradition and culture.  There's really no plot to the movie at all. just them on a quickie "mission" while they bicker.  A lot of things were left unresolved. and it just strayed from a beautiful cultural masterpiece that made me teary watching it again, to being a yawn fest.this was definitely a failure of a sequel (as most of them are) and would have been better off not being made.

So i came across these at work, one my my leaders got this out of the supply closet, just a stash of random pens, and i fell in love with how it wrote.  unfortunately for me the little clip was broken so i was unable to see the brand, the model or the thickness, but i did have an idea.  I recognized the double heart logo that was stamped into the top as papermate, which greatly narrowed it down, then matched the style of the bottom of the pen.  it was hard to find these in particular.  I bought a pack or two of papermates, just like these but with white tips, turned out those were .7 mm so they were not as bold, but i was close, before that i got two other brands that came in 8 packs of colors, trying to find something close as i narrowed down which these were.  so now i have some 30 pens total and almost 40$ invested in just finding these pens...Thats how awesome they are.  they make thick, beautiful, bold smooth lines that dry really fast and don't smudge when you accidentally rub your arm over them.  They're click retractable, and this pack comes with two black, two blues and a red.  The tips will also come with a little waxy plastic shield thing on it youll have to peel off your your nails, this is to protect the tip and the ink, so no biggie, just dont forget to remove it.  I have no problems with the flow and its pretty consistent.  it does however, seep through a little if you write really slow and hold it in that spot too long, especially on thinner paper, but i can write on post its, envelopes, and documents without it bleeding and getting on any paper underneath it. (i like to write on top of other pieces of paper because pens seem to write more smoothly and clean when the paper pen can go down into the paper instead of the resistance of a solid surface pushing back on the ball)

I've used a lot of these types of protectors in the past as they're my favorite as opposed to the cheap brittle film, however the headache i spent with this was disappointing. even managing to get a curved one on that actually held, they slid around, nothing i did would keep these on and in place long enough to get another on. trying to put them on the hinge was a fail. it was on, it was perfect, then jammed up when trying to open the 3DS.  i ended up getting a few of the internal ones to stay.  I actually thought i already reviewed this one, but i guess not. i  considered returning and getting a replacement, but i just gave up and didnt want to deal with it again.
The pictures on amazon make the item seem pretty beat up or worn, however when they were actually received they looked great! very clean and crisp.  Happy with the purchase.

I am very pleased with this lanyard.  I was bored at work and perusing amazon for items from my new favorite anime, and found this, the price was great, but i was very wary of ordering a non prime amazon item due to the last incident or two of buying this shipped direct from the merchant.  However, for $5 i took the chance, and so glad I did. I ordered it friday afternoon, and it arrived monday in the mail, from over a thousand miles away.  I got the notice my item had shipped within a couple hours of placing my order, and i honestly didnt believe it, i kind of thought of it like ebay how if you print the label it sends notification, but it actually was shipped!  I came home wondering what I had in the mail because there was no possible way this would be here, and dealing with paychecks being sent to and from that state from where i work, i have very little faith in the post office. But it arrived amazingly fast, at a great price, and I absolutely love it.  The red trim is vibrant, the material is neat and crisp, and it seems to be of good quality.  Very happy with my purchase and the effiency of the seller.

very happy with my elgato.  i can stream my wii, wii u, and my ps3 to my new laptop (which im also excited about) and the quality is great. i broadcast through a paid xsplit subscription and this works well with xsplit. it gets recognized though as a camera device in cxsplit instead of a capture card so when you go to add a source and see camera itll list the elgato and you can add the feed there
these are some very nice cables, happy with their performance, very good quality, glad i bought this set over others

i got this in the mail to today hoping this case was as cool as it seemed with all the good reviews it has and i was instantly in love with it!  not only does it look cool, it fits my S4 perfectly. it offers plenty of port clearance for accessories, and it looks great on my phone too. i like the two tone clear/frosted shell. and i plan on ordering a decal from decalgirl's site to put underneath is because i love having my phone customized. thats why i went with a clear case, so i could see the design underneath.im very happy with this case, it was super easy to get on, its very tough, yet flexible, and the lip rolls over the face perfectly so even if your phone falls screen side down, its raised so the screen wont touch the ground. unless you drop it on a rock or something lol, in which case id recommend a skinomi screen protector, which is what i also bought with this since i just got my S4 a few days ago.  they're much cheaper than zaggs and offer the same high tech vinyl and great quality.  with these two things on, your phone will come out looking as shiny and new as the day you unboxed it when you take them off even a year or more later.

Just got my skinonmi in the mail today and already put it on. i've used them before for one of my older phones and I've always loved their product.application is super easy.  I just sprayed the film while it was still on its backing, then lightly misted the device before spraying my fingers, peeled off the backing and it slid right on.  its super easy to work out bubbles.  i started laying my film from the bottom up so it centered around the S4 button, so it gradually made contact with the screen as opposed to just laying it flat and hoping for the best. (doing that will cause lots of bubbles.) with this method, i had only two large contiguous bubbles that were just solution that i swept off the sides. and with just a few passes, the shield was flat, bubble free, and perfectly aligned.The skinomi does have a slightly more tactile feel to it than the standard cheap pasty hard cellophane protectors, and while those may be all slick and smooth, they lift very easy, get gross under the corners and damage on them in visible, not to mention horrible dust and bubbling that you can never seem to work out. but it is still just as fast and responsive as it was previously without the protector, just not as slippery. which personally is fine with me, less chance of accidentally swiping something i didnt mean to.  One thing i haaaaate about the android OS, is the contact list, if you swipe too much to the side when scrolling through the list, sometimes it will register as you scrolling over a contact, and depending on the direction will start calling them! the surface having a softer vinyl feel keeps me from just swiping like a mad man and randomly calling the wrong person.I used to have a zagg, and they're cool and all, and really expensive.  I bought it on a whim at best buy because i was impatient and wanted it right away, and for the price and name notoriety, i figured it has to be good.  well it was, i was happy with it for a long time.  the installation though, which is usually fairly easy for me was just a bit more complicated.  i had also gotten one for my friend who is not only in the IT field but is very tech savvy, and he had the hardest time getting it on his tablet.  he seriously tried to put the backing on instead of the film.... because it comes clear on clear instead of paper like skinomi.  I also found that with the zagg i had, it had begun to fade and turn yellow. it was ugly against my white phone.  i eventually peeled it off and my old phone just went commando lol.The skinomi is very, very moderately priced. the first ones i purchased a while back were approx 3x the price they are here. and they also have a lifetime guarantee.  I can't attest to the clarity just yet because i just put it on so it kinda has that weird screen effect if you turn your phone on, and its also been so long since i had the last one that i don't remember, but i will update probably tomorrow when its all dried up and ready to go.  i do remember from the first one i had being terrified at the orange peel screen thinking OMG please dont stay like this, and the next day being relieved and amazed that it was back to normal, so maybe that will help anyone worried about resolution degradation.  sorry for my long rant, but thought id try to explain things best i can with actual examples and situations gained through my own personal experience.  Hope it helps someone :)btw i also bought this with a clear silicone case Cimo S-Line Back Flexible Cover TPU Case for Samsung Galaxy S III S3 (AT&T, T-Mobile, Sprint, Verizon, US Cellular, International) - Clear and it too is awesome.  i went with clear so i can get a skin decal, which is essentially like the screen protector, but for the body of the phone but with artwork as opposed to clear, this was i can have a clear case with a artistic decal underneath, and the phone body is still protected if i ever remove the case. decalgirl website has tons of awesome ones.  i just got my S4 a few days ago so im deckin this baby out!

i bought this mascara as a recommendation from my bestie.  I was looking for something with length, and volume and was disappointed with my purchase of maybellines megaplush, the teal colored tube.  i had been previously using the colossal lash version of that ( yellow tube) but it was old, and still not what i wanted.  but it was the closest i got out of the other ones i tried,  the mabellinestiletto one sucked, the loreal million lash sucked, the old school Maybelline Great Lash also really bad, and i think i had one that came in a black and baby pink metallic tube, with some kind of quilted pattern to it. but i don't remember the name.. i have not been happy with ANY of those.  and so when she told me about this i was skeptical, but had high hopes as she's a makeup fiend and always has beautiful lashes. and she was sooo right.this mascara made them super long without clumping them together. and was a dark black.  they also curled up on their own. so it seems this mascara is light enough to not weigh them down flat.  it really does suck that its not sold in the US anymore.  this stuff is hands down the best mascara ive ever used. when i get a chance i will definitely be buying a couple more tubes.

i know its called one a day, buuut i eat four lol.  well, it recommends two, but im deficient in everything.  and they taste good. some will complain but though they are gummies, they are not freakin gummy bears.  and if youve ever had to try and get down a mucinex pill, OMG. these are nothing compared to the taste of that. this method makes it much easier for me to actually remember and want to take vitamins.

Well first off, the color IS beautiful.  I bought the super red Beso color, and absolutely love the shade.That being said, I'm really disappointed by the claims this lipstick makes.  Its supposed to be All day, and smudge no bleed/transfer. however after it "dries" it still smudges easily.  to test it out i put it next to NYC's smoochproof liquid lipstick in REBEL, which comes with a clear gloss to go over it. New York Color, Smooch Proof Long-Wearing Lip Color, Rebel (483A), Lip Color .135 Fl. Oz., Lip Seal and Shine .135 Fl. Oz. I put both on my hand and let them dry, ran my finger over it and only the stila smudged, then i put the gloss on top of both, and the stila somewhat smeared.  For what i paid for this lipstick at beauty brands, 27$$ i find it disappointing that a 5 dollar walmart pick is more smudge proof and has better longevity than a 30 dollar high end brand.  i definitely have buyers remorse for how much i spent on it. like i said its a beautiful color, and i like it, but its not as good as it promises to be, and is way overpriced for its shortcomings.

i actually bought this from target.  i was never the type to use moisturizers, didnt really think i needed them back then, but as of the past few years my skins become really dry, and even after washing my face, even with a scrub, my skin was STILL looking flaky and dry, so my makeup always looked like crap and i couldnt figure out why. i switched the the neutrogena face wash, just the standard orange in a pump bottle, and though it works awesome, afterwards, my face is suuuper tight and dry.  and thats where this little product comes in.it smells great, very fresh, clean and crisp scent but also very light. and speaking of light, a little bit of this stuff goes a looong way.  i was surprised by its texture really. i was expecting an actual cream, like your typical lotion stuff and i saw this green stuff and touched it and it felt really good lol. its cold, slick and not oily at all.  that was one thing that concerned me but nope, i put a little on my wrist, rubbed it in a little and once it dried it was just smooth and soft, no oily residue.i came on here because i was like, oh this stuffs awesome, and i wondered how others who bought it felt about it so i thought a good place would be to check amazon for other peoples comments, and was not surprised to see how highly everyone else spoke of it, so i had to put my word in too because im totally in love with this stuff..i wondered if anyone knows of any of those good little face scrubber things? like the Wave or just something good that scrubs the face, a little battery powered one. or a microdermabrasion  thing. i really want to try one of those. i am in my mid 20's and still get some bad breakouts, and i just don't know what to do anymore.there's rarely ever a time my face is ever 100% clear, and by the time it does, i break out again a week before that time of the month and it takes weeks to heal.  any advice is totally welcome and appreciated.

I was on my way to the gym when i stopped at the grocery store to grab some water and a small snack type just in case i needed it when i was in the organic aisle trying to find good healthy things instead of my usual crap, and i noticed these and they looked pretty good, i figured ive had dried fruit before, so these couldnt be too bad, its just apple and apricots. so i picked one up and tried it.i opened it up and it was a dark reddish brown color, speckled looking because its just chopped mixed and mashed up fruit, and it has the texture of a dried apricot once you bite it, it has that sticky center, but the bar itself didnt have a sticky residue. i took a bite and omg it was soooo good.  it was a little tart, like i expected it to be, and chewy, which i really liked the texture and surprisingly made me feel satisfied after eating it so i didnt crave other snacks. (i ended up eating mine hours after my workout at just an evening snack)Now, it does tastes like unsweetened dried fruit, so if thats not your thing then you may not like these, they arent like granola or other types of bars with additives and sweeteners or stuff so its not going to taste like a delicious rice crispy treat or nutrigrain bar...  i know how sometimes if youre expecting one thing and it totally is off then it can ruin it, like taking a drink of milk when you thought it was lemonade and youre like what the snap, ew. so just remember that if you want to try these.I saw one post where someone tried the same bar i did a few times and got hard pit things each time, i never had that problem.  mine was consistent in texture and no weird hard spots. though it does say on the package because its a natural product sometimes a little piece here and there might have gotten by.All in all i LOVE these bars, and am looking forward to trying the other varieties as well.  they were 1.88 at the grocery store so the price on here right now is actually cheaper than buying them individual so ill prob try a couple others then get a box of my fave, or the variety pack if they all end up being just as delicious, which im anticipating :)

when i bought this i was worried that it might be too small for my needs as i was spending a week away from home and i like to have options so i pack a little on the heavier side lol.  but i got it and was surprised at how much i could actually fit in it.  i had a few pairs of jeans, a pair of leggings, sweats, and shorts, about 7 tank tops, a couple dressier shirts, flip flops, flats, and skinny designer sneakers plus a few undergarments, 7 pairs of undies and some socks. stashed the toiletries bag in there... it zipped up just fine no issues with bulging or getting caught. it has nice pockets for putting things like chargers or things like that. and the pull out handle was long enough and didnt cause any strain.  i also like the wheels that were rubber so they rolled nicely and werent obnoxiously loud. the only nuisance was when rolling off of uneven surfaces if it doesnt tip it will hobble back and forth on its wheels but thats a given.  i found the trick was to actually slow down and not move instead of trying to counter the movements to readjust it.I'm very happy with this bag i love it and intend to use it a lot now that i plan to travel more frequently.  its similar in size to my airport carry on but its more compact and easier to carry around, and it also has the shoulder strap included, which i saw some didnt have on other duffels.

bought this movie for my papa since he's from cuba and hasnt seen the place in 40 years, reminded him of the beautiful country he came from. politics are something else. he just wanted to see the creatures and the landscape. he really enjoyed it.

though a little bit pricey to buy online, i liked the convenience of not having to go out to the store.  i love how easily it takes off my makeup, especially eye makeup.  it does a thorough job and once dry my face feels soft. its kinda funny and wasnt really intentional but i had learned that these also take spra ypaint off of my hands too.  my fingers were covered, and scrubbing with hot soapy water several times did a whole lot of nothing, but i picked up one of these to clean my face for the night to discover the color was coming off on it, so a few wipes later and my hands were spotless.  these are awesome!

the hammer is nice, it does what i needed it to do, but there was something that i found a little unsettling with this hammer, initially it was the strong "Factory smell" it gave off when i received it.  the other was that it states on a warning label on the hammer that this product contains lead, and also instructs on washing hands after handling it.  it just made me a little uncomfortable keeping it around seeing as they pretty heavily made aware of the hazards of this little object.
bought this for a friend, he is loving it.  first book he has read in a long time.  glad to help him get back into books :)

there's not a whole lot to say about this trigger guard other than its perfect. :) i love it, it was a very smooth, easy installation, came with its own rollpin, it actually doesn't fill the gap fully on the trig guard area, but how i hold the grip, it really doesnt affect me, my fingers don't go up there, im a chick and i have small hands so my fingers dont touch up there, but nothing a gapper cant fix. didnt even notice that little thing until just now writing the review lol so definitely no biggie for me.

so i first bought this a week ago, but wasnt sure if it included hardware or not (some do) so i ended up returning it and going with the Mako grip for about 21$ here on amazon, thinking i should have went with that one instead.the mako grip arrive, and first thing i noticed was a stabbing feeling on m fingers, the molding on it was not clean and had plastic shards sticking out i had to shave down AND sand, and secondly, that grip is definitely a mans grip.  im a chick and i have small hands and that grip was NOT working out, as nice as it looked and i wanted to like it, but i couldnt. so i sent that one back tooi ended up getting this hogue grip back again and now that its on my lower i absolutely LOVE it. i should  never have second guessed myself and went with my first choice.  its very comfortable and nonslip, but not soft and squishy or padded, its small enough that my hands fit perfectly around the palm swell area to the finger grips, its built ergonomically has waves in some areas that help your fingers stay in a comfortable position instead of sliding over the grip when moving, and it fit VERY snug onto my lower.  its a very comfortable grip to use and i love that its has a rubberized feel because the hard place was slippery.keep in mind though this isnt the beaver tail version i would have preferred, but that wont be in stock on amazon for 2-4 months, and this particular package does not include the bottom door and battery storage unit.  but it can be purchased separately.  at the time i bought this one i think the set was out of stock. so i figured ehh i'll just buy the other piece later or make my own cover for the bottom.If youre a female or just have smaller hands then this is a good grip in my opinion.  ill post a pic if it will let me.  its a great price and has a great reputation.  totally worth it.

when i saw this grip, i wanted to really like it. it had the features that i wanted and i heard it was a good make. however once i actually got it, i was a little disappointed with it.  the first thing i noticed was that there was pieces of plastic leftover from the molding sticking out of the finger grip areas. i learned this when i tried to hold it and it stabbed my fingers, luckily no cuts, but it was very rough and had sharp edges, definitely NOT useable.  I had to grab a razorblade and trim off the excess plastic, then file it down so there weren't any sharp edges and i could grip it comfortably.Which brings me to another point... the grip itself.  its kinda big, for me at least.  from finger grips to the swell on the back its a little wider than comfortable for me.  It's definitely suitable for a man, but im a chick and i've got smaller hands and though i prefer the design of this grip, its just not very comfortable to hold, i feel like i have to stretch my hand awkwardly to get it seated comfortable in my hand and it's not doin it :( .  I returned the Hogue grip i originally bought thinking it was missing hardware but it didnt have the screw, but now im thinking i want it back. i liked the almost rubber type no slip feel. it wasnt padded or anything. but it was smaller and it felt good in my hand to hold.I wanted to give it 3 stars cuz i was disappointed that it wasnt what i was expecting, but, im giving it 4 because even though its too big for me, itll work fine for you lovely men. but i had to knock off a star for the painful ugly unfinished sharp plastic that needed filing.  also had it on the hinge area of the bottom cover. had to cut and file that off too.

this was a very sweet, cute movie about jack, a loner who longs to understand his purpose and his journey to discovering himself.  something about him i was able to connect with and drew me into the movie even though its not as context rich as some other animated films, it still carries a beautiful message that children can easily understand.

WOW.... i have to say i was amazed. i wasnt expecting it to be as good as it was, and boy was i mistaken.  First off this movie is NOT for young kids. i dont know how it escaped a pg13 rating (especially by some of the unexpected imagery and content) but i wouldnt recommend it to anyone younger than 12 or 13.the colors are very vivid and set the tone quite well.  and even though its creepy, its still very cute.  basically its about a girl who feels kind of put off by her parents who are extremely busy and have no time for her. she finds her way to an idealistic version of her world, but as she will learn (as is the overall theme of this which another reviewer mentioned) the grass isnt always greener on the other side.  Whether she's able to escape it or not ill leave that for you to find out :)  this is a tim burton movie after all, anything can happen in the crazy worlds he creates.  Enjoy!

i bought this cup from a trip to Joanns actually back last spring and this is my FAVORITE reusable cup. i use it on a daily basis, it went with me to work every day before i got laid off, i take it with my in the car, use it at starbucks all the time, and its nice at night with lots of ice and water when i wake up and im thirsty, i always have a drink nearby.  I have a thing for these cups lol. i am addicted to them and always buy one if i find a cute one at the store, and i actually have this one too which i really like Copco Sierra 24-Ounce Cold Tumbler, Hot Pink but that one is not a double wall insulated one like this black damask one is.it fits in my car fine so i have no complaints about that. my cupholder has a silicone feeling molded insert/cover thing so i dont recall if the cup goes all the way down in the holder but because of the silicone liner it locks in there snug and doesnt slide or fallout when im driving.and im not sure about others who say it doesnt maintain it insulation and gathers condensation.  i've never had that problem with this cup.  the other one i linked to thats pink gets condensation, but has a silicone grip on it so it wasnt a big issue, but it did get my table and stuff wet so i fell in love with this one and its been the go-to. its always next to my laptop so i love that it doesnt sweat all over the table.. mine has never had condensation form on the outside so if youre looking for a good insulated cup thats cute then this is a good one. i typically prefer skinny narrow straws but this one is wide enough to put any kind of drink in, even thick smoothies or shakes, or stuff with fruit bits in it, and the straw has a little funnel like attachment on the end instead of a little mixing spade looking thing.

I bought this for someone special for valentines day this year, and im hoping he loves it!  he's loved the last two i bought him, and loves my taste in things since everything i get him looks great, but i gotta say i saw this watch and fell in love.I actually ended up buying this watch at zales, which was kinda stupid because its a hundred dollars cheaper here on amazon, but with the time constraint i didnt have a lot of choice at the moment so i couldnt amazon it like i normally would have. but ive had it in a wishlist for some time waiting for the opportunity to buy it, and i guess that time is now.It's got a hefty little weight to it because its steel, and it feels like it has some substance, not cheap and flimsy.  It's also actually pretty shiny. the metal is glossy, not matte as it appears in the photo, and the mother of pearl is very faint, its not loud and pronounced like the photo indicates either.  i had at first thought this was a different version of this watch model because the pearl was so loud in this compared to what i actually bought, but like another reviewer mentioned, it looks almost all black.  this doesnt bother me though as the over-pearlized look was kinda distracting and would have been a little much considering the heft, sheen, silver accents and diamonds, the color just would have been too much.what set this one apart from the rest was that the bling was understated.  i saw a lot of beautiful diamond encrusted watches and ones with tons of dials and little weird counters and calendars on it, but this is mainly more of a statement piece.  i tend to lean towards a classier, more simple, timeless look. doesnt need a ton of knobs bells and whistles, just elegant. and this fit the bill,it comes in a nice rectangular two piece box, its a blackish dark charcoal color and comes strapped around a little black bulova pillow, which makes a beautiful presentation as opposed to a clamshell velvet type standard box. i like this one better.all in all im very happy with this piece, and im sure he will be too. id definitely recommend this one for that special man in your life too.

though my review isnt going to be as awesome and thorough like a lot of others, i just have to comment on how beautiful this story is.  i agree with a lot of others that even though its a pixar animated movie, its just as much for adults, if not more than it is for kids.  not ratings-wise but content wise.the story follows the old man through his love, loss and promises, and the journey along the way.I will admit, i started crying in the first 10 minutes of the movie, its so incredibly sweet, and it reminded me of my own grandparents in that they were each others first and ONLY love, and my mama just recently passed, so the movie reeeally connected with me on that level because i can see my papa in the old man in the movie.it's definitely a little different than your typical animated film, but if youre into the kind of more mature animated subjects and dig a sweet story, then definitely give this movie a shot.  you won't be disappointed.

i cant remember if i found these at walmart, or the local grocery store but i havent been able to find them for a while, glad they're on amazon!  these are soooo delicious its crazy, i just have a hard time spending that much on them because i know they will go quick.  but definitely wanting to buy somemore...  at least now i know where i can find them.
not a lot to say about it. the price was good, and it fits perfectly, no issues there. i used it in my PS3, happy with this purchase. arrived quick because it was amazon prime.  would buy again.

gooks great. bought for a friend who didnt have a working stove in his apartment, so this, alone with a microwave and toaster oven and he was just fine and able to cook pretty much anything for himself.  very happy with this. will buy one for myself when i get a new place of my own :P

bought this for a friend who loves basmati, but we were unable to find any locally around the area without having to travel a little. so i ordered amazon prime instead, and it was a small 2 lb container so that made it much better for storing and mailing than a big bag would have been.  very happy with purchase, would buy from again.

If you are looking for vacuum compression bags, you pretty much just want something that is very easy to use, durable, and helps you store more things in smaller spaces. You want something that is intuitive so that after you store something for a year, you do not have to read instructions again to figure out how to use it again for the next year.This set fits the bill. You get a pretty good deal for 3 bags. You can use it with almost any vacuum that has a hose even if it does not fit perfectly. The plastic is pretty thick and seems durable without having a strong plastic smell. Like others, I was a bit confused at first on how to use it, but after reading instructions on Amazon, it was a breeze for me to use. Yes, it was a bit annoying to have no included instructions on how to use it, but one minute after re-visiting this Amazon page, I am sure I will never forget how to use and will never have to look it up again.Unlike other reviewers may have mentioned, I had no trouble zipping the bags closed--I actually thought it was really easy and fast to do. Clearly, your mileage may vary...Note: I received this item for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all items just as if I paid full price for them.

Pros:- Super comfortable! I find the headband super comfortable even after prolonged periods, which is quite rare for me for headphones at this price range. The ear pads are also very comfortable.- Good sound! I cannot really tell between my higher-priced luxury headphones and this set. I was really surprised by the sound quality for a headphone at this price range.- Did I mention that these are some of the MOST COMFORTABLE headphones I have ever tried?Cons:- Microphone. I really wanted to give this a five star review because of the sound quality and comfort at this price range, but I cannot. Before I say anything else, I just want to say that I really like the sleek design of the microphone being able to fold into the headphone when you do not use them--if you did not have the microphone expanded out, you would probably not even know that your headset had a microphone at all, let alone a microphone that was sleekly stored away. Unfortunately, for me, the microphone did not work really well on my Macbook Pro--it did not even record or transmit anything I said unless I was literally screaming into it (and yes, I am sure I set it up right on my Mac to record). I am sure my unit was just a fluke and that your mileage may vary.All in all, this is a good headset at a very good price point. I would double-check the microphone upon purchase/receipt of the item, especially if purchasing this as a gift. However, I am sure my problems are not the norm.Note: I received this item for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all items just as if I paid full price for them.

I hate a dirty screen and am pretty compulsive about cleaning all my screens (tablet, phone, computer, tv, etc.). I have found that for minor messes and daily use, my most economical solution with great results is using the Moshi Teraglove and just plain tap water (though it saves me money from buying solution, it has a downsides of sometimes leaving streaks that are a bit frustrating to get out--but I cannot afford the luxury of buying special solution every few months).For dirtier messes, I usually used the iKlear solution, as it is or was what I see being used whenever I am at the Apple Store by the "geniuses." Why is iKlear Apple-approved and declared as safe and effective to use on Apple products? Mostly, it is because it is ammonia-free and alcohol-free so it won't damage the coating on your screens! Well, guess what?! The Eco Moist screen cleaner is also ammonia-free and alcohol-free! That means it is safe for my Apple products too! For several reasons, if I will be buying any cleaners on Amazon in the future, it will definitely be Eco Moist over iKlear. Here are some reasons:- No residue left behind when I clean! With iKlear, sometimes after I wiped the screen down, there is a streak or residue left over that I had to go over and clean again. I do not have the same problem with the Eco Moist.- Great microfiber towel provided. The microfiber towel provided is high quality and adequate in size. FYI, it is different than the smooth silky microfiber many people are accustomed too for cleaning eyeglasses--this cloth has a "rougher" surface which gives you a bit more friction when cleaning, so you can "scrub" easier. Though I say it is "rougher" for you to "scrub," I am by no means implying it is unsafe or harder on your screen, as it is still microfiber. I am no manufacturing expert, but I think this "rougher" microfiber is actually more expensive than the super-smooth or super-silky microfiber cloths to make, as it is easier to make a flat cloth compared to a cloth with a rougher surface that is just as safe for your screen.- It got my fingerprints off REALLY easily--just one wipe was adequate. Again, there was no residue or streaking afterwards.- No scent! I kind of hate the iKlear scent when I am spraying iKlear. There is no scent with Eco Moist, which is much more preferable for me,- For a comparably sized bottle of iKlear on Amazon, the Eco Moist is cheaper AND includes the nice microfiber cloth with it. The iKlear does not always come with a cloth, so you are paying more for the same amount of solution and missing out on a new cloth. I kind of have low success with washing cloths after they are used for a long time, so I would have no qualms just reordering Eco Moist, getting a new cloth, and tossing my old cloth, especially if the prices remain the same and iKlear does not include a cloth.Note: I received this item for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all items just as if I paid full price for them.

Pros:- This is a REALLY cute silicone stand.- It holds an iPhone 5 perfectly, as shown in my pictures, but it can also easily hold other phones (like my iPhone 6) and even tablets.- Easy to use--just put your phone on the back of the pig where there is a small bump--the bump will retract/conform to your phone right after placement.- Stays in place pretty well. Will not slide much if placed properly.Cons:- If you are looking for something SUPER stable, look elsewhere. The stand holds your phone pretty well, but it may fall if there is an earthquake or someone bumps the desk very hard. That said, it is NOT unstable...it is just not the MOST stable thing I have used. For my daily use, the stability is definitely adequate.- For $9.99, it is a bit overpriced for those that value function a lot more than form. Those that want super-stability can find other stands that are cheaper--however, they are definitely NOT as cute. I can definitely understand why people may pay a few dollars extra for something a bit less stable but a lot pleasing to the eye.I think this may be a pretty great item for stocking stuffers for the holiday season.Note: I received this item for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all items just as if I paid full price for them. Price of this phone holder at time of review on Amazon is $9.99.

I have two cutting boards (one 21 x 14.5 inches and the other 13.5 x 9.5 inches) that I always had a tough time drying and/or finding a proper place to lay them against so that they dry.This is a cheap solution that allows me to always have a default place to dry my cutting boards properly. The stand is super sturdy and well-constructed. It is probably a bit overkill for just two cutting boards--I guess I will just have to buy more kitchen items to store in it!

The mechanism to retract the ethernet cord is well-designed and gives me no issues, unlike other retractable cords that I have used. It is easy to use--retracts when I want it to and pull on the ends, and expands when I want it to as well.I bought this because I wanted a compact way of carrying an ethernet cord in my backpack everyday. It is compact, but by no means small (has about a 3 inch diameter and is about an inch thick). Even though it is a bit thicker than I thought it would be, I appreciate that both the mechanism for retracting the cord as well as the overall product seems a lot more durable than I am used to seeing. Even though it is a bit thicker than I would want it to be, it is still WAY more compact and easily stored than a normal 5 ft ethernet cable that I fold up and tie up to put in my bag.I would appreciate it to be a LITTLE bit longer, but for my purposes the length has been fine.I have used this cord daily for more than a month now when I go to work without any issues and/or signs that it will break. It seems very well-made and made to last a long time even with my not-too-careful or even rough use with it. I will update if I get any issues.

This is a very solid product that lets you use one of your USB ports to connect to an ethernet cord. It is compact and well-built compared to most of the other USB to ethernet adapters out there on Amazon. It is no wonder for me why this is one of the best-selling adapters with the most glowing reviews.The aluminum casing even matches my Macbook Pro perfectly. Unfortunately, even though it looks like it was made for my Apple MacBook Pro, it still does not match up to the Apple-branded Thunderbolt to Gigabit Ethernet Adapter (I purchased this one Thunderbolt to Gigabit Ethernet Adapter) in terms of ease of use with my Macbook Pro. For some reason, with this USB to ethernet adapter, whenever I connect to the network I most frequently use via ethernet, I have to restart the computer before my internet successfully works. I have to do this restart every time. With the Apple Thunderbolt to Gigabit Ethernet Adapter, the internet works perfectly well immediately as soon as I connect the ethernet cord into the adapter without needing to restart.That said, it works very well after I restart the computer and it does exactly the job it claims to do--it allows you to use a USB port as an ethernet port so your computer can connect to the internet via ethernet cord. I am sure the fact that I have to restart using this USB adapter and do not have to restart when using the Apple adapter is more due to my computer's settings, the limitations of connecting via USB vs. thunderbolt, or the settings of the network I am connecting to. It is not a knock on the build or quality of this Anker product or anything.Of course, this review may not apply to you if you own a PC or maybe if your network's settings are different. For my daily use, the Apple Thunderbolt to Gigabit Ethernet Adapter is worth shelling out the extra few dollars for the convenience of not having to restart my computer every time I connect to my work's network.

I was pretty happy with my Danco 9D00010306 Microban Hair Catcher, but I decided to try this one after my Danco one started growing mold.The reviews for this hair stopper seem to indicate that it is a bit more resistant to mold, so I tried purchasing this one. With just a few weeks of use, I can already see that this hair stopper is much better at resisting mold--I clean it a lot less and it still looks clean and mold-free despite the less frequent upkeep compared to the Danco Hair Catcher.This is a pretty cheap and effective hair catcher. It did the job that I bought it to do perfectly...I must say, however, that I find this Evriholder hair stopper a LOT harder to clean compared to most hair stoppers I have used. The Danco Hair Catcher was a LOT easier to clean--but I still did not clean it that often....so for now, I will stick to the product that needs less cleaning but is harder to clean.

I usually look through the reviews very thoroughly before buying, but I trusted the Lodge brand because I was so happy with my skillets and other products from Lodge.I really wish I read other reviews. My brush also melted after one use. DO NOT USE THIS BRUSH UNTIL THE SKILLET IS COOLED OFF.I have alternatively used OXO Good Grips Electric Grill and Panini Press Brush with some success and it did not melt when the skillet was just as hot as when the Lodge Brush melted.Still, for fans of cleaning the skillet while it is still hot like me, I find it is most effective to just use tongs and a wet paper towel to clean the skillet.

0:23 MinsI have years of experience with several of these kind of electric swatter products, as my family has been acquiring them from Asia and bringing them to our home in the US before Amazon even existed or these were well-known in the US.This seems like one of the most well-thought out designs I have ever seen as it has rechargeable batteries, one of the largest racquet/swatter sizes I have ever seen, and 3 layers of nets.Despite the larger size and the 3 layers of nets, this is one of the swatters I have the most difficulty killing bugs with, strangely enough...I can't explain it. Sometimes I swear I get the bug, but the bug clearly survives or probably flew right through...Most alarming to me, however, is that when I am holding the button to turn on the electric charge as I am going to zap, it sometimes RANDOMLY DISCHARGES AND SHOCKS as if it has hit a bug, except it has hit nothing except air. This only happens if I am holding the button too long in anticipation of the bug...but it is surprising nonetheless. With other swatters, I can hold the shock button for several minutes with no random discharge of electricity/shock unless I hit a bug. Maybe it is part of the design or maybe it is just a defect in my unit...Still, I cannot complain too much, as it does eventually kill the bug._______________________________________________________________________________***EDIT 9/10/2015:Decided to post video/proof of random discharges.

Note: I received this product for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all products as if I paid full price for it. Price of this product at time of review on Amazon is $13.97.My family has a house-trained Shih-Tzu that is trained to pee and poop on a pad in the bathroom during the day when people are at work or when we are unable to walk him due to weather.People in our family pride themselves on keeping a clean house. But as expected with a dog trained to urinate indoors, he obviously sometimes walks on his own urine and then trails it to other places in the house. This light clearly illuminated places in our house that the dog brought urine to with his paws that we did not see with our naked eye. In the pics I put, you see it by his pee pad holder as expected, by his bowl, and on his bed.Added plus--IT DETECTS HUMAN URINE TOO! Catch people neglecting to wipe down the seat when they are done red-handed a few times and hope people will eventually always remember to clean up after themselves!

Note: I received this product in black and orange (DECEC Harrier Cable Portable USB 2.0 A Male to Micro B Data and OTG Cable USB Charge Cable) for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all products as if I paid full price for it. Price of this product at time of review on Amazon is $12.99.This is most interesting and well-designed cable I have seen in a long time. It is unique in that it allows you to easily store the male USB connector into the female USB connector, basically allowing you to fold the cable up into two when storing, as pictured in the product page. This makes this cable highly portable. I did a quick Amazon product search for "OTG cable," and none of the products on at least the first 5 pages of search results have this unique design at date of this review on 7/16/2015 (I stopped looking after 5 pages, so it can very likely be more than 5). It is such a simplistic design, but I guess not many people have thought of it...but I expect copycat products soon.The cable is thin, flat, and flexible, but at the same time seems sturdy and not-at-all fragile.I have tried this product in all ways as advertised in its photos--ALL WAYS WORKED FLAWLESSLY FOR ME:- Most importantly, I was able to use this as an OTG cable on an android tablet to access a USB thumb drive.- I was able to use this as a data cable to sync my phone with my computer.- I was able to use this as a charging cable for a phone connected to a charger, and I was also able to connect another micro-USB with male-USB cable to the female-USB port of this cable to charge both my phone and an android tablet at the same time.People buying this cable are probably mostly looking for its OTG functionality, but for the tech newbies, obviously make sure your device is OTG-capable first before buying--otherwise you will end up with simply a data and charging micro-USB to male-USB cable that you can easily buy cheaper elsewhere.I would buy this cable at full price if I lost the sample I received and/or recommend this to close family and friends if they have need for an OTG cable.

I bought these lab markers because people in my lab keep losing or stealing each others' so much that I wanted a set of my own.These work great and do exactly what I bought them to do. They have an extra fine tip that is easy to write with on several types of surfaces (tubes, slides, etc) and yield text that is very legible and easy to read. Most importantly, they dry fast and are resistant to many solvents I use regularly that would quickly wash away ink from regular permanent markers. They are as "lab-proof" as any other markers I have ever used.However, there is one flaw that is semi-annoying, but something I am okay with living with--the shirt/coat clip on the pen cap is easily detached from the rest of the pen cap (see picture). For $40.31 (including shipping) for 12 markers (~$3.35 per marker), I expected these markers to be pretty flawless. I will live with them for now, but I would check elsewhere first for pens without this flaw before ordering again, especially if you rely heavily on the pen clip in daily use.

I have used several tempered glass screen protectors and the most recent one I had on my iPhone 6 shattered after a drop. Thus, I decided to try this one.I decided to purchase this because of the system provided to do a quick and easy install. I must admit that this is definitely the QUICKEST DUST-FREE INSTALL I have ever had for a screen protector. With other screen protectors, I can also get a dust-free install, but this was far easier and quicker because of the provided "Align Holder."However, for my first install, I noticed that even though I put the screen protector perfectly into the align holder, it was just a TINY bit off-center. Your mileage may vary, of course. Certainly the final placement was "good enough" but it was clear on my phone that the screen protector installed just a millimeter or so more towards the right than the left. When I looked at my home button, I could see that the distance between the button and the screen protector was larger on the right compared to the left. Meanwhile, the distance between the speaker at the top of the phone from the screen protector was greater on the left compared to the right.Thus, since I kinda have OCD, the screen protector not being exactly in the middle frustrated me--so I took it off and tried again. I was able to use the align holder again to carefully get the screen protector into the exact middle of the phone, but I noticed that there was a bit of resistance while I did this. Certainly, I could not simply "place the top end of the glass against the align holder and slowly lay down on the screen" as stated in step 4 of the instructions and expect it to all land perfectly. Instead, I used the align holder as a general guide for laying down the screen protector, noticing that I had to constantly adjust the screen protector along the align holder in order to make sure that the hole for the speaker in the screen protector landed exactly in the middle on top of the speaker port...then constantly adjust it so that the bottom landed exactly in the middle on top of the home button.Basically, there is a certain amount of "wiggle room" in the align holder so you still have to be careful if you care about it being EXACTLY in the middle. If you are not that anal, you could probably just follow the instructions blindly and achieve a final install that is dust-free and "good enough" in less than ten seconds--but do not expect it to be PERFECTLY aligned. If you want it to be dust-free and exactly in the middle, you still have to be a little careful and constantly adjust placement as you slowly let the screen protector down.

I bought this to hold my cell phone on my desk when I am doing work (I hate leaving my phone in my pants pockets) and also to hold the phone next to my bed.Whether it is clamped to my desk right next to my computer monitor so that my phone is easily glanced at if there are any notifications while working, or if it is clamped on my bed frame or nightstand next to my bed at night, the stand holds my phone really well.I used a lot of cell phone and tablet holders before for use in the home by the desk or in the car. I must say that this is pretty high quality and is much cheaper than similar products I used before. The arms of this holder strikes the perfect balance of being sturdy and also being flexible enough so that you do not have a workout of your arm when you are trying to flex the holder into a different position. Other products were the flex arm were either too weak or too hard to maneuver for me in the past, so I transitioned to straight bar mounts (RAM Mounts, Joy Factory mounts) that did the job, but were just a bit too hardcore and kind of an eyesore. This cell phone holder is the perfect one for me.This significantly enhanced my life so that I would purchase again if I lost or broke it. Particularly in the mornings...I used to have my cell phone just plugged in and laying on the nightstand without this holder/mount, and sometimes the phone would fall on the thick floor carpet when I would snooze the morning alarm or the phone would somehow get on my bed and get buried in the blankets--which could be a disaster since the bedsheets and my plush carpet could significantly dampen the volume of the alarm. With this cell phone holder, my phone is always in the same, safe place through the night and until I take it out of the mount to take it to work. If this company made a tablet mount I would definitely try it.

I recently got the new Logitech MX Master to use with my Mac after I got frustrated with my Apple Magic Mouse being super-loud on my desk. For $5 extra bucks I figure I would add this to my Amazon shopping cart to try to revive my Apple Magic Mouse for use with other household computers.This tape revived my Apple Magic Mouse so that it was QUIETER and WORKED SMOOTHER than my brand new Logitech MX Master. Then, I tried putting this tape on my Logitech MX Master, and I was BLOWN AWAY.I am sure this roll of tape will last me a long time even after re-applying it to my mice whenever my old applications wear down. I will never go back to using a mouse without this tape.

For $15 dollars you cannot really ask for more. Works great with my Dell 2713hm monitor.This is all I needed FYI, as I got a bit confused with some people saying you need the power supply--I did not need the additional power supply, as the 2713hm monitor can power the speaker. I am guessing if you have one of the newer Dell monitors, your monitor can power the speaker and you do not need the additional power supply. Your mileage may vary, of course.I installed this on my monitor in less than 3 minutes. I am tech savvy, but I suspect even the less tech-savvy will find this an easy install.I had no problems with any sound output from the speaker when any of my devices connected to my monitor via HDMI or DisplayPort. I connected my PS4, Macbook Pro, and iPad to the monitor via HDMI or DisplayPort and successfully verified automatic sound output through the speaker when I connected any of the devices to my monitor. The sound is not audiophile-quality but is at least standard quality and sounds pretty great for casual purposes.Works exactly as I hoped and expected it would--can't ask for more for $15!

I really wanted to like this. I like AmazonBasics products and how they provide high-quality cheap alternatives for several products.Unfortunately, this is way too large for my Macbook Pro Retina 15".That said, for larger 15" computers that aren't as slim as Macs, I am sure this is a great product. It is not a military-grade protector/case, but it seems just as well made with quality materials and just protective as other cases I have bought for other computers in the past, at a fraction of the price...if only it were the right size!!Additionally, when it comes to these accessories I like things to be minimalistic. Aside from the AmazonBasics label in the upper left corner, this is plain and minimalistic enough for my needs. The AmazonBasics label is less gaudy than how other companies like to label their products.If it were just smaller it would be perfect. Oh well.-----Update 6/23/15Two praises that made me change my review from 2 stars to 4 stars:1. When I tried to return my 15" laptop sleeve, Amazon gave me a full refund and additionally told me to keep it for free and to not bother returning it! Great customer service. I ended up giving the case to a friend that had a large 15" business/work Dell computer which the 15" case fits perfectly.2. I purchased a 13" case for my Toshiba CB35-B3340 13.3 Inch Chromebook (Intel Celeron, 4GB, 16GB SSD, Silver) Full HD-Screen. The case fits the Chromebook very well. It has some extra room in the case, but it feels like it keeps my computer very securely. I really appreciated this because the Chromebook is not the kind of computer that has a bunch of manufacturers rushing to create custom-cases that fit it completely perfectly, so to find a general case that adequately protects the Chromebook at such a low price point is really great!

When it comes to shaving, I am a pretty utilitarian guy. I want something quick before I rush out in the mornings, but I also want a shave that actually lasts the entire day and does not cause irritation. Some people think that you can either have quick shave (electric shaving) or a smooth/close shave with no irritation/ingrown hairs/bumps (wet-shaving with a safety razor), and you can never have both. Frustrated with irritation from electric shaving a few years ago, I went to wet-shaving for a few years, which felt like a lot of fun, but even after I got good at it, I still got irritation and ingrown hairs. Thus, I went back to electric shaving recently, as I figure the minimal gains in preventing irritation from wet-shaving in my personal experience was not worth the extra time spent.I've been using the Braun 770cc Pulsonic Shaver the last year or so, and I've grown tired of how the shave does not last, and how I was getting chronic irritation/ingrown hairs/bumps in certain areas. I tried a bunch of stuff to try to troubleshoot this issue for me, such as alternating wet-shaving and electric-shaving every few days and all that, to no avail.Finally, I bought the Kyoku Pre-Shave Optimizer. I was actually REALLY wary of this product because I tried the Lab Series Electric Pre-Shave stuff and Lectric Shave Pre-Shave stuff to no avail. But no matter how skeptical I was, I just could not ignore all the glowing Amazon reviews...Just a few days of using this, I can already say this is the BEST shaving purchase I have ever made. Why?- My shave lasts for the 16 hours a day I need it to. My shave is MUCH closer than without this magic stuff. In fact, I would say it is almost as close as my wet-shave. This significantly improved the way my facial hair felt towards the end of my day (ie it was much shorter).- The irritation I get from my electric shaver is SIGNIFICANTLY diminished. I get no irritation after my shave, and the chronic parts of my face that are irritated are significantly reducing.- Unlike other Pre-Shave products, I do not hate the smell, and I do not have as much trouble washing it off.I bought this product with a Shisheido pre-shave lotion that got glowing reviews on Amazon, so after a few more weeks of using this, I will try the Shisheido pre-shave lotion to compare--will report back here when I do so. That being said, Kyoku set a pretty high bar...

Note: I received this item for free in exchange for a fair and honest review. I review all items just as if I paid for them.I have tried my fair share of lightning cables, including the apple lightning cable, the amazon lightning cable, and several others. I prefer the braided variety of lightning cables (as they are tangle-resistant), but they are often twice in price compared to this Omars cable so it is not a fair comparison.As far as non-braided lightning cables go, this is the best lightning cable I have tried. Why?1. 4 feet! I often find the 3 foot cables way too short, and the 6 foot cables way too long. Finding a high quality 4 foot cable is pretty great.2. Seems more durable (a bit thicker cord) than the Apple-branded lightning cables I have tried and broken many times already. However, only time can tell if this cord stands the test of time. I will be using this daily, and will update if this cord ever fails.3. The lightning connection is almost as thin as the apple-branded lightning cable! (See my picture). I have had trouble with my iPhone case with other brands of lightning cables (ie the Amazon lightning cable) because their lightning connections were too thick and would not fit with the case on. I have no issues with this one.4. Charges, connects, and syncs iPhone/iPad with computer with no issues--just like the original Apple lightning cable.5. Comes with a nifty 3m cable management sticker/mount to keep your lightning cord on your table or whatever surface you desire (see picture). No other cords I have ever purchased came with this for free.If I were going to pay 9 bucks for a lightning cable, this would be the one.

Note: I am primarily using this to watch Netflix or listen to podcasts on my computer late-night or as I fall asleep in bed without disturbing the wife (I just cannot fall asleep as quickly without doing this for some reason, no matter how hard I try). I am not using this for professional editing purposes or expecting audiophile-quality for listening to music.I've been searching for a good set of bluetooth headphones for late-night listening that I can also use while falling asleep. I've had a good set of Bose Soundlink Around-Ear Bluetooth AE2W headphones for a few years that I have been pretty happy with, but they are just not comfortable when laying down (mostly because of the Around-Ear irregular oval shape cupping the ears instead of a perfect circle). I specifically need bluetooth headphones because I am terrified that I will choke on the cord in the middle of the night--probably an irrational fear, but a fear nonetheless. I tried a bunch of the other Jabra headphones that are in-ear, but I ended up returning them because of bad comfort and connectivity issues. Some quick notes on why these headphones are pretty great:1. CONNECTIVITY: If you had any issues with the other Jabra headphones in terms of connection, do not be afraid to give these headphones a shot. Jabra seemed to work out a bunch of kinks that plagued the older headphones, as these work perfect for me. They easily pair with my Macbook and connect automatically whenever I turn it on, without me having to play around with the computer and hope it randomly connects. I note that past headphones have a heavy focus on connecting with iPhones, iPads, etc., so they always seem to work fine with those devices, but computers were always a bit finicky. My computer will often not work with my Ae2w's without me shutting bluetooth off and then back on for my computer, but this is the first set of headphones that work just fine with my computer, pretty much every time. I will note that the distance of connection seems a few feet shorter compared to the Bose Ae2w's that I have, but it is still a good 20 feet or so. I think it might be because the newer bluetooth connections try to be lower energy, so it would make sense my older headphones might be able to connect at a longer distance.2. COMFORT. These are lightweight, slim, and small. NOTE THAT THESE ARE ON-EAR HEADPHONES (I searched furiously online for whether this was on-ear or over-ear for the longest time with no good answer, so now hopefully consumers that have the same question can find their answer here). I usually HATE on-ear headphones, and must admit that if I knew they were on-ear, I might not have purchased them. However, unlike other on-ear headphones, these are comfortable. They do not get too warm on my ear, and the tension on the headband isn't too tight so that it feels like my ears are being squeezed. In fact, I do not feel like my ears are being squeezed at all. I definitely wear these headphones for a few hours comfortably.3. POWER. Unlike other headphones that cannot be used as Bluetooth headphones while charging, THESE CAN. I am using this right now via bluetooth, while charging the headphones using the Micro-USB cable connected to a separate USB charger that is not attached to my computer. The Bose AE2W's were TERRIBLE because when you ran out of charge, you were FORCED to only use it as a wired 3.5mm headphone while taking the bluetooth dongle off to charge. With this set, I can charge this while using it via bluetooth, so that once I am finished charging, I can just take the USB cable off and already be connected to the computer via bluetooth. No need to re-attach a bluetooth dongle and then re-pair the device to the computer.I will update this review if I encounter any durability issues, etc.

A lot of the ones on Amazon I have purchased only have the electrocuting metal lines going horizontally. You would be surprised how many insects you end up missing by chance because they just happen to squeeze between the two lines. This one has lines going horizontally and vertically, so you pretty much get the bug 100% of the time--and at almost half the price!Interestingly enough, I purchased this to kill flies and mosquitoes, but I ended up using it mostly to kill house centipedes on the ground. Those buggers are so fast. I end up putting this racket/zapper right up against the ground (so that all the electrocuting lines are barely missing the floor), and then trap and kill the centipedes this way. I no longer have to chase them.
I purchased these to protect my Beyerdynamic DT 770s. The case is a perfect fit and seems like it would protect my headphones from quite a beating.

There are a lot of headphone cases being sold on Amazon, but few being sold at such a great price. I have purchased one with good Amazon reviews for ~$30 for another set of headphones, and this one from Geekria that I got for ~$14 seems just as durable and identical in quality. I use these for my Bose Ae2w's.

I had a hard time connecting with the characters in these stories.  While the stories are interesting and well-written, and will give a reader a slice of life that  most have not experienced, the stilted dialogue was just too much for me.  So much of it seemed forced or unnatural.  I know this collection has been well-reviewed elsewhere, but it just was not for me.

This versatile knife will be a great addition to any kitchen.  Sharp and easy to handle, it does everything I need it to do.  It slices easily through tomatoes, lemons, mushrooms, the list is endless.  If you are in the market for a new utility knife at a reasonable price point, I recommend this one.

I loved this novel!  It really caught me by surprise.  The titular Florence is a 70 something New York intellectual and she is very difficult.  Reading her story, however, is simply delightful, very entertaining, very engaging, very humorous.  The novel revolves around Florence, her son, his wife and their daughter, Emily.  The main relationship is between Emily and Florence, although for most of the novel, neither one would probably own up to having anything close to a relationship.  Brian Morton does so many smart things in this novel--I think this would be a great read for a book club.  Florence is a complete misanthrope, although I am sure most readers will identify, at least a tiny bit, with her desire to be alone.  Florence Gordon is a terrific novel and I think any reader with a touch of the curmudgeon in him or her will delight in reading it.  Enjoy!

The Liar's Wife is a collection of four thoughtful novellas.  Each story has powerful emotional resonance and each focusses on a character whose values and expectations are challenged by an encounter with someone else.  This collection is not a quick, light read, but rather each is a resonant, thought-provoking piece.  If you have enjoyed Mary Gordon's work in the past, I recommend this collection.  It is very well done.  Enjoy!

God is an Astronaut is a fairly interesting tale told through one woman's (Jess) email to a former lover about a catastrophe that befalls her husband's space tourism company.  The novel is written in a very straightforward fashion, so that fact that none of Arthur's (the former lover's) emails are present does not detract from the reading of the novel.  I do think, however, that some readers may be annoyed at this approach.  It did not much bother me.  The problem for me with this novel is that I found it hard to connect with Jess at all.  The  novel is a quick read, as one would expect in a novel told in only email format, and it does not get bogged down in the details.  It just did not make me want to tell all of my reader friends to immediately read this novel.

This volume is a great resource for the home cook.  This isn't a cook book, but rather a compendium of information about all different types of whole foods, but mostly the kind of foods you think of when you think about eating healthily (i.e., you won't find any information about hot dogs here).  Each food item has a dedicated two page spread with information about how to ship for it, the heath benefits of it, and environmental information about it.  The pictures are lovely and it is a pleasure to thumb through this book.  I know I will be using this as a resource in my kitchen for years to come.  I recommend this for any home chef curious about healthy eating.

How to Build a Girl is an amusing coming-of-age story that takes place in early-1990s Britain. The narrator, Johanna, struggles with who she is and invents a new persona, Dolly Wilde.  Johanna is probably an average goth-like rebellious teen at this time, but finds more freedom in Dolly, who really is an over-the-top version of Johanna herself.
