Otherwise, it is cheating the readers who have purchased their book expecting a fully told tale.As I've stated already, the book is great in itself, and I do recommend it for a good, fun read.Revised byKh

Disclaimer: I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review for a promotional tour. No other compensation was offered nor would it have been accepted.This was my first Cynster novel and I must say that I'm disappointed I have not read any before this! Rest assured that you can dive into this novel without having read any of the others previous. It may be centered on the Cynsters, but you do not need to know all of the other stories in order to enjoy Daniel & Claire's romance.I loved the setting, the time frame, and the connected feeling that is palpable between the characters from the grandmother to the aged butler to the youngest Cynster child. Plus their connection to the earth, to the Lady, and to things we often take for granted. Clean and sweet, I am very excited to join the readers who are already in love with the Cynster family and their tales. I am looking forward to Lucilla and Thomas's tale. You know it is to come, Lucilla knows it herself, but HOW will it come about is the question and I will be looking to read it soon! Now, if you'll excuse me, I need to find all the Cynster novels and read about Devil's tale, Demon's tale, etc. New Stephanie Laurens reader, right here!

I had the pleasure and honor of receiving an early review copy of Ms Hartman's newest novel, A COURTSHIP FOR CECILIA. Like all books by Ms Hartman, a character (or two) are cat lovers and I love that! I'm instantly more inclined to like a person (or character!) who likes animals and just as disinclined to like them if they demonstrate cruelty or indifference to animal suffering. What can I say? I'm an animal adorer!A COURTSHIP FOR CECILIA had a lovely plot that kept snapping along with a background story that I want to know more about! I loathed Horace and I loathed Cecilia's mother. What a horrid woman and no kind of mother in my opinion. Because Cecilia's mother is miserable in her marriage and life, she seems determined to suck every ounce of happiness out of Cecilia's by forcing Horace, the disgusting slug, upon her as a betrothed, forbid her to visit with her brother the earl and his wife, Amelia, and generally be a pain in the butt.Luckily, Cecilia, while respectful of her mother's wishes and cognizant of trying not to betray her, has a backbone and dreams of something more. She dreams of something more with support of her brother Conrad, sister in law Amelia, and father and therefore finds the backbone to follow her dreams and enjoy the company of a Mr Radcliff.I thought Mr Radcliff's outbursts of rage against those who demonstrated the least bit of impropriety was adorable and I am so glad he had that crazy, endearing, smart uncle Percy.If you haven't read a Ruth Hartman novel yet, and adore sweet romances, regency romances, etc., then I suggest you pick one up pronto! From her contemporary romances to her regency romances, they're always a good read with a sweet romance and a wonderful escape for a few hours!

All of the reviews are absolutely correct. Exciting, fast paced, fascinating, thrilling, informative, inventive, and full of  suspense. Thought provoking. A definite must read for all.Nothing else to say, for these words says it all. And, as someone once said, "just because you can, does not mean you should," most certainly comes to mind.I recommend it to all. The author, J.A. Schneider has done a great job, capturing all that I've mentioned. Superb!Kh

Who wouldn't want the ability to be a super hero? That is what Gwen Maule gets although not by choice. I loved this heroine who is so human and flawed, fragile and strong. The setting and timeframe revolving around the recent vote in Scotland make this urban fantasy feel attainable, possible, and close. I hope the next book has a touch of romance in it with Taog and Gwen has a job and finds her place as Edinburgh's superhero!

Risha, left as an orphan and having to survive on her own, and without a home, too, sets out on the journey. Her hope is to find a family member mentioned in her father's written tale. She joins the travelling traders who come but once per year. Along her adventures, she slowly discovers there are many things that she didn't know about her father and herself. In fact, Risha discovers that her self-contained father was not who she had believed he was. And she is determined, more than ever, to find the answers to her new questions and learn all there is to know.Her travels are filled with dangers. She meets a number of key people who knows, not only of her father, but her as well. People who hold mysterious information pertinent to knowing her background, information her father has never shared with her.An excellent tale that kept me riveted to the book. I look forward to reading more in this series.~KHH

This serial is hot. I love that there is something new every two weeks and that we're finally getting glimpses of Grace's past and what it's like to be Vaughn Asher. After cancelling on their Twitter date, Vaughn has been quiet for two weeks. Two agonizing weeks while Grace is helping to plan the wedding of Kristi-the-future-Mrs.Blazen.There's heart break, there's angst, there's some weird stranger who is very protective of Grace, there's super hot chemistry, there's an argument, there's reconciliation, only to have it all blow up...What is going on?! What's the truth behind Grace's past? How will Vaughn save her? How will Grace save him? Will they get their happily ever after? Argggghhhh...there are still THREE more books after you pick up this week's. I'm pre-ordering STATUS  today.

Disclaimer: I received an electronic copy of this book in exchange for an honest review."When a star about two or three times the size of our sun dies, it collapses until the entire mass of the star is concentrated at one point -- a singularity -- a black hole. As it's collapsing, it becomes denser and its gravitational attraction increases until nothing can escape its surface. In the case of the Earth, the escape velocity is seventeen-thousand miles an hour. But when the gravitational attraction is billions of times greater, the escape velocity exceeds the speed of light. Nothing can travel faster than light, so nothing can escape the surface of such an object. When the collapsing star reaches that size where its gravitational attraction is so great that nothing, not even light can escape, it's reached its Schwarzschild Radius."The above quote is from Joules, Rachel's BFF in the book. He describes what you're about to experience as you journey with Rachel on her quest to find her missing sister. This book will run you through emotion after emotion. Sorrow, fear, disgust, horror, sympathy, empathy, heartbreak, and bitter relief. I honestly had no idea what I was getting into when I agreed to review this book and it was quite the amazing surprise. Bit by bit, piece by piece, more and more is revealed, and more and more is appalling, and you will be holding your breath in anticipation, and fear, as to what could be revealed next.Rachel is one hell of a character. Brave, strong, determined, loyal, intelligent, gutsy...you can't help but admire her and and be envious of Olivia and the devotion and love her sister holds for her. Even if you're totally loved and adored by your family, Rachel's love is POWERFUL. And you will gasp and grip your kindle tightly as Florentin weaves this story around and around.An excellent read. I don't know if I could read it again as some descriptions were truly horrifying, but I'm glad I read it this time around. Definitely thrilling, definitely consuming, definitely a breath stealer and kindle bruiser.

Disclaimer: I received a review copy from the publisher in exchange for my honest review as follows.3.5, rounding to 4I was delighted to be offered a chance to read this book in exchange for a review. I've recently found a few books here and there that deal with reapers and have become more and more interested in this kind of storyline. Morbid? Perhaps. But I like that justice you see displayed and the compassion that often comes with it.This book is no different when you're at the reaping part. Aaron displays great compassion for the recently deceased and there is fear for those who have to go to the Darkness. But the main storyline focuses around the new soon-to-be reaper and all that she discovers about the current Grim Reaper, her best friend, etc.I think I am too old for this book and its demographic. While I enjoyed reading the novel, I tended to roll my eyes a lot especially when it came to one of her best friends and the fight ("If you don't know why I'm mad, then you're stupid!" etc.) or how Libbi's idea of fixing her best friend is to lie to him and tell him what he wants to hear or how, even after he causes her to get stitches from a display of violent temper, that violence is swept under the rug, especially when she learns about Aaron's past.  (Did you love that run-on? :D) I think I'm at the stage of my life where my tolerance for this is just absolutely gone.I am not a fan of Kyle: I found him manipulative, I disliked his tendency towards violence (doesn't matter he didn't mean to hurt HER, he meant to hurt someone), and disliked his woe-is-me crap.The ending could be termed a cliffhanger, but you could also read this as a standalone and fill in the "after" with your own imagination. If there's a second book for the "after", then hey! It was a cliffhanger! If not, then your imagination can take over.Thanks to Month9Books for the read!

Full Disclosure: I received a copy of this book via Netgalley and the Publisher in exchange for my honest review.In all honesty, I was expecting something fluffier of this novel despite the description. It's been my experience that historical fantasy romances (or romances in general) rarely tackle subjects like violence, politics, violence and oppression of women, all while spinning a tale that is quite romantic, even if it looks like it is undeserved, unrequited, and unwanted.AVERY does all of this.As you're introduced to the land of Kaya, you learn that their people die in pairs. You find a bondmate, your eyes change color indicating as such, you live in your bondmate's heart and he/she lives in yours. When your bondmate breathes his or her last breath, you will follow shortly thereafter. Death by broken heart indeed.Except...Ava doesn't.Ava's mate, Avery, dies in the attempt to assassinate their sworn enemy's, Pirenti, queen. But Ava does not perish. Instead she becomes a halfwalker, something to be shunned, something to be ridiculed, an abomination. Her sole purpose in a life now devoid of color, taste, laughter, contentment, is vengeance.Posing as a man, taking her bondmate's name, Ava becomes Avery. She is shot down out of the sky and taken prisoner by the enemy, doomed to a life in a horrid prison off the coast. The journey goes awry and a delicate friendship is formed between her and her captor.It's a sweeping story indeed. It follows the development of the friendship, the fragile tendrils of blossoming love, the hurt of rejection, and every time we move forward, something else is revealed.I truly enjoyed reading this book and watching as the power of conviction is changed, minds are broadened on both sides, love develops, understanding blossoms, betrayals are revealed, and solidarity is formed under the truth. The one thing I didn't like, which is kinda stupid, is that pegasus was (consistently) spelled as pegasis. I KNOW. Author's right to spell it how she wants, but since it is something that is in mythology and I've only been exposed to the "pegasus" spelling, it was something I found a touch distracting. It's a stupid thing, but I did promise to be honest, so there it is.Five stars and I will definitely be wanting to read on and will pick up THORNE, which is now available!

omfg it ends there?!?! gsyhxgfdsdhjvcfuknxsrol review to come. Jeez. Effing heck. I need more now! argh***********************************************Read through the KindleUnlimited program, so no idea if this shows up as a verified purchase or not.Um, WOW! So, one of my boyfriend's obsessions is the lore and myth behind the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse. While I've read a few books where they are the main characters or the main villain, my interest in the lore didn't really peak until he started telling me all about them. Passionate excitement about the lore got me going, I must admit. And I am SO glad it did. While FAMINE is a book I would've picked up anyway, I was more eager to do so because of this new fascination with the horsemen.Holy. Wow.First, I send you to my little statement above all the asterisks. (Edited for amazon review due to people's delicate sensibilities and inability to handle curse words.)Yes, this book leaves you JUST LIKE THAT. Precipice and everything as the characters are looking down over a cliff.Monica Enderle Pierce's writing immediately sucked me in. Without seeming like she was telling me every little detail of the scene, I indeed got a full picture, so vivid I could practically smell the squalor coming out of Matilde's miserable apartment in the Sixth Ward. My curiosity was held firmly by the author as she brings Bartholomew to Matilde by way of the murder of crows, beasts he depends on and loathes at the same time.Bartholomew has been searching for 1500 years for a vessel like Matilde. Unfortunately for her, this means that so has Famine and her cronies. Bartholomew (remind me never to name a kid or a dog that; I keep mistyping it) goes by Monsieur to protect his identity. Matilde only knows him as Monsieur despite her constant attempts to uncover who he is. If no one knows his full name and only knows him as Monsieur, then Famine has less of a chance of finding them while they are on the run.Pierce does a wonderful job of story-telling. From the beginning, you know who Famine is, that Monsieur is somehow enslaved by her, and that the Catcher wants Matilde. But you don't quite know the details and it's parceled out to you in delicious chomps.It's wonderful watching the relationship develop between Monsieur & Matilde, to see Mr Vernon & Mrs Henderson utterly accept Monsieur as he is and keep him ensconced in humanity.And I had to love listening to Monsieur as he tells Matilde things like:
"Hell and heaven are concepts created by men to frighten parishioners . . . because fear is profitable and faith has become a business. Frightened people will pay to have their sins absolved." He'd found deterioration in all of God's houses.
I care nothing for the fabrications of that book. Animals possess souls, and they can and do seek revenge.
He remarks on organized religion and teachings like this a couple of times and I kinda pumped my fist in the air with a FINALLY! YES! He isn't atheist, of course, as his fate is entwined with the Horseman and God's will. There is a God and there are the Horsemen and there is the Catcher, and the Beacon, and the Guardian, but no there aren't winged babies and this heaven/hell crap. I thought that was wonderful and it endeared Monsieur to me even more that he is willing to tell this to a child in such a matter of fact way.This book DOES evoke emotion. You think you're just happy getting the tale, but Pierce writes Matilde so appropriate for her age as she grows from an 8 year old to a pre-teen to an adolescent on the cusp of womanhood. While some readers may get annoyed with Monsieur, I found myself snarling at a petulant effing teenager who was grating on my nerves for her lack of respect, tone of voice, and utter lack of gratitude towards a man who, while he may not be forthcoming with hugs, took her out of the slums and is raising her to be a lady of means. While he had selfish reasons, too, and the pull of the Catcher, and of course Matilde will never have a normal life, he is caring for her, teaching her, arming her for her fate. So yeah, the teenage years bugged the hell out of me.While I might say it often when I read a good book, I know that this one is one that will stick with me and I'll be turning over and over in my head as I wait for the next installment. I can only hope that Monica Enderle Pierce is a fast writer. And I hope it's a short series of books of this length that totally enthrall and mesmerize you. While she could stretch it out to the end of days, I'm hoping that is not the case and I will soon be treated to the ending of this story. I would love to meet some of the contacts, see how Thomas Green is doing, and what role the Greens will have to play.I hope I didn't give you any spoilers and I hope you do read this. It was wonderfully crafted! And now I need to order a print copy as I definitely need to reread this one.

Disclaimer: I received a copy of the book as a part of this tour in exchange for an honest review.Much like book one, Garden of Eden, this book is very fast paced, with plenty of interaction between Eden and her fellow prisoners. Eden is learning to manipulate her magic while she and her friends uncover more of the Council's, and the island's, secrets.I'm enjoying the characters and the pace of these books, however I'm also frustrated as there are NO answers and tons of ambiguity. And just as you think you're getting somewhere, it leaves off, making you wait for another installment.Included in this book is a novella, which I enjoyed very much and would actually rate a star higher than the novel itself. I realize that my review this time around is more vague than ever, however, considering the length of this novel and how quickly you will be tugged in for the ride, I think it is better to keep story elements out of my review! I do think any reader will be fascinated with Eden's growth, will adore Liddon, and will desperately be trying to put together the puzzles pieces as we've received them so far!

Disclaimer: I received an early copy in exchange for an honest review; I also pre-ordered and purchased my own copy hence the verified purchase review!I normally am not a fan of serials. There are very, VERY few authors whom I will happily wait for when it comes to serials. I usually will just refuse to read and wait until the series is over and then snag them all up at once, or hopefully in an omnibus. JA Huss is one of those authors I'm willing to wait for. And apparently she understands and is sympathetic towards the wait and these puppies are rolling out every TWO weeks. Hello, gorgeous!So we left off in FOLLOW with Grace running away from Vaughn and his NDA, and running home towards her new job. She is mortified to discover that he is now following her @FilthyBlueBird account. We pick up with Grace confronting Vaughn about his tweets on her account. I found Grace's reactions adorable and relatable. She's mortified, titillated, tempted, and drooling. And I really liked Vaughn's reaction, too. Here is someone who normally doesn't fit into his use'em-and-leave'em NDA agreements, but he wants her badly and needs her to sign that NDA. His approach to her bank account and that hack to Starbucks may seem overbearing and controlling, but I thought it was sweet and one of those "it is what it is" situations. I mean, he has a point, right? Why do you work? To keep a rough over your head, food in your belly, and to be able to buy things. So, here is a simple way for me to take care of you. I'm on board with this. If I had a ton of money, I'd do that for someone I cared about to...oh wait, did I give it away? Nah, Vaughn gives himself away. Has he done this for other NDA girls? Yeah, I don't think so.So there are grand gestures in this installment, some honest yet brief conversations, and a rather decadent, indecent, delicious dinner together. Will Grace sign that NDA or what? Vaughn works hard to convince her to do so while he is internally puzzling out what makes Grace tick.But Vaughn is on to something here...there is something in Grace's past that makes her retreat into her twitter persona. Everyone has a dirty inner self, don't we? That's why there are fantasies, porn, and erotica, no? So you could argue that Grace is just letting her inner filthy bluebird out...but what's she hiding? I can't wait to read on and find out!

A lot flimsier than I expected. The plastic is thin, two arrived with cracks in the plastic already (not yet broken, but I can tell they will snap fast because of those cracks. And no, it isn't part of the "plastic process" or "tortoise shell" design.) The spring is flimsy. I don't see these lasting long, which is a shame as it's from one of the hair accessories brands I actually look for. But hey, what do you expect for under $4 for 3 of them, right?Edit 9/30/2014 -- Surprisingly, despite the crack in 2 of the 3 clips, these have not busted yet. They felt flimsy and don't have that strong claw grip from previous jaw clips, but they haven't snapped. The design doesn't work well with how I normally use these clips, but they DO get my hair out of my face and they haven't broken yet, so I'm upgrading from 3 to 4 stars.

VERY Soft and acrylic so easy washing. Knitting with it now. The threads do seem to unravel a bit with that first row when you're casting on and knitting that first row, but this happens with a lot of yarns so I'm not fazed by it.Super soft, tons of yardage, this is going to make excellent baby gifts for my soon-to-be niece!

Bought this one specifically for the Fishy pattern. Gonna make it as a Xmas gift. I hope one skein is enough because it seems small, but we shall see! :DSoft feel, better coloring than the photo shows!

Really big for my hand, but I can rest my hand fine and the long buttons are still clickable.  I like controlling the dpi and it's comfortable despite its large size. "claw" like grip, light constantly changes color, comfy!

Dog barrettes are not easy to find. I hope this whole canister lasts us a while because I so rarely find them! As it was, there were only 2 left in stock when I purchased. These are absolutely perfect. The clips are sturdy little spring clips and gather just the right amount of hair to keep the hair out of my dogs' eyes and they both look adorable in their bows. Would love if they came in more colors and patterns!
These are always a favorite in our house. Our dogs will do ANYTHING for a greenie!
Perfect! I thought these were going to be larger, but they're the perfect size. Included plastic ware isn't bad either!

Very much a fun book, about these two, thirty something women, who are the very best of friends in the world. Their enviable friendship is a part of this Christian based novel, without aggressive preaching.The two women, Sue Jan, and Lovita, inadvertently gets themselves involved in catching some crooks against our country. And along the way, learns more about one another's inner tickings, gluing their already very close friendship.Also,  learns why they love their life in this small town of Wichita, and of the world that the God has created.Life's difficult and painful moments are dealt by the two are not only inspiring, but hilarious. What I came away from this book is, that life isn't just about smugness, and drudge. It's all in how you chooses to look at all of it. Most importantly, whatever it is that arises in life, it is only temporary. It shall pass. Therefore, the best thing to do is to leave it all up to its creator, and face it with humor, and do the best you can.Both characters are inimitable, and unique in every way. This makes them not only beautiful, but enviable.Get the book and read it. They'll be glad you did.By kh

Disclaimer: I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review as follows.Time is a river. Such a beautiful thought when you start to think about ebb and flow, deltas, banks, etc. When I first started reading this book, the first thing that came to mind was submersion. Jason Gurley's words, narrative voice, descriptions, etc., just completely submersed me in water. Fitting as we start with the first Eleanor, sitting in her breakfast nook, contemplating her swim and the rain.I admit, I was really mad at Eleanor's decision. I almost put the book down, unwilling to read further, but I kind of got sucked in by the writing. And I'm glad I continued.The repercussions of one decision seem to shape the event of things to come and how everyone reacts to certain things. While I had sympathy for the twins' parents, there was also this sense of rage that I had for the grandmother, too. And all of my sympathy went to Eleanor. No child should have to shoulder that kind of burden. And yet, how wonderful, too, that there is this rift for her.I don't want to give too much away, but if you're in the mood for a novel where the writing pulls you in, the characters tug on your emotions, and a touch of whimsy and what if, I'd urge you to pick up Eleanor.

Thoroughly enjoyed it. A rare thing, of recent, when there are numerous amounts of e-books that are published by so many "authors."  Some, such as this author: Heidi Willard, are exceptional. There are many however, not in the least.  Not all are as talented, or gifted in writing an entertaining novel with the good research to back it up. My personal opinion is, if you are writing a historically based info book, at least get the correct facts to support the theme. Makes it more entertaining, educational, and credible. H. W. n my opinion has done just that.I expect, and look forward to, the remainder of the series. Also expect all of them to be just as well written as the BG#1, if not more.I will bet that she will exceed my expectations. Hope so.I cannot imagine anyone writing a good novel in 20 days. However, if one has it all together, I suppose it's possible.I am imagining that the two protagonists will gradually become romantically involved. How can it not? Looking forward to reading all of their adventures together.I also expect more revealing of the Will 's past. Having lived so many years, he must have enormously interesting tales of his past life. Also, looking forward to Violet's upcoming growth in her own experiences with Will.Not being a prude or anything, but I am glad that the author's editor convinced HW to drop the too racy parts. And toned it down to keep it all old fashioned romancing. It keeps better with the period.  That would have deterred me from reading it. My daughter wouldn't mind, but I'm older and that's not for me.I would recommend this book to everyone. I think it's a great read. You'll be hooked til the end, and look forward to more.Review by KHH

Full Disclosure: I received an electronic copy of this book in exchange for my honest review. As follows:I adored this book. I thought it was quirky, cute, sweet, and I loved how it was contemporary with a touch of fantasy. A tooth fairy falling for her dentist? A dentist falling for a tooth fairy? Seriously, such a cute concept and I loved how shy both of these characters were. The take-charge sister and mother were adorable and I loved how they got involved as soon as they heard the doctor mention her name. There is an evil, nasty woman in the shape of Korkie and really...I've met people like that. Rude, delusional, and just nasty. She doesn't really get her comeuppance, but instead it's a touch more realistic with what happens to her. This was just fine with me!Ms Hartman knows how to write those romances that make you sigh with contentment, wistfulness, and happiness. And I love the cats that show up in her books as well!

Disclosure: I received a copy of this book in exchange for my honest review.No stranger to Lia Davis's other books, I happily jumped at the chance to read this novella that deals with the relationship between Artemis and Evangelos.Recently learning that her soulmate is NOT dead and instead was banished to Earth, Artemis is given the task of delivering a message to her stepmother from her father, Zeus. In exchange, Zeus will restore Evangelos as a god, allowing Artemis and Evangelos to be together once more.For a short novella, this story had plenty of emotion and action. It can definitely be read as standalone as that is how I approached it, having not read the other books in the series. With some tense moments and bits of action, this was a fun, well-paced novella. Fans of Ms Davis will not be disappointed! I will be looking into the other books in this series to learn more about Ash and the other characters!

Mosquitos hate citronella. For years we've been spraying ourselves with chemicals that yield little to no results, leave us smelling awful and needing to strip down and bathe before we can touch basically anything.This product is brilliantly simple - it's a neoprene bracelet with a little compartment that houses a citronella disc. I live in the upper midwest where the mosquitoes are coined our "state bird". This product definitely lessened their effects while out and about. I won't say it eliminated them completely but nothing does, and compared to spraying awful chemicals on myself this one really held its own without the mess. I'll be reaching for this in the future over my can of spray. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

If you spend any amount of time on the internet you quickly find yourself needing more passwords than you could possibly remember. Every website has different requirements for length, characters, capitalization, etc. and it is advised that you not use the same password twice. I find it difficult to not only remember all of these different passwords but to keep coming up with secure, unique passwords.This journal takes all of the work out of it. Each page has a grid of characters that looks much like a word find, and you assign each website to its own page. You can use the pen/light method to draw a line across the characters that create your password but I felt it was more secure to come up with a pattern in my mind that I would take characters from and use as my passwords (ie: you can go down the left side on all pages and use these characters). Regardless of how you choose to do it, this book keeps everything organized and secure. I highly recommend it for anyone struggling with too many passwords and/or passwords that aren't very secure. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

Prior to ordering this product I had never used a mud mask before so I wasn't sure what to expect. The idea of using something that's 100% natural vs. laden with chemicals (especially acne products) really appealed to me so I was excited to give this mask a try.This mask was incredibly easy to apply. My favorite cutting boards are those plasticy boards you can buy at big box retailers in a 4 pack for around $6. They're not without their shortcomings though: they warp easily (especially in the dishwasher), they tend to slide around on the counter and I consider them to be semi-disposable because they wear out sooner rather than later. For the price, however, I felt like I couldn't complain.These cutting boards totally blow those out of the water. In this set you get two cutting boards (one regular and one mini). The big mat is great for cutting larger things like big cuts of meat, large veggies, etc. and the mini mat is perfect for smaller veggies and dicing.The "self healing" property isn't 100% - once there's a cut in these mats you will always see it to a degree but the severity of it does lessen. I've ran these through the dishwasher a few times and have had no warping/bending/deforming with either mat. I love that they are flexible like my cheapo big box retailer mats but these ones are thicker, durable, and they stay put on my counter. As of now I've tossed all of my cheap mats and intend to just stick with these. Some things are worth paying for and these definitely are. Highly recommended, great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

I'm a frequent use of an epilator. If you're not sure what this is, it's basically an electronic device which removes hair by tweezing with many tweezers at once on a roller (it's a lot less scary than it sounds, I promise!). Anyway, with this type of hair removal one is prone to ingrown hairs... the best way to combat ingrown hairs is to exfoliate, exfoliate, exfoliate!That's where this brush comes in. I've used several body brushes over the years and the things I like about this one are:-The curved handle (it really does help get a good angle on things!)-The fullness & coarseness of the bristles (perfect for legs!)-The hanging loop (handy for hanging up in the bathroom!)This is one of the nicer brushes I've used. The brush head is adequately sized for larger areas and the bristles are just right for exfoliating. The brush is well made and I expect it to last just as long as the pricier brushes I've used. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

The premise of this game is simple: count down from 60-1, circling each number as you find it on the sheet. But be quick! The game is "designed" for 2-10 players but you can really play with any number of people... even alone if you want to try to beat your own time. I'm a numbers geek and this game is right up my alley. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this changing set to keep in my vehicle for those days when we just need to run a quick errand and don't feel like lugging around a big diaper bag.In this set you will find a generously sized changing mat and an awesome wipe holder (and I mean awesome - the only place I've been able to find these is by Huggies, full of Huggies wipes which we are not fans of at all). I'm not a wine connoisseur by any means but I do enjoy an occasional glass (or three if the day's events warrant it!). I've been hearing great things about aerating wine for a while now so I was excited to try it for myself.This product works exactly as expected -  aerating infuses oxygen into the wine as it's being poured which, by some type of sorcery makes the wine more fragrant and flavorful. Yeah, I was a skeptic but now I'm a believer. Try a glass of non-aerated wine next to a glass of wine poured through this pourer and you will notice a substantial difference in the richness and fullness of flavors in your wine. It's not just for high end wine either... I put Arbor Mist (don't judge me!) through the aerator and it intensified the flavor of it as well.If you enjoy wine and want to get more out of your bottle, this product is a no-brainer. Highly recommended, great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

One of my favorite features of my new Galaxy S6 (over my old Galaxy S3) is the quick charge technology. When they say quick, they're not kidding! The only caveat is the expense of cords. I try to drink a considerable amount of water daily and with a toddler running around I've ditched the cups and resorted to using bottles. I love to have my water icy cold and my biggest gripe with most bottles is that they sweat like crazy and get condensation all over everything. Many of the double walled bottles I've looked are smaller in size and I don't have time to be refilling my bottle multiple times per day.This 25oz double wall insulated bottle is the best of both worlds. It's a larger size, it doesn't sweat, it's stainless steel (which is highly recommended over even BPA free plastic). It's easy to fill and my water stays cold in it for far longer than in a single wall bottle. When using the included pouch (which is a made of a neoprene material and is quite sturdy) the water stays cold even longer! This is great for tossing over my shoulder when running out the door.This set is great for anyone looking for a decently sized, sweat-free, icy cold beverage that's easily transportable. No leaks, no sweat, no problems! Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

This is a great all-purpose server. The size of it is appropriate for pie but I love using it for pizza as well. It would also be great for cake and I intend to use it for just that the next time I bake one.The server itself is lightweight yet sturdy and the serving portion can handle heavy food items without an issue. This is one of those products you never realize you need until you own one. I was fine with just laying my phone on my desk. Yeah, the weight and pull of the cord while having it plugged in caused it to rotate around on my desk. And I'd have to either pick it up or rotate it back and lean over so I could view the screen properly every time I wanted to use it. But I was doing ok.Then this product graced my desk. It's a simple concept: a metal stand designed to A: hold your phone at the ideal viewing angle and B: Keep your phone in place while plugged into the charger. This stand really has one job and it does it well: it holds my phone, perfectly in place at just the right angle so it can be viewed and used. There's an opening for the cord to be threaded through, a lip on the stand portion that keeps my phone in place and a back rest to keep it at just the right angle. I can turn the screen on and have full use of my phone without having to pick it up or fight with the cord and rotating issues. The stand is heavy enough to handle the job but not any heavier than it needs to be. It's large enough to cradle a phone properly but not so large that it's cumbersome. It really is perfect.Sometimes the simplest concepts create the largest amounts of convenience, and that's exactly what this product does. Great product, highly recommended for anyone who spends any amount of time at a desk and wants/needs their phone to be fully accessible. Highly recommended, great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this set for use with my Samsung Galaxy S6 phone. Looking to add a bit of dimension to my photos, I was really excited to try this product.This set comes with three lenses: a fish-eye, a wide angle, and a macro. The lenses screw easily onto the clip and the clip attaches easily to any phone. The lenses are great quality-wise and the included storage bag is handy for transporting and storage, keeping them free of dust and/or potential damage.My only gripe with this style of lens is that the other side of the "clothespin" style clip presses down on my screen. It doesn't press hard enough to damage anything in my opinion but it does partially obstruct your screen. On a phone where the camera is located on the corner I would expect it to press down on the outer edge instead of the screen. I still use this product on my S6 and am not worried about screen damage, but thought it was worth mentioning.Overall I'm really pleased with this lens. If you're looking to add some fun options to your standard phone pics, I highly recommend it. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

I ordered this product to use on achy muscles after working out or just at the end of a long day. I've used other products (ie: IcyHot) with varying success. What makes this product great:-The consistency is just right: thick but not too thick.-The scent is wonderful. It's best described as a menthol-citrus scent.-The product goes to work immediately, bringing relief to tired muscles.I'd say this product holds its own against the competition. The 4oz jar is a generous amount that will last a good long time. All in all a great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

These parent-powered nasal aspirators beat those old school bulb syringes out of the water. We bought a NoseFrida shortly after my son was born and promptly threw the bulb syringe in the trash. With this method you can get much better suction and in the exact amount you need in order to effectively clean baby's airway. My son is 18 months old now and we've used a few different brands now, each having its own pros and cons.What makes the BabyBubz aspirator great:-This is the first one I've used that is designed with two tubes and a collection container. This is ingenious! Mucus travels from the nose into the chamber and has no chance whatsoever of coming up the other tube (with the Nosefrida there is a filter in place but if baby is particularly stuffed up things can and will reach the filter, which they then advise you replace, and replacement filters aren't free!).-The shape of the end that goes into the nose is really unique. It's tapered to fit just inside the nose but is designed to prevent you from inserting too far. We found the shape of this one to be great for getting a good seal in the nostril without it going too far into my little guy's nose.Overall I'm really impressed with this product. It's easy to take apart and clean, works well, and like I said there is zero chance of anything you remove from baby's nose getting anywhere near you. Highly recommended, great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

This phone holder is awesome. I recently upgraded from a Galaxy S3 to an S6 and previously used a Runtastic phone case to hold my phone on my bicycle. This case irritated me for several reasons: it was expensive, I had to remove my phone from its case to fit it inside the Runtastic, and the sliding "lock" would unlock itself on bumpy trails so I had to keep a rubber band around it to make sure it didn't come open and toss my caseless phone on the pavement.So with that, I was a bit weary about another phone holder. Would it hold my phone securely? Would my phone fit while inside its case?Yes, and yes! This case holds my S6 perfectly while inside a pretty bulky Otterbox. The side arms have a multitude of "clicking" positions so they can provide a customized fit for just about any phone. The single tab on the bottom that braces the phone is adequate and allows the charging port and microphone to be completely unobstructed.I've taken this holder over some pretty rough terrain and my phone has stayed put. This is easy to install, easy to use, and works perfectly. It's everything I could hope for in a phone mount. Highly recommended, great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

We ordered a Knot Theory silicone ring for my husband a few months back and have been extremely happy with it so I was pretty excited to see the company offering womens' rings as well.My first impression of this ring was mostly a positive one: the color is gorgeous (maybe a touch less bright than the stock photo but not too far off) and the smaller dimensions are just what I wanted (the men's rings are primarily large and too thick for my comfort).When I put the ring on I was a bit concerned about the thinness of it. Don't get me wrong, it's not *too* thin - but it's quite a bit thinner than the men's rings and I questioned its durability for this reason. Well, I have an 18 month old who took an interest in it as soon as I put it on. He has tried to pull it off of my finger many, many times and the ring has held up beautifully. No rips, no tears, no signs of any damage whatsoever.I can't say enough good things about this ring. If you work with your hands in an environment where a traditional metal ring poses a safety hazard, or if (like me) you have a little one and don't want your ring scratching them, I highly recommend this product. It's so nice to be able to wear something in place of my wedding ring that won't scratch my little guy. Great product!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

My son has several smaller bath toys (ie: foam letters, little floating whatnots, etc.) that I wanted to keep from taking over my bathroom while still allowing them to dry properly. This hanging organizer is great - the front and top portion are mostly made of a heavy duty neoprene (which does not hold water). The "window" and back are a mesh material that allows air flow for proper drying. The neoprene gives the organizer stability without impeding the toys' ability to dry. The top portion has two heavy duty grommets for hooking the suction cups through. The organizer is roomy, durable, and just what I was looking for.The suction cup hooks, on the other hand, leave a lot to be desired. Out of the package one of them broke on me (a plastic pin came out that I was able to replace but I'm nervous that it could pop out again and pose a choking hazard). The hooks don't suction overly well to my tile shower either, but I imagine they'd do a lot better on a completely smooth shower wall. For now I'm using hooks I had on hand from another product and will probably just dispose of the included hooks. The organizer itself is worth the price... just expect to purchase a better set of hooks separately.I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

These wraps are great. I ordered a couple packs of wraps from this company and they are consistent in quality. These wraps come individually packaged and are folded up neatly inside. We use carabiners for so many things: keychains, attaching items to backpacks, bags, purses, etc. This set is great for a few reasons:-Multiple sizes: I love the variety of sizes offered here.-Twist-lock style closure: Unlike the standalone spring hinge of so many carabiners, these have the added security of a twist lock. This is a wonderful set. These teethers aren't like anything I've seen before... they're a flexible silicone but are actually on the thinner side. Full disclosure: when I got the package I was surprised by how thin they are so I wanted to make sure my son wouldn't be able to bite through one and have it pose a choking hazard. I've been using wool dryer balls for a couple years now. Prior to wool I used to use those As Seen on TV blue rubber balls with the little nubs all over them. The various attachments are simple to clean and have not dulled in performance after several uses. If you're looking for a quicker, easier way to achieve a professional looking manicure I can't recommend this product enough. Great set!I received this product at a discounted price for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

So I'm one of those people who had a "bladder of steel." I could go all day if I wanted to... never an issue, never an accident. My pelvic floor muscles were perfect. Then I had a baby, and oh how cruel mother nature can be. Despite doing the recommended kegel exercises (which I've always found to be an icky sensation and loathed doing them) my pelvic floor muscles became just another casualty of the miracle of birth.This product appealed to me for a number of reasons: as someone who is no stranger to the gym and has a firm grasp on how the muscles in our bodies work and what needs to be done to improve their strength, learning of this product was a "duh" moment for me. Doing "kegels" as described by doctors and mommy friends is basically like lifting weights with no weights and expecting your muscles to respond. Sure, resistance training has its place but not here. I know kegels can be effective for some but I was looking for better, quicker results. A recommendation from a close personal friend who has had success with this type of product and the opportunity to order a complimentary set finally pushed me over the edge and I was willing to give it a try.In this kit you will find six weights that get progressively heavier. You are advised to start with the lightest weight and if you are able to hold it in place for two minutes you can move on to the next weight. Honestly, I had a hard time with the lightest weight. My pelvic floor muscles are a mess. After diligently using the first weight as best as I could, once per day for 15 minutes at a time, I began seeing results in just a few days.I'm now on the second weight and I can feel a difference in the strength of my body in holding the weight in place. These weights give your muscles a reason to flex instead of just flexing against nothing so at least for me they eliminate that icky, uncomfortable feeling I get from just doing "air kegels". The weights are all exactly the same size so once you get used to them you don't have to keep getting used to a new size as you move up to heavier weights.I would highly recommend this set to anyone looking to work on their pelvic floor muscles, for whatever reason. Amazing product!I received a complimentary unit of this product for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

The sound quality is surprisingly decent and the controls allow me to skip through music and adjust the volume effortlessly. Great product!I received a complimentary unit of this product for the purpose of evaluating and providing an honest and unbiased review.

I use tongs for everything from salads, to flipping bacon while it is cooking. And I love silicone tongs because they can be used on any type of surface with no worries of scratching things. It came time for a new shower curtain and I noticed it was also time for new rings. I decided on these since they are stainless steal and have the beads on them. 6:44 MinsI am new to using a electric deep fryer but not new to frying. I normally use a cast iron pot and although it works great I wanted something bigger and something with baskets. So getting this is a real treat for me.It comes with 3 baskets, 1 large basket and 2 smaller baskets. You can either use the large one alone or use both of the smaller ones at the same time. It also comes with 2 removable handles for the baskets. The lid has a window to look through and also a filter to help reduce the frying smell.The plug goes into the back and is magnetic, that was kind of weird and I kept thinking it wasn't plugged in properly but it was.Before getting started I washed the unit and baskets out with some hot water with mild soap. I also made sure everything was dry before adding the oil.Ok so after I added the oil I was super excited to get started so I read the manual that came with it and umm had no clue how to get things started. They are very vague on how to get it going. But with some playing around I figured it out.Plug it in, hit the power button, hit the select button, then the +or- button to adjust the temperature you are wanting. Then hit the select button again to select the duration time, then hit the power button again. Now the duration time goes up to 99 minutes and once that time is up the fryer turns off automatically. It's a great safety feature unless you need more time to fry what you want, then you need to start that process over. But as long as you do it fairly quick the temperature stays. I know it all sounds daunting but it's a breeze once you do it a couple of times.Also when you turn the unit on and get it set the red power light will turn on and once it gets to the temperature you want it will turn to a green light.It does take the unit a while to get up to the temperature but once it does it keeps it's temperature really well. The light will cycle back and forth from green to red, that is normal, it is just doing it's job to maintain the temperature.  It was really great to not worry about me trying to maintain the temperature myself and have the unit do it for me. The unit is stainless steel and does get hot to the touch except for the handles and around the bottom. So you are able to move it around if needed when it is hot. Cool down does take a long time as well.The lid can be put on when the baskets are in the oil, there are slots on it to let the handles through. But for me I prefer to watch my food cooking so I do leave the lid off until I am done using it.I like how well the baskets are made, they do great in the hot oil and are easy to clean up. The tank can also be removed for easy cleaning.Storage is pretty nice, you can fit all 3 baskets and the handles in the tank once emptied for safe keeping.Over all I am very pleased with my first electric fryer and look forward to frying up things more often.I received this product at a discount in exchange for an honest and unbiased review.

This is a really pretty tea light holder. I love the design and when lit at night it cast really cool butterfly shadows on all sides.It is on the small side. What a great dog leash to have when you need to walk the pooch at night. No more carrying a flashlight and fumbling around with it. This doll house is pretty neat. I got it for my 10 year old and she loves it. This is a really great Pencil holder. It can hold up to 48 pencils, how great is that. It is one of the largest that I have seen.The canvas is a perfect fabric for housing pencils. 1:55 Mins I am not one to carry a purse and I have tried all kinds of different wallets but most are just to bulky to fit in my pocket. This leather case has solved my problems. When I do my nails I want them to last as long as possible so I use a top coat to help protect the polish.  This top coat does help. It is easy to apply and I apply a thin coat so it doesn't take for ever to dry. There is a slight shine to it but nothing spectacular.As for how well it works. Well for me it worked as good as any other top coat I have used. I use a good quality nail polish to start with and I make sure that they are very dry before I apply any top coat. It went on with no problems, I did not have any streaking of color and there was no tackiness once dry. It left my nails feeling and looking smooth. It took about 6 days before my nails starting chipping. I see the word Gel being used with this top coat but it is not a gel, it is just a regular top coat, nothing fancy about it, it's the same as what you can buy anywhere. I think maybe the wording in the description is misleading and causing some confusion. That being said, it's a basic topcoat, it works and does as a topcoat should do.I received this at a discounted rate in exchange for my honest review.

Living in Western PA we tend to get a lot of snow and frost on our windshields and having to clean or scrap it in the morning is a pain in the butt. And then in the summer of course we get lots of sun and having a black car with black interior means it gets really hot inside.Well now with this dual windshield cover I have 1 item to help with both seasons. How cool is that. I no longer dread the seasons.I have a Honda Fit and this fit it nicely. I was able to put in on myself which is a great bonus. What I did was take the widest end and put that on the top of the windshield. I then tucked the flap into the door, closed the door and poof that side was done. Now there are 4 magnets on the cover, 2 on the top of it just before the flaps that tuck in the door and 2 at the bottom of the cover. So as I walked to the other side of the car I made sure the 2 magnets on that side were in a good spot. Then I repeated the process on the other side. That's it. I would have like a couple of more magnets due to windy conditions out here, but so far it seems to be staying in place.And with it being made of polyester it means easy cleaning. I just hose it down or wipe it down with a cloth. It folds up nice and small and comes with a case to keep it in.I received this at no charge in exchange for my honest review.

I don't ever play CD's anymore so this is a great way to hold my phone. I have a Galaxy S3 and it fits in this pretty good. Over all I am pleased with this holder and it now has a permanent spot in my car.I did receive this at no charge in exchange for my honest review.

This clipper is really good. I like that it came in a nice box that is great for gifting. Would make a good stocking stuffer. These are a perfect fit for my husband and myself. We love the variety that the set has and they are cute. There are enough different designs and colors to satisfy us both. We use a lot of water bottles in our house. We use them when bike riding, camping hiking or just going to the park. That being said we can never have enough.I like this stainless steel water bottle. Living in Western PA means lots of snow and lots of frozen slippery ground. I am not a huge fan of boots and wear sneakers even in the winter and of course that means no traction on ice or snow. It is also cool looking.It was easy enough to attach to the bar right under the bike seat, all I had to do was remove the screw, place it on the pole then replace and tighten the screw back up. It can be a solid laser or flashing laser.The second button is for the main light unit.  There is a solid light then multiply flashing options.I really like the blue color, it's different for sure. And I like that it's on the bigger size. It's easier for me to operate it and I feel like it gives good coverage behind me. Over all I am pleased with this bike tail light. It's also fun to use when walking out in the dark.Product received at no charge in exchange for my honest review.

These are actually pretty cute. I have very dry feet all year long so I am always trying new creams, scrubs, and such to see what will help.Now as far as the ingredient list goes, the scrub is full of natural ingredients and I do love that fact. And it is not tested on animals. I do have to warn that the scent of lemongrass is very strong so if you have a sensitive nose this may not be the scrub for you. It is a easy to use tube all it takes is a simple squeeze and out comes the scrub.As per the directions I soaked my feet first for about 10 minutes to make sure the skin was soft enough to help the scrub do it's job. I then applied a liberal amount of the scrub onto my feet and let that sit for about 10 minutes. I then took a warm wash cloth and rubbed off the excess scrub. I do not have their foot cream so I did not follow up with any lotion afterwards. Yes my feet felt good after the scrub. My skin felt soft and I do believe it helped remove some of the dead skin I had. No it did not remove my calluses but it helped them some. I felt that I would need to use this on a regular basis to have it really make a difference. So far I have remembered to use it about 4 times in the past couple of weeks and the results are the same. My feet are happier then when I didn't use anything, but I feel they would be happier if I remembered to use it more often. Is it better then others? I don't know I haven't used others. Does it help? Yes is seems to help but it is by no means a miracle cure for calluses, or major dry feet. Who knows maybe using a lotion afterwards would help a lot. Over all I am happy with the results I have gotten and will continue to use it when I remember.Product provided for testing and reviewing purposes.

1:21 MinsI have never tried nail scissors. Mainly because the thought of using them is scary. But I have used regular scissors to cut my nails in the past when I couldn't find clippers. The handles are large enough to get a sturdy grip, and have a plastic coating to help keep your hands from hurting. The main parts of the scissors are stainless steal. And since they do make such a clean cut there is no need to file the toenails after cutting them.Once I got over my fair of using them and getting use to them I am very happy to have these for my nail care.Product provided for testing and reviewing purposes.

2:32 MinsThis is the first juicer I have owned and I am in love with it. And it has some weight to it. It's not a flimsy juicer that is for sure.It is nice and solid. Is stainless steel and the handles are silicone covered. The handles are large enough to help get a good grip on them and they do not hurt my hands when using.I am not sure why they say lemon and lime juicer, I used it for an orange and it worked awesome. And this juicer is plenty big to do a grapefruit even. I did not fight at all to squeeze all the juice out. I was actually able to do it one handed. The design, and weight of it make it so easy to use. There were no seeds or pulp in my orange juice either and for me that is a good thing since I hate pulp. And I truly love that juice does not going flying everywhere.Now when I first looked at the juicer I thought, how the heck is this going to work. Normally you would have the lump of the juicer go into the inside of the fruit, or at least that is what I always thought. But that would have not worked since it would have covered the holes and there for preventing the juice from getting through. So once I figured out that I was wrong on how to use it all was good. So what I did was cut the orange in half, placed it face down in the juicer and squeezed. That was it, simple as that. And then I drank my fresh squeezed orange juice.It was easy to clean, I just washed it off with a soapy towel and rinsed. I personally will not put this in the dishwasher.To me this is a must have juicer in my kitchen and now that I have it I plan on juicing things more often.Product provided at a discounted price for testing and reviewing purposes.

With a family of 4 who all have electronics of some sort I am always looking for ways to set up charging stations though out the house.I like that this plugs straight into the wall outlet. It's not super huge though, it's actually on the smaller side for a 4 port plug. I have not had any issues of over heating of anything. Everything charges as it should with no issues. After seeing these books pop up in my Goodreads friends notifications for a while, I decided to finally take the Lux series for a spin.  I was forewarned that this series was very similar to Twilight, so I was a little apprehensive since I didn't really think much of that one (no offense to Twihards),  but I enjoyed this quite a bit more.  Sure, you've got a teen moving to a small town who just so happens to run into a group of students in her new school who possess an otherworldly beauty and mystique, and then she's in grave danger and the hottest one of all happens to save her with superhuman abilities, but that's where the similarities ended for me.I actually enjoy Daemon and Katy as our hero and heroine though  I honestly didn't feel like too much happened in this book. I think we were settling into the world and the characters.  I find it very amusing that Katy's a book reviewer and blogger.  The jokes surrounding her hobby are very funny, probably because it makes her completely relatable as a book reviewer/blogger myself.  It makes me wonder if the author dabbles in it.  Since she writes so much I'd wonder where she finds the time!Daemon is arrogant and often irritating, but he can be pretty funny too.  Though he and his sister have suffered loss, a loss of personality isn't one of them and I genuinely enjoy his development with Katy. They have great chemistry and this series seems like it's got potential to be somewhat racy for a YA novel.I enjoyed the read, but it wasn't perfect.  It didn't feel slow per se, but it had a bit more of a contemporary feel at times and I occasionally found myself wanting the book to amp up the paranormal. As someone who typically prefer adult novels to YA, this has proved to be a happy middle ground for me and I look forward to reading the rest.

I held off on reading this series for a long time.  I actually started it some time ago then stopped and then decided to resume it closer to the movie's release.  Ultimately I ended up watching the movie before finishing the book. There were times that the book read like fanfiction to me (and then I learned that's because it actually was), but I've certainly read worse.  While I thought the movie was pretty rushed, the book had the opposite effect for me and felt overly long, but that could be because I didn't find the melodrama particularly interesting between the main three, especially Simon's assured-to-be-unrequited feelings for Clary.Jace.  Jace. Jace.  Well at least he has a personality?  He comes off as pretty juvenile for me at times and I didn't always find it funny, so for me he wasn't as swoon-worthy as I'm sure he is for millions of others.  The chemistry with Clary is pretty good until the twist that made my eyes roll.  After that I was pretty sure I wouldn't be interested in seeing it play out for multiple books throughout the series.I enjoyed the magic, mythology and lore here, but it honestly wasn't something that I can't get anywhere else and better, so while I don't think I'll completely drop the series, I'm also in no rush to continue it anytime soon.  I'm much more likely to read the The Infernal Devices Trilogy instead because there are only 3 of those and they're complete.

This is a great short novella if you're in-between reads.  Though the page count isn't particularly large, there's a lot of character development and story there that didn't feel any more rushed than a 350-400 page PNR novel.  It wasn't overly angsty either which was a relief and I found myself laughing quite a bit.  I enjoyed the charm and the wit and was ultimately impressed with Molly Harper's writing. This was my first time reading anything by this author and it won't be the last. The Half Moon Hollow novels appear to be standalones in typical PNR fashion, but I'm definitely a fan of her alternating between novellas and full novels. I like having the option of a fun, quick and satisfying read without investing a lot of time.

Oh boy, what a ride! While this book wasn't as quotable with the usual hilarious quips that make me love this series so much, it is definitely one of my favorite books of the series, if not my favorite.  I usually love books when the characters go on road trips or end up out of their usual element.  It usually gives a series a fresh perspective, revealing new aspects about my favorite characters and ultimately showing what they are made of when the going gets tough.  Ilona Andrews really brought their A-game from start to finish.  Kate and Curran, how can you not love them?  As solid as they are, or at least as solid as we assume they are, their relationship and feelings for one another are put to the ultimate test.I must say that bringing just about every essential character along for the quest set off my alarm bells early that nothing was going to be the same from here on out.  I feared that not everybody would make it back or make it back in one piece.  And they do take a hell of a beating in that department I'm sad to say.  But I believe everything that happened happened for the sake of pushing the story forward to the best conclusion possible.There were definitely frustrating moments making me feel for both characters as individuals as well.  I will always be a Kate and Curran girl, but I thought they handled the chemistry between Kate and Hugh D'Ambry (her father's right hand) surprisingly well.  I was genuinely looking forward to their scenes together and the outcomes weren't always predictable.  I was really engrossed in the back story involving Kate's heritage and felt satisfied with what was revealed. It felt integral to the story and to what we can expect of the series here on out.  So often I run into series where the overarching plot is merely peppered throughout the book instead of being the meat of it, making it very obvious that the author plans to drag the story out as much as possible.  I am so happy that wasn't the case here, though I honestly haven't read a disappointing Kate Daniels book.If we thought things were complicated before, this book proved to me that we haven't seen anything yet. I heard the series was going to end at 7, but then they decided to extend it to 10.  At this point I think 10 books is definitely the sweet spot.If you want a true page turner, this is one of the best you are going to find this year, guaranteed.

All in all I thought the story was original and unique enough to stick out in my mind which is definitely a good thing considering the tons of books I read throughout the year.  I see a lot of potential with the story, the world, and character development, especially in future novels. The beginning draws you in quite effectively.  I do think the novel could use an additional round of editing to cut down on repetition and improve the flow of the story.  It distracted me from the experience at times, but with tighter writing in the sequels (or even a revised version of this story) I could see it  being a true standout.  I also think a catchier titles could help draw more attention.

More like 3.5 stars.  This was my first time delving into the Love at Stake novels, or at least I think so.  What drew me to this book was mainly the title. I thought it'd be a parody of the Girl with the Dragon Tattoo novel.  There was humor here and there, but this is first and foremost a paranormal romance, so the romance and drama take precedence.  I may have read a short story from this series before because one aspect sounded familiar to me; it was the VANNA angle in particular though I can't recall where I could have read it.  VANNA is a life-size synthetic device designed to look like a human woman. There's blood stored inside it to help curb a vampire's desire to attack real living people.  That provided a healthy dose of comic relief in this book.  Though the story appears to be a standalone, there is an overarching plot that I feel has been developing since the earlier books. But even still I never felt lost.The relationship between Dougal and Leah was decent but I didn't connect to it very much. Both were a little too down on themselves most of the time.  I also think the timing was wrong for me because I read this on the heels of another book where reincarnation was at the heart of the relationship.  I wasn't disappointed with the book, so I imagine fans of the series who have read it from the beginning should enjoy it. Though I doubt I will read all the earlier 13 novels, I might look into reading one of its stronger prequels to get a better feel for Kerrelyn Sparks's writing at its best.*ARC Provided by Publisher

I was sitting on this book for quite a while but I was glad to finally read it.  All in all the writing and characterization were top-notch.  It's not very often when I can connect with a heroine but I really enjoyed reading this from Karou's point of view.  Though I enjoyed her interactions with Akiva as well, I think I the first half of the book was more entertaining for me than the latter half.  The latter half takes on a darker and more serious tone and the series will never be the same from that point on.My biggest gripe is the cliffhanger.  While it doesn't totally ruin a series for me I found this one particularly frustrating.  I want to read the next one, but I am considering waiting until the series finishes or at least until a few more books are available. The twists and turns, while not completely surprising, were still shocking.  When it comes cliffhangers, I was very happy to have read the Fever books by Karen Marie Moning after they were all released (before she decided to continue them anyway).  I don't know how fans who read those novels in real-time stayed sane. And I feel like the Daughter of Smoke & Bone series could be of that variety.  The writing and intrigue are just that good, especially for a young adult novel.  Who knows, when book 3 is out I might give book 2 a go.  But for now I'm debating if it's worth it to continue right away.

Dark Mind is a well-done debut effort by Matthew Goldstein.  Though only a high school student, Cole's left with a huge responsibility that most adults couldn't manage.  He can prevent tragedy, but it's a constant game of chess to determine if the decision is the right one. If he can prevent a tragedy, it comes at a price elsewhere, namely to those he loves.  This give and take leaves him conflicted and leaves the reader wondering what he will choose, and the outcome is not predictable.All in all I enjoyed the novel.  It looks to be the start of a new series, so I would like for future novels to elaborate further on the paranormal aspects of the story.  Some sections felt a little too contemporary.  The cover is really cool.  I like that the style is a departure from your usual photoshopped covers with models or flashy text that comprise most of the covers this genre.  I'm definitely looking forward to a sequel.

As a follow-up to Gilded Destiny, which I enjoyed quite a bit, I must say that Jaded Touch was also well done.  I feel like the Vesper species is a pretty unique addition to the world of urban fantasy.  My favorite part of this novel would be the origins and development of their race.  Though it's a short read, a borderline novella, it offers very solid world-building and it pulls me in as effectively as any full length novel, leaving me wanting to know what comes next.  The politics and dynamics between male and female Vespers adds just the right amount of tension while still keeping things unpredictable.  I still have questions, but I feel as if more layers will be peeled back in the next installment.The relationship of Jack and Three has me on the fence.  Though the dynamic didn't always work for me, they have a lot of chemistry.  As their own characters I liked them quite a bit though.  Scarred and tormented, Three has to march by the beat of her own drum due to her origins, so she's constantly getting into trouble. But deep down she is a genuine person and she's easy to root for.Considering how the first book ended I actually was expecting this novel to be a continuation of that one.  And considering how this one ended, there are even more possibilities for the next novel.  I won't be giving away spoilers here but I certainly wouldn't mind a revisit to what could happen between either of those potential storylines.

Quin Lennox found herself lucky last time, managing to escape the alternate world of Vamp City.  But that world isn't quite done with her.  They need her powers to restore the magic of their world and free the vampires currently bound there. Vampire Arturo Mazza is sent to bring her back, and Quinn has learned her lesson than to trust him again after his betrayal.  However this time Vamp City has some leverage, her brother.  She has to return to save him, and Arturo's all she's got.  Has he learned the error of his ways? Or is she setting herself up for disappointment once again.The first book was one of my favorite reads last year, so the sooner I could get my hands one, the better. Palmer's morbid imagination really makes this series a standout to me, though I think certain dynamics of the first book didn't sit well with everyone.  For this novel I think it has more mass appeal, but I had a gripe or two.  I guess the pace of the book was a bit of a problem for me.  They spend quite a bit of time talking about the final adversary and yet we don't even see that stand-off in this book.  Cliffhanger enthusiasts should love it, but I can't say the same for those of you who don't.  I just wish it would have wrapped up the novel in a more serial fashion because towards the end I was anticipating a conflict I didn't get. The book just kind of ended and that was that.I do like her efforts to redeem Arturo.  I mean, sometimes the graphic and horrific things he endured got a little hard to stomach, but he had a lot of ground to make up and I think he did that.  Tish was okay. I never really had a problem with her, though her over protectiveness of her brother, while noble, got a little annoying after a while.  The chemistry between Tish and Arturo was s still immensely strong which certainly adds to their appeal.I liked the history and backstory about the vampires and other supernaturals that live in Washington, VC, learning of their gradual deterioration into what they have become and why.  It was thought-provoking and I was often conflicted about the best course of action to fix everything.At this point I am sort of wondering if Palmer plans to make this a trilogy or if it's an ongoing series.  If it's a trilogy it certainly feels like a middle book.  I feel as if all the issues presented can certainly be resolved in one more.*ARC provided by the publisher.

I'll start off by saying that the cover is gorgeous and I think this was a pretty good start for this series. Wicked as They Come (The Blud Series) by Delilah Dawson truly turned me onto the steampunk vampire genre so I'm always eager to read more. I think the writing was well done and it captured the steampunk/period style perfectly.  I think the plot was well-paced and the relationship between Honoria and Blade developed nicely. They both have tremendous responsibilities and hardships, so it's easy to sympathize with them in their own ways.One gripe for me was the choice of name "Blade" for the leading man.  I constantly found myself thinking about another vampire (or dhampire rather) anti-hero made famous for Marvel comics and Wesley Snipes.Though the book was good, I'm not sure if I want to continue right away based on my personal tastes.  I'm just not sure if I like the brand of vampire that she has to offer.  As overdone as it may be, I will always prefer that they have fangs.  I understand that authors want to make their creatures unique and she accomplishes this to an extent, but I still have my preferences.I think the story will been enjoyable for many of you.  Though it will be like usual paranormal romances and focus on one couple per book,  I don't believe Honoria and Blade are finished with their contribution to the series.

I read the first three books back to back and then took a break.  It was a good break because returning to this one unveiled a whole new level of drama! Based on the synopsis, get prepared for a huge dose of awkwardness. We can finally put a face to the name for Dex's girlfriend, and it was great seeing the layers gradually peel back on their relationship as the book progressed. It felt more real that way.  While I enjoyed the book,  a few revelations were pretty predictable, but I was glad to see them resolved.Dex and Perry both experience a bit of growth in this one, even though the novel ends on a cliffhanger.  This series is considered horror, but character development is at the forefront this time around. Thankfully each book provides enough revelations to keep me coming back.  Often times when a book tries to do too much (ie: spending more focus on the book's mystery rather than the overarching plot), I find it lacking.  Even though character relationships are probably the most important aspect, I prefer when it ties into the series storyline,  and I don't want the revelations to feel like breadcrumbs.  Some ongoing series have a habit of doing that to the point of where I give up because there's too much filler and not enough meat.I really enjoyed the introduction of rival ghost hunters.  They were such tools. I kind of wish more happened there, but I also think we haven't seen the last of them.  I do like this series for the horror and I found this book very enjoyable.
