Then you back it off various turns for different grind sizes; 1/2 turn for fine, 1-1.5 for medium, and 1.5-2 for coarse.  We found that 1.75 turns is perfect for the coarse grind we want for our 17 oz Bodum French press (2.5 turns was too coarse).On You Tube, we found a cool idea by pvn2plus2 where he removes the handle and puts a 10 mm (6.1 mm hole) nut on the end of the shaft that allows him to operate it with his cordless drill.  I bought this nut ($0.25) and screwed it on but it quickly got tight because of the rough edges of the flats machined on the bolt. You have to turn it on with some force once, then it will come on and off easily like the knob does. Now I can use my little Ryobi  cordless screwdriver with a hex extension that has a 3/8" socket drive and a 10 mm socket to turn the mill while applying direct, downward pressure to help it stay aligned and not wobble for the coarser grind. I keep the screwdriver plugged in to get optimum power because it takes a fair amount of torque.This grind is definitely much more repeatable and of uniform size than we can achieve with our Krups blade grinder by pulsing it 12 - 15 times.  However, it does take several minutes to grind the 30 gm of beans we need for the 17 oz press even with the cordless screwdriver (slow speed) -- about the time it takes to bring the water to a boil in the microwave. If you have a blade grinder and pulse your beans 3-4 times, they feed into the burr mill faster. (If you are in a real hurry, of course, just go with instant coffee and hot water. ;P)We have negligible "silt" in the bottom of the cup, and the combination of this mill with the Bodum French press makes very flavorful coffee even with an old standard like Eight O'clock Original beans. I'm saying good-bye to my Mr. Coffee 4-cup drip machine.====================================================================on Dec 11, after using this product for several days, we have decided it works much better with the supplied handle than trying to use a drill and nut.  The best setting for us is like 2 full turns off bottom / fully engaged.  It works great for AeroPress and our Bodum French press.With the manual grinder mode, it works very fast (about 1 minute for 33 gm of beans - two 8 oz cups of coffee) and is fun to use.
We use this with our Oyama convection oven for casseroles
Easy to install and very attractive
My favorite.  I will definitely order more.
Great batteries.

At the pro shop, this same number of tees would cost $100, so these are a bargain, and I don't expect to need to buy tees again soon.I didn't want to stuff all 1000 tees into my golf bag, so I just put several handfuls into a few snack-sized ziploc baggies, put one in my bag and handed the others out to each of my golf buddies.  They were actually quite happy to get them, so now I keep a few spare baggies full to give out when I see somebody who needs a tee.  It's a small thing, but it's always appreciated!

The first thing I noticed about this pan was that the heavy bottom and rounded handle make tipping it sideways to slide out an omelette considerably harder than with some other pans.  I've gotten used to it, but someone with arthritic wrists might find it a problem.This heavier base also takes longer to heat up than my old lightweight pan did, so I had to get used to that too.  On the upside, once heated, the additional weight gives it more "thermal momentum", so the pan stays hotter when the food hits it--which speeds cooking time a bit.The non-stick coating seems about average.  When I first got it, the non-stick actually seemed worse than the pan I was throwing out (and yes, I seasoned it), but in the end, it's probably about the same.The instructions say to not "shock" the pan with cold water while it's still hot, but with limited time to make breakfast and clean up, I basically do exactly that, spraying it with water and washing it up quick before putting it away.  The coating has survived just fine, so it seems durable, and the pan seems well-made.With all the 5-star ratings I think I sort of expected this pan to change my life---I mean holy smokes, everybody just loves it!  In truth, to me it's just a non-stick pan that does its job, which is good enough.

I took a human version of this supplement (Osteo Biflex) for DeQuervain's Tendonitis and cured it completely, but many other people with the same condition found it didn't help.  In the end, this type of supplement seemed to help about half those who tried it.As for the Cosequin, I bought it because my dog had developed a sore front shoulder and a limp that didn't seem to be getting any better.  We started these pills, and within a week or two she was good as new.  They also helped a friend's dog with a bad hip, so they really do work.Still, like anything else, they don't cure everything, so if they haven't helped your pet within a few months, I'd say they're probably not going to.  But they're certainly worth a try, because they're cheap, they often work and they're certainly safer than surgery!

These are great.  I've used +1.25 for computer glasses for many years, recently moving up to +1.50.  I also use the +2.50 power for reading books.  Lately, I've taken to just ordering these instead of getting them at the drug store.These are reasonably priced, comfortable and seem to have excellent optics.  They have a nice classic shape and style, and are reasonably compact when folded.  I like that they seem well-made, also.The spring hinges also mean that they can flex a bit for a universal fit, and the adjustable nose-bridge pads allow those to fit properly also.  I've ordered quite a few pairs of these now; they've become my favorite go-to readers.

A friend and I decided to read this (having been blown away by all the positive reviews) and neither of us could get past the first several chapters.For example, in the first chapter, we're treated to the story of a super-rich woman buying a hotel she has just arrived at, just so she can fire the front-desk clerk to punish him for a snub.  (Yes, that was the entire first chapter.)  It wasn't even slightly funny.  Instead, it came off like a badly-written adolescent revenge fantasy, and amazingly, things get even worse from there.In fact, when my friend asked me a couple of weeks in if I had read any of the book yet, I felt guilty telling her that I had only read a few chapters because I just couldn't get into it.  She stopped me short and said that she had struggled quite a bit further into the book than I had, hoping it would get better, but that it just got worse, and she urged me not to continue.  We both quit in relief.This book is the second time both my friend and I have been badly fooled by a few hundred positive reviews, only to find the book itself virtually unreadable.  I've always trusted the Amazon rankings in the past, but I'm far more dubious now.  The only positive to purchasing this book is my hope I can stop you from making the same mistake.

About six people in my book-club decided to read this based on the glowing reviews.  When we convened to discuss it, I had to admit that I hadn't been able to finish it; it just didn't hold my interest.  As it turned out, only one person had finished it, and he thought it was just okay.  The rest of us thought it was so bad we agreed to waste no more time on it.I'm still shocked at the number of 5-star reviews for this book.  When I went back to actually read a few pages' worth of them, however, I found a large number were one-sentence reviews, or even one word, like "excellent", which made me wonder if they weren't simply friends of the author.  Most of the remaining reviews were enthusiastic about the book simply because they thought it did a good job of ripping Bush and Cheney or even just America in general.So if that sounds like something you might enjoy, then you might enjoy this book.  If you're actually looking for an excellent novel, however, you're likely to be disappointed in this one.  We all certainly were.

This drive lasted me about a year, and then began to have problems.  I strongly suspect that this may be due to the fan-free design causing relatively high internal operating temperatures.Whatever the reason, it doesn't work for more than a day or so, then goes unrecognized by my computer and I can't even reboot without unplugging it.  Making everything work again means power-cycling the drive and rebooting the computer, daily.  Not good.Had I reviewed it right after I bought it, I probably would have said it was great.  Now, a little over a year in, the owner experience isn't good at all.  I expected this to last at least a few years.  Now I'm shopping for another one---and it won't be this brand.

This product is, like many spray bottles, simply a metal can with a screw-off plastic spray nozzle--but with a top that ingeniously doubles as the pump.  It seems like a really great idea, but it's not so great in practice.First, when you're done and want to simply replace the top, you have to pump it one more time (because that's how it works, after all), after which the cap rebounds a little bit from the pressure in the can.  So the cap never actually seats on the can very well.Then, if you leave it pressurized on the counter, the cap slowly rises off the bottle again from air--and oil--slowly leaking out of the spray nozzle.  This eventually makes the can greasy and you have to wash the whole thing.  (Plus it looks weird sitting on the counter with the top inexplicably standing halfway off the can...)Eventually I decided to just unscrew the top a little bit and depressurize it to stop it from leaking, but that didn't really seem to help very much.  The can was somehow always greasy when I picked it up again.As far as spraying performance, it works okay; it's just that using it wasn't really a pleasure.  I eventually tossed mine and suspect most other people will too, eventually.  Wish I could say I loved it, but I just didn't.

Normally I hate giving gift cards.  But in this case, I'll make an exception, because this kind does serve a purpose:First, the main reason I don't like gift cards is that they're just cash limited to a single retailer. So it's no more "thoughtful" than plain old cash, just less flexible.A second reason I don't like most gift cards is that many of them become lost or are incompletely redeemed, and the residual value becomes pure unearned profit for the cards' sellers.  No wonder they try to make people believe they're a "thoughtful" gift.However, in one case, I can recommend the use of THIS particular gift card, and it involves redeeming a prepaid VISA or MasterCard debit card.  These types of gift cards have the advantage of being accepted almost anywhere, and are very commonly used nowadays to issue product rebates (one reason for which is that the issuer gets to see what you buy with it, learn a little more about your buying habits and sell that knowledge to others.  But I digress...)The point is, although these prepaid-type cards are widely accepted, they're a pain to use, because unless your entire purchase fits into the remaining balance, the checkout system (or cashier) has to know how to do a "split tender" transaction, with part of the balance coming from the prepaid card and the rest from another card.  As of this review (7/8/2013), even Amazon's checkout system provided no way of doing that with two "credit" type cards.  Like other retailers, they only know how to do a split-tender transaction involving their own brand of "gift" card.  A lot of retail cashiers don't know how to do that either, in my experience.So that's where the Amazon Gift Card comes in.  Your prepaid VISA rebate or gift card comes in an even-dollar denomination, and if you simply use the entire amount to buy an Amazon gift card of the same amount, you have now transformed it into something that WILL work with Amazon checkout.  Better yet, because Amazon isn't just a single retailer but a whole marketplace of retailers, you're not locked into spending your money at a single store.  Problem solved--at least if you shop on Amazon.(Incidentally, the same technique works in retail stores when the cashier is unable to do a split-tender transaction:  just use the prepaid VISA to buy a store-brand gift card first, then make your regular purchase using that gift card.  This works because EVERY checkout clerk is trained on their own store-brand gift cards.)Incidentally, if you ARE stuck with a prepaid VISA with only an odd few residual dollars left on it, one of the easiest ways I've found to drain the remaining balance is to use it on gasoline purchases.  It seems that those systems, unlike most others, are capable of detecting the remaining balance on a gift card and dispensing only that amount of gasoline---after which you can finish filling up with a regular card.  Still more of a hassle, but at least you get to fully drain the card of money.

I couldn't quite figure out how this dressing container worked from just looking at the picture, and I wasn't sure about buying it as a result---especially after reading that someone had a problem with a piece falling off.  Now that I've used it, my doubts are gone---it's great.Basically, the white plastic top portion screws onto the glass bottom, and when it's closed (which is how it's pictured), you can shake your dressing vigorously with no problems.  Then, when holding it, a finger-press on the lower back portion of the top hinges open the dispenser, unplugging the hole at the top of the lid, enabling you to dispense dressing.  Another finger-press closer to the top pops the lid closed again, and neatly reseals the bottle.I was a little worried that it would be cheaply made or not worth it, but I really do like it now that I've had it a while.  All my previous dressing dispensers seemed to always be leaking or oozing oil onto the outside no matter how hard I tried to keep them clean, and leaving a ring where they stood.  This one stays absolutely clean from top to bottom at all times.  It was a great purchase, one I'm happy I made.

There are two ways to pay for a coffee-maker:  in research time and dollars up front, or in frustration, anguish and despair later.  This coffee-maker is so bad that I literally just finished wrapping it as a white-elephant gift for our office holiday party.  I would not be surprised to see it pressed into piata duty afterwards:We purchased this coffee maker for our small office because it grinds beans and makes coffee.  Unforeseen were 1) the amount of time required for cleaning, 2) the sharpness of the plastic edges on the parts (and the thousand nagging cuts they would inflict), and 3) the overall rapidity with which we would all grow to deeply hate it.The bean-grinder is like any other $10 stand-alone grinder, except that it contains a built-in screen and delivery chute and is therefore much harder to clean.  The filter basket is permanent and also requires a toothbrush and running water to clean, and doesn't take standard disposable filters as an option.  Every time you brew coffee and do the subsequent 10 minutes of cut-inflicting cleaning in the sink with a toothbrush, only to discover that the machine is still visibly dirty in multiple inaccessible areas and will never, ever, truly be clean again, your desire to live ebbs just a little more, until you, like us, eventually decide that 1) either it dies or 2) you will.We replaced this unit with a Baratza Virtuoso bean grinder (simply excellent) and a Bunn coffee maker (simply excellent) and we now enjoy delicious coffee with literally no cleanup needed because of the thoughtful design and ability to use disposable filters.  I earnestly suggest that you do the same while skipping the pain of buying this one first.  Don't let the low price lure you into a life of scullery duty.

I happen to be a fan of Adam Smith's work, so I had high hopes when I happened across this "modern interpretation."  Adam's writing is tough to read, so anything that makes it more accessible seems like a good thing.  But that's not what this is.  Even the samples afforded by Amazon's "Look Inside!" feature quickly revealed why I didn't want to read more.Essentially, the author takes small excerpts from the "Wealth of Nations" and comments briefly on each in a "quick tips for success!" style, seemingly aimed at business people.  Unfortunately, she seriously misses his point at times, and seems to be using his words more as a launching pad to promote her own liberal notions.For example, she cites Adam's statement (as best I can put it from memory) that "The power of exchange is what gives rise to the division of labor, so it (the division of labor) is limited by the extent of the market," a fairly straightforward idea.  You're not going to see anyone set up an assembly line to produce a single item for a single customer, in other words.  A small marketplace doesn't support that great a division of labor.But the author interprets this, confusingly, to claim that Adam was proposing the idea that "innovation creates its own marketplace," which is not at all what he was saying.  She then goes on to refute what he didn't say, by saying that innovation mainly occurs only in existing industries.  I couldn't find a single useful take-away from that discussion.At some point the author says we should all be driving more electric cars to avert anthropogenic global warming, and that indeed we would be, except that Big Oil is distorting our choices.  I expect the author would be shocked to learn that the electricity used by those electric cars is just a storage form of energy originally produced by (wait for it) fossil fuels and nuclear power.  (Electric car drivers merely outsource their carbon footprints, in other words.)  She has also not considered the problem of heating an all-electric car sufficiently to make it a viable choice for the bitterly cold climates many of us are doomed to live in until the blessed global warming finally arrives.She even goes on to say that global trade results in a win only for the consumers who get cheap products, not for the workers in less-developed countries who get only low-paying jobs.  She seems to miss the point that the low-paying jobs in question must still be more desirable than other choices in those countries, or nobody would take them.  It's a win-win presented as a win-lose, presumably because those workers aren't instantly promoted to the same economic level as their customers, an idea that would have been preposterous to Adam---and is to me as well.Adam's original work is available free on Kindle, incidentally, and although the writing style is hard to read, the principles are still alive and running the world to this day.  If you're interested in economics, it's worth the slog.

I bought this book when it came out, and to this day it remains the most life-changing book I've ever read.The authors give you a miniature medical degree, using basic facts found in standard medical texts to arrive at logically inescapable conclusions that make complete sense and echo what you see with your own eyes, on your own blood tests and on your own bathroom scale.Your health will improve, you'll feel better in many different ways, and you'll not only be able to tell people what you're doing, but why---which is infinitely more valuable.If you have a logical mind and want bedrock truth once and for all, you will be overjoyed to have finally found it.

This book won't teach you quantum mechanics or astrophysics, thank God.  Anyone who pans it for that, or for containing spot inaccuracies, is a nit-picking killjoy.Instead, it reveals the whole "but how did they figure that out?" behind those subjects, while making you laugh out loud.  I cannot recall a more enjoyable read on ANY topic, and I recommend it strongly for anyone who enjoys science writing and likes to laugh.If you have somehow managed to navigate to this page, put the book in your cart right now--even if only for later--because it will enrich your life far more than saving the money would.  You'll love it---and that's the whole point.

When someone gushes about a movie being the funniest thing they've ever seen, it usually kills it for me.  Fortunately, I had no expectations at all for this movie, and ended up thinking it was hilarious.I don't know where to start...Napoleon's brother is SUCH a dweeb you'll want to smack him yourself---yet I'm laughing even now thinking about him.  There are all these subtle continuity errors and era-inappropriate artifacts that are so obvious they had to be intentional, and even those still make me laugh.But the real reason the movie is funny is because most of the characters are so incredibly pathetic they'll remind you, sometimes quite painfully, of real people.  Some parts almost make you cringe that way.If you're looking for something a little different, and if you can sit down to watch this without any particular expectations, you might accidentally get a huge kick out of it.  I did.  (Make sure you watch the part after the credits; a lot of people miss that.)

I really expected to like this boombox, but I was disappointed almost immediately, because the radio tuning isn't selective.In other words, even when you're listening to strong stations, you can hear other stations "bleeding over" into the one you're tuned to.  It's like a ghost station in the background.  It's not horrible, but it messes with the sound.For example, when listening to a rock station, I could hear faint talk-radio.  On talk-radio, I could hear faint music.  On a classics station, commercials from nearby stations were *really* noticable when they came on.There was actually another problem with my particular sample, which is that it arrived with a faulty display (didn't have all the segments working in the rightmost character/number), but I could have lived with that.The sound quality might be pretty good for CD's, MP3's and other clean sources, but I bought this specifically for the radio, and that part stinks (both AM and FM were plagued with this problem).  There is simply no excuse for poor selectivity in a $140 radio.  No speakers sound good playing two radio stations at the same time.Other disappointments were the lack of a simple, conventional cord (it comes with a transformer), and a significantly cheaper feel than I expected.  But the lack of clean, clear radio reception makes this a no-buy recommendation from me.

This is a very basic one ear headset with microphone.  Looks nice.  Although advertised for the PS4, it can also be used on many other devices.  I used it on my computer for example to make a Skype call to a friend in Africa (on my computer the headset and mic jacks are combined into one jack, if your computer has separate headphone and mic jacks this will not fully work).  Sound quality is good and I have had no complaints from those I have talked to about not being able to hear me.  There is an in-line volume control and also a mute button for the microphone.  Was comfortable on my ear.  This product is good for mono chat or audio conversations.  No batteries required, it is powered by the PS4 controller. 30 mm driver.  At this current price point ($14.99) I have to go with 5 stars.  No complaints.

I placed this mat at the door leading in from our attached garage.  The mat looks nice and does not slip.  Because this is a relatively thin mat it did not interfere with the opening and closing of the door.  The mat works quite well as a convenient place for incoming people from the garage to wipe their feet.  The mat we got was 2 foot by 3 foot in size.  Appears to be good high quality construction and may last a lifetime.  The color I got was dark gray, but other colors are available.  Very pleased.  Works fine for me!

These have fit well for us but we have had one leak.  We are not seeing any adverse reactions on the baby, such as rash or skin irritation and I like that.  As for the one leak, we have tried different brands over the years and have found all can leak from time to time.  I like the umbilical cord cut out and the wetness indicator, which eliminates the need to check with hands.

This is a very simple toy.  No batteries, no assembly needed.  What you get is a plastic bucket and 20 hard plastic flash cards with words and pictures on them in both English and Spanish. Babies can fit the cards into a slot at the top of the bucket and the bucket also has a handle.  The hard plastic flash cards are too big for a baby to fit in the mouth so I see no choking hazards.  Words on the cards include monkey, banana, apple, chair, dog, bottle, house, tree, train and so on.  No complaints.

These cups are pretty thin and thus easy to squeeze, too easy to squeeze in my view.  But they look great and do the job, and the team logos are great.  Hopefully more team logos are on the way.  I would like to see the University of Kentucky, University of Louisville and Indiana University for sure.  These are perfect for tailgating.  Just be careful not to squeeze them too hard while holding them otherwise spills will result.  These cups are not insulated in any way, so you should expect to use them only for cold drinks.

Hard to say much about something as simple as a pizza pan.  It works.  Made of aluminum, 12 inches in diameter.  Dishwasher safe.  Perfect for baking small to medium pizzas.  No complaints.  I deduct one star as this is a very simple product and the price seems high (currently $16.20) for such a simple product.

We have a small dog that tends to be picky about what he eats.  We had no problems getting him to eat this particular dry dog food.  The first 5 ingredients are (1) turkey, (2) turkey meal, (3) peas, (4) chickpeas, and (5) chicken meal. So far we have had no digestive or other problems.  I will come back and update this review if we do.  I deduct 1 star as the price for the 4 pound bag seems expensive at $19.56 (current listed price).  The 12 pound bag would appear to be the better value (current listed price is $38.99).  This kibble is small, about the size of a pea.  The crude protein is 30%.

Scale looks great.  Like stepping on black glass. Digital display is very large and easy to read day or night.  Another thing I liked about this scale is that it takes 4 "AA" batteries to work. And has a low battery indicator. Batteries are included.  I buy "AA" batteries all the time for kids' toys so these will be very easy to replace when needed.  My other digital scale requires a 9 volt battery (not as common in kids' toys) and has no low battery indicator.  There is a switch on the back of the scale that allows you to switch from pounds to kilograms if you are into metric measurements.  Scale came with clear and concise instructions and I also liked that.  As far as accuracy goes I would say this scale is maybe a pound off, but I can live with that.  No complaints so far.

These shoes fit well, are comfortable and well constructed.  Daughter loves both the shoe and the brand.  She has been jogging in them.  And they look great.  We have not had these shoes long enough to know how long they will last.  No complaints so far, and no problems.  I do recommend.

No complaints here.  Fit was good.  No leaks so far (been testing for about a week).  No adverse reactions from our little one.  These are sort of like pull-ups.  Appears to be lots of absorbancy.  Price appears reasonable (currently $16.11 for a box of 42).  Very convenient.  We will continue buying these until no longer needed.  I do recommend.

Does a good job cleaning my teeth.  Price is reasonable for a 5.8 once tube.  Like the flip open and closed cap better than the old screw on and off type caps.  Has fluoride. Taste about like other Colgate pastes (not gels) I have used.  Eliminates mouth odor.  Has many of the same benefits as other pastes, helps prevent cavities and so on.  Only thing I dislike is there is no ADA (American Dental Association) seal.  Hoping that will come.

These pants appear well made and fit the granddaughter perfectly.  She loves them.  No problems with buttons or zipper and the pair comes with a reversible belt.  Made in Bangladesh and 55% cotton and 45% polyester.  Machine wash cold cycle with similar colors gentle cycle. Washed them only once so far but they held up well. Tumble dry low.  We are pleased.  Will buy more if needed. No complaints.

Nice blow dryer.  Has 2 speed settings and 3 heat settings.  Works well for our family.  Heat has been adequate for all of us no matter what the length of hair.  Appears well made and should last a long time.  Is easy to handle and not so heavy that it wears you out.  Comes with 2 attachments one of which is a diffuser.  Price seems very reasonable.  No complaints. We do recommend.

The pair we got is great.  Seams are well stitched and knees are reinforced.  No loose threads.  Fit is good. Can be machine washed (cold, no bleach) and hold up well after washing so far.  Tumble dry low heat.  55% cotton, 45% polyester.  Made in Bangladesh.  Waist is not expandable or elastic so it is important you get the right size.  We did.  Have not had them long enough to say how long they will last long term, but given the way boys grow, I am expecting he will outgrow them before they wear out.  Washed only twice so far.  I will update this review if problems develop.  Right now however 5 stars.

As a result of testing the Rapid brand staplers through the Vine program we are trashing all our old office staplers and replacing them with the Rapid brand. No jams.  Staples go where you want them to go and stay.  No problems with this specific model in stapling briefs and memorandums of law 45 pages in size (regular paper).  I have used staplers for decades and never found a brand as reliable as these Rapid staplers.  Highly recommend.  Get the best; trash the rest.

This is a nice basic slow cooker with off, low, high and warm settings.  My other one (different brand) allows more temperature settings, so I like that one a bit better, but this one does the job also and is larger.  Cooking with this unit has been even, no hotter or cooler points. If you just want a basic slow cooker with simple controls and settings this could be a good unit for you.  You may get an odd smell when you first use it, but that is normal and will go away.  Design looks great.

Our granddaughter is all about the Disney princess girls.  Her favorites until Frozen came out were the mermaid and Cinderella.  She also loves making dresses and assorted clothing.  Big on colors.  She has a very creative mind at this point in her life. This Play-Doh Princess Castle toy is perfect for her.  She loves it.  What I like is that the play-doh does not make much of a mess and is safe for kids to play with.  No complaints here.  I would recommend however that you get more play-doh.  Kids love the stuff and it is crazy all the things they can come up with.

This is a nice toy for the younger kids.  Ours is about to turn 4.  No batteries required.  I trust the Fisher-Price brand.  The toy has wheels on the bottom and as you roll it the shark jaws go up and down.  There are also two action figures on the deck, Jake and a pirate dressed as a shark.  There is a lever at the side that allows the child to pretend the two are having a sword fight. My only objection is that the price (currently listed at just under $50) seems excessive.  I thus deduct 1 star, leaving 4 stars.

Nice pillow type positioner .  Our infant loves it.  Baby cannot talk, but appears comfortable.  Can be machine washed (cold water, no bleach, gentle cycle) and tumble dried (low heat).  The tags are nice for getting attention.  Light weight so easy to move from room to room.  Made in China, no batteries required as well as no assembly.  Very pleased.

Odd color (purple).  But it smells nice and cleans well as a body wash.  I have preferred the Irish Spring body wash but will start using this as an alternate from time to time.  I like the bottle as it is easy for me to grip and snap open and shut.  Pleased overall, no complaints.  4 stars.

This soap does a good job of cleaning my hands and smells nice.  The bottle is plastic but looks quite fancy and like glass. I had a little trouble at first getting the pump to pop up, but when I held the cap in place and twisted the pump counter-clockwise it popped up for me and I have been fine ever since.  I dock it one star as the price is very high ($20 as of time of this review).

These knives are a good value for the price.  They are adequate to work in most all kitchens and do the job.  You get 9 knives and the wood block for less than $15 (at current listed price).  That is not a bad deal.  Nothing fancy, but at $15 you should not be expecting anything fancy. Handles are plastic and I did find them easy to grip.  They hold up well so far in the dishwasher.

The kids liked this game and it is very easy to understand and play.  Adults would likely be bored by this game, but it is after all for kids not adults.  I liked the game not because it was entertaining to me personally, but because it allowed me some quality fun time with the kids.  I also liked that the game is pretty inexpensive. No complicated rules or great skill required.

I was originally going to give this toy 2 stars. I got it, set it up with the trackball (not the app) and could not get it to work in the "ball" and "leash" modes.  Music, dance and feed modes worked fine. Plus there is no volume control.  Then I got my 8 year old to help out.  We downloaded the app and he mastered it quickly.  So I guess the problem was not the toy but me.  This toy takes 4 AA batteries for the Miposaur itself and 4 AAA batteries for the trackball.  Batteries are not included.  Also you need a small Phillips head screwdriver to install and replace the batteries. The boy loves this toy so I upgrade it to 4 stars. I deduct 1 star however as Amazon currently has no price listed for this toy and without a price I cannot make a value judgment on this toy (a toy may be a good value at $75, but not at $125 for example). I also believe the instructions could be better written and more clear.

These are great looking earrings. My oldest daughter loved the color when she saw them.  They are smaller than the main product photo of course, which is an enlargement to show detail.  No irritation of the ears.  Reasonably priced at $143.90 (at time of this review).  These would make a great gift for any woman in your life.

We have used these oils for cooking, dipping and salads.  We like them both.  They are both extra virgin. The Zoe Diva Select Cornicabra has been awarded as one of the best olive oils in the world by the New York International Olive Oil Competition.  It is Kosher certified, fruity and sweet.  There is an aftertaste.  Our family is a little less fond of the Arbequina, but tastes are subjective in nature and it may be great for your and your family.  The packaging was perfect for protection from breakage. These would also make wonderful gifts for others. A quality product from a quality brand.  No complaints here.

My dogs absolutely love these treats!  And that is important because a treat a dog does not like is not really much of a treat.  I like the product is made in the USA, has real chicken, no fillers, no wheat, corn or soy, no artificial colors or flavors. I am comfortable with the ingredients.  Dogs indicate no problems stomach or otherwise with the treats. These treats are big, so I recommend either breaking them up or cutting them into smaller pieces, but I am fine with that.  I definitely recommend these treats, and we will be buying them in the future.  5 stars here, and if I could give 10 stars I would.

I had this water purification system installed by a plumber and I would highly recommend you do the same unless you know plumbing well. With the system properly installed and working for over a week now, I have absolutely no complaints.  The unit performs exactly as advertised and our water now tastes great and looks great.  This system once installed is very easy to maintain.  Do not like the added cost of replacement filters and what not, but the cleaner better tasting water we now get is worth it.  If you have water purity or clarity issues I do recommend this unit.

This is a fairly simple USB charging station that does what it is supposed to do, i.e., slowly recharge USB devices.  There is an on/off switch at the front and this product has 3 separate USB charging ports.  Two ports are 1 amp capacity and the middle port is 2.1 amp capacity.  The pegs unfortunately are fixed and your devices may or may not fit within the pegs, depending upon the thickness of whatever devices you want to charge and whether or not you have them in cases.  The main advantage of this station for me is that it saves usage of wall outlets, allowing one wall outlet to be used to charge 3 devices at one time. The box does not come with any additional USB cables.  You get the charging station, which comes with its own power cord, and that is it.  This was not a problem for me however as all my devices came with their own USB charging cords.  If you are part of a family with multiple phones to charge this could be a great product for you.  I wish there were some way to make the pegs adjustable, but they are fixed.

This is a very good lock for the money.  Uses a 4 digit combination that is easy to set.  And you can make up your own combination and then change it whenever you like.  Appears very well made and weather resistant.  Comes with instructions hidden behind the lock in the packaging.  Once you have opened the cover and dialed in the combination, you release or open the shackle by pressing in on both sides of the lock near the top of the case.A few things I did not like.  First, the numbers on the combination dials are not easy to see in low light environments, so unless you have near perfect vision you will likely need a flashlight to open this lock in a low light environment.  I would have preferred that the combination dials be black with white numbers or white with black numbers for more contrast and easier reading.  Second, there is a lift up cover that conceals the combination dials.  It says "PUSH & LIFT."  But when you push the cover does not always lift, the result being you may have to push more than once to get at the combination dials to enter the combination.  Third, the written instructions could be more clear on how to set your initial combination.  I set an initial combination I did not want, the default combination, by mistake, and then found it easier to reset than to initially set.  Now that I have figured it out I do not expect problems in this regard in the future, but the instructions on the initial combinations set could have been better.All things considered this is a strong, good quality lock at a good price, which makes it a good value. I do recommend. 4 stars.

Got this TEKTON hammer just in time to use it on some wood deck work in back of the house.  Also needed to do some repairs to a wood tree house I built for the kids years ago, damaged by a recent storm.  Never used a TEKTON hammer before and never used a fiberglass handle hammer.  I was pleasantly surprised.  Took me a minute to get used to the handle, mainly because it curves at the end.  You can see the curve in the product pictures.  All my previous hammers for over 50 years have had straight wood handles with no curves so at first the handle of this new TEKTON hammer felt strange to me.  This particular design does absorb some of the impact shock from my old wood handle hammers and I like that a lot.  The magnet for starting nails is fantastic.  I really, really like that.  After I got the feel of this hammer I was able to keep a very good grip on it.  Product appears well made in addition to being well designed and I expect it to last for life.  I find this to be a great hammer for the price, a good value.  Never heard of "TEKTON" before this, most of my tools are Craftsman, Snap On and Stanley.  TEKTON is a new brand for me.  But I can and do recommend this hammer.

My dogs had no problems with this food and appear to like it.  I like that it is grain free and low glycemic.  I also like that it has 32% protein.  I also like that the bag is easy to pour and resealable.  Nutro dry dog foods tend to average 4 to 5 stars with Dog Food Advisor and I am impressed by that.  What I am not so impressed with is the price.  The current listed price for the 4 pound bag is $18.98, which makes this dog food about $4.75 per pound.  That is just too expensive for me with multiple dogs.

This is a great fondant.  Ready to use no microwave needed.  No trans fats.  I did find it very easy to handle and roll.  No cracking.  The package is 1.5 pounds and the package I received said best before 10/2/17.  Like others I attempted to go to the manufacturer's web site but found it not working. I do recommend this product.

This card is 5 1/4" wide and 5 1/4" tall when not open to read.  Interior is blank, which lets you write whatever message you like.  A fitted envelope is included for mailing.  A protective sheet is included that you place on top of the card before placing in the envelope and mailing. This card is part of the Hallmark Signature Collection.  Nice looking card.

This review is for the Defender II small size, 20.5" x 11.75" x 11."  Appears to be a well constructed duffel bag.  Has 2 exterior zippered compartments, one on each end.  One is ventilated the other is not.  Also has a small zippered interior "valuables" pocket that I assume is for a wallet or phone or watch. The adidas logo looks fine and is on one side only.  Shoulder strap is handy and functional but not padded.  Also has carry handles.  The base is padded but the padding is so thin I do not see much value to it.  I knock off one star only because the price (currently listed at $36.46) seems a bit high to me.

5 stars here.  This KitchenAid KCLI60CRER Streamline Cast Iron 6-Quart Casserole Cookware is one of the best I have seen in years.  I love the red color (other colors however are available).  I was a little disappointed at first as it appeared from the inside that this product was not "Porcelain Enamel Interior" as stated in the product description.  But it is, just in a way I had not seen before.  I like the basting dots.  Looks to me like this product will last a lifetime.  Have run it through my dishwasher 4 times now with no problems at all.  Also appears to heat evenly in both my regular oven and on the stove-top.  This product being cast iron is heavy.  I would say a good 18-19 pounds in weight.  I like that no seasoning was required.  Not sure why the product description (as of date of this review) does not contain an interior photo.  It should, so that folks are clear on what they are getting here.  So I am including one with this review.  No complaints here. I do recommend.

We grill a lot during the summer, but I am not feeding a huge family anymore as most of the kids are now grown and have their own homes and grills.  All I use now is a kettle grill about 26 inches in diameter.  This product fits my kettle grill well and appears very well constructed and weather resistant.  I expect it to last the rest of my life.  I like the vents, which have been absent on some of my previous covers.  The vents allow moisture to escape and reduce wind problems during storms.  I also like the handles, which make it easier to remove the cover when the grill is going to be used.  Also love the fact the cover will not rot, which has been a problem with some of my boat covers in the past.  The quality strikes me as excellent.  I do recommend.  Just make sure however that this cover is the right size for your grill.  Manufacturer says "Fits kettle grills up to 26.5-inches diameter 38-inches high."

I have a small 10x10 ft. storage shed on the back of my property where there is no electricity.  I wanted a light that would be bright enough at night to let us see the door lock well enough to fit in the key.  I keep a large flashlight inside the unit so once we are inside if we need to access something I use the battery powered flashlight.  I mounted this solar powered light just over the door on the outside and turned on the "auto" setting.  The door of the shed gets plenty of sunlight during a normal day to recharge the unit as needed.  This solar light has been a perfect solution for me, throwing down enough light at night if I need to enter the shed to allow me to easily find the lock and fit in the key.  Once I have the door open I simply grab the battery powered flashlight to find whatever I need inside.  Only time will tell how durable this unit is.  Right now I have no complaints and the product does exactly what it is advertised to do.  Make sure when you get this unit to let it sit in the Sun and fully charge.  Also, it would obviously be best to mount this unit in a position and place that normally gets a lot of sunlight during the day.  I have seen a few people complain about the solar panel detaching from the unit.  Not a problem for me as mine is securely attached and if it were not I would likely just glue it in place.  I have to review the product I received not the product somebody else received.  5 stars from me.

This headboard arrived in a huge very well protected box in perfect condition.  Some assembly is required but it is not complicated.  My main recommendation regarding assembly is that you have some help.  You can assemble it yourself acting alone, but it makes assembly difficult and it is better not to take the risk of injury.  With a helper I was able to assemble this in about 20 minutes or less.The product comes with all bolts needed.  With 2 exceptions they are hex head bolts and an Allen wrench is included with the package.  The 2 exceptions require a standard Phillips screwdriver and perhaps a pair of pliers or adjustable wrench, not included but common in most homes.  An instruction sheet is included and is very easy to understand so far as it goes.One matter that caused me some minor frustration is the padding that is fitted over the headboard once it is assembled.  The padding is a very close fit so you must be careful installing it.  There is a cloth side to the padding and a plastic mesh like side.  Make sure you turn the padding inside out if needed so that the cloth side is facing outside and the plastic mesh side is facing in.  Otherwise installation of the padding will be more difficult and you may rip it (the cloth side).  The instructions do not clearly state which side of the padding faces in and out and I wish that were corrected.  At first, not paying close attention, I just assumed the padding was the same on both sides.  It is not.I had no problems at all with holes and bolts matching up.  All matched up well.  What I recommend during assembly is that you not tighten up the bolts until all have been lined up and started in the threads.Once the board is assembled and the padding installed you simply slip on the cover (mine is sand color) and you are ready to hook on your full or queen size bed rails. Full size rails are bolted to the inside holes in the legs, queen size rails are bolted to the outside holes in the legs.  Lay on your box springs and mattress and you are done except for making the bed.All things considered I am very pleased with this headboard.  4 stars.  I deducted 1 star because (1) the price seems a bit high at $484 (current price listed as of date of this review); (2) the wood is not solid but appears well reinforced.  Just do not be standing on it; and (3) the instructions could have been a little more clear about which side of the padding faces out.  If I needed another headboard I would certainly consider buying this brand and product.  I might however wait for a sale.  I do recommend.

I assembled this Spalding Portable Basketball System with a friend last week end in our backyard (we have a large flat back patio).  So far we have played 5 games with it.  All of us like it.  Assembly was relatively easy for us, but I would strongly recommend you do the assembly with some help instead of trying to do it all alone. This unit is heavy at about 165 pounds without any sand or gravel or water.  Assembly alone may be possible but is just not worth the risk of injury.  We like the acrylic backboard, although glass usually gives better rebound performance.  Our goals are simply to have some fun and get some exercise so the acrylic works fine for us.  This backboard at 54"x32" is smaller than regulation size (if memory serves me correctly regulation size is 72"x42").  Nevertheless the rectangular shape and size of this acrylic backboard still gives us a lot of bank shot plays.  What I like best about this unit is the adjustable height, 7.5 to 10 feet.  That makes it easier for more to play including the young teens.  We filled ours with both sand and water.  Spalding has been known for quality products for years and the quality of this unit appears very good.  I am not expecting this unit to wear out and if we have any problems with it I will certainly come back and update this review.  But so far all love it and there are no complaints.  This is a big improvement for us.

The excerpt looks tantalizing, and the story would without a doubt be fun, however, whoever sets the price for this stuff needs to be realistic I am not paying between 3 and 28.00 for a book that has fewer than 200 pages.

I have to be honest. This is the best book light I have found for any e-reader. I currently have 6 Kindles, and because I get headaches I prefer to read on my regular old DX. Which is not back lit. It works like a charm.Pros: Lights well, the lamp can be angled to prevent glare and gives enough light to read without straining your eyes, while still a very gentle lamp.Cons: Battery. News flash folks the battery drains even when your aren't using it. On or off it doesn't make a difference the battery life is the same. To change the battery you need a specializes ultra small (3/32nds) Philips head screw driver. On my particular light, the very first time I needed to change the battery I found that the screw was so secure I stripped it trying to get it out... so I undid the other three screws on the back cover and removed the entire back in order to access the battery. Yes removing three of 4 screws I intentionally broke my light so that I could change the battery. Its reassembled now and working, but if you aren't tech/mech savy then you may be better off with a different light or getting a case that has a light. I have one of those too, and while the lamp causes a slight glare the battery is MUCH easier to access. No special tools required.

DISCLAIMER: I DO NOT WORK FOR FITBIT, NOR IS THIS A PAID REVIEW.I am employed by a major US Cell Phone carrier (Desk Job) and the FitBit Zip made our list as "Accessory of the Month" in February. I had wanted one since August, so I finally picked one up. Now my hopes were not all that high, I have used pedometers before (they usually vanish into the nine hells of the laundry room) and to be honest don't do much to inspire me and usually make me self conscious because you can HEAR them chime when you move.No such Issue, I clip it on my bra with the display facing in, and it doesn't even disrupt the line of my clothes. Vanity satisfied, the price tag had me careful not to wash it.I love this thing so much FitBit SHOULD Hire me.Pros: Size, color selection, the mobile App and website.FitBit has made their little corner of the market by making it social, a way to be exercise buddies with pals in the Military no matter how far apart we are. Your account with FitBit can be connected to your FaceBook account, HUGE Plus.When you use the App you can track your calories (Just like MyFitness Pal) and Track your water (food diary). BUT when you get close to your CUSTOMIZED goals, the App will send you an Alert. "Almost there, 200 steps to go!" You can earn badges, and if you are at all competitive its a great asset when you don't have an exercise buddy.They also send you a weekly e-mail, summarizing your highs and lows and average caloric intake. (Sold Yet?) If you are on a weight-loss program or working with a Trainer of Physician these updates can be forwarded straight to them. Diabetic? Talk to your doctor about it, walking encourages circulation, gotta fight nerve damage!FitBit has a great family of products, take a look at the Aria Scale (sends your weight wirelessly to the fitbit site) keeps you honest. Sleep Monitors (for our friends with apnea) they all work together in a very cohesive fashion.I'm converted.Cons: I want a Barcode Scanner.This little gem has taken me from less than 1000 steps a day to 5500 daily in less than 3 months. Everyone should have one, I should know, I just talked my boss into it to help her shed baby weight, also got our work Wellness Center to host a contest to win one. I hope that this is helpful!
I bought this for my dog who is in the XL range, a boxer. He hates the cold mornings. It did not fit over his chest. Very dissapointed.
Perfectly comfortable. One did not have the wrist strap but over all very happy. Wish I knew what kind of wood it was.

Now to be honest, I bought it because it was cheap. The one I wanted was 60.00 and I just couldn't do following the holidays, I will be upgrading in a few months.My doctor told me that 10,000 steps is considered active, being asthmatic it can be very difficult to be active, but I do enjoy walking, so I decided that along with my New Years Diet I would start tracking my activity. I received my Pedometer, I would say it was over-packaged, had no instructions and getting it open so I could check it out was a feat. I do not see how it can be practical to check throughout the day when shaking the thing tracks steps. Also you can hear it chime for each step it tracks. I think that the developer could up the resistance just a little and improve accuracy, the chime it makes is audible enough to me and that it makes it less than discreet and me very conscious of myself when I am around others.-1 for not coming with instructions and being difficult to open.-1 for sensitivity/inaccuracy.Good for what you pay, but not impressive value.

Sean Michael is a master of sensual writing. Never have I FELT writing the way I felt this. Normally I can pick out little flaws in structure or grammar that pulled me out of the story, not in this case. When I was in Highschool my best friends mother was involved in the BDSM culture. Parties and Dom/Sub full time, she had parties and had all sorts of people in and out of the house. Her only steadfast rule was "Touch my girls and you'll lose a hand." We could do what we wanted and participate in anything that wasn't sexual. I learned about knots and how sensual pain could be even without sex being involved. So when I say Sean's writing is real and felt I mean it. When I bought this book without any reviews on it, I thought it would probably rank a three star... but I was so pleasantly surprised. I will read more, recommend and share this book.... Even if it was too short.
No cracks, no fissures, no chips, no bubbles. about 3.5 inches of crystal, a great buy same amount my Dad paid for his in the '70's! I really like the weight and feel.
What to say? It had all its feathers and didn't start loosing them right away. It cleaned well. I like feathers much more than microfiber.
I received the assortment in good time and got more than I was expecting. The crystal Points were individually wrapped as were the geode slices. All were top quality.

I absolutely loves the outcome this spray gives my hair. I use this spray when I don't have time to use a curling wand. I just spray all over my head, run my fingers from root to tip the scrunch and shake. That method leaves me with the perfect curls that last all day. I love using my litter scooper the deep sifting base makes the job a breeze. The tube-shaped handle is easy to grip. This scoops is very durable leaving an effective litter box cleaning.

I had results very fast using these pills. I have lost 15 pounds so far. I never experienced any breaks, headaches or upset stomach. The supplements are easy to swallow and doesn't have the nasty after taste. I now have more energy then before.

I was prescribed Phentermine by my doctor for years and it worked great for me to help me lose weight and keep it off. My doctor took me off of it about a year ago and I started gaining weight  so I began looking for an alternative. I used PhenRx PM for some time and that also worked great for me, but I havent been able to find it lately. I recently discovered Xentrafen PM and I have to say that so far it is my favorite weight loss aid, hands down. It helps me sleep through the night which is an added bonus and it keeps my appetite in check. I have only been taking it for a few weeks, so I cant fully assess the weight loss aspects of the product yet, but I definitely feel slimmer  I will update my review in a few weeks after using this product longer. But, so far, so good!

I love how the color quality that I get when using these toners. Everything I prints comes out great the colors are bold and sharp. I haven't experienced any ink bleeding. This toners also allows me to gets me a higher yield then other toners. The price is very affordable.

This is the only car charger I trust to charge my iPad air and iPhone. Both of them can be plugged in at the same time and I can still get a fast and strong charge without either one of them getting overheated.

Great price. When traveling with my family we cannot have enough chargers. This charger is easy to travel with and switch between cars. The led lights works great and isn't to bright at night time. When using this charger I can fill my empty battery in under 30 minutes.

I spend a lot of time traveling and a lot my work is done from my tablet. I dont like to carrying around chargers when going to meetings so i got this portable car charger to give my tablet a fast and full charge. Since using this charger i noticed it gives my tablet the fastest charge.

This charger is easy to instal and remove. It gives my phone a fast and charge. Even when a second phone is plugged into the outlet it still provides a strong charge quickly. It doesn't make my phone hot

This is a great book. The storyline is very engaging. The unusualness of the storyline  holds your attention the whole book. All of the characters are well-developed. The pictures throughout the book helps adds to the atmosphere, allowing you to image visual pictures in your mind while reading the book.

I will always make sure to have this at hand! My skin has improved dramatically since using this product. Less breakouts, splotches, and hydration without feeling like I rubbed oil all over my face. Another thing that I LOVE about this product is I can use the smallest amount and still get the coverage and moisture I need.

Since switching to these toner cartridges the print quality of my flyers have improved a lot. My company booklets and brochures has been receiving great compliments. Plus I've been saving money on ink with the page yield.
This curling iron gets hot very fast and maintains temperature the whole time while I'm doing my hair. The automatic timers comes in handy. My curls have last all day and are very cute.
This is a great film. One if my favorite characters is the lead actor. The film was very entertaining the whole way threw.

The are designs are so beautiful with very bright colors. The craftsmanship very high quality. The rubbery material is soft, smooth and durable.  The case was very easy to install and doesn't scratch my phone

This bathing suit is the best of both quality and stylish. The fit is true to fit and fits my curves fabulous.  Allowing me to be flirty. I have washed my bathing suit a couple of times and the material is wonderful and still soft.
We've been using these compatible items for the life of our printers-they work just as well, for much less- you can buy a new printer for the cost of the drum!

I love try different types of food and experience all the great things about the area I'm traveling in. I used this guide to plan my vacation in Dallas and I have to say this book directed me in all the right directions and made my vacation one if the best yet.

I got a free sample of these supplements to try before making the purchase. After using then for a little while my body felt much better. It was the best detoxification I have had. I loss weight and it's actually staying off.
Very comfortable. The eye mask is  lightweight and smooth to touch on my eyes.  The stitch work is neat and durable. The material is dark enough to sleep during the day.
I felt in love with this massager in seconds.  The buzz is very quite yet the pulse of the vibration is strong. This massager is a great tension reliever.  The batteries last for a while.

The craftsmanship of this case is great. Very durable and lightweight.  My cards fits inside the case perfectly. My  iPhone 5 goes in the case perfect. Overall the case is very convenient and durable.

This is one of the best chargers I ever had. It charges my Galaxy S5 very fast and its also fast whenever transferring pictures and video to my computer. The cord is very thick and durable. This bundle is a great price and quality.

I bought these bags because my toaster was getting full of bread crumbs and melted cheese. I found these bags will accommodate almost any size of bread. The limitation is the thickness. It will easily take a toast with a couple of cheese slices and pepperoni pieces but using very thick fillings would be difficult. The advantage is tough you do not need use butter to make a toast. I can make toasted sandwiches in under 3 minutes.My toaster is now free of bread crumbs and melted cheese because all fall into the bag. If the bags are wiped clean with a paper towel right after use there really is no significant clean up. Crumbs and cheese do no stick to the bags, I can just wipe them off.I can use these in microwaves to heat up frozen food. Then I use a fresh bag to heat them up in the toaster. They do turn out so crispy, absolutely delicious. My food no longer has 'microwave sogginess'.I have found them so useful that I keep some at work and some spares at home. I will definitely be buying more when my spares run out!
With using this my files downloads much faster. And I'm more secure that my pin won't be damage.  This great to travel with. I received mine very fast after ordering.
This app is very handy. It's great for both keeping notes and even prep writing essays for school. Word Docs was very easy to use on my kindle. The files save fast and drain the battery.

This is one of the best kitchen tools to have.  I found by using this it gave my shrimp a great peal.  Which saved me so much prep time. It's very easy to use. You don't need to use much energy when using it. Plus cleaning it is so easy.
I have been using my mat twice a week since I received it. My meats now have a full flavored taste without the gas taste. The mat was easy to clean

This lamp is the first one that keeps my computers  area bright without bothering others around me. I love that I can change the position the lamp. It also have five different levels of brightness and self timer.

Legion battery works very well and as advertised. It charges your phone with no problems. The digital screen is extremely useful with lots of useful information for when you're on the go. The screen can tell you how many minutes you have remaining until your battery runs empty. A great feature.

These are the pads that sticks to my chairs for a long time. They are very durable and priced at a great value. So far they have been on living room chairs for three months and the hold is just as good as it was day one. I will be placing another order very soon for furniture in my ladies area.

This is best mount I found to hold my iPad while I drive. It was very easy to to install my iPad in the mount. Once installed the mount had an amazing grip and my iPad didn't wiggle a bit. My favorite part about this mount is that I can rotate it with easy. So my daughter can watch a movie while i'm driving or if my husband is driving I can adjust the mount for I can type a paper without holding the iPad in my lap.

I use this to clean my grill after every use. This brush is very lightweight, with a handle that is easy to grip. The brush cleans thoroughly and does not require me to go over it twice. I've been saving at least 30 minutes during cleaning time. It is also very easy to clean this brush out.

I have been tattooing for a while and these tattoo guns and power supply work perfectly. I have bought other tattoo kits on amazon and ebay that don't work half as good as this one! Especially the guns and power supply are freaking awesome. Also the carrying case is very handy dandy with enough room for all the guns, power supply, needles, and inks. I recommend this to anyone who tattoos, either beginner or professional -- go get this tattoo kit!

I have one of these hidden in my 16 year old car to make sure he is where he told me he is at. As well as making sure that he is driving the speed limit. I also use this locator when going on family trips. So that if I we decide we want to split up. I can easily check and see where the other group is on my phone. The location has always been correct.

This is the most handy phone case I have ever purchased. When hanging out with my friends at parties I can easily open beers without hurting my hand or using my shirt. The case is very shockproof, if you happen to be one of the type to drop your phone a lot I recommend this case to you. The kick stand is very strong and durable as well.

This coat was originally designed and sold only in China. All labels are in Chinese. The size conversion chart is not accurate. You will need one size larger.  Since these coats were designed in China the zipper is on the left and the chest area is very tight. The sleeves are also very short. It is a nice coat but why not buy one designed in the US?
This is just for one box. Normally this item is sold at this price for a pack of 3. Keep looking for a better price.
BEWARE - this is for just one box of breakfast biscuits. For this price it should be a pack of 3 boxes.

The photo on the website makes the shirt look much better then in real life. After one washing the shirt was very wrinkled and needed much more ironing them most shirts these days. And as you wear it during the day the shirt will become more and more wrinkled and by the end of your day you will be wearing a shirt full of wrinkles and creases. It will not look at all like the photo. I am returning the shirt and am very disappointed.

Very nice shirt but one star removed due to the absence of a chest pocket. Neither the photo nor the description mention that there is no chest pocket. I also removed one star because the sleeves are very short for 34/35. I will be returning the shirt due to the sleeves being too short. I would of kept the shirt otherwise.
BUYER BEWARE. This is for exactly one box not a pack of 3. You can get a pack of 3 for $1.00 less.

The shipping is one month. When the little unit finally arrived we were confused because there were no instructions. We finally figured it out but the recordings would not play on any computer. I requested a refund. It is about the size of lip balm.

Everything about this show is perfect. The actors, the scenery, the story, the character development, just everything. The second season picks up where the first season ended with the trial of the killer. I also read that there will be a third season! Well worth your time. Highly recommended.

The most durable medium sized safe  that I have ever purchased. Be aware that the safe weights 21 pounds and feels much heavier. The latch can be hard to open or close. The owner's manual even states that the safe may have to be pried open after a fire. If you register the product there is a limited lifetime warranty. The safe will be replaced after a fire or flood. We want to store the safe in a space that is quite high and you need to be on a ladder. Since it is so heavy we will not be taking it down frequently. Very happy with it so far.
