These pills have the most offensive taste imaginable. It is like eating an actual piece of bark or root. No coating at all. And the smell is horrible also. Amazon told me to throw them out and I will get a refund. Can't speak to the pain relief as I was only able to take 2 doses.
Not sure which movie is worse - A Good Day to Die Hard or this one. No reason at all to make this movie except to give Vin Diesel more of an ego. Just terrible.
This is a good movie and it appears to be an ongoing type of story. You will not be bored.

Out of the box these shoes looked great. I tried them on and then the problems started. First of all the shoes are extremely narrow. I am a size 9 and I ordered a size 10 and still could not wear them. Second, the design of the shoe is such that it was very uncomfortable to wear them even for a just a few minutes. I am unable to recommend these shoes at all. Returned them right away.
The only escape here is the end of the movie. Stupid story, cheesy music and no entertainment value at all. Definitely skip it.

This entire movie encourages wild and reckless stunts. There is a disclaimer at the end of the movie but no one will probably see it or care about it. There is no way a person can jump from one level of a bridge to a lower level while catching another person and survive. Windshields are not trampolines.  The tank was really cool though. In the end I loved seeing Paul Walker one last time but the movie was just too much for me.
I am not a race car fan but really enjoyed this movie. All the actors are excellent in their  roles. And everyone seems to speak in their native accents.

Joseph Gordon-Levitt is so talented. Here he has created a straight New Jersey Italian guy who is addicted to porn. Mr. Gordon-Levitt really pumped up for this role and fits in perfectly in his Italian family. The ending was somewhat lame but the movie is highly recommended.

This is a very exciting movie but it is not without it's flaws. The dialogue at the beginning is just so stiff and artificial. And it is really too much Tom Hanks. But the Somali actors are outstanding, especially the leader. I was wondering why these ships do not have weapons on board? A small group of men was able to easily take over a ship with a crew of 30 or so. The only defense against invaders were the fire hoses. The movie is recommended.

An interesting movie with lots of twists set against an upstate New York winter landscape. The problem with the movie is the 2 1/2 hour length. There are many slow scenes that are not needed and the pace could be picked up in many scenes. At least 30 minutes should be trimmed from the running time. The winter scenes in the sleet and snow were very well done.

This movie is about our digital life and how it can destroy us and the people around us. All the stories are based on true stories of bullying, addictions, porn and identity theft. All new computer users should watch this movie as well as parents and teenagers. The cast is excellent and the pace is just right. A winner!

I was really looking forward to watching this movie. I watched the unrated version and it was less gory then "The Walking Dead". The movie is frantic and loud. I think most summer action movies are made like this now and I don't like it. I like the slow pace of "The Walking Dead". I am also a slow zombie type and in this movie the zombies move at warp speed as well as the virus with a 12 second incubation time. Brad Pitt is very bland in this and all the other characters are just supporting him(also a producer). This movie is far from the best zombie movie but it is about average. A good watch once. The extras are just more advertising for the movie and Brad Pitt. He also made sure to be the only handsome actor in the movie. The cute young doctor was killed off after just 10 minutes.
One of their best from one of my favorite groups. Highly recommended. You will love it.  Love pet shop Boys!

The first 45 minutes are very entertaining. Visually stunning, good story and pacing. But a spaceship crashes and so does the movie. After that the story is all over the place with conspiracy theories and slow pacing. I started looking around for something else to do while the movie was playing.
An entertaining movie about magic and using it to commit crimes. Some of it was filmed near where I work in Chinatown.

This is one of the weakest of the Star Trek movies. It is loud and frantic. There is a small amount of humor but not as much as the previous movie. Fans will appreciate seeing the inside of the Enterprise on a grand scale. Not bad but I would not watch this movie a second time. I was very happy to see one of my favorite actresses appear in a small role - Aisha Hinds. She took Chekov's place on the bridge when he went to Engineering. I love her in "Under The Doom" and also here in a very small part.

This is the worst piece of crap that I have ever seen. It is not funny, not exciting and not at all watchable. Cartoon characters with an annoying voice over. I suffered through an hour but could not bear to watch it any longer.

This movie is a 2 person survival movie in the wilderness. Nice scenery but the John Travolta character is just so annoying - a terrible accent and tar black hair dye. It is OK just to pass the time if you are bored.

Please, find the painting already! One reality in another reality in another reality and on and on. Just gave me a big headache. I did not like Inception either so I guess these types of movies are an acquired taste. The nudity will wake you!

I just love Elliot Loves. I have watched it at least 5 times and love it more each time. It is very real and funny at the same time. The actors are all perfect in their roles and the story will grab you from the beginning. I loved the animated parts as well. Highly recommended.

I was so anxious to receive this book because of the reviews that if you loved "The Shack" you will love "Eve".  Well......I absolutely loved "The Shack" and didn't see how anyone could write a better book but I sure was excited to see if they could.  I was right, for my reading interests, in that "Eve" wasn't better for me and "The Shack" remains the best book I have read in a very long time.  The absolute best.  In "Eve" I felt like I was reading science fiction all through the book in spite of the fact that reality struck with Biblical references that constantly came to light through the book. I did read it all the way through, though, to see if the ending was what I expected having fairly good knowledge of the Bible and what happened in the beginnings of our earth, and I was kind of disappointed.  I thought it was just me, but my sister-in-law who also loved "The Shack" also anxiously awaited "Eve" said that she gave up trying to follow it and quit reading. Maybe I'm just not deep enough - don't know. I'm glad I got the book, read it, even though I was really disappointed in it. I buy a lot of Biblical books always trying to get deeper and clearer understanding ofBiblical events, prophecy, stories.  This just didn't do it for me.

These pillows are wonderful; while I prefer the plush for sleeping, this pillow is great to sit against in bed while watching television. Made wonderfully; quick service. Will likely order another of the Talalay Latex Pillows - plush - for my spare room.

Handbag is pretty, roomy and holds a lot. But...I deducted one star because when I put my "stuff" in it (and it isn't overloaded at all) the top kind of folds in and makes it difficult to open and access the stuff inside. I was hoping for a purse that would help stand up and keep it's own shape. This isn't it....but I kept it because it IS pretty and roomy.  I'll find a use for it :)

These curtains are wonderful.  Definitely block the sunlight so should make things cooler in the summer/warmer in the winter by virtue of the backing. The material is wonderful; drapes beautifully and so soft to the touch. They were a little wrinkled when they came, which I expected but I tossed them in a dryer with a couple wet towels and the moisture steamed the wrinkles out.  Love them.......
This is great tasting green tea.........5 stars for the flavor.  Mixed review though - I give it only 1 star for the price. WalMart sells it for $4.99/12 pack.

It was my cat's favorite treat......She'd eat it room temperature  and would eat the leftovers cold when it was Appetizers Fancy Feast - NOT Purely Fancy Feast.  It took me 2 years to finally find a wet food my finnicky cat would eat consistently - then Purina decided they needed to make it "better". Better isn't any good if the cat won't eat it, and she won't touch this.  I hadn't noticed the name change; purchased what I thought was her favorite food, set it in front of her and she sniffed it, looked at me, and walked away. Then I noticed it was the "new and improved" recipe.  I did have a couple of the older ones here, opened one of them and put it down for her, and she gobbled it up.  Purina needs to stop messing with their food!!!!!
I normally wear an XL; did order this in 2X as I ordered one previously and it was a little snug.  Love the material, fit, looks.
Beautiful sleeve for the HP Stream......just the right size. Nicely made; good sized pocket in front for the cord/mouse. Perfect for what I need.

Nice case for my HP stream and works as advertised. My issues are that it doesn't always automatically connect with the tablet and it may be something I'm doing wrong - haven't figured it out yet but I thought it should automatically connect when it is turned on, and tablet is also turned on. My other issue is that the tablet slides around in the "pocket" making it a little difficult to get to the power button and to see the icons across the bottom of the screen on the desktop side.  The fix is easy - slide it up so I can see the icons.  Easy - but annoying. Definitely easier to use a keyboard like this than to try to maneuver the virtual keyboard which so often covers up what you're trying to write.

Works great and exactly as described.  The "click" of the button to push the bristles out, or pull them back to remove the cat hair easier, kind of scares my kitty but that's an easy problem to solve.  Great brush.........

Beautiful case; ordered another one for me to go with my red one.  It fits great and love the blue.  Got this one for my brother for his phone - the kickstand is great, esp for use with the nightstand light/clock. My phone has the wireless battery and I was concerned that this might not fit since the depth is a little bit more than regular battery but it fits - snug but it fits and feels very secure. Love this case...........
Beautiful case for the 822; came more quickly than expected.  Bought it as a gift for a friend who loves butterflies and has the Nokia 822 phone.  Very nice set; would purchase again........

Pretty watch; I love the pastel colors on the dial which is why I bought it, plus I needed a "work watch" with a second hand and this serves the purpose very well. I gave it only 4 stars because the watch band just fits my wrist and my wrist isn't large so it could be a problem for some people.  Also because it's a bit bulkier than I anticipated but it is OK for work.

I love the Keurig brewers but this machine is a big disappointment to me due to the fact that it completely controls and dictates what kcups you can and can't use with it.  It absolutely won't accept the inserts so you can use your favorite brand of coffee; it won't accept many of the kcups currently on the market that actually may be one of your favorites (like Tim Horton, Gevalia, SanFrancisco Bay, Cameron's, etc) because they have not been approved by Keurig even though they will work in all the brewers by Keurig up until this 2.0 model and won't even accept Keurig approved Kcups purchased before about July since it will only accept those who say Keurig Brewed on the top of the cup.  This brewer reads the lids - I was told if I put an "older" approved kcup in the machine it would say "oops" and I could call their 800# presumably to be able to be talked through an option that might let me use one of their approved coffees.  This feels like a giant control effort to prevent people from enjoying their brewers unless you also use their coffees.  Sooooo - if you happen to like a brand of coffee they don't approve of you will have to choose between their new brewer and all it has to offer or your coffee.  I chose my coffee; there are a good many brewers that will still let me use my favorite brand of kcup that I don't need their new brewer.  And given time, I expect the other coffee makers will also offer what this one does (like the option of making either a single cup of coffee or a 4 cup carafe of coffee with their new kcup size) without dictating what coffee you enjoy in it.  It seems that Keurig would prefer to sell these brewers to anyone who wants one, while enjoying the approved coffee to those who choose to drink it, or will actually let people enjoy their brewer and their favorite coffee even if Keurig doesn't approve of their coffee.  I expect there will be others who did what I did - bought the machine only to realize this after I got it home and quickly realized I'd have to give up my favorite coffee to keep it, or throw out 95% of the kcups I had that were purchased before about July of this year.  I returned it - don't tell me what coffee I can like, Keurig - the other makers of single serve brewers that accept your kcups don't tell me what I have to like to use their brewers.  They will be the ones who sell their brewers while yours get returned and they will be glad to let me enjoy my favorite coffee in them.

Love these Polo shirts - needed Navy polos for work and the white piping sets it off nice.  Fits good, looks good, washes good and needs no ironing.  Would purchase again - in fact I tried to but they were out of my size :(

Love this coffee....blend is medium and no bitter aftertaste.  Nice that Keurig has approved it for their machines.  Now........if Keurig would approve some of the other coffees out there that are good (Tim Horton's, SanFrancisco Bay, Cameron's) I might get their new machine which only accepts Keurig approved kcups and nothing else.  Give up my coffee? Give up the machine?  I'll keep my coffee thank you, and if my Keurig dies I'll find a machine that will accept my favorite coffees (like the older model Keurigs or one of the many other single serve machines out there that will accept them all and will even let you use an insert to use your own coffee.) Their new machine (2.0)won't, nor will it accept any kcup that doesn't say "Keurig Brewed" around the top of the cup.  95% of the kcups I have were bought more than a month ago and therefore won't work in the 2.0.  This kcup (Starbucks one listed here) is one of the older ones I have - still tastes fresh - but won't be accepted by the 2.0.  Sorry......on a soapbox as I really would have liked the new Keurig - WalMart has it now and love that it has a carafe to make up to 4 cups as well as makes 1 cup.  But I won't give up my Starbucks coffees I have, nor will I give up my Tim Horton kcups, nor any of my older kcups that don't have the new labels that the 2.0 reads, to get their new machine............Anyway......love this decaf Starbucks.
Kitty likes it.....all that's important.

Really wanted to like this.........the fit was nice, band was easy to adjust, looked good on the wrist.  Counting steps was pretty inconsistent but I had wanted to also use it as a watch and the time was 2 hours off; couldn't find any way to adjust it and the display only stayed on for the length of time the button was pushed.  Maybe I got a lemon???  Anyway........returning it.

I love the Andy Carpenter series and this does not disappoint. A lot of twists and turns and an unexpected ending that all manage to include his beloved dog Tara.  A great suspense story told with tongue in cheek comments that help you smile along the way.  Love this entire series and hope it never ends.  Great to start a story and know the main players intimately from previous stories.
Can't wait to try this out - just received it a couple days ago and it looks like it will be perfect for the cooking I do.  I use the Microwave for nearly all stuff so this is perfect.

Summary: These washcloths are super soft. They're so nice to feel. I've been using them more as mini-handtowels, but I'm sure they function just fine as wash cloths for babies or big people.Random comments: (including some things I think people have legit cause to complain a bit if they're so inclined.)- They're tiny. I know they're intended to use for babies, but they're very, very tiny. I have small hands and I still feel it's barely there.- Super soft. :-)- The package is cute, but those little rings can easily damage the delicate clothes. First one I pulled off took several threads with it...I didn't rip a hole in it but it was a close call. Even being careful, several had a few damaged threads.- Not sure how they'll hold up long haul. I plan to test that through the next few weeks and I'll update accordingly.11/21/15, so far so good, I've been using them as hand towels....they're so nice and soft, quick drying.Conclusion: So far, so good. Nice, soft, baby washcloths.*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*

Summary: Nancy's in NYC to support Bess Marvin's bid for stardom on a early vision of American Idol (idea probably existed about a decade before those shows took off). She gets caught up in a case of trying to help this girl with amnesia recover her memories. The Hardy Boys are in town to investigate an embezzling case for a hot shot producer.Random Comments:- Okay, so the book's a lot out of date, but it's still fun.- The plot's convenient, but when were these books ever not full of convenient plot pts? That's part of their antiquated charm. I think payphones were mentioned. Nothing of today's technology yet the detectives are still top of their game. Must be nice to be 17/18 forever. I'm slightly jealous.- There's quite a lot of mystery in here. Some of the conclusions and leaps of logic are laughable, but it works.- Not my favorite cover, but probably my favorite of the Nancy Drew and Hardy Boys series.- Danger level is about on par with their typical cases. The files/casefiles era was particularly fond of endgame violence.Conclusion: Classic. But I'm not sure how teens today will like it.

Summary of what you get: Easy to use beginner microscope. It's got a stand, lens, course focus, and fine focus.Random Comments:- Might drive some bio teachers crazy because it doesn't have all the parts of a traditional microscope. That said, these would be super easy to stock in a classroom and you could get them for a fraction of the cost of a microscope.- The picture taking opportunities are awesome.- I'd actually probably use this to show off a chemical reaction, provided I could mount the camera on a proper ring stand. It's basically a glorified camera with a pretty powerful zoom function.- It works fine and is easy to install but you sort of need a CD drive, which I'm hearing some computers aren't coming with. My new laptop had one, but it's not a mac.- Packaging was well done.- Instructions are fair. Nothing spectacular, but not horrific either.- Price is fair.- Picture quality is good.- Great for homeschool use for those who don't have the money or inclination to buy an expensive one from a science supply company.- It's more a hobbiest's toy, but it's also got a ton of potential for easy learning opportunities. The way you use it is limited to your imagination...and the reach of the relatively short cord. I've decided a short cord's okay, I'm sure some company out there is willing to sell you a USB extension cord for a few more bucks if you really need a longer cord.Conclusion: Easy to use microscope. Doesn't do all that a traditional microscope can do, but it does some things that a "normal" microscope can't do. The ability to take a dozen pictures in seconds is kind of awesome.*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*

Summary: You get a lot for the money this time around. The main item is a case that's built for the belt clip and holder. Bonus items include a stylus, a plastic protector and a microfiber cloth to clean the glass surface of your phone.Random Comments:- Changing Cases (4/5 stars) - The case was big enough for my phone but it took a fair amount of prodding to actually get the cover on. It's good that it's not likely to fall off, but the silicon inner lining kept folding under the phone as I tried to put it in.- Style (4.5/5 stars) - Okay, so it's not the slickest look but it's functional and the black-gray color combination works nicely.- The case has a tiny notch that latches into the holder. Not sure how this would hold up over time, but it seems sturdy as of this moment. (Might not go jogging with it, but I think it would hold at least for a while.)- Phone snaps in and out reasonably well. I'd be careful not to scratch the face on the clip on the holder that keeps the phone in place.- kickstand is an interesting idea. Not sure how much practical use I'll give that feature, but it works swell.- Usefulness (5/5 stars) - Fits right on nearly any belt. It's pretty lightweight. You'll hardly remember you're wearing it.Conclusion: Right price. Decent look. Great idea.*I received a free sample in exchange for my thoughts.*

Summary: Nancy goes to Scotland to investigate the case that got her mother killed. (That's not a spoiler, that's in the trailer.)Random Comments:- I've been on a bit of a ND game hiatus here. I think the last I played was #14 or #15, but I was/am excited to play a story that tells you a little about Nancy's mother.- It was slightly annoying that they changed the canon info that Nancy's mom died when Nancy was 3 years old...I guess they needed it for their story line here but would have been nice to stick to some basic facts.- The puzzles in here were crazy hard (though take this from a non-puzzle gaming person)...I'm in it for the story not the puzzles. This is why it's always good to get the game a year or so after it releases...then the detailed gaming guide will walk you right through the tough stuff.- Even with the guidebook, the story takes about 5 ish hours to play through if you talk to everybody and investigate everything.Conclusion: Fun story. Great game. Might play again in a few months. Not sure how much replay value there is, but it should be good.

Summary: A firefighter witnesses a murder and is placed in protective custody. He's then pushed to the edge by the bad guy.Random comments:- Storyline is predictable but satisfying.- It's nice to see Bruce Willis in here...he could have had more parts, but he's still great in the support role.- Very violent. Torture scene included. Lots of strong language. Even for the type of movie it is, that could have been toned down a little. There are some R movies that are still on a level where most kids could watch it and be fine, but I wouldn't recommend this to teenagers.- Does include some themes about racism and gang wars...Conclusion: Worthwhile netflix or amazon instant pick, but probably not a keep on your shelf and cheris forever sort of movie.

Summary: Very nice glass screen protector.Installation: (4/5 stars) I cleaned the screen with the wet and dry wipes then lined up the screen and put it down in place. There was one large bubble in the middle and I couldn't find anything to squeeze it out with. I ended up usng the foam the glass had been originally wrapped in to try and press the bubble out. Fairly smooth installation.Feel: (4.5 stars) nice feel ... though it's a little strange to feel the glass near the bottom button, especially when trying to unlock with a thumbprint. Will just take some getting used to.Random comments:- I liked that you could clean the phone easily.- I like that it covers most of the screen but doesn't interfere with the case.- So far so good. I'll update if that darn bubble comes back again.Conclusion: Glass cover is way better than plastic. This is a nice sample.*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*

It took me a long time to write this review because strawberries were ridiculously expensive for a while there.This is a fun, little simple device that lets you pull the core out of a strawberry in about 2 seconds.Random Comments:- it takes a fair amount of thumb strength to push down enough to get the front part to open, but once you slide it into the strawberry and release it does the rest of the work.- It works better with strawberries that are ripe but firm stil. Squishy strawberries get mangled a little.- It's fun to play with as well as functional. I used it for prepping strawberries for a shortcake dessert, but you could use it for nearly any instance you need strawberries.- It works best if you tear off the green stem first, but you don't absolutely have to.Conclusion: Excellent for tearing the hearts out of strawberries.*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*

Note: I did buy a kindle, but I also listened to the audio performance thanks to a code from the author.The opinions are fully my own.Summary: Political pressure from the suspicious suicide of a Senator's son sends the FBI scrambling to solve a series of other suspect suicides.Random Comments:- On the personal front, I'm glad there are significant gains on the Lei relationship front. The almost teenage internal back and forth of what to do for several books got annoying. (It might very well be realistic...but it's still annoying.)- This story expands quite a bit on Sophie Ang. I think the author could have safely scaled back on the pages dedicated to her, but she's a cool character. I like how in the series the side characters do get some spotlight time.- The mystery is ... unique ... in a good way. Not many murder mysteries focus on suicide.- The wrapup is okay but there are a few threads left hanging. There's a big to-do in the beginning with the senator and his wife, but then they're pretty much never mentioned again in the entire book.Conclusion: A decent entry in the Lei Crime Series. Big gains in some of the side plots that have been hanging for a few books.

Summary: Joe Pickett's on the trail of a hunter of hunters.Random Comments:- I like how Joe's a normal guy. He's not described as the "best shot ever" ...- The mystery is pretty standard fare. Some nice twists.- I like the few sections with his family. Definitely a series I'll continue.Conclusion: Well-worth listening to (or reading).

*I received a free pair in exchange for my honest opinion.*Summary: 1 pair of (navy) waxed shoelaces.Random Comments:- I'd never head that shoelaces could be waxed. It feels a little odd, but they work fine.- I had to tie it in a double knot to get it to stay. I do that with all shoelaces, so I'd say that's par for the course.- These are a little thinner than the shoelaces I'm used too, but I imagine they're way easier to clean off, if one were so inclined to clean their shoelaces.- Colors and color selection are very nice.- The shipping would probably be negligible because they can fit in a business envelope and sail the USPS under a single stamp.Conclusion: If you're in the market for new shoelaces, these are a great choice. I do think the wax may have them untie a few more times than normal for heavy use, but just double knot them and they should be fine.

*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*Summary: Cute, portable humidifier. Perfect for traveling.Random Comments:- I've needed a humidifier for the past few winters because the heat just dries up the air. This is a nice option.- The cord's not terribly long.Slight Cons:- Having to plug into a USB port is odd. I had an adapter I stole from my kindle, but other than that, you'd have to have a power strip that has a USB port, which is just an extra "thing" to have to be awarre of in a traveling situation.- It doesn't last the whole night. I think it'll work for a good 6 hours, but if you sleep for much more than that, you'll wake up with it straining to pump the last little bit. Incidentally, it will never get the last centimeter because of how far down the filter can reach.Pros:- The LED light works great and is a very soothing color.- It worked immediately and very well at that.- Lightweight. You could easily pack it and not have to worry about dragging about much more than that adapter to get it to fit in a socket.Conclusion: If you need a humidifier and travel alot, you should definitely consider this. Also, if your humidifier needs are modest, I'd say you could go for this anyway. It's not going to turn your room into a tropical jungle, but it should help fight off the dry winter air.

It's not the world's greatest movie, but the end has enough action to keep it interesting.Sean Connery does a nice job as Marshall O'Neil.I almost quit on it several times, but I'm glad I stuck it out.Some of the plotting is shaky, but the characters are simple, straightforward, and realistic.

*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*Summary: You get one relatively easy install shower head with a few different flow settings.Random Comments:- This showerhead sits a little higher than the last one I had.- The hose has two ends, and the directions aren't really clear on which end should go where. It's pretty easy to figure out by process of elimination when you do it wrong the first time, but that probably was an easy fix in the directions. The directions picture is pretty useless.- As a showerhead it works swell. The mist is a setting I'll probably be ignoring, but I appreciate that there are options.- The thing dripped for a little after I shut off the water, but it stopped after a while.- The water restricter was removed by choice.- Sleek, clean look to it.Update: I've been using this showerhead for a while now. Still works great. Nice strong water pressure.Conclusion: Fair price for a decent product.

Summary: John Puller's brother escapes from the military prison.Random Commentary:- This is a pretty long audiobook, but it's decently read. The music behind certain parts fits very well. Nice presenation.- The dialogue isn't super wonderful, but it's workable.- The plot's extremely far-fetched, but what thriller isn't? That's kind of the point. Danger. Intrigue.- There was actually one part that almost made me cry...I think it was the father's letter to the military court.- Third book in the series, strengthens the thing as a whole.Conclusion: Don't think too much as you listen/read the story. It's entertaining. Puller's a good character. Knox is a fair foil for him.

*I received a free sample in exchange for my honest opinion.*Summary: I'm not sure what the difference is between a serum and a lotion. Guess I just don't try enough of these things.Random Comments:- I am always leary of trying new skin things because my skin seems to be tempermental when it comes to new products. So, I tried a little on my hands first.- First impression: It smells nice (faintly citrusy; not overpowering; the scent comes across as light and purposeful rather than heavy handed to mask something) and goes on smoothly.- It's only been used a few days, but so far so good.- It's a very tiny bottle, but you don't need all that much. And it's not meant to be a full body lotion, so it should last a while.- The discounted price of $24.95 seems pricey, but that could just be that my typical lotion can be bought off a shelf at Target/Walmart, etc. In the grand scheme of serums, it is modestly priced, so take that into consideration.Conclusion: If you're in the market for an anti-aging serum, this is a decent choice.

*I received a free sample in exchange for an honest review.Summary: This is a stick designed to hold your phone so you can take pictures of yourself and a friend or things behind you without the super awkward angle of a normal selfie.Random comments:- Worked swell on an android phone. No trouble hooking up.- Maybe it's just me, but I have trust issues when it comes to something like this that essentially places one's very expensive phone in the air at a height quite able to damage it if it falls. So far, no mishaps though, so I think it's a decent design. The clamp worked well. The stick was easy to maneuver in and out.- I like that it has its own carrying case.- Would make a nice gift.- I'd be cautious about using it over ledges. Just my paranoia, but it's one thing to risk possible dropping a phone and another to risk dropping it someplace irretrievable.Conclusion: If you're in the market for a Selfie Stick. It's a good option.

Summary: Lei's Aunt Rosario ships her off into the woods with some camplike counselors and some other troubled teens. Chaos ensues.Random Comments:- The scenario described is somewhat plausible, though I doubt a program like that would allow a male counselor any alone time with a female client for the sake of both the client and the counselor. Misunderstandings could lead to lawsuits.(That whole conversation with Tim was irksome.)- The beginning was rather slow moving, but 1/2 way through things picked up very quickly.- A bit dark but compelling.- Lei's survivor instincts are intact here. She's the most developed character here. In a novella with this many side characters, it's hard to make everybody 3d. Some are and some aren't fleshed out here. That doesn't detract from what you get.- I love the last scene.Conclusion: Great story to read for some early insight into the mind of Lei as a teenager.

Summary: Nikki Sotos body washes up on shore, setting Detective Lei and co on another murder mystery adventure. But thats not all, theres another victim, another young woman missing and she happens to be the daughter of one of Leis acquaintances.Random Comments:- The endings a little abrupt, but the mystery unfolds at a nice pace.- There were some threads that seemed to go nowhere. Im being purposefully vague to avoid spoilers, but some aspects of the investigation seemed hyped up for no reason.- The medical examiner was suitably quirky. Dr. Harris was nicely fleshed out for a side character.- To my knowledge, the story doesnt contain any spoilers for those who havent yet read the Lei Crime Series canon. I believe this story fits near the second book. (Jack Jenkins is her partner and shes a detectivedefinitely not first book.)- The bad guys a little stock, but thats not a terrible thing.- This novella also brings up a topic thats close to my heart. And the title fits well.Conclusion: Well worth reading.

Summary: Earth gets attacked by Formics, starting in China. The world scrambles to figure out how to stop them.Random Comments:- Only half of the characters are likable, most are just annoying. The 8 year old kid is neat; wise beyond his years. Lem's annoying. His father's annoying. Victor's family is sort of interesting. Reena seems like a lady with a good head on her shoulders but she gets like 2 scenes.- There's a large cast here, but it doesn't seem like the page distribution is very even.- I think it's cool to be exploring the backstory, but like any spinoff, it suffers from trying too hard to be what was and not enough time being an awesome story in and of itself.Conclusion: Okay but skippable.

Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Mandy M. Roth (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is the second book in the Druid series.  While it does stand on its own, I highly recommend reading the series in order of publication.In fact, I highly recommend reading this series.  It has an even balance of action, lust, and humor.  My favorite combination to be found in a book.My favorite character was Gigi, without a doubt.  Between Gigi and Korey there were some interesting and well-kept secrets that I thought were incredibly imaginative.I hope I get the next book in this series and soon!

Title:  LION FOR HERSeries:  N/ACategory /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Brandy Walker (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is a stand-alone novella in the Southern Shifters Kindle World.  It is not part of any other series.One of the best questions an author can ask is, what if?  So, what if the one you thought was your fated mate isnt?  How did you read that wrong?  How can this be resolved?I thought there were great characters and a different story.  Most PNR have the H/h meeting as adults and fated mates recognize each other immediately.  Instead, Maddie, Van, and Mack have known each other since they were children.  They wouldnt know each other as mates on the playground and as they reached puberty they were a threesome of best friends.  Maddie makes a mistake and so do the boys.  As adults sometimes the hardest thing is recognizing a colossal mistake, admitting it, and then finding a fix.  I loved how Brandy Walker made it all happen.  She has great secondary characters that could also be brought into their own stories (hint, hint).I have begged Brandy Walker to write about at least one of the other characters, to (pretty, please) return to the Southern Shifters World.  She agreed!!!!  Vans brother, Mack, deserves his HEA, too.  Eliza Gayle has created a wonderful world that I am enjoying exploring.  In fact, I still have two more books in the series and hoping for more.

Title:  HUNTING LAURACategory:  Erotica, RomanceReceived from:  J.A. Bailey (in exchange for an honest review)Laura is a reporter and her bosses have told her to get the story about the Hollybourne School or she will lose her job.  In this school ladies learn to be the perfect submissive.  She and her fellow students are each given an experienced dom/mentor to lead them through their lessons.  Lauras mentor is Mr. Hunter.  The big questions are will he find out why shes really there and will he be able to break through her head space to help her find herself.Ms. Bailey has produced some engaging characters that do not fail to provide equal parts of steam and feisty attitude. Title: SINFUL DEEDSSeries: Cynfell Brothers #2Category /Genre: Historical RomanceRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Samantha Holt (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing: ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is the second book in the Cynfell Brothers series. Though each does stand alone, I would recommend reading in the order of publication. You can expect updates on the previous couples.Dante Cynfell is the second son in this family. I am reminded that the traditional aristocracy procreated with the motto of an heir and a spare. Meaning that each family wanted there to be two boys born, because of the high infant mortality rates of the times.Born as the spare, Dante lacks the seriousness of his brother. He lives a life of privilege with no responsibility. He doesnt see his responsibility even for his mistress. When Josephine, Jo-Jo, tells him that she wants more or freedom, he really doesnt understand what more a woman could want.I loved the banter between these two. I also loved the growth they each experienced. Its obvious from page one that they love each other, but they are both strong enough to ask for what they want and fight for what they need. I thought this was a great story and extremely well written. This was not the usual boy meets girl, boy loses girl, boy fights for girl. Instead we start at boy loses girl and they both make the fight worthwhile. I cheered when he inevitably re-won the heart of the girl without making her lose herself in the process.As stated in the previous review, the chores are often ignored when a truly good read is available  still guilty. I began this one as soon as I finished Sinful Confessions and now Im done. I guess its time to get back to work but rest assured, I have one eye on my kindle account to see when the next book in this series will be released.

Title: SINFUL CONFESSIONSSeries: Cynfell Brothers #1Category /Genre: Historical RomanceRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Samantha Holt (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing: ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is the first book in the Cynfell Brothers series, each embodying one of the seven deadly seasons. Each will stand alone, but I would still recommend reading them in the order of release. You can expect updates on the previous couples.The Marquees of Lockwood, Julian Cynfell, is wrath personified and with good reason. Three times he has been left a widower and the tongues of the ton are wagging, as one might expect. His only joy comes in the letters from his pen pal in America. Viola Thompson is the daughter of a business associate and she provides all of the correspondence for her ailing father. Besides being awkward for both of them, I thought their first meeting was as intriguing as it was funny. In fact, I loved the whole story  Julian fighting the love vs lust battle and Violas secrets and background add to the tensions, both sexual and societal.Somehow, Samantha Holt is always able to provide intelligent, unique romance with a solid side of humor. She has delivered again and I am looking forward to continuing this series. I read it in one sitting (instead of doing the chores i had set for myself for the day LOL). I know that I will never go wrong with a romance from Samantha Holt.Bonus: Yeah!! I already have book 2 - and yes, I'm still ignoring those chores!!!

Title:  THE BUTTERFLY EFFECTSeries:  N/ACategory /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Renea Porter (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is a stand-alone story / not associated with a series.I love the story concept. Title:  SUNKSeries:  N/ACategory /Genre:  Contemporary RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Renea Porter (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  B  a few small errorsThis is a stand-alone story/ not part of a series.A little bit of drama, a smidge of BDSM, and a lot of sweetness and love against a backdrop of unbearable loss.Likable characters that I could relate to, since I do know the devastating depression that follows the loss of a child for everyone involved in that childs life.I found the writing to be a little simplistic. Unfortunately, far too much time was spent on trivialities.  Though well written and added to the story, they werent what the story was about. Title:  DAMAGE REPORTSeries:  Immortal Outcasts #2Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Mandy M. Roth (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is the second book in the Immortal Outcasts (an Immortal Ops spin-off).  Each stands on its own, but I would recommend that you read them in order anyways.When I got to work this morning, the power was down.  I had several (interrupted) hours and I devoured this story!  I am thanking God for a power outage.  How often do you get to say that?Weston is a grumpy bear.  Things change when the immortal is told that he has a mate, and she is in trouble.  Thats all it takes for the reclusive man to pull up stakes and fly across the country with Gus and Bill in an effort to find and save her.  Paisley doesnt even know she needs to be saved until moments before they arrive.  I loved her determination in all things  whether it was supporting her friend or chasing her heart for the sake of her mate.  She is powerfully strong emotionally and intellectually.Gus and Bill have returned in this story as well and they have never been funnier.  When Bill asked Paisley if she had a sister named Plaid for their Scottish friend (Striker) who wears a kilt, I thought I was going to die laughing!!  In fact the interaction between Gus and Bill was even more endearing this time around.  I just felt closer to both of them and adored their symbiotic and brotherly relationship.My final word:  Another one hit clean out of the ball park.  Mandy M. Roth remains as one of my go-to authors!

Title:  A WOLF TO BEARKindle World:  Southern ShiftersAuthor:  Dee CarneyPublish Date:  08.09.2015Publisher:  Kindle WorldsCategory /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, Fan-FictionRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Dee Carney (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is a stand-alone novella in the Southern Shifters Kindle World.  It is not part of any other series.This is the third story that I have read that is set in the Southern Shifters Kindle World (fan-fiction set in the fictional area called Tail of the Dragon in the Southern Appalachian Mountains).  I have loved each of the ones I have read thus far.  I have two more downloaded and Im looking forward to more from this series (see list of books and authors below).Who can resist a damsel in distress?  Murphy Hazen is doing his best to resist her, but knowing she is her fated mate and she is in her first heat is making it damn hard (pun intended).  Still, he is intent on doing the right thing for her, even if that means giving her up.  As I said on the day of my divorce, sometimes loving someone means letting them go if that is what will make them happy.  Along the way, Murphy is going to find out that Sable knows that passion and love are the only things that will make her happy.  He will also learn that needing a helping hand doesnt mean that she was hopelessly helpless.I loved this quick romantic story and the characters are just so sweet!  The ending had me smiling for hours!  Im not spoiling anything when I say that a romance novel has an HEA, but the road to getting there is filled with love, loyalty, and surprises.This is the first book I have read from Dee Carney.  She has quiet an extensive backlist that I would love to devour now that I have had a taste.

Title:  SHIFTIN SASSY:  DERRIA PRYDESeries:  PRYDE RANCH #4 A Southern Shifters Kindle World novellaAuthor:  T.J. MichaelsPublish Date:  08.09.2015Publisher:  Kindle WorldsCategory /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, Fan FictionRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  T.J. Michaels (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  B  a few small errorsThis is the fourth book in the Pryde Ranch series.  It does stand on its own, though now Im curious about the rest of the pride, but it also has a cliff-hanger.  The primary conflict (why shes chasing the rogue, Kerr, is not resolved), but it is an excellent introduction to all of the characters and I didnt feel cheated by it ending where it did.This is also a novella in the Southern Shifters Kindle World, set in the Tail of the Dragon area in the Southern Appalachian Mountains.  In this world, this book also stands alone and does not need any other knowledge, though there are references to other story lines that has me clamoring for more!I have to share my favorite statement from Lakota.  Derria is one of the most capable women I know.  If she could get here and ambush you alone, trust me, shell be fine.  Besides, the newly healed claw marks on my chest from just this morning are a reminder that when I get the urge to try to control her, its best to change my mind.That about sums up Derria.  She is doing her job and nobody, not even a mate, will get in her way.  I loved that she immediately recognizes the mate bond and doesnt fight it.the first time around.Kerr is the mystery man running from Derria with no idea why he is being chased.  He is hot and alpha.  I fell in love with him on page one even if he was the bad guy.Lakota (Kota to his friends) is a basketful of secrets, but everything changes when he meets Derria.  He is also hot and alpha.  From first sight, he is devoted to making Derrias life easier and more comfortable, whether that means tracking a rogue or finding her a place to lie down at night.If they were food, Lakota would be dark chocolate, Kerr a cinnamon caramel, and Derria the cherry whip that brings them all together.  Now Im hungry for more of them, more Southern Shifters, and a special chocolate, caramel, cherry treat!  If youre looking for me, Ill be in the kitchen with a wooden spoon in one hand and my Kindle in the other.

Series: Crossfire, #1Category /Genre: Erotica, Psychological ThrillerRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: A friend, as a birthday gift (Kindle edition)Grammar/editing: A  near perfectThis is the first book in the Crossfire Series. They do need to be read in order.Thank you, Ivan. He told me to pick a book from my Amazon wishlist and he was giving it to me for my birthday in January 2015. It has sat in my TBR until now when I finally had some me time.I recommended this book before I had read it. 'Twas the day before Christmas, and I was at a local department store. As is my routine, I went to the book section to see if any of my favorite authors were on display. It was very early in the morning and there was only one other shopper in the section. He looked lost. After a few minutes, I asked him for whom was he shopping. He said his wife waited until the last minute to tell him that she wanted a book for Christmas. I asked what she likes and his answer is "I don't know." So, I try to change tact and ask him what the last book that she read was. His answer made me giggle, when he said, "I suck." Now, I need to tell ya'all I haven't read FSOG and I hadn't read the Crossfire series, but I was told that anyone who liked FSOG would like this one. So, I suggested to him that he pick up the boxed set. As he stood there looking at the rather generic cover he asked what kind of books they were. Of course, I recognized that he was asking me what I had asked him in the beginning. This time I blushed (yes, I really do blush), and whispered "erotica." He lifted an eyebrow at me, questioningly. So I suggested that HE would thank me if she read the books. That's all it took and into the cart they went.Since then, I have read all three of the FSOG books (on a dare)  and I hated them. So, I was reluctant to read anything with the if you liked FSOG, then tag. On the other hand, I was told these ones were *better than,* so here I am. I agree  this was much better than FSOG. The relationship was the most important part of the relationship, not just his ego being stroked - it was a real couple, not just him demanding and her doing. I loved Gideons attention to all things about Eva.Just keep in mind it is fiction. Most of us dont live in a world of trust funds and billions of dollars. The story does stand on its own and I havent made the decision as to whether I will continue reading the series.

Title: THE SCENT OF A VIRGINSeries: n/aCategory /Genre: Paranormal Romance, BBW, MnageRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Amazon purchaseGrammar/editing: C  average writing, poorly editedThis is a stand-alone short story of male eroticism.Two, alpha, billionaire werewolves decide they want the curvy virgin secretary and alphas always get what they want.There was no seduction. Instead, Lila is offered a raise if she complies and threatened with the loss of her job if she doesnt. This is sexual harassment in its most basic form. If youre looking for smut, this will fit the bill (and there's nothing wrong with that - i won't judge). If youre looking for romance, move along  nothing to see here.

Series: N/ACategory /Genre: Contemporary Romance, Zombie ApocalypseRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Jade C. Jamison (in exchange for an honest review/Beta reading)Grammar/editing: ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is a stand-alone story of survival and hope.Savage  the boy who held her heart and filled her dreams in her youth. Savage  the new reality of a world decimated by a zombie plague. Savage  the man who can once again claim her heart and reignite her hope in a future.When Jade C. Jamison first told me that she was going to write a zombie book, I thought, I love you, but I dont know if I want to read this. I never told her that out loud though, and Im glad I didnt. Jade is best known for her heavy metal, romance series, Bullet. SAVAGE proves that not all rock stars take to the stage. Some only need to be the stars of our lives. Kevin Savage has been the star of Nina Hardwicks dreams, fantasies, and wishes for decades.Kevin and Nina are in their forties. It was refreshing to read characters that were past the age of ingnue and yet youthfully hopeful in their hearts.Trust me, you want to spend a winter stranded in the Colorado Mountains with Nina, Kevin, and her neighbors. Will they survive? Will her heart? Will the zombies find them?

Series:  Highland Wolf Clan #1Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  A.K. Michaels (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  B  a few small errorsThis is the first book in the Highland Wolf Clan series.  They will need to be read in order.Cameron Sinclair never wants to be alpha of his family pack.  Instead, he left to build his own fortunes and he has succeeded.  Though a billionaire on his own now, when called back to the Highlands that were home, he goes.  What he finds is that his uncle in America has some serious hostile issues coming from an unknown enemy.  During reconnaissance, he sees a white she-wolf and finds that his life will never be the same.I loved this story.  The family relationships are not all happy, happy, joy, joy.  Theyre real  a little bitter, a little sweet, and a lot of love.  The story line is well thought-out and expertly executed.  This is one that will stick in my mind for a long time to come.  I have tons of questions, but asking them here would be spoiling the story for you who are reading this review.I recommend picking up this book and joining the Highland Wolf Clan  Arrrooooo!This was the first book I have read from A.K. Michaels.  I promise it wont be the last.  Thank you A.K. for offering me this story.  I am looking forward to reading book 2!

Series:  California Bears #6Category /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, BBWRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Amazon purchaseGrammar/editing:  D  many errors, some distractionThe numbering of the books is a bit wonky as both Bear Bound and Beach Bear are listed as #3.  They are not the same book, so a little confusion there.  Since they do stand-alone, it turns out to be not a huge issue.  Given the dates of publication, I would say this should actually be listed as #6.When Sunny Prim, a curvy weather girl, falls off of a cruise ship, she finds herself washed ashore on a deserted island that already has one occupant.  Havoc Hunter had given up on the idea of a mate and has isolated himself on his uncharted island.  Havoc has come to Sunnys rescue once, could he be her salvation?  Could she be his unexpected mate?Entertaining, but.even in human form, he penis was referred to as his bear cock  ewwww  smacks a little too much of bestiality.This is the first book I have read from Rachel Real.  I have to admit to a morbid curiosity to try another of her books.  While I found her editing lacking and the touch of bestiality disturbing, I still thought the story idea was interesting and promising if polished up.

Series:  book 1 of 2Category /Genre:  Contemporary RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentTriggers alert:  Domestic violence, sexual assaultReceived from:  Mia Rivers (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedTara has a secret that has haunted and tormented her for six years.  Tara also has a tormenting boyfriend.  He knows her secret and is using it as only a domineering jerk could.  When Tara (literally) runs into Nick, she is immediately thrown off center and wishing for a life she believed could never be hers.  Nick, too, has a secret.  One that could destroy them.I loved Tara.  She is beautiful mixture of vulnerable, nave, and intelligent.  She is determined and strong, despite her toxic relationship with Alex.  Alex is a classic silent-movie style villain in the black hat.  There is not a single redeeming quality to him, except in her dreams.  I was cheering for Nick the whole way through the book.  He is gorgeous, sexy, sweet, and alpha-dominant.  A dominant man (Nick) is always sexier than a domineering one (Alex). and then the last chapter happened.  I did NOT see it coming.  I wanted to throw my Kindle.  I wanted to scream.  I settled for contacting the author, calling her a naughty word (after thanking her for sharing the book with me), and then insisting that she get writing because I need to know what happens next!This is the first book released by Mia Rivers.  I consider it a treat to find a new author just starting out that I believe could be a big name in the literary world.  There were a few places where she could have provided more description and there were a few places that it was obvious she was going for word count  newbie mistakes, but I feel she has a great story-telling ability that only needs to be nurtured to life.

Title:  THE HUNTSeries:  V.V. Inn #2Category /Genre:  Paranormal Romance; ThrillerRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentGrammar/editing:  ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedTrigger warning:  Rape sceneReceived from:  C.J. Ellison (in exchange for an honest review)This is the second full-length book in the V.V. Inn series.  They do need to be read in order.After tracking and killing Ivan a few months previously, and the seeing the thrill it provided the guests to out think a master vampire, it has been decided that they would stage a new hunt.  Sanctioned by the Tribunal, the guests will be allowed to hunt and claim the power of a rogue.  What could possibly go wrong in pitting seven vampires and seven werewolves against one ancient vampire intent on surviving and winning her freedom?I could not put down this story  you know the kind:  you read at the red light, while you eat, and extra minutes on the treadmill just so you dont have to stop.  It was a lot of fun to read this story in not just two voices, but seven!  Vivian, Rafe, Jonathan, Drew, Asa, Paul, and Joanna each provide their own insights into their Arctic supernatural world and the events of the week of the hunt.  I honestly cant decide which is my favorite character.  They are all wonderfully created  each is unique and complex.I am already reading the next novel in the series, BIG GAME, and I will post that review tomorrow.

Title: Evil StepsisterSeries: Love Series #1Category /Genre: Contemporary RomanceRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Scarlett Jade (Amazon gift)Grammar/editing: A near perfectThis is the first book in the Love series. They will need to be read in order.Carter has been in love with Brielle since they were very small children. No matter what she does, he loves her even when he doesnt like her. His father marries her mother and the emotional torment she gives him increases to a fever pitch. When she moves away, breaking his heart, and then returns, he is left to wonder if her demons can ever be put to rest. Can they ever have the HEA he wishes to have? Im not sure what I expected, but this story idea surpassed my imagination. I didnt realize I love my step-brother/sister was a modern trope, especially since its near to life in my family. (My sister married our foster-brother.) Now, Im curious what other authors may invent with this concept.At 50%, I couldnt keep it to myself and had to gift a copy to a friend.Brielle reminds me of every mean girl I ever met in high school. Her favorite target is the one boy she knows will love her and protect her no matter what. Its such a horrible way to repay such dedication and devotion. Here is an example of their interaction: Why cant you just leave me alone?Because I dont want anyone else to have you just in case I decide I want you later on. That pretty much sums up Brielles attitude. Even with that, I still love her just as much as Carter. As always, Scarlett Jade creates characters who are beautifully flawed, lovable, and relatable.I cant wait to read Good Stepbrother. Were going to find out WHY Brielle acts that way. Knowing Jade, this is not just a simple case of narcissism. Good God, where might she lead us next?!

Title:  HER EVERYTHINGSeries:  1Night StandsCategory /Genre:  Romance, short-storyRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Tara Andrews (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis story is part of the 1Night Stand series.  Each one stands alone and there is no need to read them in a particular order.I loved the quick pace of this short-story.  It was quick, but I never felt rushed or lost.  There is just the perfect amount of naughty to stay sweet and be steamy too.Mark and Rachel are such a perfect match that I was rooting for them the whole way through.  Everyone should find that one person who is their everything and who believes that you are everything for them as well. Then there is the ending I dont want to spoil it, so I recommend you pick up a copy and find out why Im smiling.This is Tara Andrews second release, both in the 1Night Stand series, and both are extremely good.  I look forward to reading more from her!

Title:  BEARLY EVERSeries:  Alpha Werebear Shifter Romance #1Category /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, short storyRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Amazon purchaseGrammar/editing:  B  a few small errorsThis is the first book in the Alpha Werebear serial.  They will need to be read in order.There are more than bears and wolves shifting in this town.  That cute little bunny wiggling its nose, just may be the neighbors kid out for a hop!  Ever Jackson has no idea that shifters exist.  She just knows that her sister is missing and nobody seems to even know she was there.  When the Brahms (alpha) son, Sheriff Aiden, investigates the new girl in town, he realizes that the human is his mate!I absolutely love the story, but hate the abrupt ending.  I dont hate the ending  its excellent  I hate the abruptness.  Its obvious the author wants her readers to want more.  Olivia Gayle does apologize for being evil, but I could hear a distinct Mua-ha-ha in that apology!  Im sure shell be getting what she wants from a lot of us.  The good news is that the second part is available:  here.  Yes, I one- clicked one for me.This is Olivia Gayles premier in the world of authoring. Id say she has a voice that needs to be heard with a wonderfully unique story to be told.

Title:  I BELONG TO YOUSeries:  Inside Out, #5Category /Genre:  Erotica, RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Simon & Schuster (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is the fourteenth installment in the continuing Inside Out story.  Each does stand alone, but I recommend reading all and in order to enjoy the full tale.Mark has come to New York City to be with her mother as she goes through her cancer treatments.  Being in NYC also means time with Crystal and Riptide.  He is dealing with the loss of Rebecca, the investigation, and threats to himself and his family.  Now more than ever, he believes he must take control.  With Crystal he feels more than he ever has before.I love Crystal even more after this story.  She seems to be a balm to Marks soul  more even than he ever believed was possible outside of the control he held over his submissives.  This is not to say that he has been cured.  He is still a dominant and enjoys being in control, but, with Crystal, hes finding the balance that will make him a whole person.  What a beautiful story of personal growth!I am so sad to think that this series may soon be ending.  On the other hand, it is in development for cable TV and I am excited to see Suzanne Todd (producer of Alice in Wonderland) bring our favorite characters to life!

Title: DEATH'S SERVANTSeries: V.V. Inn #0.1Category /Genre: Paranormal RomanceRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Amazon purchaseGrammar/editing: B - a few small errorsFor most readers to date, this has been a prequel, written well after they had already read several of the books in this series. For me, I had not read any, so this is book one to my mind. I was not lost. Each character is well-introduced. BTW: the introduction to Dria and Rafe is hawt, hawt, hawt!!A year ago, college student, Jonathan Winchester, was bitten by a wolf and forced to believe that the things that go bump in the night are real. Romeo, alpha of the Manitoba pack, takes him in to train him, but it is soon evident that Jon is an alpha and will one day outgrow or challenge for the pack. Jon decides to leave after a tremendous argument with Romeo that shows no sign of resolution. He finds himself in Virginia, close to but unable to go home. He's surprised to chance upon another lone wolf, his waitress, Raine. When he discovers her secret and the danger she is in, he is determined to save the woman he believes could be his mate. His determination leads him to a pretty redheaded vampire, Dria, and her human husband, Rafe. Will saving Raine mean death for Jon?If you are new to the series, as I am, I recommend this as a first read. Allow yourself to fall in love with Jon as I have! You have to admire any man who will place himself in danger or debt to claim the woman he wants.How exciting to be at the beginning of a new series loved by so many! I'm looking forward to the next "prequel," Just One Taste; see that review, soon!

Title:  THE MATE CHALLENGESeries:  Sassy Mates #4Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Milly Taiden (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is the fifth book in the Sassy Mates series. She was sure and he was sure from the first time she walked in on him (naked) the first day she was visiting the Wolfe house.  She is just determined that he see her as an independent, mature woman capable of holding her own in the world  and shes determined to do it all at his side!  Hooray for a strong, yet feminine woman!!As always, Milly Taiden brings plenty of humor, tension, and hot, hot alpha male sex.  This time that alpha male has his alpha female stirring things up too!

Title:  MATING BEHAVIORSeries:  N/ACategory /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, short storyRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Amazon purchaseGrammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is a stand-alone story, not part of a series.As hard as it is for authors to write those blurbs, its not often that theyre a great representation of the story.
