Title:  DEVILS AMONG USSeries:  Devils Among Us #1Category /Genre:  Paranormal RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Mandy M. Roth (in exchange for an honest review)This is book one in the new Devils Among Us series.  They will probably need to be read in order (I will update when I know for sure).Hannah has a secret admirer.  Though shes never seen him, she knows hes there.  She can feel him watching her.  Each time he visits, he leaves a very unique gift behind.Keane has lived hundreds of years.  Human women are meant to be used and discarded, but now hes drawn to Hannah.  Hes kept busy protecting her from the evil that seems to be drawn to her.Janco has been teasing Keane about his obsession with the human.  That is, until Hannah and her friend, Preyca, are attacked while the brothers are watching.  Janco tries to deny his feelings for Hannah to prevent fighting with his brother, but sometimes fate is stronger.One slayer, two sexy-as-sin demon brothers, and a bit of magical fate bringing them together, all leads to a sexy, short, paranormal love match.I absolutely loved this first book in the series and hope there is more soon.  Maybe Preyca will like Keane and Jancos brothers?

Title: CRAVING TALONSeries: 69 Bottles #2Category /Genre: Erotic, Contemporary Romance, M/M/FRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Zoey Derrick (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing: ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is the second book in the 69 Bottles series. They do need to be read in order, but there are no cliff-hangers.Addie and the boys of 69 Bottles are riding high on the news of the bands successes following the impromptu duet between Addie and Talon on stage. Unfortunately, there is a downside to her unexpected fame. Will fears and insecurities come between her and her men? Will it cause her to run back to L.A. and the job she is used to using to hide from the world? Only Addie can decide.Craving Talon picks up where Claiming Addison left off. There is even more hot, yummy, erotic sexcapades happening. There is also more heart, more emotion, and more love. Its not easy for any of them to admit to the biggest emotion, but words arent as important as action. There is no shortage of action.I am absolutely in love with everyone on this tour bus! I love this series! Zoey Derrick is brilliant! This is a page-turner. Plan to not put it down when you start (hubby can order a pizza for dinner).My only warning: no prudes allowed. This is a mnage romance with two hot rockers and a sexy band manager. Don't bother to wear panties - they'll only melt off anyway!

Title:  HIS KIND OF WOMANSeries:  N/ACategory /Genre:  M/F transgender erotic romanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Nona Raines (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is a stand-alone, erotic, transgender romance .I completely enjoyed this unusual love story.  I would recommend it to anyone, but especially to those who need a little push to understand a GLBTQ (gay, lesbian, bi-sexual, transgender, or questioning) person in their life.Nona Raines provides a sensitive compassionate  hot  story that leaves no doubt about the struggle and the triumph that can be found in living an alternate lifestyle.  An intelligent reader could also push the lines of this reading to understand that it goes beyond lifestyle  why does anyone need to be defined by the boxes in which they are categorized? (male/female, rich/poor, black/white/latino/)  I say we celebrate love and happiness wherever it may be found!This is the first book I have read from Nona Raines.  It may be a short story, but it is well thought out, beautifully constructed, and expertly delivered.  I truly would love to read more from her.

Title:  CLAIMING ADDISONSeries:  69 Bottles #1Category /Genre:  Contemporary RomanceRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Zoey Derrick (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  A  near perfectThis is the first book in the 69 Bottles series.  They do need to be read in order, but there is no cliff-hanger.Addison has one hell of a week in this book.  For the last seven years, she has poured herself into her work and the payoff is being given to her in the form of a promotion representing 69 Bottles as their PR rep while on tour.  Surrounded by sex-god rock stars, the sexy manager, and tour security, she is one woman in a hunky candy store.  Protected by all, she is going to be claimed by two.  Can she choose between them?  Does she need to choose?!This is your warning  skip it if youre a prude.  There is hot, steamy action, and it is not reserved for the M/F type of relationship.  Addison is in a hot-man sandwich and I do mean HOT.  There is no hold the mustard for her or her double-decker treat!The best Ive read from Zoey Derrick yet!  I love how she brought in old favorites from her other books to play a part in this story.BTW:  Addisons motto seems to be dont feed the animals, and youd be surprised how often it is the perfect fit for dealing with so many situations.OMG!! I get to start reading book 2, CRAVING TALON as soon as I post this  lucky, lucky me!!

Title:  SOME WOLF BLUESeries:  Wide-Angle Lens #4Category /Genre:  Paranormal Romance, BBW, MenageRecommended for:  18+ due to sexual contentReceived from:  Ruby Glass (in exchange for an honest review)Grammar/editing:  ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedThis is the fourth book in the Wild-Angle Lens series.  Each does stand alone, but I recommend reading them all and in order.Talya has been requested for another unusual wedding.  This time it is just her, the bride, and the two men climbing a mountain for a private hand-fasting.  Once again, she has asked the bride to share their story of meeting and falling in love.  So which man is the groom?This was a sweet romance perfect for the Valentine season.  Adeline has an unusual job and is place in an unique position between the alpha boss, Gregor, and the beta, Thad.I love the consistency of having the photographer in each of the books in the series combined with the new characters in each of the books in this series.  It provides a continuity mixed with diversity.I cannot wait to read the companion short-story that is going to follow-up this series.  In the final installment, perhaps the photographer will be on the other side of that camera  I hope!

Title: WILL YOU BE MY VALENTINEAnthology: Pink Shade of Words 2015Author: Jade C. JamisonCategory /Genre: Contemporary Romance, Short-storyRecommended for: 18+ due to sexual contentReceived from: Jade C. Jamison (beta reading)Grammar/editing: ungraded  book received as an unedited ARC / errors excusedAlly is running late for an interview when she and another commuter both reach for a cab door at the same time. Imagine her surprise when it is the boy she crushed on back in high school! The one double date they went shared back then ended in an argument for four. Now that they are adults, will he forgive her? Can they make the most of a shared cab?I absolutely loved this short-story of a second chance at romance. For just a little while, I was in Denver, meeting an old crush, and hoping for fireworks right along with Ally. I was also Eric, going about my normal day when serendipity delivers my high school crush within the confines of a yellow cab. Sigh!Youll never go wrong when you pick up a story from Jade C. Jamison. All authors will teasingly tell you that the stories come from the voices in their head. The unrelenting voices in her head must be amazing!

I have been wanting a football for a long time. This little ball is really nice. It has a soft padded layer and it is a little smaller than regulation size. It is great for tossing around and playing catch. This ball is perfect for kids because of the size and the padding. The black also looks nice and the rubber laces add some extra grip. There are also long and short play ideas on the sides of the ball. This ball is a great toy.

These plates are perfect for my decorative plate hanger. It has 3 slots for plates, and I change them according to the season. The black and white is perfect. It matches my kitchen and the look and variety of the plates are perfect. They are dishwasher and microwave safe ceramic, but they are not too heavy to hang. They would be equally as nice used for cookies, hors-d'oeuvres, or bread. Another nice kitchen accessory from Lenox.

Another winner from Lenox. This ornament is a heavy silver-plated metal. It is very sturdy and says bless this home on it. The front and back are engraved, so it will look good at any angle on the tree. The house looks like a little bird house with a heart on it. Then it's a silver wreath with a bow. It comes with a red ribbon for hanging. The 2015 hangs down on a little chain, but it is hard to read. This makes the 2015 very subtle and this ornament is very pretty.

I am really enjoying the Lenox ornaments this year. I have the angel and now I've added the mercury glass snowman to my collection. This is very pretty. The crystal glass snowman is glittery, but the real magic happens when the lights are switched on. There is a button on the bottom that switches on a color changing light.The ornament then lights up with an ever changing color. It is very pretty, and there are no batteries ar assembly required. This ornament can be hung, but it can just sit on the base too. I'm going to have it on the mantle with the angel and some other light changing ornaments. This also comes very well packed. It is fragile, but arrived in perfect condition. I'm looking forward to finding some other Lenox treasures before the Christmas season.

It's always a struggle to find good swimming goggles. These have a tight seal and the strap doesn't pull my hair. The silicone is soft and conforms to the face. This is probably why the seal is tight. These are larger, but they work and keep that chlorine water out of my eyes. They also come in a cool plastic case.

I'm one of those weird people who actually like the taste of water. Crystal Geyser is my preferred spring water. That being said, this Pact water is pretty good. I have often hit the cranberry juice when I thought some type of bladder issue was coming on, so I appreciate the benefits of cranberry and Ocean Spray are the cranberry experts. I doubt as many of us would have had cranberry juice on a regular basis if it wasn't for this company.I also like the ingredients of this product. I am fine with both of the sweeteners, the cranberry extract, and the filtered water. The only thing that may be a little suspect is the "natural flavor", I'm not sure if it is an urban legend or if castoreum is really used in berry flavors, but ever since I have heard of this extract I try to stay away. Instead of "natural flavor", I wish they would say raspberries or castoreum free.Still this stuff is pretty good, although it's a little on the sweet side. I would probably like one of the other flavors better than the raspberry. I need to try the mango next.

This angel is very delicate. It is lightweight glass, and it looks better in real life than in the picture. In spite of being very fragile, it was packed well and arrived undamaged. It is ready to go. The batteries and color changing lights are already installed. All we had to do is turn the switch on. The angel looks very pretty on the mantle, and the color changing lights add ambiance. Very pretty and just in time for the Christmas season.

I have been searching for a purple bath/shower mat for a long time. This mat looks pinkish in the image, but it is actually a light purple color. This is the closest that I have come to what I was searching for. My shower has an older fiberglass shower pan that is kind of worn and rough. I always use bath/shower mats on the bottom to protect my feet. Two of these cover my shower floor perfectly, and they match my color scheme. These are plastic with holes for the water to run through, and they also have non-slip suction cups on the bottom. These mats are perfect for me.

This self-tanner goes on smooth and dark. It can also be showered off after 3 hours. One thing that I have always disliked about self tanners is the smell of the tanner after applying it. This tanner smells great, kind of like sun tan lotion. This only needs to be applied once a week and dries fairly dark. It works best when applied with the applicator mitt. This is a quality self-tanner that is easy to apply and smells great.

Olaf is the goofy, yet lovable snowman from Frozen. Frozen is the smash Disney hit that kids love to watch over and over. The Olaf snowman is a large but cute replica of Olaf. I like shaved ice and snow cones and love the simplicity of this snow cone maker. Simply put in the ice, put in a cone, and press Olaf's forehead. Next thing you get is shaved snow cone ice. Just add flavoring and you are good to go.This is cute and simple enough for the kids to make. Just keep them away from the sharp shaving blade. The Olaf is goofy but adorable at the same time. For the syrup, I made a modified simple syrup using a couple of Kool-Aid packets for flavoring. Just heat sugar and water on the stove and put in the flavoring. I like to make homemade simple syrups instead of using store bought syrups. I'll have to find some healthier flavoring alternatives than Kool-aid packets.Frozen is still popular with the kids. It will soon be cold, so I'm not sure if snow cones will be as popular, but the loveable snowman is still a hit.

These X3s are my favorite blue nitrile gloves for all kinds of uses. These are the industrial ones the mechanics wear. These work great for working on cars, cleaning, and avoiding getting your hands dirty. They are slightly textured, for a perfect grip. They are also thin and fit well enough to have full control of your fingers for writing, typing or whatever is needed. These are wonderful all purpose industrial gloves.

These anti-microbial vinyl gloves are perfect for volunteering in the animal rescue. These could be used for a lot of different things from cleaning to just not touching anything you don't want to. The vinyl is not as comfortable as the nitrile or latex, but they are thin and it's easy to use your fingers wearing these. I use these in the animal rescue when caring for animals. They are great for cleaning cages and not cross contaminating environments. The 200 pack is a good value, and the gloves work perfectly.

These indigo nitrile gloves are the perfect fit. They are thin enough to work with my fingers, yet protect the hands perfectly. They are also a really nice deep indigo color. These are perfect and there is a size for everyone. I use these for all kinds of dirty jobs, from cleaning to working with oil these gloves protect my hands, yet enable me to have full dexterity.

It's been awhile since I have taken sleep aids, so I don't have a tolerance built up. I took two of these and sat down to watch TV. It didn't take long before I started feeling drowsy. I went to bed and slept, well. Usually, when my cat wakes me up at two or four am, I stay up. Not after taking these. I let the cat out, fell back into bed and instantly fell asleep. I was still a little drowsy in the morning but was quickly able to shake it off.So these seem to work if you don't have a sleep aid tolerance built up. My only complaint with these is the natural claim. They do contain herbs and melatonin, but the caps are gelatin caps and they contain blue dye. The blue pills look cool, but the dye isn't necessary. They also seem to overhype the natural claim. I was trying to find the brand of these, and I guess it is Natural Rest. The label says All Natural, Natural Rest, sleep the way nature intended. They work, but the natural claim is overdone.

This new trimmer is replacing my Wahl trimmer, which has been a dependable trimmer for about 10 years. The Panasonic is quite the upgrade, it vibrates less and is quieter. The fact that it is rechargeable, and I can rinse it off, are huge. As others have said, the adjustment wheel gives a lot of options. The guides also move up and down when the adjustment wheel is turned. My old trimmer didn't do this. This is a really nice trimmer.

Because I have oily skin, I don't use a lot of moisturizers. Although, the other day I noticed that my brother, who is 8 years younger than me, has crow's feet around his eyes. I would like to avoid the same, and this eb5 is perfect for the delicate skin around my eyes. This treatment is non-greasy and the scent is almost indistinguishable. It's very light. This light, clean moisturizer goes on smooth, and I can feel a slight bit of cool moisture around my eyes. It almost instantly softened the skin and the appearance of creases. This is a great eye treatment, and it came when I need it most.

This is a great calendar/planner. It is a thick flexible paper that has stitching that looks like fabric. There are tabs for each month, with a regular, square day-of-the-month calendar in the front. Then the days are divided up by quarter pages, so we can really drill down for each day. There is also space for notes and brainstorming. The back has a pocket, and a sheet that has US times zones and holidays listed. This is a nice 81/2 by 11 inch calendar/planner. I hope to use it for a successful and productive year. At a glance weekly / monthly planner is a winner!

These are fine dishcloths.They shrink and thicken a little after washing. They are thin, yet absorbent. They are great for washing dishes and cleaning the counters. They look good and match my kitchenl.

I love anything that will help combat stress, and keep me calm. These seem fine when I am not stressed and I haven't noticed any negative side effects from taking them. When I was really super stressed, taking a couple didn't seem to combat it. Although, since I've started taking them it does seem like my panic attacks and palpitations happen less frequently. I think as a supplement, these seem to help over time if taken on a regular basis. They are no Xanax, but every little thing helps.

I have three cats, and I'm very particular about their litter. I am a huge fan of Freshstep. Even though, it costs more it really helps with odors. My main complaint with the Freshstep is the dust. This natural wood clumping litter is dust free. It also clumps like clay, and it is light weight. I'm not sure if it fights odors as well as the FS, but it works great mixed half and half. I'm not sure if I will permanently switch to this new litter, but it seems to be one of the better choices in natural litters and cat litters overall.

These labels are large giving a lot of space to write on. The fact that it is a chalkboard sticker and can be used with regular chalk is really cool. These are awesome for gifts or place-holders or anything else the imagination can dream up. Low tech and fun!

I've always wanted an SSD. I love the fact that they are faster and more quiet. I've also been too lazy to install one in my computer. Until now, anyway. My desktop is new and I have it configured exactly how I want it, so I didn't want to mess with that. Then I discovered that my older laptop has two drive bays, so I can make an easy switch and won't have to purchase new mounting brackets.My older HP laptop runs Vista, but it is supposedly a multi-media laptop. I usually hate all of the bloatware that HP installs, but I thought it would be easier to keep everything. I installed this in the 2nd drive bay. I then used Acronis True Image to copy everything over. Then I replaced the old HD with the SSD and gave it a test. It booted and was noticeably faster. I'm still using Vista and there is a lot of bloatware on the laptop, but it was still faster.I was then able to install the original drive in the second bay, reformat and use it as extra storage. Pretty cool, this is a pretty good SSD.

These are handy little tags. The stock is fairly thick and there are pre-punched holes for adding a string or ribbon. These would make great homemade gift tags and would look good on a bottle of wine or other bottled gifts. Avery makes a lot of neat labels and templates for customizing tags. These are really cute.

I learned a lot about gemstones just reading the info on this description. This sapphire is created meaning it was made in a lab. Then again you would be paying a heck of a lot more if this were made from this many real diamonds and a large emerald cut real sapphire. It's not a bad pendant necklace, but it doesn't look like natural gemstones. At least, it doesn't seem like it to me.Still it is shiny and intricate and fairly pretty. Even though, the chain is 18" it hangs kind of  high. A longer chain may be more desirable, unless you want a short necklace. The packing was a little box and a little pouch. There was some fuzz on the pouch from the cushion in the box. The pendant was also in a little plastic bag with a paper tag that says made in China.This may not make the best gift, without some work on the packaging, but it would be a fine necklace just to wear.

I love the fact that the aluminum doesn't rust. I also like the lightness of the caddy and the finish of the aluminum. I have a sprayer on my shower head, so I put a nail in the wall above the shower and the caddy hangs down on the side. It doesn't slide and the suction cups aren't an issue.I like that it is small and simple. My shower has some built in shelves, but having the extra space is always useful. I've heard that razors will last longer if the blades are kept dry, so the razor hanger seems like a great idea.

I always credited my success in college to being organized. I always used a binder with dividers to keep my notes straight. My tip for all college students is to rewrite your notes at the end of the day and clarify and fill in any gaps that you may have. It really helps to have solid notes as a reference, instead of a scribbly unclear mess.These dividers are big and heavy duty. They come in bright colors and the plastic is see-through. If I only had these back then. Still I make notes for projects and still like to keep organized, so I'll get a lot of use out of these. The Ultralast are strong and durable. I was also fortunate enough to get an Ultralast binder to go with these. This is a really great system.

This is a huge box of large tags. These things are awesome. I'm not sure if people use them for shipping anymore, but I am using them to mark the cages at the animal rescue I volunteer at. They would also make cool gift tags, table name cards, and more organization. These are very sturdy and useful.

Stress and free radicals are the enemy for me. Fortunately, there are some herbal supplements that help with both. I first started taking Holy Basil and it seemed to help with my anxiety. After adding the Rhodiola I feel calmer and more focused. I also like that they are both strong anti-oxidants. I have a spot on my cheek that I am concerned about. After taking these two supplements it has gotten smaller. I also haven't noticed any negative side effects or upset stomach taking either of these. The effects may be small, but I don think they help.

I have had a few different Sonicares over the years. This one does have some improvements. I like the two modes and the 3 intensity settings. Although, I thought using my first Sonicare years ago was hilarious. It vibrated so much it would tickle my mouth. After awhile, you get used to it, but full intensity at first is pretty dramatic.This battery stays charged, it says up to 3 weeks, either way it doesn't need to be charged daily, like the older models. It also has a slim profile and doesn't take up a lot of space in the bathroom. I'm not sure about the whitening, but it really makes my teeth feel clean so removing stains would help with whitening.I also think the handle feels good and I like the new brush design. The green buttons look nice too. The only thing I don't like is the timer and the 30-second intervals. I understand the concept of brushing for two minutes and getting all 4 quadrants of the mouth, but I don't need a timer to tell  me that. I wish it could be turned off. I find the intervals and the timer annoying.

These in-ear headphones sound great. I have the sport model for iOS. I like to listen to podcasts and/or music while walking or riding my bike and these are perfect. They are sweat resistant and I can still hear outside noises a little bit for safety.I wasn't sure about the style of earbud, but after getting used to them they are not bad. The charcoal black is a nice unassuming color. The sound has that Bose quality and the microphone works great. I also like the carabiner clip on the case.

This game is sort of fun, but it's also a little confusing and a bit of work. The dessert cards are dishes that have 2 or 3 ingredients, we need to serve guests their favorite food from either our ingredients or if we are lucky our card will be the exact dish in which case we can draw another dessert card. Cute theory and the idea of playing with and thinking of desserts is fun.It is just kind of hard to figure out what is what. Still once the game is understood and we know what each image is there is some strategy to combining items with guests wishes and getting rid of the cards first. This is one of those games that would be more fun with more practice and everyone getting with the Just Desserts program.

This small clear snorkel set isn't overly prominent, but it works. The small mask has a tight comfortable fit and the snorkel works well and blocks water when going under. So far, this baby is only swimming pool tested, but in a couple of weeks it will be beach tested when I go on vacation. I'm too afraid to use it in the river because I don't want to actually see what is in that water. Maybe if I go higher up to the mountains where the streams are less intimidating. This set is affordable and works well, it's a great value.

This is kind of a cool quirky stapler to have on the desk. It is plastic and looks like a plastic high heel. As others have said, it is not super heavy duty, but it seems to work fine. I'm not sure what other people were talking about it needing special staples, the ones I had on hand fit it fine. This is a handy little tool and a conversation piece.

I love how this first smells when I wash my hands. This soap also looks high end on the counter and the bottle says made in France. I love lavender scented products and this lavender sage smells very nice. It also rinses clean and feels gentle on my hands.The only slight drawback is after my hands are rinsed and dried there is a slight lingering smell of something other than the lavender. I think it is a slight glycerin smell. Which is still clean and natural, but I prefer the lavender scent over the soapy glycerin scent. Still this is some nice soap and it is going to get a lot of use sitting next to my sink.

I love appliances that serve more than one function. The first thing I did when I received this was throw my old rice cooker away and give my crock pot to a neighbor. Now I have a little extra room in the cupboard.I'm pretty lazy and I'm not much of a meat eater, but what I would frequently cook in my rice cooker was rice or quinoa, with vegetables steaming at the same time. This nice KitchenAid handles steaming veggies alone or with rice on the bottom with ease.It also acts as a very high-end slow cooker and can easily replace a crock pot. I'm not very good at slow cooking, but I thought I would make a blueberry cobbler or crumble and use the cooker like an oven. I found a recipe online where you just put blueberries and sugar in the pot along with a yellow cake mix stirred into melted butter.I think I should have just put the pot on 350 for 40 minutes and it probably would have turned out perfect. Instead, I put it on high slow cooker, and then when after 3 hours it didn't seem cooked enough, I turned it up to 450 and I ended up burning the edges. The non-burned parts were pretty tasty with ice cream, but I'm still confused about the best way to use this.There are recipes in the manual that sounds really great, including soups, and meats, and pudding and risotto. If I ever get the stirrer I will try the pudding and risotto. They both sound really good and relatively easy to make with the stirrer attachment.I wish there was more information in the manual or that there was a forum or something. Maybe I'm overthinking it and can use the cooker exactly like a stove and oven. I'm just not sure about that part. Even though, the rice cooking, steaming, and slow cooking already make this cooker worth it.This is a very nice looking appliance and has that stylish KitchenAid quality. The steaming, roasting basket is solid, the non-stick cooking liner is very nice, and the lid is nice too. You can also use the pot as a kitchen timer, without any heat.I still need to experiment and figure out the best way to use this, but I think it is a very nice cooker and I really like it. If I ever decide to attempt yogurt making, it even does that.

These are interesting earbuds. They are very small and light weight. I used the tips that were on it, but two other sizes came with them. They looked like they would be too small for my ears, but they fit perfectly inside my ear. The sound was surprisingly good. The earbuds are marked with and R an L, so there is no guessing about which ear to put each one in.The microphone is on the left ear side. These don't feel like you are wearing anything at all, yet they sound very good. The cord is cloth and the magnets aren't in the earbuds like other ones I have used. Instead, there is a rubber magnetic loop that you can wrap the cord and earbuds with. For such a reasonable price, these are very comfortable and sound great.

My first experience with a flat iron was several years ago. The stylist showed me how to use it, and said to never iron dry hair or it will burn and frizz. At the time, we used Aquage shine spray and I shelled out $100 for a professional ceramic flat iron. If you have long hair, a flat iron will get out the weird natural bends and twists and make your hair look shiny and awesome.Several years later, I became lazy and gave up on using the flat iron and I'm not even sure if shine spray is still in style. Products seem to come and go, and I may be a bit out of the loop. In comes the Remington PROtect Flat Iron, this thing works as good as the professional flat iron plus it infuses my hair with moisture.I love the Macadamia Conditioning Treatment, this stuff smooths and conditions and keeps hair from being damaged while adding moisture. This is actually a great product and a really nice flat iron. If you have the time to use it, your hair will look awesome.

My cat thinks everything is a toy and loves to attack and chew on cords. My original iPhone cord has taken a beating because of him. Belkin to the rescue. This cord is the normal Belkin quality. It is 4 feet long, which is pretty long and it comes in awesome colors. I love the purple that I received, but the green would match my iPhone 5C perfectly. Great cord and I received it just in time.

This dog bed is the medium size which would work for most dogs. The faux sheepskin is soft and my cat started using this immediately. This would be great for protecting a couch, chair or car seat from pet hairs. It would also be better than nothing for a pet that lives outside. The only downside is that the bolsters are very padded, but the inside where the animal actually lays isn't very thick. This is great for on top of a soft surface, but not that great for laying on a hard surface.

These silicone kitchen utensils are interesting. The handles feel like hard plastic, but the ends are bendable silicone. They are also BPA free, dishwasher safe, and heat resistant up to 480 degrees. I like the regular spoon and the slotted spoon. This is my first spaghetti noodle spoon and it is actually pretty handy. My only complaint is the spatula, or as they call it, the turner needs more contour in the handle. It's almost like flipping something with a flat spatula. The red color matches my Paula Deen cookware and comes close to the color of my Kitchen Aid multi-cooker. This is a nice set of utensils, expect for the flaw in the spatula handle.
